author: {'steamid': '76561198963810920', 'num_games_owned': 752, 'num_reviews': 258, 'playtime_forever': 67, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1710638056}
review:
Rating: 6.5/10
Yes this is janky and very clunky. Even if you gave this to a kid ,it does not have tight movement and good level design like Mario yet the game despite its jank has a certain charm to it. Levels are short but charming in their own little way. Jumping and moving around is too slidey . I honestly quite enjoyed the art style. Its awesome. For an hour of playtime i can say this is a fun but flawed experience. It also i think it needed a better main hub world since it's quite rough as it stands. 
But i can't say this is the worst game i played ,its a product of its time and i can tell someone wanted to make a fun experience but probably did not succeed and that's fine. I recommend you get this on sale, it's not worth full price but it's worth it for a dollar and some mindless fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198124692789', 'num_games_owned': 241, 'num_reviews': 235, 'playtime_forever': 95, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1599353613}
review:
[h1] Woodle Tree Adventures [/h1] 
Woodle Tree Adventures offers a straightforward platforming experience with its charming visuals and simple gameplay mechanics. While it provides a nostalgic feel reminiscent of classic platformers, it may lack depth for more experienced gamers. Overall, it's a decent choice for casual players looking for a lighthearted gaming experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198133279402', 'num_games_owned': 124, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 40, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1708243033}
review:
üå≥ Woodle Tree Adventures: A Masterpiece of Joyous Exploration! üå≥

Prepare yourselves, fellow adventurers, for an epic journey into the heart of whimsy and wonder! Woodle Tree Adventures is not just a game; it's a portal to a realm where joy dances on the breeze and every leaf whispers tales of enchantment.

From the very moment you step into this vibrant world, you're greeted with a symphony of colors that would make even the most resplendent rainbow blush with envy. The lush, handcrafted environments are more than just pixels on a screen‚Äîthey're living, breathing landscapes begging to be explored. Each level is a canvas, painted with the brushstrokes of creativity and imagination.

But let's talk mechanics, shall we? Woodle Tree Adventures is a triumph of platforming perfection. The controls are as smooth as silk, allowing you to leap, bound, and glide through the air with the grace of a woodland sprite. And oh, the challenges that await! From precarious jumps to cunning puzzles, every obstacle is a delightful test of skill that will have you grinning from ear to ear.

And let's not forget about our charming protagonist, Woodle, a little tree spirit with a heart as big as the forest itself. With his adorable antics and boundless enthusiasm, he'll steal your heart faster than you can say "photosynthesis." You'll find yourself rooting for him (pun intended) every step of the way.

But perhaps the true magic of Woodle Tree Adventures lies in its ability to transport you back to a simpler time, when the only worries in the world were how high you could climb and how far you could jump. In a gaming landscape often dominated by grit and grime, it's refreshing to lose yourself in a world filled with nothing but pure, unadulterated joy.

So, do yourself a favor and embark on this extraordinary journey. Woodle Tree Adventures is not just a game; it's an experience‚Äîa celebration of all that is good and beautiful in the world. And trust me when I say, once you step foot into this magical forest, you'll never want to leave. üå≤‚ú®

author: {'steamid': '76561199010042150', 'num_games_owned': 3874, 'num_reviews': 2454, 'playtime_forever': 33, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1705774344}
review:
I am 32 years old.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and we adopted our son together. Both are now 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I felt lost and unhappy. I was self-destructive. One day, I was so angry with everything spiraling out of control that I punched a concrete wall in a moment of overwhelming emotion. This resulted in breaking my fifth metacarpal in my right hand‚Äîthe hand I worked with, played games with, and used to carry my children to bed‚Äîthe hand I desperately needed to ensure I could continue providing.

Upon learning the severity of the self-inflicted damage, I became almost suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man, with no history of depression or anxiety. I had never experienced anger outbursts, nor was I the type to break down and cry, but I was in a tough situation that truly prevented me from seeing the light on the other side.

With nothing better to do, I looked for a game I could play WITH ONE HAND while recovering. Somehow, I stumbled upon this game and read some of the comments. I decided it was worth a try... I must admit I didn't beat the game, nor did I play as much as some of you. In fact, I may have played this game for only a day or two. That being said, after doing so, I had a new joy and hope for life. I managed to leave behind the pain and suffering that had been thrust upon me. I could experience the joy and happiness of other people. I relaxed for 5 ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• minutes listening to this music, long enough to realize that I would be okay.

After realizing this, I turned off the game and went back to work. My hand hurt a lot, but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so sorry for myself and became the father I needed to be at that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving like.

Today, I am close friends with the mother of my children. We don't fight, argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents and friends.

Now I have 3 children. My third child is, wait, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my separation, and we just unexpectedly stumbled into each other's lives. We have been dating for a year and are very happy together.

Moral of the story: you never know what life has in store for you, and if I had given up when all odds were against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198132655796', 'num_games_owned': 1303, 'num_reviews': 169, 'playtime_forever': 91, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1705764779}
review:
Un petit platformer 3D qui a presque r√©ussi a faire le strict n√©cessaire pour un jeu du genre.
Les graphismes sont assez mignons et enfantins, les objets √† collecter ne sont pas des pi√®ces mais des baies, plusieurs niveaux diff√©rents qui ont tous un th√®me diff√©rent.
Malheureusement pour un platformer 3D il ne faut pas juste faire des jolies graphismes 3D, il faut aussi laisser le contr√¥le de la cam√©ra au joueur, ce qui n'est pas le cas ici (test√© avec clavier et manette, a part reculer la cam√©ra on ne peut rien faire), pourtant la cam√©ra bouge bien d'elle m√™me quand on s'approche du d√©cors et il arrive m√™me que si on saute dans le vide a certains endroit la cam√©ra ne montre plus du tout les plateformes sur lesquelles il faut sauter ! Encore pire que les cam√©ra sur les jeux PS1 c'est dire √† quel point c'est fun

author: {'steamid': '76561198361671357', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 409, 'playtime_forever': 104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 104, 'last_played': 1705523175}
review:
A cute little 3D platforming adventure where you play as a small tree (or stump), collecting magical water droplets in order to travel to unique locations! Encounter foes that faint at a mere swing of your leaf as you collect berries on your journey! 

My only complaint for this game are the achievements, those being grindy as hell. It's almost as if an exploit was left in the game intentionally in order to combat this...

author: {'steamid': '76561198045398392', 'num_games_owned': 1835, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1705510633}
review:
[h1] 2.5 / 10 [/h1]

Cute game, but has probably the worst camera control I remember experiencing (basically lack of any control) and the game is kinda clunky. Also has some game breaking bugs, for example camera just getting stuck on one position

It is an old game and seems like it is made by just one developer + it is really cheap (on sale), so I can't be too harsh. I just can't recommend it whole heartily.

review:
O jogo tentou algo parecido com a nostalgia do Nintendo 64, at√© que acertou no visual, mas de resto errou feio!
Hist√≥ria passou longe, voc√™ √© um cepo de madeira que √© abordado pelo Deku Tree que fala que o mundo precisa de √°gua, voc√™ desce o sarrafo com uma folha em uns bixo que nem te ataca e n√£o tem nada haver com a parada.
A m√∫sica/trilha sonora n√£o combina em nada com o jogo, a gameplay n√£o √© fluida e o jogo possui a pior c√¢mera que j√° vi!
O jogo possui um sistema de checkpoint que tem vontade pr√≥pria, as vezes salva no meio do mapa, mais na maioria das vezes ele te joga pro come√ßo do mapa, mesmo voc√™ j√° tendo spawnado alguma vez no meio...
Tinha potencial, mas faltou MUITO capricho, enfim, nem na promo√ß√£o vale a pena!

author: {'steamid': '76561198049823783', 'num_games_owned': 1712, 'num_reviews': 1265, 'playtime_forever': 91, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1690478653}
review:
Aventura grafica Estilo yooka laylee, tenes diferentes mundos en los que tenes que entregar las 3 gotas de agua de cada uno para seguir (como no pasa nada si moris, juntas todas las manzanas, matas a todos los enemigos y grindeas asi). Ya en la casa central podes seleccionar los mundos a los que queres ir y los poderes que queres como ‚Äúcomprar‚Äù con las manzanas que tenes.
Sos un hermoso tronquito chico, lore nulo casi, hermosos graficos, excelente m√∫sica, sonidos, ambientaci√≥n (tu espada-hoja mel√© y el tirar vientito como da√±o de rango estan muy buenos) es una pena que dure tan poco y no haya workshop o multiplayer, sin dudas es un must play de aca a la china!
Lo am√© cada segundo!
9.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198042475731', 'num_games_owned': 934, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 103, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 103, 'last_played': 1691016123}
review:
I Mean, i guess it's aimed to be an "old school platform game" but it's like adding the worse bits about the old school platformers together into one short mess.
- Camera is horrible 95% of the time and it's just a pain to get around and judge where you're jumping to
- Movement & combat is just very stiff and doesn't really flow very well
- There's no real goal or end goal you basically have no real purpose other than to get to the end
- The art style is cool and does reminisce on the old games we all once played but that's about it...
- I Suppose the music is pretty calming when you're losing your mind to everything else about it, yeah just not a fan really i'm afraid

review:
Woodle Tree Adventures, kendine √∂zg√º sanat tarzƒ±nƒ± eklerken eski okul tarzƒ±nƒ± benimseyen b√ºy√ºleyici ve nostaljik bir platform oyunudur. 90'larƒ±n oyunlarƒ±nƒ± anƒ±msatan unsurlara sahip bu oyun, 6 farklƒ± d√ºnyada keyifli bir yolculuk sunuyor.

Oyuncu olarak g√∂reviniz, maceranƒ±z boyunca daƒüƒ±lmƒ±≈ü b√ºy√ºl√º su damlalarƒ±nƒ± toplayarak topraklarƒ± kurtarmaktƒ±r. Bunu yaparak, d√ºnyaya barƒ±≈ü ve dengeyi geri getiriyorsunuz ve sonu√ßta yeni kahraman oluyorsunuz.

Woodle Tree Adventures'ƒ±n √∂ne √ßƒ±kan √∂zelliklerinden biri de yarattƒ±ƒüƒ± huzurlu ve dingin atmosfer. Oyun d√ºnyasƒ±, g√ºzelce hazƒ±rlanmƒ±≈ü ortamlarƒ±nda seyahat ederken bir huzur duygusu yayƒ±yor. Film m√ºziƒüi ve sanat tarzƒ± genel sakin tona katkƒ±da bulunur ve rahatlatƒ±cƒ± bir deneyim arƒ±yorsanƒ±z oynamak i√ßin harika bir oyun haline getirir.

Platform t√ºr√ºn√ºn sƒ±kƒ± bir hayranƒ± olmasanƒ±z bile Woodle Tree Adventures yine de dikkate alƒ±nmaya deƒüer. B√ºy√ºleyici oyun d√ºnyasƒ± ve nostaljik √ßekiciliƒüi hem yeti≈ükinler hem de √ßocuklar tarafƒ±ndan beƒüenilebilir. Oyun, t√ºm oyunculara mutluluk getirmeyi ama√ßlayan bir sanat oyunu ve platform oyunu olmak arasƒ±nda bir denge kuruyor.

Banjo Kazooie ve Super Mario 64 gibi oyunlarla ilgili g√ºzel anƒ±larƒ±nƒ±z varsa, Woodle Tree Adventures sizi eski g√ºzel g√ºnlere geri g√∂t√ºrecek. Kendine √∂zg√º bir cazibe ve oyun deneyimi sunarken bu klasiklerin √∂z√ºn√º yakalƒ±yor.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11207, 'playtime_forever': 255, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 194, 'last_played': 1686246218}
review:
Woodle Tree Adventures is a 9 year old console ported low poly family friendly 3D platformer with a minecraft-esque visual style.  Gameplay consists of 3D third person platforming as you awkwardly control a treestump/cinnamon roll and collect water drops and berries, and smack enemy critters with a leaf.  Ok whatever, the problem here isn't the concept, it's the shoddy implementation. 

From a technical perspective, the game doesn't meet basic minimum requirements that most PC gamers expect as standard.

The game features lazy low-polygon "retro" assets, making this look like a barely functional 3D game from the 1990s.  It's unclear why the developers weren't able to arrange high quality, high polygon count contemporary assets for the game, and also irrelevant... what matters is that this looks bad as a result of their decisions, a compromise PC gamers shouldn't have to put up with.

The game features lazy low-polygon voxel "Minecraft"-like "art", making this look like a barely functional 3D game from the 1990s.  A lot of amateur developers see Minecraft's success and assume it's because it looks bad, not because it had unique and appealing game mechanics, and they try to emulate the success without understanding it.  It also happens to be easy, and doesn't need any proper talent in terms of game development/graphic artists etc.  That's why reviewers are faced with so many of these terrible games with confrontingly bad graphics.  Developers must learn that Minecraft succeeded despite the bad graphics, not because of them.

The controls can't be customised, which will be an annoyance for many, but it can also render the game unplayable for differently-abled gamers.  The camnera controls are complete trash, owing to the console heritage of the game (more on that in a bit). 

PC gamers will be insulted by the demand from the developer that a console peasant children's toy controller should be used, despite this being on PC.  Developers should try to be aware which platform they're developing for, and must never, under any circumstances dictate to gamers how their games are to be experienced.

Because this is a console game, it carries a number of deliberate design deficiencies.  Compromises were made to cater to the inferior console gaming appliances that the game was designed for.  These are unfortunate compromises and limitations that PC gamers shouldn't be forced to accept, but it's evident that PC was a second thought for the console-centric developers.  The game is deficient as a result of these choices, and would have been so much better without the handicaps that designing games for consoles forces upon a game.  Once more, console peasants have made gaming worse for everyone.

These technical defects push this game below acceptable standards for any modern PC game.

Woodle Tree Adventures didn't appeal much to the people who own a copy of the game, either.  It has achievements, and they show us a very clear picture that the game didn't really capture any interest from gamers.  The most commonly and easily attained achievement is for completing the first simple level (less than 5 minutes), but only around 14 percent of players bothered to get that far before uninstalling the game.  Hardly a success story, gamers just weren't all that interested in the game.

Reviewing SteamDB to check how popular this game was with players reveals a surprise... there's a very healthy spike in player counts for the game.  But this isn't consistent with the achievement stats, that show only 14 percent of players bothered playing the game for any reasonable amount of time.  How is it possible for this game to have so many concurrent players who weren't even playing the game?  Trading cards.  Players will use card idling software to collect the cards and sell them, but this won't trigger any achievements in-game.  That tells us people only really bought this game for trading cards, and that's a damning indictment of the woeful quality.  A closer look at the numbers shows the game just has a couple of players every week running up the game and idling it for cards, then deleting it.  We must ask how it benefits gamers for there to be so many games like this, with no merit as a serious game, that only generate sales from people idling and selling the trading cards.

Woodle Tree Adventures is relatively cheap at $3 USD, but it's not worth it. Given the defects and quality issues with the game, coupled with the unrealistic price, this is impossible to recommend.

review:
Buggy attempt of a junior developer to make a classic platformer game. This attempt at a relaxing platformer competes with the first Dark Souls thanks to poor controls and a camera that lives a life of its own.

+ graphic style has its own charm

The most disappointing thing is that it costs money...

author: {'steamid': '76561198190380543', 'num_games_owned': 613, 'num_reviews': 603, 'playtime_forever': 94, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1602441127}
review:
Woodle Tree Adventures may be a pretty platformer with colorful visuals and cheerful music, however gameplay is just meh. The character movement and jumping is a bit stiff, and player camera control is really limited, on a freaking 3D platformer.
Fortunately, the game is short, with 6 (+ 1 bonus) stages total where you need to collect 3 water droplets and reach the end in each of them. Took me little more than an hour to complete it, and for cheap, it is enjoyable, even with the gameplay problems. Has 8 easy achievements if you use an exploit as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061247255', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 151, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 151, 'last_played': 1595221441}
review:
Even though I received the product for free, I will review this as what the game is. The game starts with a simple story but throughout the whole game the story is just lost, you forget why you're there. the game is boring in terms of playability and have a horrible camera view (it would be better if I could just control what I see, or the camera follow the character just like any third person game). the music is alright, I believe it does the job of being "relaxing", but at the same time, it is very frustrating falling down the scenario because of camera view and have your character moved to the beginning. the developers could have done a better job at working up the scenario, it just feels that everything is missing, misplaced or even just poorly made. the game gives you a half an hour play (if you fall a lot).

Mesmo que eu tenha recebido o produto gratuitamente, analisarei como o jogo √©. O jogo come√ßa com uma hist√≥ria simples, mas durante todo o jogo a hist√≥ria est√° perdida, voc√™ esquece por que est√° l√°. o jogo √© chato em termos de jogabilidade e tem uma vis√£o horr√≠vel da c√¢mera (seria melhor se eu pudesse controlar o que vejo, ou a c√¢mera seguir o personagem como qualquer jogo de terceira pessoa). a m√∫sica est√° boa, acredito que faz o trabalho de ser "relaxante", mas, ao mesmo tempo, √© muito frustrante cair no cen√°rio por causa da vis√£o da c√¢mera e ter seu personagem movido para o come√ßo. os desenvolvedores poderiam ter feito um trabalho melhor na elabora√ß√£o do cen√°rio, eu apenas sinto que tudo est√° faltando, mal colocado ou mal feito mesmo. o jogo oferece meia hora de jogatina (se voc√™ cair muito).

author: {'steamid': '76561198049020554', 'num_games_owned': 4131, 'num_reviews': 374, 'playtime_forever': 98, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1593889130}
review:
To be honest, I'm not exactly sure why the reviews of this game are not worse. Essentially you are playing as a tree stump collecting water and berries. It is a simple 3d platformer, with not much more to it.

In fact, I would say there is much more negative than positive for this. The camera is absolutely horrendous. It is really hard to do anything in the game without the game getting all f**ked up. This makes the controls also annoying to use. Perhaps if they had actually designed it better I would be reconsidering this review. The levels are also not exactly stimulating, and it seems like something that a beginner at Unity would make. Some other positive reviews seem to enjoy that it uses pretty cute designs, but that is not an excuse for a poorly designed game.

Overall, this game needs a lot of fixing for me to consider recommending.

Rating: 4.0/10
Recommend Price: $0 (unless you get it free, it's not worth buying)

author: {'steamid': '76561198110815209', 'num_games_owned': 231, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 87, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 87, 'last_played': 1482947756}
review:
Woodle Tree Adventures is a bright, colorful platforming game where you play as an adorable little tree...thing.

Your goal is to collect 'fairy tears' and 'berries' for your Deku-Tree Father, who gives me King of the Cosmos vibes. The jumping and moving feels okay, but the game is completely bogged down by a truly horrendous camera and a very unresponsive attack. It's also unclear which creatures on each stage will attack you or are just part of the environment.(Some of them get sad when you whack them with your leaf-weapon-thing too, which is sad)

On the plus side, there's no real fail-state(falling off the world or being hit by an enemy just sends you back to the start of the level, with all your items still collected), though no chance of failure can also be a negative.

There's a creepy lack of music or sound in some areas. It feels very much like a beginner's attempt at a game. Rough and unpolished, but there was clearly an idea there to make a fun, neat little game. Would be okay for very young children.

author: {'steamid': '76561198129683628', 'num_games_owned': 63, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 791, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 790, 'last_played': 1589042890}
review:
Woodle is a platformer with heart, and it pleasantly surprises. What the game lacks in an accessible camera view, sensible checkpoints and a cohesive storyline, it more than makes up for in charm, nice visuals, and sentient barrel-rolling trees. The levels are sprawling, which can make it challenging to map the route, but the secret niches usually contain a cache of berries, convenient collectibles to measure level progress by. The sprint ability is a nice gimmick that is occasionally vital to clearing levels. The game's measured difficulty makes it satisfying to play while remaining unpretentious.

There is an annoying variation in checkpoints (ditto) after multiple deaths, but this minor inconvenience is outweighed by the presence of sp00ky cr@bs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078694373', 'num_games_owned': 121, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 91, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1590140828}
review:
[h1] There should be more to it than empty cuteness [/h1]

This is a direct case when looks is the most precious quality. The artwork and cuteness of the main character - chubby wood stump, and his enemies is undeniable, however, the gameplay enjoyment drops drastically after the first level. What happened?

The answer is pretty simple: the range of actions given to a player is limited, to say more - it is tiny. It is completely understandable as it looks like a game for children, but on top of that player‚Äôs perspective is confusing. To elaborate: the whole riddle of this platformer is a spatial maze, if only there was an ability to view an entire map and control the actual camera view (not only zoom in and out but also rotate) then the fun would skyrocket immediately.

The music and effects are pretty simple and even weird sometimes but they keep a charming childish atmosphere that boosts your immersion.

Overall, I believe that with a few improvements the game would be worth buying but at this stage you will abandon it after first or second level.

Doubt that you will enjoy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043777080', 'num_games_owned': 1337, 'num_reviews': 112, 'playtime_forever': 173, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 173, 'last_played': 1578674311}
review:
Full review at: https://thegamehoard.com/2020/03/06/woodle-tree-adventures-pc/

Woodle Tree Adventures is intended to be a snack between larger games, something that doesn‚Äôt push you too much while providing a little play area for you to amuse yourself for an hour or two. The polymer clay look and relaxed music certainly send these signals, but the 3D platforming is not a good fit for this world. Camera problems, uninspired levels, tedium, and weird water elevators mean that the game can either become humdrum or downright grating. The calm simplicity of the world has its moments where it comes through, but every task feels either too plain or negligible, meaning the little flaws end up shining brightest.

Beyond the camera issues most of Woodle Tree Adventures‚Äôs problems are small stumbles or practically intended design features. The levels aren‚Äôt meant to put up a fight so they don‚Äôt, but they can become unintentionally challenging when the camera doesn‚Äôt work right or the design forces boring backtracking. It‚Äôs never really hard so you can avoid some moments of it, but the game places berries around so that you‚Äôll have something to focus on besides the straightforward tear gathering, and these can sometimes lead to the troublesome quirks in the game‚Äôs design.  It really just feels like the game needed more polish, more time in the polymer clay oven if you will, but unfortunately this is the form Woodle Tree‚Äôs adventure took, and its small appeals like its cute protagonist can‚Äôt make up for a game that is fairly empty.
developer_response: thanks for the thorough review, you can try the second game, I think you‚Äôll like it more!

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198054364392', 'num_games_owned': 374, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 620, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 536, 'last_played': 1605168965}
review:
Es un juego tipo plataformas 3D, en el que encarnamos a un tronquito que fue creado a partir de las ra√≠ces del "gran √°rbol", con el prop√≥sito de conseguir agua ( lagrimas de hadas ) para su mundo seco. Comienzas en un peque√±o terreno con una casita donde podr√°s viajar a los diferentes mundos, hay un total de 7 niveles con diferente ambientaci√≥n llenos de obst√°culos y enemigos. Habr√° que recoger unas gotas de agua en cada nivel para desbloquear el siguiente y unas bayas que se usan para desbloquear objetos y alg√∫n nivel extra.

Conclusi√≥n: Como juego es bastante sencillo y con muy poca dificultad ( no cuenta con sistema de  vidas por ejemplo ). La historia es breve, los niveles son bastante cortos y f√°ciles. Los controles son b√°sicos aunque molesta la c√°mara fija para mi gusto. Visualmente es muy agradable y colorido con texturas sencillas y redondeadas. El tema de efectos de sonido esta acorde con el tipo juego y tiene una tranquila banda sonora instrumental. El juego en s√≠ no es muy bueno pero para completarlo una vez est√° bien. Sin embargo, es un videojuego perfecto para los peques ya que no es para nada violento, no es muy dif√≠cil y la ambientaci√≥n en mi opini√≥n tiene un toque infantil.

¬° Que el vicio os acompa√±e !

review:
Un juego sencillo cuya dificultad viene principalmente de la poca cooperaci√≥n de la c√°mara. Para nuevos al genero les vendr√° como buena introducci√≥n, pero sabr√° poco a gente mas experimentada. 

La progresi√≥n del arma, aunque sencilla, facilita el avanzar en el juego. 

Los Logros no son dif√≠ciles, alguno algo tedioso.

La c√°mara en ocasiones hace lo que le da la gana y cambia en el momento menos apropiado, paciencia.

author: {'steamid': '76561198208370897', 'num_games_owned': 420, 'num_reviews': 259, 'playtime_forever': 76, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1577143188}
review:
[h1]Woodle Tree Adventures is not a bad game[/h1]

But the work of the camera spoils all the fun of the game. Simply because you can't rotate the camera often results in you falling off the map, and thus taking us back to the beginning of the level. After some time it started to annoy me. It's also a pity that there are so few levels, which are also very short, and the whole game can be completed in maximum 2 hours.

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]

In the game we move a piece of log and our goal in each level is to collect three drops. In addition, we can collect berries, which automatically unlock the next leaves with which we can attack monsters on the map. 

[h1]Graphics[/h1]

These may not be high quality textures, but the graphics are pleasant, clearly aimed at the young player. 

[h1]Sound[/h1]

In the background you can hear calm music, which is not particularly good. It is certainly not worth remembering.

[h1]Summary[/h1]

To sum up, Woodle Tree Adventures is not a bad game, but all the joy of playing is received by the camera, which makes the game difficult and annoying with every minute. This is the main reason why I do not recommend this game, unless you are a calm and patient player, then it is worthwhile to train your patience while playing this game.
[b]

‚úîÔ∏èGood graphics
‚úîÔ∏èTwo-person playability

‚ùåBugs
‚ùåCamera

review:
Il gioco in se non √® malvagio,ma presenta alcune imperfezioni.

In primo luogo non viene rilevato il controller 360 che utilizzo in ogni gioco.
Sorvolando su questo,il gioco risulta un po' legnoso con i movimenti e le dinamiche,ma pu√≤ piacere o meno.
Notando un'ispirazione da super mario 64,non posso che considerare il sistema di movimenti lento.
La telecamera inoltre a volte risulta fastidiosa e il fatto di non poterla regolare rovina i movimenti.

Come detto, per√≤, il gioco non √® male in quanto a idea.Solamente un po' poco fluido nei movimenti di personaggio e telecamera.

Recensione positiva perch√® √® il primo gioco di uno sviluppatore indipendente e voglio sostenerlo

author: {'steamid': '76561198050646172', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 98, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1567070723}
review:
"Woodle Tree Adventures" ist ein Platformer alter Schule und pr√§sentiert sich im Stile eines Mario 64 oder Banjo Kazooie, der Fokus liegt dabei jedoch klar auf Level, Grafik und -Sounddesign und weniger auf dem Gameplay an sich. Das beruhigende und fr√∂hliche Konzept des Spiels zieht sich durch fast alle Bereiche. Der Umfang des Spiels ist dem Preis entsprechend recht gering, ich habe das Spiel kostenlos √ºber Steamgifts erhalten.

Pro:
+Unglaublich knuffiges Figurendesign
+ Die Farbgebung verspr√ºht positive Energie 
+ leichtf√º√üiger, beruhigender Soundtrack
+ Ansprechendes Leveldesign, insbesondere die Schneewelt, die sich teilweise so anf√ºhlt als w√ºrde man auf Watte laufen
+ Die Welten unterscheiden sich angenehm stark
+ Wenn alles funktioniert wie es soll ist das Spiel tats√§chlich eine sehr Stimmungshebende Erfahrung

Contra:
- Die Grafik erinnert stark an unausgereifte Unityprojekte aus dem Anfang des Jahrzehnts
- Die wabbelige Physik-Engine leistet sich immer mal wieder Aussetzer
- Die Steuerung ist stellenweise etwas hakelig, was dem Spielkonzept gegens√§tzlich, zu Frust f√ºhren kann
- Die automatisch wechselnden Kameraperspektiven sind leider selten zugunsten der √úbersicht und f√ºhren schon mal zu dem ein oder anderen unverhofften Bildschirmtod
- Abwechslung im Gameplay ist rar ges√§t, in dieser Hinsicht √§hnelt sich die H√§lfte der sowieso schon wenigen Level zu stark
- Sehr kurz 

Fazit:
Wo das Spiel in Sachen Design auftrumpft versagt es in puncto Gameplay genau an den kritischen Stellen die f√ºr 3D-Platformer wichtig sind, deshalb wird die positive Grundstimmung des Spiels auch immer wieder von dem unausgereiften Gameplay getr√ºbt. Nichtsdestrotz macht es oft Spa√ü die verspielten Welten zu durchlaufen w√§hrend man den beruhigenden Kl√§ngen des Soundtracks lauscht. F√ºr drei Euro oder weniger ist das charmante Jump n' Run Vergn√ºgen f√ºr Genreliebhaber jeden Alters durchaus zu empfehlen, besonders viel darf man aber dem Preis entsprechend nicht erwarten.
72/100

review:
Woodle Tree Adventures es un juego de plataformas en 3D desarrollado y publicado por Fabio Ferrara. En este videojuego, el agua del mundo desaparece y ser√° hasta que el jugador recoja las tres gotas de agua en cada una de las seis etapas para restaurarla.

Es un videojuego sencillo, en cinco horas tal vez se lo puede terminar (dando un promedio de cincuenta minutos por etapa).

El personaje tiene la capacidad de saltar y atacar con una hoja. La hoja puede ser mejorada. El jugador solo puede recibir da√±o una vez, en caso de que suceda simplemente se lo coloca en un punto de guardado anterior.
Como opini√≥n personal: tienen que mejorar los controles y las c√°maras que son una desgracia‚Ä¶

author: {'steamid': '76561198397464077', 'num_games_owned': 152, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 198, 'last_played': 1566415744}
review:
Woodle Tree Adventures √© um game independente de aventura e plataforma 3d, com visual infantil. Ele n√£o apresenta um enredo t√£o bem desenvolvido, voc√™ deve visitar os n√≠veis em busca de tr√™s gotas de √°gua para completar e desbloquear a seguinte, al√©m de tamb√©m coletar berries, umas frutas espalhadas pelos n√≠veis.

As m√∫sicas s√£o bem simples, assim como os controles. A c√¢mera do game √© fixa, te deixando apenas controlar a dist√¢ncia, e √†s vezes ela acaba bugando ou se posicionando da pior forma poss√≠vel. Enfim, o game √© simples e at√© divertido para passar o tempo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002257152', 'num_games_owned': 1079, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 252, 'last_played': 1488037334}
review:
[h1]Review[/h1]
Woodle Tree Adventures is a 3D platformer with a cute art style.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=549949923

You play a little log on the quest of collecting magical water drops on 6 different worlds. Your weapon is a leaf and you can unlock more powerful ones by accumulating enough berries which are scattered around everywhere in the worlds. While the first leaf is only a very short ranged whack, the upgrades cast a tiny tornado.

Many complain about the camera angle. I agree that the default angle is often a frustrating hindrance, but fret not, you can actually control the camera which allows you to have a positive experience.

Unfortunately there are other flaws, such as the gameplay which needs improvements.
First of all, it is too easy. The enemies are barely a threat, especially after unlocking the second leaf. They are no challenge.
Second problem is, whenever you die - usually by clumsily falling off a platform down into the void - you get set back all the way to the starting point of the level. Slain enemies and collected berries do not respawn, that's a boring backtracking.

Another issue is the music. It is - how should I word it? - unpolished. Watch and listen to the video on the store page. The rhythm feels a bit off, I get this unpleasant feeling that notes don't exactly hit their right spot and being played somewhat random. Different parts feel a bit butchered together. The leading instrument is often hasty, jumpy and hard. The music lacks proper intonation, harmony and smoothness. Overall the soundtrack makes me feel uneasy which doesn't fit into that cute world.

The game has 6 worlds, it is short, and most of the time has been spent with collecting 3000 berries for that one achievement by repeating a level over and over again.

I think the most fun in the game I had was messing around with the jumping in the world-select area.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=549949537

[h1]Rating[/h1]
Play Time: 4.2 hours
Normal Price: 2.99 ‚Ç¨ (30 DEC 2019)
Rating: 2 / 4
Price-Performance Ratio: 3 / 4

[h1]Conclusion[/h1]
The decision was a difficult one and it hurts a bit to select "No" to the question if I'd recommend this game. I just saw that a sequel got released, I didn't test it, but one may hope it got some improvements.

author: {'steamid': '76561198105695354', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 124, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 124, 'last_played': 1562096219}
review: Mehhh achievmentsss

author: {'steamid': '76561198074521218', 'num_games_owned': 743, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 148, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 148, 'last_played': 1561156204}
review:
Woodle Tree Adventures suffers from poor keyboard controls and a camera which sometimes has a mind of its own. There are times where I have died in a level due to strange hitboxes and have respawned with the camera in the wrong place, making the level hard to complete.  

The goal is to collect all the water droplets in each level and deliver it to the cup at the end. You can also collect berries which unlock other levels. However, the slow pace of the character makes collecting things very boring. I would not recommend this game, not even for children.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058481394', 'num_games_owned': 1502, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 595, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 589, 'last_played': 1642573268}
review:
I'm not a regular platformer player so I found this one challenging.  The jump mechanic was a little odd as sometimes you land on the very edge of a platform or step above you.  Also, I'm not sure what the headband you eventually earn has any effect or is just for making your creature cuter.

Positives; colourful, cute characters, diverse levels, at least one very easy level, pleasant music and enemies that are one hit KO, easy achievements.
Niggles: wonky camera if you fall off the 'wrong' side of a level and odd zooming at times; you sometimes 'slide' when you jump and not only on the icy level.

If you're nervous about narrow walkways and high places, either don't play or never look down.  Cheers.

PS: Don't let Woodle Tree stand under elevators - doesn't end well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032372768', 'num_games_owned': 285, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 216, 'last_played': 1561703382}
review:
The game is colorful and has a fine amount of design variations in its levels, however the controls and camera angles for me were anger-inducing, and the loading positions each time the player dies are very irritating, confusing and underwhelming. Game should have gone through proper play-testing before release because I feel like it hasn't.

I did not fully enjoy the game, but based on it's price, I will not "NOT RECOMMEND" it, perhaps the developer can fix these issues and it would actually turn out to be a pretty simple & nice game to pass by.

Overall I'm giving it a 3.5 out of 10 in its current state.

author: {'steamid': '76561198258444839', 'num_games_owned': 238, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 120, 'last_played': 1561684066}
review:
Ok, so the game has it's flaws. Sometimes the camera can be a bit janky (Pause and press your attack button to re-angle it if it messes up) and sometimes the controls can be a little slippery. But that's not the point. For some reason this game floods me with nostalgia. I feel like a little kid playing video games with my friends again whenever I hear the soundtrack if that makes sense (Especially the snow level, IT'S SOOOOO GOOD!). I love the feel of this game as well, it reminds me of my own creations. Every once in a while I'll sit down and make a small 16 bit platformer or something just for fun. The levels don't really follow a pattern and there's no fancy gimmicks or extravagant effects. It's simple, and it's something fun just to sit down and play for an hour or so and share with others. This game definitely feels like it was made out of passion rather than to make a perfectly polished game for mass profits, and that's what I like to see in games. Thank you for making this short and adorable platformer!

P.S. I'm the guy that sent the thank you tweet to the dev earlier today. :)

Edit: It's nice to see everyone who enjoyed the game even though they came in for achievements for the summer sale!

review: My Grandfather smoked his whole life. I was about 10 years old when my mother said to him, 'If you ever want to see your grandchildren graduate, you have to stop immediately.'. Tears welled up in his eyes when he realized what exactly was at stake. He gave it up immediately. Three years later he died of lung cancer. It was really sad and destroyed me. My mother said to me- 'Don't ever smoke. Please don't put your family through what your Grandfather put us through." I agreed. At 28, I have never touched a cigarette. I must say, I feel a very slight sense of regret for never having done it, because this game gave me cancer anyway.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079024378', 'num_games_owned': 1706, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1553452556}
review:
It's a bad shovelware platforming game with some redeeming qualities.

The Good:
- Cute art style, kind of similar to Nintendo games on the Wii.
- Progression system is fine, you collect berries and as you collect a certain amount, the next level (among a few other things) will unlock.
- Level design is actually not that bad.

The Okay:
- The story. I know it's a game for babies but there could've been a bit more than "go do this" at the start and "thanks for doing this" at the end.

The Bad:
- Camera system is a damn mess that makes simple platforming unnecessarily frustrating.
- The controls feel like every level is an ice level.
- There is an ice level that... well, it's bad.
- There's an achievement that requires you to play co-op. Apparently keyboard/mouse and a controller is not co-op. You need two controllers.
- Soundtrack is terrible. For example there's a very wholesome looking beach level with some dramatic piano music in the background.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089683297', 'num_games_owned': 1528, 'num_reviews': 108, 'playtime_forever': 112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 112, 'last_played': 1549292212}
review:
[code]If you enjoyed this review, please consider following my Curator Page [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/33864135/]Nep's Gaming Paradise (Nepiki Gaming)[/url] for more reviews![/code]

[h1]Nepiki's Stats[/h1]
[table]
    [tr]
        [td]Overall length[/td]
        [td]1 hour for one playthrough, 1-2 hours for completion.[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Overall difficulty[/td]
        [td]Low difficulty.[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Overall score[/td]
        [td]‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ[/td]
    [/tr]
[/table]

[h1]Review[/h1]
Woodle Tree Adventures gives me the feeling of being a developer‚Äôs firstborn child, and while that does not necessarily come off as bad, there are noticeable improvements to be had. The checkpoints are wonky, but the worst offender of all is easily the non-controllable camera. And even then, there is so little diversity to be had in this game with only half an hour of actual gameplay which only consists of platforming and sometimes attacking. The game is short and easily completable for the completionists out there, but otherwise there is little reason to play this game. It works and Woodle controls alright, but there are too many negatives for me to recommend this game.

[hr]

https://store.steampowered.com/app/299460/

author: {'steamid': '76561198069334972', 'num_games_owned': 332, 'num_reviews': 117, 'playtime_forever': 277, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 264, 'last_played': 1591120722}
review:
It's a small game (1 hour for a full playthrough). The music is mainly based on the piano, but it fits the whole theme and is probably the best part about the game. The controls feel off at times and there are still some glitches on the map, as well as surfaces that your character will surpass, even though the character model appears to be directly on it. The story is shallow and you have no involvement what so ever. On the other hand, it doesn't throw a 20 minute tutorial at you, not even a 10 minute one. You get a 1 minute 'cutscene' as an intro and off you go. I can't recommend it as a game, but if you get it for free and you're looking for a game you can play while watching netflix or listening to music, this is probably what you want. However I wouldn't recommend anyone straight up buying it. 
Not even for 3‚Ç¨. 1/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198276469834', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 327, 'playtime_forever': 581, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 134, 'last_played': 1546656692}
review:
Es un buen intento de plataformero, un tanto inspirado en Mario 3D Land y a su vez nos hace recordar en ciertas partes como si a la vez estubieramos jugando a los diferentes crash¬¥s de los 90¬¥s, pero tiene unos cuantos fallos en cuanto a campo de vision y el manejo de esta, ya que al momento de jugar hay momentos donde es casi crucial tener un mejor campo de vision que el que proporciona el juego, y no es que el hecho de poner la camara fija sea una mala idea, a no ser de que no sea aplicada de la mejor manera. En cuanto a los controles, si estas jugando en el teclado al momento de atacar te sentiras un tanto cansado, puesto que los controles que vienen por defecto no son los mejores, ya si juegas en mando la historia cambia un poco, esos serian los problemas mas sobresalientes con los que te toparias a la hora de jugar, si bien el juego es competable despues de terminar un nivel ya no tienes ganas de seguir jugando por el hecho de lidiar con estos problemas, por otro lado la musica no te brindara la mejor experiencia, ya seria escuchar tu musica preferida mientras juegas a este juego, pero el caso, lo recomiendo pero con una nota mediocre...

5.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198172107071', 'num_games_owned': 128, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 21, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1608347288}
review:
So this game is probably the best game of all time. I mean dont kid yourself just look at those graphics. Any game where you play as a tree stump named woodle is just an absolute top notch game. One con i have about the game is that there is way too much gore in this game but not enough to effect the amazing plot.

100/10 IGN Game of the Year

author: {'steamid': '76561198026786565', 'num_games_owned': 971, 'num_reviews': 165, 'playtime_forever': 268, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 268, 'last_played': 1543183739}
review:
[b][h1]Simples e casual![/h1][/b]

Woodle Tree Adventures √© um game indie de plataforma e aventura, desenvolvido pelo est√∫dio Fabio Ferrara e distribu√≠do pela Chubby Pixel. Lan√ßado para PC em junho de 2014, ganhando uma vers√£o para Nintendo Switch em 2017. 

No game assumimos um simp√°tico e pequeno tronco que equipado com uma mochila e uma folha de √°rvore explora os cen√°rios coletando frutas e enfrentando monstros igualmente caricatos, enquanto tenta encontrar gotas m√°gicas que trar√£o equil√≠brio e paz para a terra.

Com mec√¢nicas simples, onde o jogador deve apenas se movimentar pelos cen√°rios 3Ds e saltar entre as plataformas, Woodle Tree Adventures se demonstra ideal para crian√ßas que est√£o come√ßando a jogar, por apresentar uma dificuldade acess√≠vel onde o maior desafio √© explorar os ambientes para encontrar todas as gotas m√°gicas.

O visual √© simples e infantil, apresentando cen√°rios com um bom level design. Ao todo s√£o apenas seis fases, al√©m de uma fase b√¥nus que s√≥ √© desbloqueada ap√≥s uma quantidade de frutas serem coletadas, fazendo com que o game possa ser finalizado rapidamente, em aproximadamente duas horas e o √∫nico incentivo para se continuar jogando √© desbloquear todas as conquistas do game. 

O game apresenta alguns problemas t√©cnicos, como lentid√£o e imprecis√£o dos movimentos, al√©m da c√¢mera se posicionar automaticamente em alguns momentos em √¢ngulos que n√£o ajudam na jogabilidade, mas apesar disso tais problemas n√£o chegam a estragar a experi√™ncia.  

Woodle Tree Adventures √© um bom game de plataforma, simples, mas funcional, que apresenta alguns problemas de mec√¢nicas. Nitidamente voltado para o publico infantil, mas que tamb√©m pode agradar os f√£s de jogos casuais e ca√ßadores de conquistas. 

[b]Informa√ß√µes adicionais:[/b]
Nota geral: 6,5.
Tempo dedicado ao game: 04 horas.
Conquistas desbloqueadas: 06 de 08.
Dificuldade: Extremamente f√°cil.
Fica a dica: Ideal para crian√ßas.
Gameplay: [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=c0R-yLsUv9U]Em breve.[/url]
Imagens durante a jogatina: [url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/luishq/screenshots/?appid=299460]Clique aqui.[/url]
Vale o pre√ßo? Como o valor √© baixo, at√© vale.
Modo de jogo: Exclusivamente singleplayer.
Idioma: Somente em ingl√™s.

[b]Publicado originalmente no [url=https://portohq.blogspot.com/2018/11/analise-games-woodle-tree-adventures.html]Blog PortoHQ.[/url][/b]

review:
[b]Poszukiwany: kamerzysta[/b]
Oddalanie i przybli≈ºanie, tym dysponuje gracz, poza tym zmiany sƒÖ wymuszone przez grƒô co skutecznie uprzykrza rozgrywkƒô w wielu miejscach jawnie naruszajƒÖc podstawowe nawyki gracza szczeg√≥lnie ≈ºe dotyczy to platform√≥wki 3D.

To zmusi≈Ço mnie do zadania sobie pytania po co tw√≥rcy dali mi ten li≈õƒá??
[b]Kto ma czas na pisanie dokumentacji?[/b]
Wydawa≈Ço by siƒô standardem dla platform√≥wek kt√≥rych uko≈Ñczenie wymaga przechodzenia tych samych plansz kilkukrotnie ≈ºe otrzymujemy jakƒÖ≈õ formƒô statystyk naszych poczyna≈Ñ. [b]≈ömierƒá? Czemu nie![/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198305496918', 'num_games_owned': 663, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 256, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1589102624}
review:
This game, have potential. That's what I can say about it. The problems will be listed down below. Please, please, please do consult these before thinking about buying this game:

1. Camera Angle. Oh boy the camera angle for this game is bad. it can be fix though if the devs would just give us the ability to control the camera angle, but no sadly.

2. The replayability of the game is pretty low to none, you will constantly do the same thing over and over again, hence the low playtime of the game

3. 1-hit enemy. If you get hit, you're dead basically. This also can be fix if the devs would add a health bar for the the character, but if you die, you'll lose some berries & have to collect them back, it will be pretty challenging and fun

Conclusion:

Although the game have problems, there are a few ups as well. The graphic looks nice, characters are cute and soundtrack for me, it's fit well. Just try to not expect a lot of stuff happening when you first try out this game ok?

author: {'steamid': '76561198111628317', 'num_games_owned': 312, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1532366709}
review:
Woodle Tree Adventures si presenta come un platform 3D dai colori molto vivaci e rilassanti. La storia √® ambientata in un pianeta terra a rischio siccit√† e voi, un ceppo di legno, verrete incaricati da un albero sacro per andare alla ricerca delle gocce d'acqua magiche che serviranno a cambiare le sorti del vostro amato pianeta.

Il gioco √® composto da 8 mondi i quali possono essere completati raccogliendo obbligatoriamente 3 gocce d'acqua in ciascun livello. In ogni livello sono presenti anche dei frutti, una sorta di moneta di gioco, "utile" per migliorare l'abilit√† di attacco del nostro personaggio.

I comandi sono abbastanza semplici. Abbiamo il salto, la corsa e l'attacco.

Fin qui potr√† sembrare un gioco carino, simpatico e alla portata di TUTTI ma purtroppo non √® cos√¨.
La telecamera presente in questo titolo √® una schifezza.
Certe volte se ne va a conto suo, mettendosi in posizione frontale al personaggio (succede spesso quando si muore) rendendo quindi impossibile il proseguimento del livello.
Anche il calcolo dei salti risulta spesso "difficile" a causa dei numerosi problemi legati alla telecamera.

Il livello di sfida offerto da questo titolo √® nullo. I nemici presenti in tutti i mondi sono quasi completamente inutili, tolti quei due che ti inseguono o ti lanciano "qualcosa" contro solo se ci passi abbastanza vicino, magari per sbaglio...
Un'altra cosa che non ho apprezzato per niente √® stata la soundtrack, facilmente dimenticabile per quanto √® noiosa e per niente adatta con i livelli di gioco.

Per completare tutti i mondi sono richiesti circa 60 minuti e volendo √® possibile rigiocare uno o pi√π livelli anche in compagnia di un amico, grazie alla modalit√† in split screen.

Onestamente non ne consiglio l'acquisto. I problemi legati alla telecamera sono talmente fastidiosi che rendono il gioco parecchio frustrante.

Pro:

‚ñ≤ Graficamente molto gradevole
‚ñ≤ Struttura dei livelli carina
‚ñ≤ Obbiettivi semplici da sbloccare


Contro:

‚ñº Sviluppatore italiano ma gioco solo in inglese
‚ñº La telecamera √® terribile e il basso budget a disposizione non giustifica questo risultato
‚ñº La soundtrack √® noiosa e non si adatta mai con i livelli
‚ñº I nemici non aumentano il livello di sfida, sono proprio inutili

author: {'steamid': '76561198091728166', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 116, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 116, 'last_played': 1513530280}
review:
Woodle tree adventures tries to be a collectathon platformer just like banjo and mario. However the game is completely blend and boring. You can finish it in 1 hour and don't want to go back to it afterward. 
The game uses a fixed camera which makes it nearly unplayable at times and the music is just way to uninteresting. 
I really tried to like this game, especially for its cute art style, but I just couldn't. 
Don't buy this game. 

Rating: 
Gameplay: 2/5 - The controls are okay but you can't move the camera. 
Level Design: 2/5 - There is no challenge at all and the levels are very blend in general 
Soundtrack: 1/5 - It just doesn't work with the game 
Story: 3/5 - Enough for a platformer 
Graphics: 3/5 - The game looks pretty 
Length: 1/5 - Less than 1 hours long 
Replay Value: 1/5 - Nearly non existing 
Enjoyment: 2/5 - Sadly, I couldn't really enjoy this game at all

author: {'steamid': '76561198166231490', 'num_games_owned': 317, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 27, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1505871002}
review:
Not really the best of games. Camera needs some serious work, as it is often the cause of failing a level, or dying to an enemy you literally cannot see. First times i tried to play it it wouldn't even work properly, due to the massive lag I experienced. Level design needs work. If the camera and loading issues were fixed, this would be an okay game that would be worth getting on sale.

Okay story, backpack gets too big during play through. Those two parts of the sentence were completely unrelated, but needed saying. I wanted to refund it, but it was too long between buying it and playing it. It's really too bad the developer didn't listen to the criticisms of his game, bc they made a second one with the exact same problems.

Characters are cute, just needs a lot of work to play. IF you still have your mind set on it, get it on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072369473', 'num_games_owned': 190, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1530074095}
review:
If you're searching for good platformer games who has similiarities with Spyro and Mario 3D, this is not for you.
I have several issues with this game, and I can't recommend this to anyone.

The first one is the level design, level design in this game is completely plain, boring, and also sucks.
Second, the backpack funcionality. As you collect berry, the backpack is gotten bigger and ruining the gameplay.
Third, one hit die. If you got hit by enemy (I can't even tell where is the enemy and where's ally) you just die and going back all the way to the first place.. come on can you at least give us Health bar or something?
The Fourth issues is the controls feels rigged and hard to move if you're using keyboard and the movement is slippery, like.. why?
and The Last one is bugs, I got stucks like 3 times in the first level and my character suddenly fell off when riding moving platform...

The art direction is also unpolished and plain. I barely play it, this games is not even mediocre it suckass.
2/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198196615109', 'num_games_owned': 64, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 169, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1550973440}
review:
Super cute and relaxing. Good (also chill) music loop--I don't even notice. Fun to pass time while still feeling like you've done something (AKA collecting bits). Anyone of any age can play; enemies are varied but not difficult to defeat. 
Only thing is, you can't control the camera angle. You can zoom in/out wiht the mouse by moving forward/backward, but the angle itself only changes when the game wants to or when you step into a different area.
[EDIT]: *As I play more the camera is getting worse. In some areas you must walk along narrow paths or fall off. Because the camera controls your walk angle as well (forward is directly away from camera, etc.) it can be very difficult and annoying.*

Haven't tested 2player mode--YET. +I see a review that says there isn't 2P, but there's an acheivement for it so we'll see+
I'm an adult and still enjoy it.

Pros:
-adorable and unique asthetic
-relaxing gameplay
-decent music
-easy (I'm someone who gets angry at games very easily, but not Woodle Tree!)

Cons:
-camera control could **definitely** be improved

author: {'steamid': '76561198129771193', 'num_games_owned': 799, 'num_reviews': 303, 'playtime_forever': 104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 104, 'last_played': 1528666810}
review: I suspect this game is inteneded for kids. Either way, it's not worth any money. The camera angles are incredibly bad, and you can't control them (though you can zoom in and out). Another issue is the backpack. As you collect berries it fills up, but it rapidly gets so big that it blocks your view. If you enjoy platformers there are much better ones out there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043782587', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 598, 'playtime_forever': 89, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1527289783}
review:
Ok guys, we morning tree stumps now.

Or don't know. Remember when Steam sales were still exciting and you would buy random super cheap game just out of curiousity, while believing that you save a lot of money anyway? And now we just don't want to clutter our library with less than decent game.

Well, this is less than decent game. A 3D platformer of sorts. Super simplistic. It tries to remind you of Mario 64 or so times, but the main difference is that those old 3D platformers made you feel like exploring real-like yet designed in fun ways places and obstacles. Well, real-like compared to 2D gaming. Here it's all blocks in air after blocks in air. Controls is simple aside from part where you can turn yet can't slow down in air. Weird.

And I don't know. No bosses. You whack enemies with a leaf, they lazily die. Very passive. Too easy aside from platforming. Sometimes you respawn from what appears to be a checkpoint, sometimes at a start of a level. It's kinda not offensively bad... but... is that it? Also, 6 short levels plus a bonus one. Yeh.

Feels like a student project than a real game to sell on Steam, you know.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053638029', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 249, 'last_played': 1525022877}
review:
It's a game for kids. I bought it while ago on sale, because of trading cards. Later I decided to get all the achivements and it was 'okay experience', thanks to existing guides on the Internet. Achivements are poorly dimensioned - the game itself has zero replay value and forcing you to collect 3000 berries would mean playing the game through multiple times. And where's fun at that?

Other than that, there are some occasional programming problems - initiating bird eye view is not zoomed in and you have to restart the game, leaf projectiles in the game ignore walls sometimes, player does not have complete control over the camera. 

I still recommend this game, because I am not clearly target audience and I can imagine kids having fun playing this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009474997', 'num_games_owned': 2217, 'num_reviews': 1072, 'playtime_forever': 414, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 414, 'last_played': 1530802699}

author: {'steamid': '76561198413987657', 'num_games_owned': 3035, 'num_reviews': 129, 'playtime_forever': 320, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 320, 'last_played': 1531151143}
review:
Don't let the cute art deceive you, this game can be quite finicky. Though that is mostly owed to awkward camera angles making it tricky to maneuver at times. This game is adorable. It really is. It does however also offer very little explanation. Some things are intuitive, some less so. Which cute critter is an enemy (and which one asks "Why did you hit me? :( " when you try to hit it before it touches you)?

The mechanics are simple enough to figure out, but there are plenty occasions where you wish you could do more with the camera. Generally you have an option to zoom in or out, but sometimes it's a turn in the angle you really want. At times the camera changes angels by itself - sometimes so fast that it sends you over the edge, e.g. you wanna run around a corner, the angle shifts but you still press the same keys as before, so running up and right now sends you over the edge instead of around the block.

You don't need to collect every single fruit to complete a level (you'll need three 'tears' and reach the goal with them to finish), but you'll find that you wanna collect as many fruits as possible because they're needed to unlock other worlds and other features. So the choice is yours: rush through the level a lot of times to get what you need, or take your time and collect as much as you can each time? The backpack growing with the amount of berries you have is a cute touch, but you'll never know your total until you finish a level (unless you were manually counting them yourself, but with 100+ berries in the first level alone, have fun with that).

'Death' in a level is a minor setback. Initially it just sends you back to the beginning of the stage, but you still keep the tears and berries you collected. So if you, for example, fell to your death on your way back from a branch, you don't have to go back on that branch. There seem to be more spawning or checkpoints in various levels though. I doubt I found them all but it's certainly nice to know I don't have to walk all the way when I miscalculate my jump just before the level exit.

This game could do with some fixing, and the whimsical camera might eat away at your patience, but overall it's still an adorable, loveable game. There already is a part 2 at this point so I don't expect the cameras to change in this one, but if you get it in a bundle or sale,  you'll definitely have a few hours of gameplay in this one that are stuffed with cuteness and jumping deaths.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960931103', 'num_games_owned': 483, 'num_reviews': 213, 'playtime_forever': 146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 146, 'last_played': 1518739586}
review:
Woodle‚Ä¶.not a good game. A very short platformer. You go around collecting berries and drops of water on several different levels. There are enemies, some of them don‚Äôt move. There are upgrades to your single attack, that don‚Äôt make a difference. 

The graphic style and your character are cute. Unfortunately, the rest goes downhill.

The camera is downright unacceptable. The only control is zooming in and out. The camera angle can change randomly after dying. The camera zoom level can change randomly during a level. By far the worst part of the game.

Depth perception is also affected by this bad camera system. Sometimes I would walk right off the edge of a level thinking a platform was connected instead of floating.

When you die, you get reset. However, dying at the same point will sometimes reset you back to the beginning of the level. 

There are random level pieces in the background when you zoom out. Probably left over from developing the game but never took them out.

Level design is erratic with no flow. Seemingly random obstacles were created.

[b]Pros[/b]
+60fps
+Graphics style & character are cute
+Music on some levels

[b]Cons[/b]
+Terrible camera
+Level design doesn‚Äôt make sense
+Vague controls
+Short (1 hour maybe?)
+Random camera resets
+Random respawn points
+Enemies are mostly pointless

This is bordering on an unfinished game. There is very little content or fun to be had.

[b]2/10)[/b] Not good

author: {'steamid': '76561198200877527', 'num_games_owned': 165, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 126, 'last_played': 1512132334}
review:
Developed by Fabio Ferrara and published by Chubby Pixel, Woodle Tree Adventures, first made a splash back in 2014, when Chubby Pixel brought the tree focused platformer to Steam on the 6th of June. By no means was it the biggest platformer, as the game solely consisted of 6 worlds and a hub world, but the game with a colourfully cute and rather unique art style, did go on to win the hearts of some of those who played it. A sequel by the name of Woodle Tree 2: Worlds was released in 2016 and it changed what the game could be. It was a much larger open world platformer than the first game was and had a hell of a lot more features at play, as the little Woodle Tree protagonist, could now use his leaf to glide, have tea with a fox and push a block. If it wasn‚Äôt for the fact both games share a protagonist, a title, the same graphics and catchy tunes that are of the old school variety, you would think the two games have nothing to do with one another as Woodle Tree 2: Worlds, is on a whole other level. In fact, it is actually a shame the sequel isn‚Äôt on Switch, as it does look like a game that players of any age can enjoy, despite the children‚Äôs TV show vibe it has going on, but instead, for now, what we‚Äôve got is the first game in the series. Woodle Tree Adventures isn‚Äôt an appalling game, it‚Äôs just not its sequel, but fortunately for us, it‚Äôs not Woodle Tree Adventures that Chubby Pixel brought to the Nintendo Switch, because what we got, is Woodle Tree Adventures Deluxe. Instead of just porting the game in its original state to Switch, it was instead decided to make the total world count 8, as well as adding new items, improving the graphics vastly and ensuring Woodle Tree Adventures Deluxe runs at 60fps. Visually, the game does in fact, look better and performs very well, but one aspect where the game was said to be improved, I feel as if a little more could have been done. When it comes to platformers, the two most important things are precision and camera angles and Woodle Tree Adventures Deluxe does fail a little on both, especially the later. Although the camera angles and movements have been reworked, there are plenty of instances across the various levels when the camera placement feels completely wrong and even when you use the right analog stick to zoom in or out, it can still be more of a hindrance than an actual help, so if you do plummet to your death, get ready to respawn at an earlier save point on the world you‚Äôre currently playing. The good news about dying though, is that in this 3D platformer, the lives are infinite and all the berries and Fairy‚Äôs Tears that you collected, will remain intact, so as long as you picked them up, no matter how many times you die, even when the enemies you‚Äôll encounter, one hit KO you, your little knapsack on your back, will remain full! Now, while the Fairy‚Äôs Tears are very important to collect as there are three on each level and are the whole point of Woodle Tree Adventures Deluxe, as it is the protagonist‚Äôs task to collect these tears, to quench the thirst of a thirsty world, but the berries are important to get as well. Sure you can‚Äôt advance to the next level unless you collect all three Tears and take them to the cups located near the end of the level, but there are two levels that withheld from you, as each one requires a set number of berries to unlock them, and there are items that take the same approach as well. In the hub world, which is where all worlds can be accessed, both in and outside your house, for 200 berries, you can get a better leaf, then an even better leaf for 400 and the best leaf going for 800. Each leaf can kill enemies in the one hit, but some of them actually fire off a projectile/gust of wind of sorts. As for 850 berries that will let you unlock a headband that can be worn in a bid to decorating your little Woodle Tree. So without a doubt, it does definitely pay to strive to run and jump your way into collecting every berry going, even if the controls do seem to try and over compensate  by having you jump further than you would like, but childlike or not, although Woodle Tree Adventures Deluxe can be beaten well within 2 hours, it can be a pretty enjoyable game if you give it a chance and give yourself over to the tranquil tunes that are there to serenade you with serenity, as opposed to making you jump up and down like any kids song from most kid shows. So definitely don‚Äôt underestimate Woodle Tree Adventures Deluxe, it won‚Äôt blow your mind, but it can surprise you as you will enjoy it more than you think you will.
CONCULSION Although Woodle Tree Adventures Deluxe is not a platformer that can solely be played by those who aren‚Äôt adults, as older players above the age of 18 can enjoy this simpler take on the platformer genre, I do however think that Woodle is better played with children. If you are a parent and you have a young child looking for a game they can play by themselves, with you sat beside them, ready to assist or give advice, then this is where Woodle comes into its own. It is the video game equivalent to a bicycle with stabilisers on that can be played more than once, so you‚Äôll easily get your $4.99 back. But even if you don‚Äôt have a child, you can still get it, as you‚Äôll probably play it at least twice in the whole time you have it because it‚Äôs not a bad game, but during both those times you play, you won‚Äôt get the true experience Woodle Tree Adventures Deluxe has to offer.
10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198061037557', 'num_games_owned': 157, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1502040632}
review: This is the best game i have ever played and i doubt there will be a better one, until the elder scrolls 6 comes out. 3 and a half years later i still find interest in starting a whole new character and there are so many possibilities in terms of what class you choose to create. The quests and joy are never ending with this game, im always finding something new or a new quest. The modding community is great, and you can further extend the length and depth of this already massive game with the mods. Also the DLC's are amazing and a great addition. If you haven't played this game before, don't wait around just buy it already, what are you waiting for!!

review:
Art/Graphics: 3/5.(Simplistic, but cute)
Immersion: 2/5....(Game is just way too slow paced) 
Gameplay: 2/5.....(Too basic) 
Controls: 1/5.....(Very bad) 
Value: 3/5........(It is cheap)
Difficulty: 2/5...(As much as I played) 
--------------
Overall 2.2 (Difficulty always excluded)

[url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/31208751/]Please follow my Pixel Art Curation to discover other great games...[/url]


I really wanted to enjoy this game...

I am a big fan of the old 3D Zelda's and the likes, so I look forward to new implementations...For example, I LOVE Unbox and this it is an awesome concept, fun game play and very well implemented.

Unfortunately, this game only has the fact that it is a 3D adventure, going for it...

It is a cutesy world, that on the surface seems like it will be an enjoyable experience, but it stops very short.

The controls (escape closes game), character animation, hitboxes, camera angle/controls are ALL very wonkey!!!

The game is very basic with run, jump and attack, all of which feels very odd, delayed and unpleasant.  The character performs at a very slow pace, which is not enjoyable.

The worst part of the whole thing is fixed camera angle, that can only be adjusted with a zoom in and out, but that gets reset to odd points.  It is very hard to see the level, where you are going and what you are picking up or avoiding.  At one point, there are a Orsen Wells angle that locked in, after I feel from the platform and the camera was lock down almost below the feet :(

I really feel like this is an unfinished demo/project, rather than a well polish game and probably is not ready to be on Steam as of yet.

Even for the inexpensive cost, this game is more frustrating than fun :(


ACHIEVEMNETS:  Just finish the game (one co-op achievement) if you can tolerate it ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198045359528', 'num_games_owned': 364, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1515278519}
review: This is a gentle platformer. It almost feels like a game intended to introduce new players to the platforming genre. The controls are stiff but not sloppy - they feel a bit like driving an SUV with oversize tires. The camera is infamously poor, although I've seen worse camera controls and angles in bigger budget games. Neither the music nor sound effects provide information, so it's hearing impairment friendly. It's a very colorful, big-shaped world, with slow-paced music and enemies that mostly don't even try to hurt you. "Death" has, as far as I can tell, no concequences other than replacing you at your last invisible checkpoint, tear drops and berries intact. It has very little replay value, and an overly ambitious 3,000 berry achievement for a 6 level game. But for a couple of bucks, it can provide some relaxing entertainment for all ages.

author: {'steamid': '76561198306160639', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 194, 'last_played': 1498798488}
review: The movement on the game is nice, you can run and accelerate and even jump While going around the world! you're able to collect berries that will help you during your journey!

author: {'steamid': '76561198036162044', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 64, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1402179845}
review:
Not a very pleasant game.
Soft and charming characters and models look very clunky due to amateur animations. Music is uninspired, unmemorable. 
Biggest crime is the level design. Not overly fun to play due to blocky and soul-less mapping. Gameplay is serviceable for a 3D platformer, but does not stand well against other platforming titles. Unsatisfying ending, minimal story.
Recommended if you want a quick, simple and cheap 3D platformer.
Not recommended if you expect a memorable 3D platformer.
3/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198098448007', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 148, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 93, 'last_played': 1592100190}
review:
Juego simple, rese√±a simple:

Juego algo flojo pero no injugable, vale lo poco que cuesta, si ten√©s hijos muy chiquitos de hecho lo podrian disfrutar.

Pros:
[list]
[*]Extremadamente barato
[*]Va al grano al apenas empezar a jugar
[*]Estilo artistico simplista pero lindo de ver
[*]Controles basicos y sencillos de aprender
[*]No tiene vidas, limite de tiempo, ni penalizacion alguna por morir excepto volver un poco mas atras en el nivel, relajante
[*]Musica aceptable, la musica cambia dependiendo de la tematica del nivel
[*]Se pueden comprar objetos
[*]No hay ningun tipo de violencia, bueno para los mas chicos
[*]No requiere una pc avanzada para jugar fluido
[/list]

Contras:
[list]
[*]Extremadamente corto. (1 hora de juego como maximo)
[*]Animaciones flojas tanto en el personaje como en los enemigos
[*]Efectos de sonido pocos o nulos, casi imperceptibles.
[*]Algunas melodias no son tan buenas
[*]Los objetos adquiribles apenas sirven y no son necesarios para avanzar
[*]La camara a veces se buguea y enfoca desde el punto de vista equivocado
[*]Es facil caer al vacio y tener que empezar de nuevo
[*]Historia sosa y floja (aunque para ser sinceros no se deberia esperar mucho)
[/list]

author: {'steamid': '76561198026971090', 'num_games_owned': 1037, 'num_reviews': 115, 'playtime_forever': 4205, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1700108061}
review:
The game's objective is very simple, you collect raindrops to finish the levels. In addition you collect berries amongst the way. There are enemies, you kill them but however no points or whatsoever is gained. Get hit and you respawn either at the start or at some point you've reach. That's basically it if you ask me. So overall, the game is VERY easy. Though, I'd say it requires some patience particularly when you're jumping from one spot to another lol.

Achievements are really easy but as said, this game requires some patience so it may take time to get some of the achievements such as 3000 berries.... Unless you're very quick at collecting them. The graphics I really nice. It's simple, vibrant and looks very fun to attract the eye. The soundtrack is pleasant and soothing to listen while playing. 

Do I recommended this game? Yes, it may be worth the full price depending how long you spend finishing it considering the $1 = 1 hour of gameplay rule. If you're someone who got this for really cheap or a steam key like me. This game is something you would play when bored/have time to kill. 

So keep calm and COLLECT THEM BERRIES O____O
