review:
Es un juego de plataforma bastante corto en duraci√≥n. Sin embargo se entiende ya que el juego parece estar dirigido mas que nada a un p√∫blico infantil. Los dise√±os de los personajes y escenarios son bastante agradables y simpaticos. La musica de ambiente tambien es muy bonita y sabe acompa√±ar al juego. Complete los niveles principales y por lo que pude notar el juego no tiene ning√∫n bug.
El unico inconveniente del juego es que la camara es un poco compleja de manejar, y solo puedes acercarla o alejarla del personaje, por lo que en algunas zonas podria resultar complejo el movimiento.
Sin embargo, es un buen juego. 8/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995102061', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 79, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 79, 'last_played': 1511529260}
review:
This game is really crudely done. Don't expect clever level designs, a clear concept of where to go, animations that give good feedback for player actions, reasonable camera controls, joystick code that works, or any of the polish you'd expect from a game made in this century.

This game is good if you're looking for some nostalgia for a 1999 shareware game that would run on your shiny new 3dfx card. Otherwise don't buy it.

I'd give this a 100% score if it was made by a high schooler for his computer science final grade, but as far as a commercial product it's not worthy of being in Steam's storefront.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021845514', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 4008, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1290, 'last_played': 1629051910}
review:
You play as a sentient tree log collecting acorns for upgrades and fairy tears. This is a platforming game. The conrolls are basic and enemies are not very challenging. I would get this game only if you want to play with young kids. You can play multiplayer as a beaver with a second controller and help who ever is the main character

This game is simple and you cannot controll the camera which is annoying but can still be enjoyable. The game is fun but I am only reccomending it because of the price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067485129', 'num_games_owned': 279, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 660, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 660, 'last_played': 1510176321}
review:
[i] ATEN√á√ÉO: Como a steam n√£o disponibiliza um meio termo entre as avalia√ß√µes e o jogo foi √∫til para mim optei por recomend√°-lo, por√©m leia as observa√ß√µes![/i]

Vamos falar de Woodle Tree Adventures!

O jogo foi desenvolvido pelo Fabio Ferrara e distribuido pela Chubby Pixel em 2014. Woodle Tree Adventures se trata de um jogo com a pegada de cl√°ssicos de plataforma dos anos 90 mas dessa vez em 3D, al√©m disso possui uma arte extremamente atraente! O jogo tamb√©m conta com uma DLC [b]Gr√°tis[/b] onde se encontra um pack de musicas que infelizmente s√£o muito repetitivas e com o tempo acabam irritando...

O jogo tamb√©m possui [b]Cards Steam[/b] e [b]Achievements[/b], os achievements s√£o bem f√°ceis de conseguir e sua grande maioria se completa durante o zeramento do jogo, [i] ao final da analise fix√°rei um Guia para auxiliar quem tem interesse nos mesmos![/i]

Falando sobre a hist√≥ria do jogo, a mesma √© quase inexistente o que me deixou um tanto quanto desapontado... B√°sicamente temos 2 di√°logos o primeiro explicando que precisamos buscar √°gua e o ultimo agradecendo o servi√ßo no fim do jogo...

Quanto a mec√¢nica o jogo, a mesma deixa a desejar e [b]MUITO![/b] no controle de c√¢mera, o que as vezes podem causar mortes extremamente irritantes. Quanto a movimenta√ß√£o do personagem temos algo interessante e fluido e pode ser alterada pelo tipo de piso ou mundo em que voc√™ se encontra, o que ao meu ver √© um ponto positivo.

Conclus√£o: Recomendo este jogo para pessoas entusiastas de jogos de plataformas e caso entre em promo√ß√£o para aquelas que buscam alguns Achievements novos!

author: {'steamid': '76561197977683490', 'num_games_owned': 92, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1509582366}
review:
Concept is interesting, but still has a lot of work for this to be a completed game. Feels like a $1 game from the 90s. Not worth your time, unless you enjoy incompleted demo-ish games. 

Some of the reasons why:
‚Ä¢ No in-game tutorial
‚Ä¢ Controllers aren't well configured
‚Ä¢ Poor character control
‚Ä¢ Poor Camera control (strange default angles and views)
‚Ä¢ No in-depth story
‚Ä¢ Strange characters that you don't know if they're good or bad
‚Ä¢ Menus/Views that you can't exit when you're exploring
‚Ä¢ Falling through walls
‚Ä¢ Random respawn locations

author: {'steamid': '76561198223274944', 'num_games_owned': 402, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 154, 'last_played': 1509238700}
review:
Este juego tiene sus pro y sus contras...
Para empezar, a la hora de juzgarlo hay que tener en cuenta que si steam tuviese una etiqueta de clasificaci√≥n de edades (muy necesaria me parece) por ahi donde est√°n las etiquetas, los analisis, la fecha de lanzamiento y todo eso, en este juego seguramente dir√≠a que es para ni√±os. Por su jugabilidad simple, de controles b√°sicos, corta duraci√≤n y niveles sin gran dificultad, sobre todo en cuanto a temas de combate, se nota que fue pensado para un p√∫blico menor.

Por lo positivo, la m√∫sica me pareci√≥ agradable y relajante, lo cual combinado con las visuales tiernas y coloridas y la jugabilidad para ni√±os, lo convierte en un juego muy relajante, ideal para cuando no est√°s para engancharte con nada complicado o con historias que te comprometan mucho.

Por lo negativo. Necesita seriamente permitir al jugador controlar la c√°mara, porque la verdad los √°ngulos a veces no te dejan ver a d√≥nde ten√©s que ir, saltar o lo que sea y en estas ocasiones, no muchas en mi caso por suerte, termin√°s movi√©ndote a ciegas y cayendote un par de veces hasta que logr√°s adivinar c√≥mo era la cosa.  
No le vendr√≠a mal tampoco un men√∫ un poquito m√°s avanzado, donde puedas configurar controles a tu gusto y cosas as√≠, adem√°s de evitar que el salir del juego sea simplemente presionar Esc. Para terminar, tiene alg√∫n temita de optimizaci√≥n se ve, porque me funcion√≥ algo lento, lo cual es raro siendo un juego de los requisitos y calidad que es.

Para resumir, es un juego que me pareci√≥ agradable y divertido, pero que tiene algunas cosas que mejorar. Estas cosas no me impidieron disfrutar el juego, pero tampoco me dejaron disfrutarlo al 100%

author: {'steamid': '76561198050680766', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 37, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1532219741}
review:
My friend bought this for me when it was 10 cents as a joke. I wish it would go on sale for 10 cents again, I'd buy enough copies to give to literally everyone on my friends list because it's so bad. I played it with some friends and I couldn't stop laughing the whole time. It's not even a dollar right now on sale (50 cents) and it's made me happier than some games I've paid more than 5 bucks for, so I'd say it's really worth it. You can zoom out endlessly until it's just sky. It's so great. 
If it wont break the bank, have a good giggle at how awful it is. 

10/10 Woodle Tree Best Tree changed my life I cri eritiem

review: The camera angles on this game are atrocious. You can't tell depth and you spend most of the time falling through gaps you didn't know were there. Soundtrack isn't very good. While I do find it fun to collect berries and teardrops, the HORRIBLE camera angles kill the game. Tje graphics are cute, but that does not make up for the inability to jump to places without fallng to your doom.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022423584', 'num_games_owned': 769, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1572240725}
review:
The "music" gave me a migraine. Literally 90% of it is just notes assembled without any tempo or melody. Also, the volume of the music changes seemingly randomly in the middle of some tracks. One of the few games I've ever played that's made me feel nauseous from the sound design alone. And the level design isn't much better - it follows a similar pattern as the music which is to say it doesn't follow a pattern at all. It's just shapes thrown all over the place for you to jump between. And if you fall down? Better hope the game actually registers that you're near a checkpoint, or you'll be sent back to the very start of the level... which will happen 2/3 of the time. The camera will make sure you do fall off the edge a few times, too, or walk straight into an enemy that you had no idea was there (because you were walking towards the screen...)
Avoid this shovelware like the plague.

author: {'steamid': '76561198215707559', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 54, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1507728774}
review:
This game reminds me of early 3d adventure/platformers from the 1990s such as Dex, Glover, etc. It's not really as refined (as games made 20 years ago), but thats how it feels. The whole point of the game is to explore 3d environments looking for a few items. There is some light combat, but it feels very off.

It's probably appropriate for a child, but I wouldn't really recommend this outside of a steam sale or bundle.  Yes, it has cards and achievements, but the achievements will be a chore.

author: {'steamid': '76561198145493480', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 8, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1501763005}
review: This game is definitely for kids. I got this game out of a random steam key and I said "Hey why not?". I didnt even play it for long and I already got the idea of what is was. This is a platformer that was quite obviously inspired by sonic and super mario galaxy. Yet it's oddly, different. With enemies that arent even hard to get passed. Most of them dont even move. Waste of money. They have a text box, and a camera, with angles that make it seem like the tree thing is talking. But the only noise that comes from a living thing in this game is your 1 and only annoyingly repetative jump.  If you are below 12 maybe. But this title isnt worth what it is selling for.

author: {'steamid': '76561198540692162', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 8, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1527255789}
review:
Played through this game during after wifi went down because I had nothing better to do. This is what I though of it.

Positives

-Artwork: Everything in this game is fun to look at and very pleasing to look at while playing.

-Steam Trading Cards: At least this is included and this seems to be why most people bought the game.

-Short: In the end it can be completed in less than an hour and is cute and frustrating at the same time

Negatives

- Camera angles: Holy cow,  ever wanted to play a platforming game with a locked camera sometimes pointing the wrong angle at a 45 degree angle so you are unable to see anything? I certianly dont.

- Checkpoints: The first time I fell off of a clip because of the camera angles I was returned back to a few seconds before where I was when I fell off the cliff. So where do you think I would be returned after falling off a platform (again, due to camera angles) less than a second from the end of the level? All the way back to the beginning? I don't know why that would be a thing.

If you got this on accident and you are unable to refund than it is worth your time to check out but do not purposefully spend your hard earned money on this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027267313', 'num_games_owned': 1838, 'num_reviews': 4460, 'playtime_forever': 216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 216, 'last_played': 1500958513}
review:
Tags: 3PP- Third Person Platformer
Additional Tags: Delete Local Content & Remove from Library

TLDR: I am pleased with Xbox pad support, the art direction for the visuals but everything else comes up short of even minimal standards for a third person platformer release. Obtain and try for free or better yet avoid altogether, this is not a pleasant experience in this genre and there are better uses of your time out there.

Review: Level design is extremely corridor-ish with no exploration, levels that float in thie middle of empty space, no exploration or freedom whatsoever. Goes against the formula established by successful third person platformers such as mario64 which I felt this game was sort of emulating in a generic knockoff kind of way. The camera work is all wonked out and it is sometimes very hard to see where you are headed and what you are doing. The combat is insanely floaty and non kinetic, you fight by swinging a tree leaf around. You can collect berries and apples which I guess are like coins. Audio was lacking in comparison to the somewhat charming visuals. Not a lot of abilities and moves I could do by the time I abandonned play, I suspect there are little to none. Death is handled intelligently in that you just spawn back at the beginning of the level with previously killed foes remaining dead and any collected coins kept collected. This helps to compensate from the unplayable state of the combat and camera and allows for some kind of progression albeit not very fun. Removing game for declutter.

review: I wish I could give this game a good review. The graphics are decent, the story is fairly original, but the controls and camera angles are fairly dogsh*t. What's more, the achievements don't award even when I reload the game. This looks and plays like a developer's first draft of his first game, rather than the final product. I would only recommend buying this game if its sale price is cheaper than the trading cards you can get playing it.

review:
I was hoping for a casual relaxing experience, but got a terrible camera and clunky controls instead.

It's cheap, it has a demo, and the developer seemed to have put love into it, which is nice, but Woodle Tree Adventures is still too much of a mess for me to recommend, even if you were to get it for free.

author: {'steamid': '76561198335486643', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 81, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1655406053}
review:
Pues, al empezar a usar steam por una u otra razon me encontre este juego, al principio se veia sumamente interesante, con bonitos graficos y parecia entretenido.
Ahora que lo pude empezar a jugar me lleve algo de desepcion...
Para empezar, creo que el jugar con mouse es bastante complicado llegando a cansar bastante (tengo mando, lo probe con mando y se juega bien, pero igual deberia estar mejor optimizado para mouse)
En tanto a jugabilidad no es la gran cosa, das un golpe a los enemigos con una hoja y PUMBA cargados asi de facil, las animaciones de muerte en general tambien estan meh...
Pero lo mas odioso, lo mas pu*****te odioso es la camara QUE SE MUEVE A SU PROPIO GUSTO.
En fin, se que en realidad este juego en si tampoco ofrece mucho, pero la verdad me desepciono
No lo recomiendo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198215469363', 'num_games_owned': 274, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 260, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1501345809}

author: {'steamid': '76561198198054513', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1497670200}
review: Woodle Tree Adventures caught my attention when I first saw it. I had it in my wishlist for a while and purchase it in a bundle with Woodle Tree Adventures 2. It's a simply platformer but very enjoyable depending on the type of gamer you are. Me being a gamer, I'm open to any game that interests me, it just needs to be fun. I did have fun playing this game, and I felt rather relaxed playing it too, mostly due to the the impressive soundtrack and level design, My only problem with this game however is it's respawn system and what I mean is when you reach block B from block A. If you die father from block B, you'll respawn back to block B, but if you die closer to it, or just fell it cause the edges are very slippy and you can fall off easily if you by the edge. You'll spawn back to block A, which made the game more challenging and kept me on my toes. The story was straight forward, and what some could say basic. But I felt like the gameplay itself helps explains the story more when you playing it. I would give this game a 9/10 and I even found myself revisiting it just to play again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007471259', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 239, 'playtime_forever': 180, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 180, 'last_played': 1497543184}
review:
Boring and simple platformer. 3/10.
There are ca. 8 levels, where you need to find 3 water drops to finish it. Alongside, you also collect berries. Although there is an attack key, it is rarely used, and so you basically just jump around a bit. Finished it in 2.5h. Camera is a problem. Should be free.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056329822', 'num_games_owned': 2641, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 176, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 151, 'last_played': 1506336914}
review:
Rather minimalistic simple jump'n'run. Basic, easy, good for newcomers in gaming. Although, jump sequences may be an issue at times, due to the standard 3D jump'n'run stiff camera problem.

The camera is ok when it works but can freak out (in terms of not adjusting to the level segment you enter/leave), overall you shouldn't look too much into the technical parts of the game altogether.

Had quite some fun with it regardless. Initially bought this because of the aesthetics reminding me of N64 and Kirby, don't expect much though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058495950', 'num_games_owned': 429, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 551, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 241, 'last_played': 1569427201}
review:
Video game mascots are one of the pinnacle inventions that brought the market back from the brink. For kids, it was a way for them to connect, to easily recognize out in the wild, and more importantly, allowed the arguments of who was better: Mario or Sonic? These conversations continued up to the fifth generation of the Playstation, Sega Saturn, and Nintendo 64. As time went on, these mascots seemed to fall back to the shadows (with the exception of Mario and terrible Sonic games), but there‚Äôs always something so charming about a main protagonist that resembles the characters on a cartoon. Chubby Pixel has braced an entry into the mascot platforming genre with Woodle Tree Adventures as a charismatic log, armed with a giant leaf, set to collect special apples and water droplets to give new life to his forest home.

Woodle Tree Adventures is a recreation of the popular 3D platformers like Super Mario 64, Spyro, and Croc. There are six worlds to explore (seven once you‚Äôve collected 600 apples which means finishing the game) of all different atmospheres including wintry wonderlands, water ridden marshes, and bee infested honeycombs. Strapped with an ever growing bag, you‚Äôll collect apples which will unlock new worlds.


Mar022015
Woodle Tree Adventures ‚Äì Indie Game Review

    Posted by Eric M Hunter 

 

Games like: Super Mario 64, Sypro, Croc

TL;DR

Time played: 70 minutes

Video game mascots are one of the pinnacle inventions that brought the market back from the brink. For kids, it was a way for them to connect, to easily recognize out in the wild, and more importantly, allowed the arguments of who was better: Mario or Sonic? These conversations continued up to the fifth generation of the Playstation, Sega Saturn, and Nintendo 64. As time went on, these mascots seemed to fall back to the shadows (with the exception of Mario and terrible Sonic games), but there‚Äôs always something so charming about a main protagonist that resembles the characters on a cartoon. Chubby Pixel has braced an entry into the mascot platforming genre with Woodle Tree Adventures as a charismatic log, armed with a giant leaf, set to collect special apples and water droplets to give new life to his forest home.
The hut makes a sort of hub between worlds.

The hut makes a sort of hub between worlds.

Woodle Tree Adventures is a recreation of the popular 3D platformers like Super Mario 64, Spyro, and Croc. There are six worlds to explore (seven once you‚Äôve collected 600 apples which means finishing the game) of all different atmospheres including wintry wonderlands, water ridden marshes, and bee infested honeycombs. Strapped with an ever growing bag, you‚Äôll collect apples which will unlock new worlds.

Weeeeee!

Weeeeee!

The game opens up with our character Woodle standing on a floating island. This will act as your hub from world to world. Around the outside, you‚Äôll find some podiums with giant numbers over them. Collecting will unlock new worlds and also allow you to upgrade you leaf weapon. Moving to the inside of your house, there‚Äôs two floors to enter the different worlds. You‚Äôll have a few to start with then unlock more as complete them. Walking up to the different ‚Äúballs‚Äù you‚Äôll swipe at them to start the level. This is reminiscent of jumping into the paintings in Super Mario 64

Because I can hit everything else, why not you?

My Xbox 360 controller worked right out of the box. The left analog stick moves Woodle around, A button jumps, and holding down the X button will make him run. Which is a blessing because the walking speed is extremely slow. The jump mechanic is a bit floaty at times. You‚Äôll be relying on your shadow spot to line yourself up on platforms. You can adjust the distance mid-jump which will help making it to different platforms. There doesn‚Äôt seem to be any uniformed jump distance between platforms so some jumps will feel fine using a full force jump while others you‚Äôll over jump and ultimately die. With all of the issues with the camera in this game, you‚Äôd think the jumping would feel more controlled. Sadly, it doesn‚Äôt.

Collect 3 water droplets to complete the world.

Even though in a 3D environment, the layouts of each level have a start and end point. There is a little bit of exploring that will grant you more apples to collect, but mostly if you stay on the right path, you‚Äôll collect everything you need and make it to the end. Lots of platforms to jump on, some cool jet streams that‚Äôll push you up into the sky, and turtles! The graphic design is remarkable. Very unique and, I mean this is a nice way, cute. It‚Äôs extremely charming to run through these lands as a happy, apple collecting piece of wood. Who would have thought?

author: {'steamid': '76561198364111575', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 205, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 205, 'last_played': 1493981466}
review:
I personally really enjoyed this little game, the art style is beautiful, the music is relaxing.
The game itself is not very challenging but it does have that relaxation vibe to it which I loved.
Sometimes the camera can be a bit annoying but that adds a little challenge while your playing, good game for kids and adults alike. 
Recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061961710', 'num_games_owned': 203, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 194, 'last_played': 1459025180}

author: {'steamid': '76561198048897529', 'num_games_owned': 1226, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 166, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 166, 'last_played': 1493686595}
review:
It's very cute and has promise, but needs work.

Movement felt sluggish, enemies can walk through walls in some places (I met an enemy at platform height 1, i jumped up to a platform of height 2, he didn't stop at the solid wall, he walked through it with his head sticking out the top of platform height 2, then he killed me), camera issues.

Another reviewer mentioned this was made by one person. The game looks really nice. The graphical work and the style would make for a great kids platformer, I think they just need to get someone who is a better developer (and maybe some play-testers) to work with them to make this game hit the mark.

I haven't tried Woodle Tree Worlds 2 yet, but I hope they took their experience from this game and fixed some of the issues this one had.

author: {'steamid': '76561198153490345', 'num_games_owned': 286, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 204, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 204, 'last_played': 1490922867}
review:
So I got this game for free and thought: Hey, this looks like a small fun game.
But it isn't...
For me it was a boring and frustating expierence.
When I started the first level I collected all the apples in the game.
What do you get? nothing. You just need to collect the water and finish the level.
This is ok to do but the camera is so annoying while playing.
This camera causes to deaths and when you die you start at the begin of the level.
The enemies are really stupid in this game, they one shot you and you one shot them so basicly these enemies are just being annoying.

I wouldn't buy this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053984243', 'num_games_owned': 1268, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1490102535}
review:
Woodle Tree Adventures
8/10

I would give this game a solid B+. The concept is very cute for a platformer and I enjoyed playing through it immensely. The controls were tight and fluid, which I was not expecting coming for an indie-platformer, but it did control quite well. The momentum of the character was solid and consistent, you could accurately judge and calculate the jump distance. The game is very easy, but given the child-friendly and looking appearance, that could have been an intentional design choice. Rather than fail the level or be sent out from your attempt should you be hit by an enemy or fall from the screen, you are simply sent back to the start of the level. You do keep all the berries and water drops you collected, however, which does make the blow of being sent back not sting as much. The game is fairly short, I completed 100% of the achievements in just over an hour and a half, and the stages themselves only take 5-10 minutes to clear, which gives the game a brisk pace. You will naturally unlock all the upgrades through normal play and quickly, though there isn't much difference between the upgraded leaves themselves, it's still worth noting you will not be forced to grind out levels (unless you are going for all achievements the 3000 berry one will take maybe 20-30 minutes of replay). The music is very chipper and enjoyable and sets a great mood for the friendly atmosphere, though perhaps it is a tad loud in comparison to the sound-effect volume level as it feels quite drown out.

What keeps this game from getting a 9 or 10 in my book is just a few small issues. The camera could have done with a little work, and the ability to move it even say 45 degrees left and right to help you see around a few corners would have been helpful with some of the more tricky jumps. The game is also very short. Currently this game is listed for $3.49 dollars, and it was worth a playthrough to me at that price, but some more thrifty gamers may find the price to be a bit high considering the game can be beaten in an hour-hour and a half. The biggest issue I had however was the lack of options, specifically the lack of volume control. You can change graphical settings and controls easily enough, but even with the games upbeat soundtrack, I think it would have been nice to be able to turn it down or mute it when I was replaying a level.  With a few more options and control mechanics the game would be a perfect little indy platformer, but it just has a few key issues I hope the developers take note of for future releases. 

I whole-heartedly recommend Woodle Tree Adventures for a fun little platforming game for everyone of all ages!

author: {'steamid': '76561198154072680', 'num_games_owned': 404, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1488777492}
review:
I would not reccommend paying the $3 for this game. Perhaps if you get it free, or MAYBE, on sale. It is just a basic platformer with a camera controlled by mouse movement (forward mouse movement gets you further from character and Visa Versa). 

Music isn't TOO bad (gonna be honest, have it playing in the background while writing this), but it all does sound very similar and gets repetitive after hearing it multiple times in one level. It sounds as though it was made to be able to flow well enough into a loop that you may not notice for a couple plays of it. 

It also lacks in combat systems, and in checkpoints. The first level has one checkpoint (check points are based on where you die, not a place you have passed. So if you go to the end, then jump off back before the middle checkpoint, you will respawn at the beginning rather than middle checkpoint)

Story line isn't too bad. Not too thought out though from what I gathered.
All in all, I give it a 6/10. A 'D' isn't too bad I guess, but it is an Indie title after all (That's not to say there are few good indie titles though. Some of my favs are, but yeah. Some aren't as great. This is one of em after all.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198105310120', 'num_games_owned': 1274, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1488485209}
review:
[h1]Woodle Tree Adventures[/h1]

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
The game is about a little tree-stump saving his town from thirst by collecting fairy's tears from another worlds.
Woodle Tree Adventures, is a 3D Platforming Adventure game, where your objective it's to go around the worlds and collect all three fairy's tears.
You only have one attack, with you can improve in the future while you collect "apples" on the worlds.
There's infinite lifes, but if you hit a invisible checkpoint, and if die twice, you will start from the beginning and have to walk all way back.
The game is not long, around 70 minutes to finish the story, and around 2 hours to complete it 100%.

In this game, there are many, little and meaningless bugs (and errors that can be easily fixed), but some of them can mean a lot between win and lost. [list]For example:
 [*]	If you spam the jump button (better result while running), the animation will repeat everytime, resulting in the player becoming upside-down, only returning to normal after the jumping button has stopped being spammed.
 [*]	While running or walking, it's possible to get a little bit of acceleration, which may lead to death if not careful.
 [*]	While running, sometimes the jump button blocks, not letting the player jump.
 [*]	Launching pods (the wind lifting you up), only works sometimes, and if you run towards it, it won't work.
 [*]	If the player goes to a section where the camera inverts, and dies, the camera will stay, even if the map is backwards and doesn't let the player see anything. It can only be changed if the game restarts. [/list]

The menu has no options, and the default key is on Enter, and Esc is to exit the game, making a lot of players exiting the game except of pausing it.
There is no "tutorial". This game supports Local Multiplayer (Not tested by me), Steam Achievements and two controllers.
The developer is active and it's "open" about fixing glitches and bugs.

[h1]Visuals[/h1]

The Visuals look like from [u]Super Mario 64[/u], exactly what the developer intended.
The game was meant for kids and adults with nostalgia from Nintendo 64, making a level per world, platforming, 3D, adventure videogame.
The menu looks like it was made in a few minutes, doesn't show the potential that the games shows.

[h1]Sound[/h1]

There is only 6 songs (one for each world) without talking about the menu, and intro music.
Those 6 songs, some look sad and others look calm, giving a calm ambient to the game.
The song "CallForAction" seems misplaced, having a very intense and "action" song on a tranquille videogame.
The Sound Effects are pretty nice, they also show the tranquille ambient, as for example the "death" of the enemies are pretty calm and SFW (Safe For Work) for kids and adults.

[h1]Overall[/h1]

This game has errors and bugs that could be fixed, but only some of them make the game harder, while the others give a sense of fun.
The game does give the nostalgia for games like [u]Super Mario 64[/u], it's smooth, calm and tranquille. It contains no imagery that can affect kids and it's pretty safe.
Although, I doubt that "kids" will have fun with this game, even though this game was meant for them and for adults with a feel of nostalgia, they are nowadays changing more into First Person Shooters (FPS) for example, and less into "friendly 3D Platforming Adventure" games.
But with no doubt, the game is playable by anyone and does it's job right of doing what it was meant to be - "(...) an hybrid between an art game and a platformer and is meant to be played by adults and children and to bring happiness to all souls".

[h1]Rating: 60/100[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198217673589', 'num_games_owned': 34, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 153, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 153, 'last_played': 1475959613}
review:
Backstory

You are a baby tree-stump who is to save and explore worlds, collect magical fairy tears and become a hero.

Information

This game is a Platforming/Adventure game where you have to go around several different levels in several different worlds collecting these seed/fruits as well as items know as fairy tears. the character, Woodle, is a little baby tree-stump who is born to save the magical lands within Woodle Tree Adventures. He comes equipped with a little backpack which he stores the fruits/seeds in that you collect in the game and he also carries a leaf around, this leaf, to the untrained eye is his lethal weapon for taking out anything who dares stand in his way.

If you are a lover of platforming and adventure games then i am sure you will adore this game, it's simple, fun and the perfect game to play when you have a little bit of spare time on your hands.

Pros:

- This game can run on the lowest end PC's available so don't think that you can't play it
- This game has a really cool yet simple art style that you will fall in love with
- The game does have some form of story embedded into it
- Has soothing music playing in the background

Cons:

- When characters are talking there is no narrator which can be bad for some people
- Occasionally there can be some "flickering" textures which can be annoying
- There are some bugs and glitches like falling through the map

Want my opinion in numbers? - 7/10

I hope this review helped you, Game on & Stay Awesome.
Review written for Trump Giveaway's Curator.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006286029', 'num_games_owned': 1597, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 134, 'last_played': 1487094488}
review:
Game was given to me by The developer <3 Thanx for this!

Played through the entire game.

It's a cute and lovely platformer, albeit a bit short.
Long story short you run and jump through a level collecting berries to unlock better Leaves and an additional level
The main objective is to collect 3 drops of fairy water in each level and take them to the cups at the end.

The game is a tiny bit short, it has a few bugs (one of which is pretty funny imho)
Said bug happens when you rapidly press the spacebar when you run up a set of stairs, it will make your char go upside down.

a few of the achievements also trigger too early in my oppinion :P

Besides that, lovely game, lovely music <3

~ General M-13
twitch.tv/generalm13

author: {'steamid': '76561198040913806', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 17, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1462144857}
review:
This is a game about Woodle and his grand adventure spanning the width, length, and height, of a humongous tree and its many branches.

It's terrible but it's also like 10 cents on sale so you could get 15 minutes of gameplay for that much. If you think about it proportinally 10 cents * 2.5 = 25 cents (price of a gumball) and 15 * 2.5 = 37.5.

In other words, if you try to justify buying this game 2 and a half times as opposed to a gumball you can get 37.5 minutes of fun hypothetically. Does a gumball last 37.5 minutes? Maybe. But by then it's stale and hard and gross and you should stick it to the bottom of something you don't own.

author: {'steamid': '76561198137490566', 'num_games_owned': 651, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1558729884}
review:
[h1]Backstory[/h1]

You are a baby tree-stump who is to save and explore worlds, collect magical fairy tears and become a hero.

[h1]Information[/h1]

This game is a Platforming/Adventure game where you have to go around several different levels in several different worlds collecting these seed/fruits as well as items know as fairy tears. the character, Woodle, is a little baby tree-stump who is born to save the magical lands within Woodle Tree Adventures. He comes equipped with a little backpack which he stores the fruits/seeds in that you collect in the game and he also carries a leaf around, this leaf, to the untrained eye is his lethal weapon for taking out anything who dares stand in his way.

If you are a lover of platforming and adventure games then i am sure you will adore this game, it's simple, fun and the perfect game to play when you have a little bit of spare time on your hands.

[h1]Pros:[/h1]

- This game can run on the lowest end PC's available so don't think that you can't play it
- This game has a really cool yet simple art style that you will fall in love with
- The game does have some form of story embedded into it
- Has soothing music playing in the background

[h1]Cons:[/h1] 

- When characters are talking there is no narrator which can be bad for some people
- Occasionally there can be some "flickering" textures which can be annoying
- There are some bugs and glitches like falling through the map

Want my opinion in numbers? - 7/10

I hope this review helped you, Game on & Stay Awesome.
Review written for Trump Giveaway's Curator.

author: {'steamid': '76561198285707134', 'num_games_owned': 3890, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 214, 'last_played': 1486877914}
review:
Simply put, the game is fun, cute, short, and has good music and animation. I really enjoyed playing it and is one of the best games I have played on Steam, yet I haven't really played that many. However, I wouldn't have paid its full price for it is way too short. I recommend getting it on special, but do get the DLC.

P.S. I hope this game gets more DLC's with additional levels but seeing its sequel is out already I hardly doubt that will happen. Either way, I'll get the second version to this game when it is put on special.

author: {'steamid': '76561198136257044', 'num_games_owned': 635, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 197, 'last_played': 1486220036}
review:
The story of Woodle Tree Adventure is a very captivating one ,the dying world is in need of your help , you play as the tiny log born from the dying roots of an elder tree that made you for a reason , to get back the water to the world with the help of the fairy tears wich are hidden around the world, you must deafeat many enemies along the way and collect as much berries as you can possibly collect, you need to complete multiples levels to restore the World's Water.


What really makes you want to play are the mechanincs and the content of the game. Altough the graphics of the game do not look as great as you may expect , it complements with the funny mechanics and  bright colors. When your character jumps it's smooth and sometimes funny , after many jump it starts to turn upside down , He is given a leaf as his trust worthy weapon and companion, made especially to aid you agains  the enemies you encounter along the ways , which are monsters living in this dying world.  You unlock new weapons along the way with the berries you collect from the levels and unlock new levels by beating the last ones. The menu isn't your tipical text menu , It's a floating island containing your home given by your father.


From my experience Woodle Tree Adventures is a wonderful game and I recommend you buy it , It's not boring and it's verry good from my perspective. I love almost everything about it and you shouldn't be fooled by the games cover

author: {'steamid': '76561198078271291', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 99, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1519597364}
review: Do you love getting angry at cute lil cartoon characters? Do you love punishing yourself with unplayable maps with uncooperative camera controls? Well, boys and girls, do I have a game for you. Jump into a world where the plot is unclear, the art is creepy-cute, and be ready to get really annoyed really quickly.  If you love platformers, you won't love this game. But if you do love masochism... This was made for you in mind.

review:
Bonito e simples.
Me lembrou de cara o Mario do Wii, claro q n√£o √© igual, mas parecido.
√â um jogo Indie bem bacana, bem simples.
O jogo n√£o possui uma hist√≥ria extremamente bem elaborada. O jogo baseia-se em um √∫nico objetivo: voc√™ deve levar √°gua para um mundo com sede. Assim, voc√™ dever√° percorrer os diversos n√≠veis √† procura de gotas d' √°gua, coletando frutas durante o caminho.
A gameplay, infelizmente, √© comprometida por alguns detalhes: o jogo falha com a sua c√¢mera que atrapalha a sua jogatina. Outro ponto que infelizmente at√© mesmo desanima no jogo √© os checkpoints, que falha ao salvar. Assim, ao morrer, voc√™ pode voltar no local perto da morte, ou pode voltar para o in√≠cio.
Mas, √© um bom Indie, gostei bastante.

Ci sono dei problemi per√≤: troppi pochi livelli e un bug con la visuale. Pu√≤ capitare di dover ripetere parte del livello se si veine "uccisi". Nel caso si abbia in quel momento un angolo di visuale particolare, ritornando indietro se ne avr√† uno decisamente scomodo.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970149845', 'num_games_owned': 3732, 'num_reviews': 453, 'playtime_forever': 75, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1485432331}
review:
Woodle Tree Adventures is a 3D jump and run where you collect orbs and by doing so unlock new worlds.

+ (Somewhat) Charming graphics
+ Decent music
* A fixed-camera system (camera position changes as you traverse the world)
- Very bad camera positioning
- Bad hit detection/attack ability
- Unclear and inconsistent checkpoint system (first world seemed to have none, yet second had them)
- No introduction to controls/abilities (no mention of running or going back to the hub)
- After (accidentally) using the back key to go back to the hub, it no longer worked. ESC (which is said to be the same action according to the help screen) straight up quit the game.
- The story/world introduction is text-dialog based, yet unskippable.
- Pretty bad camera flow on the introduction
- Sometimes bad platforming sections (bad camera positioning making it way harder than necessary)
- No collectibles counter/completion info on completed levels
- Controller not hot-pluggable
- Played through in just 45 minutes, without unlocking the teased worlds/stuff
- No sotry conclusion/outro (you complete a level, and suddenly credits roll)

The comparison to the likes of Banjo Kazooie is corageous at best. The only thing notably in common is the collecting to unlock worlds.

All in all a cute and somewhat enjoyable experience. Were it not for the bad camera work and hit detection, I would have given it my recommendation despite its other flaws.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968748110', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 230, 'playtime_forever': 123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 123, 'last_played': 1457270248}
review: Comfy game, in a comfy world. Good for just relaxing and maybe just taking the edge off your day, or even just a simple Saturday Morning game with Coffee. Highly Recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970314107', 'num_games_owned': 2304, 'num_reviews': 917, 'playtime_forever': 69, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1485295054}
review:
Woodle, woodle, now that's a funny word. It refers to your little tree stump character that you'll be hopping and scrambling all over creation with, and it's an appropriately adorable name for an adorable little fellow. I could say the same for the rest of the game, that it has a simple, even precious charm to it. Unfortunately that's about all I can say about it without digging into all the parts that are lacking, so before I do that, let's just enjoy that title a little more. Woodle.

Woodle Tree Adventures opens with a great mustachio'd tree raising you whole from the earth and commanding you to bring water to the land. This is accomplished by traveling to six different worlds, finding the three giant fairy teardrops floating around, and taking them to the three giant Dixie cups at the end of the level. Along the way you can collect piles of berries that unlock new items for you, as well as a gaggle of precious and mostly passive monsters to maybe get in your way.

The colorful screenshots might hearken to mind Mario 64 or any of his other 3D outings, and that's not too far from the mark. Each of the six levels is a mass of blocks and platforms floating in a vast blue sky, and you have full range of moment to scamper about them, hoovering up berries and droplets. Your woodle dude has none of the fancy moves that Mario has trained up over the years, just run, jump, and bat things with his leaf. That's plenty to get through the different worlds of forests and beaches and ice and bees, because there are no puzzle elements or secrets to speak of.

This is where the game starts to show how thin it is, because each level is exactly what it says on the tin. 100 berries and 3 droplets, and you only need the droplets to win. The berries are added up at your house between levels and unlock new leaves to swing, but all the three fancy leaves do are let you shoot an air gust different distances. There's also a bandanna that's just for show and a seventh world you need 600 berries to access, but that doesn't mean you need to find every berry. No, every time you replay a level you can collect all the berries again, so if you were so inclined you could grind out all the unlocks on the very first level (do not do this). And once you beat the sixth world, you get a THANKS FOR PLAYING screen and that's it.

There's not going to be much reason to run around in the game beyond finishing it because the basic elements are just as threadbare. The platforming is stiff in its physics and sticky in how you get stuck on edges and walls. Animations are incredibly basic, rendering combat nothing more than waving a leaf and watching enemies slowly fall over with a sad bloop. There's literally no UI so forget about keeping track of the berries you found, and no camera controls so enjoy 3D platforming from a fixed angle. The camera thing is particularly damning because there are triggers around the levels that flip it to side or overhead angles but don't flip it back when you leave the area, so if you take an unlucky fall you might be doing a 3D jumping section from a profile view.

I had high hopes for Woodle Tree Adventures based on how cute and platformy it looked, but it plays more like a proof of concept than a finished game. There's not even a pause menu for cryin' out loud, just a splash screen with the controls and a button prompt to quit the game. It's a title that's very clearly the work of one developer, and while it's a great accomplishment in that respect it's still lacking the quality of a retail product. I'd love to see a sequel with more polished movement, more professional graphics (and sound, some of the piano tracks kill me), and just more to do. There is actually a sequel, but from the looks of it none of those improvements have been made. So sorry, little friend woodle... your name is a winner but your game really isn't.



Did you enjoy this review? I certainly hope so, and I certainly hope you'll check out more of them at https://goldplatedgames.com/ or on my [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/audish#curation]curation page[/url]!

author: {'steamid': '76561198141922380', 'num_games_owned': 48, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 8, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1466865477}
review:
A long time ago, two races ruled peacefully over the Earth: HUMANS and MONSTERS. One day, a terrible war broke out between the two races. After a long battle, the humans were victorious. They sealed the monsters underground with a magical spell. In the year 201X, a small child scales Mt. Ebott. It is said that those who climb the mountain never return. Seeking refuge from the rainy weather, the child enters a cave and discovers an enormous hole. Moving closer to get a better look... the child falls in. Now, our story begins.

Woodle Tree Adventures is a traditional role-playing game where no one has to get hurt. Fighting is wholly unnecessary: negotiate your way out of danger using the unique battle system. If you do feel aggressive, however, the encounter system allows you to time your attacks for extra damage, then dodge enemy attacks in a style reminiscent of top-down shooters.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999629896', 'num_games_owned': 510, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 205, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 205, 'last_played': 1484086170}
review:
Clumsy and not really complete game. 

The graphics are alright-y but the sounds are royalty free and do not match with most of the animations which are stiff and feel odd.

There is no UI to tell you how much have you collected on a level and Options section, hey at least let me adjust the volume.

The gameplay is about collectiong stuff and bashing badies, nothing violent perfect for getting comfy or 
 a kid EXCEPT when you make a mistake and an enemy hits you the game sends you back to the start of the level. 

Tell that to a 4 year old.


To bad because it could have been a really cute, comfy game but its not done.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042620952', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1382, 'playtime_forever': 106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1483748440}
review:
[h1] Genre [/h1] Ein 3D Plattformer

[h1] Gameplay [/h1] Es gibt insgesamt 6 Welten in denen wir herumh√ºpfen, Beeren einsammeln & Gegner mit unserem Blatt besiegen. Das Spiel ist relativ Kurz gehalten. Was mich sehr gest√∂rt hat, war das wenn man von einem Gegner getroffen wird, das man dann am Anfang des Levels zur√ºck gespawnt wird. Leider gibt es die √ºbliche Kameraf√ºhrungsschw√§che des Genres die einen schon Wahnsinnig machen kann

[h1] Achievements [/h1] Es gibt insgesamt 8 Erfolge. Hierf√ºr m√ºssen wir das Erste Level schaffen, das Spiel durchspielen, 3000 Beeren einsammeln & das Gelbe, Orangene & Wei√üe Blatt bekommen.

[h1] Pro/Contra [/h1]
+ Gute Musik
+ Sammelkarten
+ Achievements
+ XBox 360 Controller Support

- Kameraf√ºhrung sehr merkw√ºrdig
- Man wird zum Anfang zur√ºck gespawnt wenn man getroffen wird

[h1] Fazit [/h1] Ein Netter Kurzer 3D Platformer mit den √ºblich Kameraf√ºhrungs schw√§chen die das Genre Leider hat. Dennoch ein sch√∂nes Spiel mit recht einfachen Achievements. Definitiv zu Empfehlen

author: {'steamid': '76561198097560716', 'num_games_owned': 62, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 253, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 253, 'last_played': 1483735858}
review:
[h1]RECENSIONE WOODLE TREE ADVENTURES[/h1]

Salve gamers e benvenuti in questa nuova recensione!

[h1]INFORMAZIONI SUL GIOCO[/h1]
                                                       
                                                          [code]PREZZO ORIGINALE: 2,99‚Ç¨[/code]
                                                           
                                                          [quote=author]Woodle Tree Adventures is an old school platform game with a catchy and unique art style! Explore a total of 6 worlds and save the lands with the magical water drops you'll find through your journey, bringing back peace and balance and finally becoming the new hero![/quote]

                                                          [code]SVILUPPATORE: Fabio Ferrara nel 2014[/code]

[h1]ANALISI[/h1]

[u]ATTENZIONE! QUESTI SONO SOLO PARERI PERSONALI E SONO BEN ACCETTE CRITICHE AL SOLO SCOPO DI ESSERE COSTRUTTIVE![/u]

[b]PRO:[/b]

[list]
    [*]Musica rilassante e piacevole che ti immerge totalmente nell'ambiente naturale quale presenta.
    [*]Grafica 3D semplice e carina, che rende il gameplay molto piu' fluido e piacevole. Personalmente non ho riscontrato gravi glitch.
    [*]Gameplay semplice e immediato. In totale vi sono 3 azioni: SALTO, CORSA, ARMA. L'obiettivo √® raccogliere 3/4 gocce di acqua sparse nella mappa da portare poi verso la fine del livello in 3/4 contenitori. Il gioco si presenta con 6 livelli (4 inizialmente, poi 2 da sbloccare con l'avanzare del gioco). Vi saranno anche vari mostri che potranno essere uccisi con un solo colpo, che per√≤ cercheranno di ostacolarvi. Infine, vi √® la presenza di "Mele" (credo siano Mele xD), che potranno essere raccolte per poi sbloccare i vari achievement.
    [*]Ambiente molto colorato che ti immerge totalmente nella natura
    [*]Uso del controller consigliato per un ulteriore godimento del gameplay.
[/list]

[b]CONTRO:[/b]

[list]
    [*]Troppi pochi checkpoint! Dopo un p√≤ il gioco torna ripetivo e senza checkpoint una persona si inizia anche a stancare di giocare!
    [*]Visuale che in alcuni momenti √® fastidiosa poich√® non vi √® la possibilit√† di girarla a 360'
    [*]Visuale 3D che in molte occasioni toglie il senso della tridimensionalit√†
    [*]Mancanza di una storia vera e propria; ci si lascia cadere nell'immaginazione!
[/list]

[h1]GIUDIZIO:[/h1]

√® da tener conto che questo gioco √® stato datato per una fascia di et√† molto giovane, per questo non vi √® molta difficolt√† nel gameplay. Nonostante i parecchi difetti che ho riscontrato, consiglio questo gioco per i piu' piccoli o per chi comunque ha voglia di divertirsi su un platform vecchio stile!

                                                                 [code]VOTO FINALE: 7/10[/code]

[h1]Ricordo di entrare nel mio gruppo ufficiale curatore "R1cO" per altre recensioni![/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198055992065', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 59, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1483393343}
review:
This game has its ups and downs. The graphics are fun, level design isn't horrible and it plays ok with a controller. But boring obstacles, dumb enemies, infuriating respawn system, lackluster story and general unimmersiveness just don't make it shine at all.

The game can easily be beaten in half an hour. Which is good, because that's all I could stand it. It's not the worst of all indie games out there, but I won't recommend it to anyone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079704709', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 271, 'playtime_forever': 189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 183, 'last_played': 1484972538}
review:
This is your average platformer game, that may include rage-induced moments of trying to jump on logs, moving objects, falling off the map and hitting everything with a (colourd) leaf. Plus, it starts off with introducing a guide that resembles the Deku tree from Zelda OoT! 

I liked the bright and vibrant appeal to the game, as well as some of the interaction and dialogues. What an adorable game. :3

This game seems targeted towards younger audiences, though, and because the minimum age requirement to have a steam account is 13 it may not appeal to majority of the community. The 2 achievements for collecting berries will also be a time-consuming effort.

author: {'steamid': '76561198118249446', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 142, 'last_played': 1483302783}
review:
Appena vidi il gioco non ne fui entusiasta. La schermata di apertura in bassa risoluzione, la totale mancanza di un men√π principale.. Insomma, la prima impressione non √® stata il massimo. 
Successivamente, destreggiandomi attraverso i pochi livelli presnti (non √® un gioco particolarmente longevo) ho imparato ad apprezzare lo stile grafico molto rilassante e colorato e la sensazione di pace e relax che il gioco offriva alla vista. 

Uno dei problemi principali del gioco √® senza ombra di dubbio la telecamera; trattandosi di un platform 3D, poter muovere la telecamera a proprio piacimento √® FONDAMENTALE o, almeno, avere una telecamera che inquadri bene le parti necessarie al proseguimento. In questo gioco NON troverete sicuramente aiuto dalla telecamera, anzi, molte volte cadrete e cadrete tantissime volte per colpa di essa. 

Fortunatamente questo fatore √® compensato da un'ESTREMA semplicit√† di gameplay, caratterizzato da vite infinite e nessuna penitenza per ogni morte.

La mancanza di UI nei livelli √® alquanto fastidiosa (un contatore di bacche raccolte ad esempio non starebbe male) ma ci si pu√≤ anche chiudere un occhio.


In conclusione Woodle Tree Adventure √® un gioco semplice, veloce e simpatico per un pubblico molto giovane e alle prime armi del gaming.

review: This game needs some fixing, especially with the camera which I think is the buggiest thing in this game. Also, I didn't even play it fast and finished it in an hour. author: {'steamid': '76561198352204301', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 221, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1482892264}
review: It's an evil, cruel world out there, and "Woodle Tree Adventures" opened my eyes to the reality of it all. You are born into a life of crime. From the day you are born, you are running around collecting debts owed to the family, being fruit, of course. If they can't pay up, then their tears will suffice. Sometimes you have to use force, because sometimes they fight back. Your only weapon is a leaf, but I swear I have yet to see a leaf capable of so much pain and destruction in all my years as this one, and I've seen a lot of leaves, my house has windows. All it takes is one fell swoop and any retaliator or rebel is vanquished. Sometimes innocent lives are lost as well, caught in the crossfire, however some live to complain and tell the tale and must be taken care of later. Their deaths are most tragic and graphic; they fall backwards as a sign of submission, then right after they give a little "squee" they burst into white flakes, completely vanishing from existance. Families will forever be torn apart, populations drastically affected by the murders, but you remain unphased. This is what you were meant to do, and you do it with a smile. I value the time I've spent playing "Woodle Tree Adventures", as it has shown me a side of this world that I would have never seen outside of my bubble. It not only immerses us in the hard life of crime, but has an underlying message of love for one's family and how far people or small tree creatures will go to do what is best for the family.

author: {'steamid': '76561198114186986', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 153, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1505900442}
review:
This game is one of the graphical indie gems delights ever produced. You play as a simple seedling, you grow and collect various items all around the gameplay. The music is tranquil, soothing, but the graphics are even more amazing.The games storyline is good but the animations and graphics are even better. But beware though if you're looking for gory bone chilling , atmospheric fight scenes you may be disappointed. For it is atmospheric, it is filled with fight scenes. But not the way you might expect.

There are many positives to this gem of a game and relatively no negetives.

Positives

!. The game is easy on the pockets
2. The game has a smooth and polished finish to it
3. Atmospheric (omaginery sort of way)
4. The best part is that the game lets the players imaginations fly

Negetives

1. The game can fll sort of expectations some times
2. The game can be a bit kiddish in its way

All in all a great fun game for all ages I rate it 6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198280371208', 'num_games_owned': 838, 'num_reviews': 272, 'playtime_forever': 145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1482812005}
review:
Ever wanted to play as a tree stump before? Woddle Tree Adventures may seem promising to you. However, there are a few things you need to get past if ypu want to play this.

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
In Woodle Tree Adventures, it includes 6 levels that are needed to complete the game. In these levels, you collect magic water drops and berries till either there are none left, or you reach the end, and fight enemies with a leaf. 3 magic water drops, which is explained to help feed the land at the beginning, are hidden in each level and are needed to progress and unlock the other levels. Berries, however, are more to unlock an optional level, a headband and three different leaf colors, The leaf colors only having an additional ability to have a whirlwind projectile to get enemies from far away with a different swirl. There are also achievements that goes with collecting berries, but you can go through the whole game not knowing there are collectables. The game tells you it's to aid you on your journey, which I thought was a way to get more lives before I saw how many there were, and the fact that they are located in the back of the starting yard. It wasn't till I was at the last level before I decided to walk behind the house and saw these unlockables. Though it doesn't save what you got if you exited and launched the game again.

The platforming absolutely needs to get used to before you can progress or avoid being killed by it. The perspective somewhat causes this, but the controls can somewhat be delayed. In some cases, a current that launches you up does not work even though you hit the area it activates this. Nor does it keep you in the air at some points, since it is so easy to hit it and move away immediently, while some go downwards where you automatically die if you go that low (this could of been solved if it didn't show the hitbox for it lower than you can go). The speed of your character also seems way too slow than it should. Sprinting helps, but the default speed is not desirable. The speed in the water is not desirable either, being slower than the default even if you are only one inch deep. 

The camera positioning and spawning points is one of the big problems. You can only zoom in and zoom out, while it changes only if the area dictates it, So if you die, you are ultimately stuck with the last camera angle till you go to the area that changed it. This makes for awkward platforming, and in some cases frusturating, as you can not change the positioning. While the spawning points are far and few between to the point that I thought there were none. The spawning point is often the beginning, but others are not unlocked unless you already past that particular area. It would make sense if it is when you first arrived, but not after. This causes a lot of frusturation, especially if you die by an enemy you thought was far enough (or right after you killed it) or fell off. 

A small thing is that the enemies don't seem much like enemies at first. One of them does since it charges towards you, but not the others. The enemies are noted to be defeated by falling over and disappearing, accompanied by a light colored smoke. Some just stands there and others walks or runs. These seem just regular people that inhabit these places, so why do these be pegged as enemies while caterpillers and ladybugs can't hurt you? It would be better if these were inhabited by creatures obviously harming the area. The snow is also handled poorly, only being a block of white placed on the land, you and the enemies clipping through it (it doesn't seem like you should since it doesn't leave a trail). One of the things I would of liked to see is the tree stump and the leaf changing based on the season of the level, to give more of a sense of immersion. Instead of the leaf color only being changed if you select the unlockable.

[h1]Replayability[/h1]
It only has replayability in doing the unlockable level and collecting enough berries to unlock the two achievements. It could have more in the muliplayer aspect, but I couldn't get it to work (both the keyboard and the controller controlled the main character, non controlled the beaver). If you like playing the same levels over and over, I suppose this has a lot of replayability value.

[h1]But It Was Developed By One Person[/h1] 
Personally, I didn't know it was developed by one person till I saw another review mentioning it as a Pro. But this shouldn't exactly mean a game automatically deserves to be recommended. I have played other games developed by one person that was better for the lack of words. You are being advertised for the game, not how many developers worked on a game. 

[h1]Overall[/h1]
+ Good for 5 year olds and younger
+ Art style bright and cute

+/- Soundtrack (generic, doesn't stand out. I couldn't necessarily remember it after a few minutes of playing)

- Camera Angle
- Perspective/Platforming
- Spawning Points
- The speed you can go (especially in water)
    -The dialogue boxes, in the beginning and the end, go way too slow as well (you can't skip it if you already read it all)
- Enemies don't seem they should be enemies
- It seems way too slow than it should be
- Couldn't get multiplayer to work
- Can sometimes crash when you Shift+Tab, causing you to restart your computer (since it locks your mouse to the game)

Woodle Tree Adventures may be fun to kids 5 years or younger. But otherwise, there's problems that does not let this game shine. If you just want to play a game to waste a couple hours, it's on sale (or happen to get it from a giveaway), and don't want/have another game to play it takes that role. In normal circumstances, I wouldn't get this unless you don't mind the issues it has.

review:
Woodle Tree Adventures Tiny Review

I got gifted the game and now let's break down the game

+ Cute
+ Gives me that puding puding feeling
+ Gives that Kirby feeling
+ Game has a general goal & is simple to follow, would recommend for younger kids as the game seems to be targeted towards that demographic
+ The game music is good & has a joly theme to it
+ Gameplay is good but could use abit improvement because of camera swaying sometimes and chaining abit weirdly

Overall the game lacks in a few things but general is one of thoes games that is to cute to discard, + the game is very cheap so could be something fun to play while bored and/or looking for something to do

author: {'steamid': '76561198058227393', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 12983, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5121, 'last_played': 1708985683}
review:
What happens when you mix the essence of human fellings with graphics can challenge michelangelo. The strong main character is the perfect representation of the human soul.  This game pushes the boundaries of human comprehension. When I play this game all feels right in the world. Sadness, Dispair, Love, Helplessness, Satisfaction, are only a few of fellings I get when I play the game. Ive only played the game for 110hrs, but the game has played me my entire life. The sexual satisfaction I get while playing this game has allowed me to play the game without the need of any real life relationships. I pray to one day have the honour of sacrificing my soul to the higher power that is this game. I feel death coming closer to me every day I continue playing this game. For with Woodle Tree Adventures a man does not need Food or Water. A man must sacrifice his own selfish needs to please Woodle Tree Adventures. I fear not, of death, for I am eternal, living, inside the game. I will hang on until my last organs fail and my motor system shuts down, for the last pixels that grace my body, I will keep with me in the afterlife. A place where I hope to live alongside the main character, forever. 

I leave my body, a mere vessel whose only purpose was to connect me with Woodle Tree Adventures. 

One day you shall all be with me, together, eternally playing Woodle Tree Adventures.

review:
I will try to express how i felt in the game in long story short.
The games rating is i have to say 7/10 and i RECCOMEND the game on any time the price is good for such a good game!

Pros:
+Its fun in multiple way
+Has good graphics
+quite long game as i die many times :D
+Devoulepted by 1 person
+little kids really enjoy the game

Cons:
-When you die you spawn so far away
-Zooming in and out is hard
-So slow( i have 280 fps) cant skip or anything have to awthc it all again and agian

Overall: The game is super fun for younger kids we steam users i guess are too old try to give it to your child / little brother/sister and they will enjoy the game :)

review:
Il fatto che non si pu√≤ spostare la visual mi ha triggerato parecchio!
Super mario 64 che √® del 1996 si poteva spostare la telecamera ,questo che √® del 2014 NON PUOI FARLO!
Hanno fatto dei passi avanti questi qua con la tecnologia!!!
Poi bello quando si bugga la visual e NON PUOI SPOSTARLA!
E quel scroto che cresce ad ogni mela che trovi ,dio santo quanto √® irritante specialmente
quando √® gonfio come il mio di scroto e si bugga la visual e NON PUOI SPOSTARLA!
La musica fa venire il mal di testa ,sembra che ci stavano sbattendo dei gatti contro il pianoforte.
Io per sfiga mia me lo hanno regalato sto coso ,neanche volevo sapere che esistesse una cosa del genere!
Per coloro che hanno speso 2,99‚Ç¨ per sto gioco ,cavolo gran bella cagata avete fatto.
Io ci sto giocando per prendermi le carte e venderle e poi via dalla mia preziosa libreria!!
Fa cagare come skyrim.

review:
Cons:
- Bad visual art style (seriously, there's neither character nor object that looks alive and not a bad polygonal model)
- Boring gameplay mechanics
- Awful camera
- Checkpoint starvation
- Bad hitbox and damage feedback
- Maybe there's The Plot, but I don't even wanna care about it
Pros:
+ Great for farming Steam levels through cheap trading cards

I wouldn't recommend this game even for casual gamers because I don't want torture them with badly implemented  camera, hitboxes, etc.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120289206', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 241, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 241, 'last_played': 1464787924}
review:
.
[h1][b]Woodle Tree Adventures - 6/10‚ú™[/b]	[/h1]
Kurz √ºber mich was: ich mag Abenteuer, Indie Spiele sehr gern!
Habe dieses Game geschenkt bekommen.

[quote=SimsToni][b]Story (6 ‚ú™):[/b]
Die Story ist nett und einfach zu verstehen.

[b]Grafik (6 ‚ú™):[/b]
Die Grafik sieht super aus, erinnert stark an Super Mario 3D Land oder vergleichbaren.
Der Charackter (also dieser Minibaum) sieht auch sehr niedlich aus.

[b]Steuerung (6 ‚ú™):[/b]
Die Steuerung ist mega einfach gehalten und Gamepadunterst√ºtzung gibt es auch.

[b]Lust (6 ‚ú™):[/b]
Ich hatte sehr sch√∂ne Spielstd. damit, leider konnte ich es nicht zu Ende spielen,
da ich noch andere, gute Spiele spielen wollte. Vielleicht geb ich diesen Spiel einen Neustart
und spiele es erneut. Die UVP von 3‚Ç¨ ist sehr wenig, wodurch ich dieses Spiel empfehlen kann.
[b](PS: Eher was f√ºr Kinder aber auch f√ºr alter Hasen wie mich ^^)[/b]

[h1][b]PRO[/b]	[/h1]
[list]
    [*]Zeitvertreib
    [*]Steam Sammelkarten
    [*]Gamepadunterst√ºtzung
    [*]Koop (nicht online)
    [*]F√ºr Kinder empfohlen
    [*]UVP sehr klein gehalten
[/list]
[h1][b]CONTRA[/b]	[/h1]
[list]
    [*]Kein Online
    [*]Komplett auf Englisch
[/list]

author: {'steamid': '76561198048817935', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 137, 'playtime_forever': 52, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1478421529}
review:
Woodle Tree Adventures √® un platform pensato per bambini, ci√≤ √® intuibile sia dallo stile grafico ma anche dalla facilit√† stessa del gioco (non difficile o frustrante come spesso sono ora i platform). Se avete quindi dei bambini (7-10 anni) e volete indirizzarli alla [b]GIUSTA E SACRA VIA DEI VIDEOGIOCHI[/b], in particolare nei platform ma senza farli sbroccare a ogni caduta, questo gioco non va bene perch√®...

1)I controlli sono leggermente legnosi (ah ah ah.), cio√® il personaggio si muove anche troppo lentamente e vi √® una leggera imprecisione nei comandi.
2)Manca il controllo della telecamera (e questa √® una grave pecca)

A parte questo  il gioco lo si trova a un prezzo basso e inoltre spesso lo si trova gratis sui vari siti come giveaway o usato come riempitivo per i bundle. Per i gamer veterani va bene giusto per farmare carte o achievement.

author: {'steamid': '76561198200201969', 'num_games_owned': 342, 'num_reviews': 141, 'playtime_forever': 76, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1477836089}
review:
Si tratta di un platform probabilmente destinato ad un target di videogiocatori di giovane et√†, ma purtroppo non mi ha convinto a causa del gameplay fortemente penalizzato dalla cattiva gestione della telecamera. In sintesi:

PRO:
- Personaggio carino
- Graficamente ricorda i vecchi platform
- Atmosfera rilassata e pacifica

CONTRO:
- Pessima gestione della telecamera (a volte non si muove, non si capisce dove si √® e dove si sta andando.. e non √® gestibile dal giocatore). Di conseguenza diventa difficile e frustrante da giocare.. proprio perch√® √® ostico far muovere il personaggio se non si ha un'idea chiara delle distanze, dei salti ecc.

author: {'steamid': '76561198100507095', 'num_games_owned': 507, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 30, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1500753580}
review:
Nice look. But there are many problems!

1. Music is kinda sad/boring

2. no checkpoints

3. one hit death

4. walking is kind of annoying, I expect to gradually get faster while walking, not have to press the run button (but this isn't really a problem)

EDIT: I no longer recommend this. I played throught it a little bit more, but it just isn't fun at all.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062363150', 'num_games_owned': 517, 'num_reviews': 405, 'playtime_forever': 108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1477793368}
review: Game is very short, I like the character and monster designs however there are no enemies that offer a real challenge, game lacks a real story line, would of liked a little story to each map, love the music. Map design was not the best for PC arrow buttons since the layout didnt always align correctly but overal it was okay. Hated the camera view absolute worse thing to this game, just an enraging camera definatly need to add some key or mouse control so i can look around more. Not a terrible game but i wouldnt recommend buying it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013723081', 'num_games_owned': 1047, 'num_reviews': 368, 'playtime_forever': 92, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1476850071}
review:
One of the easier games i found on steam. This game, i do recommend for young children to play, maybe around 8 yrs old and up. For older gamers, like myself, this game will probably be more about achievement hunting..

Anyways, see my time above and see how fast i got all the achievements for it. 

I recommend this game for young children due to it's innoncent nature feeling it portrays in the game. I also recommend this for seasoned veteran players on steam who are achievement hunting, just for that. Other than that, there is not really much else to the game, but the simple nature of it makes it quite whimsical, and im sure the young ones will find enjoyment in this game. Anyways, i personally recommend this game!

Note that the game does not really have replayability, but young children might find it fun for awhile.
