author: {'steamid': '76561198132503739', 'num_games_owned': 601, 'num_reviews': 548, 'playtime_forever': 168, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 168, 'last_played': 1474818821}
review:
[b]My playtime:[/b] 2.3h (based on steam, 100% achievement).
[b]Grindy Achievement:[/b] Yes (2 achievements; there is a trick to make it not grindy though).
[b]Optional Achievement:[/b] Yes (6 achievements).
[b]Difficult Achievement:[/b] No.
[b]Developer Response:[/b] ~1 month (in selected threads).

[h1]Intro[/h1]
Woodle Tree Adventures is a platformer game about a newborn branch which was asked to collect raindrops. There are 6 + 1 levels with a specific theme in some levels.

[h1]Graphics[/h1]
The graphics are cute. The map is designed very well. However, the UI and UX is executed poorly. After the game launches, the main menu won't show up unless you press some key. The main menu also only consists of Play Game button and credits text in it, with a serif font which doesn't even fit with the game.

There is also an instruction which won't show up unless you press a certain key. I doubt that i will see the instruction if i didn't try to spam all keys to figure out what does each button do. The instruction also showed up in a picture which consists of three basic controls. You can change the key binding just to find out that the instruction doesn't change.

[h1]Music[/h1]
The musics in this game give a relaxing vibe. Most of the music have a very low volume (or it could be my speaker) which might make you sleepy. However, i really like the music in level 6 which is snowy themed.

[h1]Story[/h1]
The game doesn't focus much on the story. It will show a cutscene after you start a new game and it will show another after you finished the game. Funnily, the cutscene dialogue will disappear after a certain time (which can't be dismissed unless you wait) although there is no voice nor bgm while it runs. Luckily, it doesn't take too long to finish the cutscene.

[h1]The game[/h1]
As i said before, the level are designed very well. Each level has several "areas" which doesn't conflict with other levels. As a platformer game, the obstacles in this game are the pits and the monsters. However, the monsters can be defeated easily and you'll master on how to avoid falling in no time. There is no life in this game, so you will be moved to the starting area (or checkpoint) if you somehow died.

There is one checkpoint (aside for the starting point for respawning spot) in most of the levels. However, the checkpoint detection seemed to be off. Most of the time, you'll be respawned in a checkpoint only to be respawned in the starting point on the next death.

This game's controls are focused on controller. You'll miss some controls if you didn't configure your controls through the settings box which showed up after you start the game. However, the back button can't work in some levels.

Although there are a lot of controls in this game, there hardly any explanation on it. You'll only know that you can only move with WASD button and attack with E button (and Q for something which i forgot since it doesn't do anything when i press it). However, you won't know that you can sprint by holding Shift. The game character is slow enough without it and sometimes you might want to have a little boost to jump higher. The same goes for other controls such as back button for return to level selection and enter for showing the instruction screen.

You can upgrade your weapon (leaf) by collecting berries. There are three upgradeable weapons which has an ability to do ranged attack.

Lastly, you can't rotate your camera manually in the game. The game automatically rotates your camera in a certain spot although it won't revert the camera rotation if you enter the previous area. The only way to reset the camera rotation is by restarting the level

Pros:
- 6 + 1 levels
- Upgradeable weapon

Cons:
- No camera rotation
- Unexplained controls

[h1]Should you buy this game?[/h1]
[b]Yes.[/b]
[i]It's quite enjoyable despite of no camera rotation. Buy it on discount and you won't regret it.[/i]

review:
The only thing that sucks about this game is the camera, other than that it's AMAZING. The camera isn't game breaking but can be challenging to platform sometimes ... 

It's an adorable game, though sadly I beat it in about a half hour on my FIRST playthrough ... The worlds are fun and creative, I like slaughtering the caterpillars ... The game is just good platforming fun. If you love platformers I'd definitelly suggest buying it, it's only a few bucks.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031891305', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 69, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1570596329}
review: Annoying as heck... music, if you can call it music, makes me feel like I'm at a looney house. The graphics remind me of kiddie programs my little ones like to watch. They like the graphics, but the game is too hard for them. It's too easy to drop off from the sides of the platforms and then you have to "run" back quite a long way. By "run" I mean the creature is darn slow. At the first level, I spent about 15mins extra to run back from the end of the level, since I missed one tear along the way. They are pretty hard to find at times, since I couldn't find a way to change the camera angle playing with keyboard. Therefor it's hard to know when to slap the foes, since it's hard to see when you're near them. If someone did this in a week or so, congrats, nice work, but it's not something I'm going to play after that frustrating first level.

review:
I know the camera is bad. I know the game is short. I know a lot of people disliked it.
But guys this game... The cartoon graphics... The little piano music... The cuteness... This game is filled with a kind of innocence that makes me falling back into childhood. It make me think of my dream: create video games. This guy did it and it's now on steam! I feel so happy for him and I'll support him.
(Funny easter eggs can be found if you play with camera angles ;) )
Again, good little game to just relax and dream for a small moment

author: {'steamid': '76561198174657626', 'num_games_owned': 388, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 272, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 272, 'last_played': 1472896811}
review:
I got this as a free steam key ages ago. I didn't care about the game to be honest considering it was given out as a free key all the time, I thought it was a really rejected game so I just idled the cards. Now that I've decided to play it, considering the graphics do look very nice and cute with it's vibrant colours XD 

The game's objective is very simple, you collect raindrops to finish the levels. In addition you collect berries amongst the way. There are enemies, you kill them but however no points or whatsoever is gained. Get hit and you respawn either at the start or at some point you've reach. That's basically it if you ask me. So overall, the game is VERY easy. Though, I'd say it requires some patience particularly when you're jumping from one spot to another lol.

Achievements are really easy but as said, this game requires some patience so it may take time to get some of the achievements such as 3000 berries.... Unless you're very quick at collecting them. The graphics I really nice. It's simple, vibrant and looks very fun to attract the eye. The soundtrack is pleasant and soothing to listen while playing. 

Do I recommended this game? Yes, it may be worth the full price depending how long you spend finishing it considering the $1 = 1 hour of gameplay rule. If you're someone who got this for really cheap or a steam key like me. This game is something you would play when bored/have time to kill. 

So keep calm and COLLECT THEM BERRIES O____O

author: {'steamid': '76561198096378737', 'num_games_owned': 507, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1559052842}
review:
Ok, for $2.99, this game isn't really that bad. A great time-waster and very calming. 

Here are some things I think the developer should fix:
"add AI to enemies"
"add a HUD and pause menu, because right now you have to Alt+Tab to get out of the game'
"It looks you wanted this game to have only one camera angle as a platform element, however the game isn't linear, so having a locked camera doesn't work for the kind of level desing, switch to an adjustable camera."
"Add text speech bubbles instead of black boxes, looks nicer"

anyways, I can reccomend this game for someone with a bit of money left, and doesn't know what to spend on.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076052686', 'num_games_owned': 422, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 31, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1471266813}
review:
It's really hard to judge this game.
I'm a really big fan of these type of graphics and I tried this game with open mind.
It's a mixed bag of everything. It plays like an early indie game and not the good kind.
If this is supposed to be a 3D game, then the camera should be the best feature! But it isn't.
The only thing you can do is zoom in and zoom out. It seems like you can do it without limits.
You can't rotate it and in certain areas it's automatic, which can really screw up some jumping challenges. Speaking of which, the level design is a crap shoot. The first level is better than the second. I gave up on it, because it was so frustrating to jump around and start all over because I missed one jump.

The music is alright, but some of the sounds could be a little more lively or varied.

I was lucky to get it for free, because of the library sharing. It could be a great game. It looks nice, but the most basic elements of what make a 3D platformer good are totally abscent. The camera is bad, the controls are bad and the level design tolerable at best.

I'd be disappointed if I paid 2 euros.

author: {'steamid': '76561198131532019', 'num_games_owned': 142, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1472470354}
review:
tbh the game is not that bad although it kinda lacks direction, although it's a free roam game. Probs wasn't paying attention in the beginning.

However 3 big problems in the game mechanics is camera angles, HUD and checkpoints:
[list]
    [*]Camera angles are weird and don't reset after dying
    [*]Camera isn't controllable (on keyboard)
    [*]no HUD (should have some indication of how many berries I've gotten
    [*]Camera is too sudden (I'll often fall off the map due to this)
    [*]Camera makes it too hard to tell where you are, can't see enough ground (a higher angle would make it easier)
    [*]Checkpoints sometimes make you go back to the beginning if you jump far enough away from a  platform. (might be a mechanic though - 3 deaths and back to the beginning)
    [*]Strange white bar when dying (idk what it is)
[/list]
I also found that jumping repeatedly and note letting character rotate back to regular angle, the character will eventually turn upside down, easy to do this on stairs as you sticks to stairs while run + jumping.

However, the game is still pretty good, just at this stage, I wouldn't recommend, probs wouldn't recommend ever since the developer is working on the sequel now, so bugs might never will be fixed.
Also an indication of what level you've done would be nice.

As of now, this game is pretty much used for idling cards.
EDIT: I all my cards were the SAME.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973923018', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 117, 'last_played': 1472164828}
review:
Woodle Tree Adventures is a charming 3D platformer ruined by the inability to manually rotate the camera or consistently change the angle of the camera, making platforming at times excruciatingly tedious because you just can't tell exactly where you're going to land.

Woodle doesn't just fall down on the platforming (haha), the sound effects are also incredibly lacking, and the music doesn't seem very fitting. While it might be a cliche, arcadey sound effects and chiptune style music would have been much more appropriate and would have gone a long way to improving the experience. At least it looked nice, though simple, in a Nintendoesque sort of way; it just doesn't have anywhere near the same polish you would find on a Nintendo title.

Even at the low price Woodle has gone on sale for (sometimes even free) I couldn't recommend it. Woodle has something special about it, and I felt compelled to play it all the way through, but whatever redeeming qualities I was hoping to find totally escaped me. Maybe Woodle 2 will have improved upon the areas in which Woodle 1 is so sorely lacking.

3 out of 10. Did not get wood(le).

author: {'steamid': '76561198304172766', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 24, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1467917772}
review:
I would recommend this type of game for children to play.  I played it for a little while and I like the art style, but there are a few issues when it comes to the actual gameplay.  While playing the first level it was difficult to see inside the little building.  Once you enter the building it glitches slightly as well the camera view you cannot change to see what is inside of it.  Going through the level and getting up on the second platform I came into contact with two marshmellow like characters.  I wasn't sure if they were enemies or the good guys.  I attacked them and word bubbles appeared and I died.  Not sure what the point of those two marshmellow people being there are.  
Overall, still needs some work (as I stated before) and that this game would be better for children to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198253174189', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 359, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1472943389}
review:
Sinceramente non ho trovato questo gioco pessimo ed eppure le recensioni lo descrivevano come un gioco di fascia bassa che era meglio non acquistare.
Ho ricevuto il gioco gratis tramite un bundle di giochi e quindi ho detto perch√® non dargli una chance? La grafica di Woodle Tree  Adventures non √® malaccio,molto colorata e vivace e sopratutto ben fatta (a parer mio),la musica anch'essa non √® male ma la variet√† di tracce √® molto poca (1 musica che si ripete per tutto il livello). Il problema principale di questo gioco √® la telecamera in-game che molto spesso causa problemi per i movimenti del nostro personaggio non permettendoci di vedere dove andiamo. 
Secondo me per chi √® amante del genere platform questo gioco pu√≤ andare bene per iniziare perch√® dopotutto ha pure un prezzo irrisorio e le sue potenzialit√† sono tante.
Riassumendo:

ASPETTI POSITIVI
[list]
[*]+ Abbastanza Livelli
[*]+ Ambiente colorato e ben definito
[*]+ Gameplay ottimo senza lag (dipende anche dalle impostazioni utilizzate ovviamente)
[*]+ Il prezzo
[*]+ Tasti per il movimento comodi (classici comandi WASD + barra spazziatrice)
[/list]
ASPETTI NEGATIVI
[list]
[*]- Poche musiche (1 sola per livello)
[*]- Telecamera "buggata" la maggior parte delle volte
[*]- No multyplayer (solo coop sullo stesso pc)
[/list]

[u]Insomma,a me questo gioco √® piaciuto abbastanza e quindi vi consiglio di dargli una chance,proprio come me,perch√® dopotutto se la merita essendo un gioco Indie.
Spero di aver fornito una recensione abbastanza completa anche se non ho toccato molti aspetti del gioco.[/u]

author: {'steamid': '76561198107468667', 'num_games_owned': 194, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 45, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1471371397}
review:
TL;DR: I can't think of anything this game did right.

As someone who's worked in Unity before, this game screams laziness. The only challenge in the game is figuring out where a platform ends and a pit begins. The developers didn't even try to get the camera right. There's no UI of any sort. An enlarged backpack can make it very difficult to see where the character is. If you're running and attacking an enemy, it's very likely you'll trade hits and go back to the beginning of the level. There's no pause button; Esc closes the game. And lastly, the achievements and the game itself are very grindy.

EDIT: Two positives. One, jumping fast enough lets you flip upside down. Two, the uninstall function worked perfectly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042026617', 'num_games_owned': 737, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 99, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 99, 'last_played': 1470744199}
review:
I get that making 3D platformers isn't exactly easy but this game manages to make every mistake possible and its only saving grace is that the game itself is incredibly easy so your suffering will not be too extreme.

-The camera is trash. It's fixed and there is supposedly a way to move it but I only ever managed to do it by accident alt-tabbing out of the game and could never do it on purpose, the relocated camera made the game harder to play.

-The levels make the level designs in the new "3D" Mario games actually look good. They're simple, blocky, full of pitfalls, and not much fun to navigate. Worse still is the bevelled edge everything has that makes it difficult to tell where edges are sometimes.

-The fruity collectibles appear to just be currency, there is little point to actually get them and they respawn in levels when you re-enter them. You can literally just farm them in the first level and you don't even have to beat it, you can just grab the easy ones, hit escape, and then go back into the world until you have every item.

-The game does nt let you continue playing when you beat it. This means you can't continue playing the same game just to get every achievement without having to play this abysmal mess all over again. This is extremely contrary to every other game in the genre I have ever played as they always let you continue playing even after 100%.

-The music is not great. It isn't the worst music I've ever heard but it was clearly someone's early attempts and you can tell they are not very knowledgeable about good composition in general. It ended up ranging from forgettable to annoying.

-There are some strange things related to character animations. If you consecutively jump, woodie's model will rotate until it's at a 90 degree angle from where it started. It looks hilarious, but not in a good way. He also doesn't look like he really walks, he just floats across the ground and waggles his legs. There is no bounce to his step and some of his quirks make me think his hitbox might actually be round instead of square and in a blocky game like this I cannot imagine why that would be necessary but I don't actually know that for a fact, that's just how he looks.

This definitely look like something a single person tried to make to learn a 3D engine or other aspects of game design. If it were a free game I probably wouldn't be so hard on it but it honestly looks like one of many instances where someone tried to sell their first project and that is never a good idea. I don't recommend this game unless you want a pretty clear idea of how not to design a 3D collect-a-thon platformer.

I cannot even think of any upsides to mention because all the remotely redeeming things featured in the game are done much better in just about every other entry into the genre that I know of - and since this is my all-time favorite genre, I have played quite a lot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068294840', 'num_games_owned': 234, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 264, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 186, 'last_played': 1561508492}
review:
This is a bad game.
The controls are bad.
The camera is bad.
The graphics are bad.
The story is bad.
The gameplay is bad.

The bad controls and bad camera make it so platforming is near impossible. There are little to no checkpoints with no indication of when you reach one. The graphics make the game hard to look at and the gameplay and story (or lack thereof) make it so you want to stop playing almost as soon as you figure out what this game is.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040952038', 'num_games_owned': 1596, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 45, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1470691289}
review:
Woodle Tree Adventures is a charming and relaxing platformer with an insanely cute protagonist that goes around collecting berries and such as he traverses all the way to the end of the levels. I managed to pick up this game on sale for only a few cents a few months back and just now got around to playing it, and while the game doesn't offer much in terms of longevity or challenges (if you're a platforming expert such as myself, the game can be beaten in well under an hour. 30 minutes for some), I can't complain for the dollar that I spent. $2.99 seems a bit steep for something that can be beaten in such a quick manner and has no real replayability. It's certainly a solid dollar, however.

The only real horrendous aspect of this game is the atrocious camera and clunky controls. Despite the simplicity of the controls, you'll frequently find yourself unable to jump or falling off due to the character just moving on his own or not moving in the direction of your input.

Also, if you find the game too quiet like I did, you'll find Woodle Tree Adventures is MUCH more enjoyable with any given track from the Super Mario 64 OST in the background. I had Bob-omb Battlefield while I played the game, and it felt pretty amazing, so do yourself a favor and get those tunes ready beforehand.

PROS:
- Charming atmosphere and level design
- Cute protagonist
- Straight to the point

CONS:
- An abhorrent camera
- Clunky controls
- Absurdly short (though this isn't entirely a bad thing, as I believe it's OK for a game to be short, I do think the $2.99 price-point is a little steep, despite it still being cheap compared to most other games either of this nature, or just in general)

author: {'steamid': '76561198029186365', 'num_games_owned': 1139, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 80, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1469958916}
review:
It's a cute little 3d platformer. The music is nice, and the simplistic art direction fits with the overall theme of the game. I didn't notice any bugs or graphical glitches, so the game is polished. 

The main issue stems from the camera, which makes the platforming difficult. If you die, which happens more often than not due to the camera, you more than likely go back to the start of the level, which can get frustrating. There seems to be a checkpoint system in place, but it's wildly inconsistent. It's also very short, only about an hour of gameplay. 

There's people giving keys away all the time, which is how I got the game, so if you can find a free key, check it out. Otherwise it's not worth your money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055369886', 'num_games_owned': 603, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 132, 'last_played': 1617048889}
review:
Woodle Tree Adventure is a basic platform game in which you need to collect 3 drops of water to leave the level and that's about everything there is to it..

Along the way you can also collect berries that are used to buy some items which are for the most part cosmetic as far as I noticed, these also unlock steam achievements, in total you need to collect 3,000, not hard to do however there's around 100 berries on the levels so you will need to replay them over and over to get that many which isn't exactly fun to do.

The levels are really short, simple and not in the slightest bit challenging, most enemies don't attack and only a few will even move, there's no hazards' other than falling of the land. There's no hit-points so if you get hit you get sent back to the start of the level with all progress kept but there's no limit to lives so you can keep trying again as much as you want.

The worst thing about the game is the camera, There's no control over the rotation and the zoom is absolutely terrible and not really that helpful.

Overall this game feels like it's not completed, lacks content/features too easy and too short; to sum it up it's a "my first platformer game".
Unless you're getting this for a young kid it's not really worth buying.
There's not much to gain from this and any other half competent platformer would probably be better.
The game is solid enough in that there‚Äôs no real issues with it however a lot more is needed to justify it‚Äôs price despite it being cheap.

author: {'steamid': '76561198130972248', 'num_games_owned': 292, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 62, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1469332260}
review:
Woodle Tree Adventures is a charming game, easy to look at, and has music that isn't too bad to listen to. It's not very complex, as the game revolves around platforming in a variety of themed levels to collect three plot items, and then depositing them at the end point. It's simple to understand, and the controls are easy to grasp, if a little clunky in game.

I have some gripes about the game, of course. You are not able to control the camera, which leads to many frustrating moments when it's zoomed in too far, angled too low, or just generally in an unhelpful spot. When going around corners, the camera will sometimes suddenly jump to a new angle, altering which way your controls move you in the process, which is exceedingly frustrating. The game has no lives system, or any pentalty for dying to an enemy or falling off of the map, except for booting you back to a previous checkpoint, which are not marked, and seem to be randomly placed, if at all present on the map. Enemies are also not instantly distingushable from the few friendly NPCs which wander around the map, so it's usually a safer bet to try to kill anything that's moving. A minor complaint is the presence of an ice level, which uses the always hated game mechanic of slippery floors, which, when combined with the small icy platforms you're expected to cross, suspended over a bottomless pit of death, can be hair-pullingly infuriating.

Despite all of this, I'm recommending Woodle Tree Adventures, because the art style is fun to look at, and the game managed to hold my attention long enough to see it through to the end, which is not something that I expected when first going into it.

In conclusion, it's cheap, good looking, and you might be able to distract yourself from your eventual death for a few hours if you play it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198272098937', 'num_games_owned': 116, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 88, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1595579081}
review: Not to be rude, but this is the worst game I've ever played by far. I won it in a raffle, so just saying, I would never buy it with money unless you attempt to fix the following: To start, it took me half an hour to beat the FIRST level because whenever you hit into an enemy you instantly die and are forced to restart the level. I think that a way to help this would be toHave a health bar and when you get hurt, you move more slowly or something. Secondly, the begining of the level was LITERALLY the same level as Super Mario 3D Land (for the 3DS) so I feel like you need more originality in your levels. Next, The music is too peaceful, so I'd say use something more fast paced for this kind of game. Otherwise, it's ok but I truly belive that you should take note of these problems and really consider tweaking the game and if you do, I'll see your commitment so I'll probably reccomend it to all my friends and trust me, I have like 70 steam friends and like 30 real life friends. Thx for taking your time to read this! I'm gonna say that I don't reccomend the game for now, but if you change those things, I'll change my review

author: {'steamid': '76561198273469328', 'num_games_owned': 174, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 107, 'last_played': 1584390198}
review:
Woodle Tree Adventures is a fun, cute little game and easily better than many of the child-level PC games I played back in 2006. However, this is not 2006, and the little bugs and hitches that were common back then make today's games flawed and annoying.

By far, the most annoying thing about this game is the respawn system. Checkpoints are few and far between, and when a small design flaw causes a death or two, you are sent back almost halfway across the map, which makes deaths stressful and irritating. This is an easy fix for the game and I hope to see an update that adds more support for this.

Besides this, the game is
+ cute
+ playable
+ easy on the eyes
+ great for kids

As a side note, there are a few things I would like to see added.
- Camera angles are a bit buggy in places but nothing that affects the gameplay too much
- Adding secrets/easter eggs would make this game amazing
- The tree guy from the first cutscene should have voice acting

If all of these features were added, this game would be well worth the $2.99. In the meantime, get a free key online from the dev.

author: {'steamid': '76561198259976884', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 212, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 212, 'last_played': 1468844439}
review:
Underhand game: it's seems to be nice, with a pleasant wood and soft fruits, the blue sky and beautiful weather... none of this! You are convinced that the enemies are those cololful puppets, but it's a red herring. Your real enemies are others:

- The Depraved Camera. You can only zoom in and out, you can't rotate the camera (that in 3d platform is useful like a lifesaver in the desert), so you get stuck between the blocks and you can't see where you are going (very often you fall doooown).

- The Evil Checkpoint. When you die, you go back. Sometimes, the evil checkpoint takes possession of the level, so you must finish it in reverse: the wood walking towards you and you can't understand the fucking way.

- The Naughty Controls. The controls become bad expecially when you shake that ridicolous green leaf: the enemy die, but also you die! Ahahah how nice fucking joke! 

Absolutely recommended for who have already lost innocence.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044494288', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 164, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 130, 'last_played': 1511122381}
review:
(Reuploaded due to the people behind Valcarta: Rise of the Demon going through my profile and dislike-bombing my reviews)

I heard about Woodle Tree through the likes of Indie Game Battle (as I also have a character playable in that game), so much to my craving for 3D platformers, I got curious about this title and gave it a shot. Basically, there were things I liked about it and things I didn't, but I THINK there is just enough for me to say the good outweighs the bad. Nevertheless, I always feel the need to explain everything in detail. After all, this game's getting a sequel soon, and it's best there's improvements to be made for it.

One thing that stuck out for me was the visual style. I kinda have a soft spot for it. It has a homemade feel to it, with a hint of Nintendo 64. The levels also drive home a sense that feels much like Super Mario 3D Land. As this adorable little tree log, you simply have to get to the end of each level, while collecting three floating water drops along the way for each. It's simple, but cozy. For the most part, anyway. I do wish the soundtrack was more upbeat and catchy, but the platforming is fairly enjoyable, and your attack has decent range, making for enemy kills to be reasonably tangible. 

Not as reasonable is when Woodle Tree gets hit. For some reaosn, the checkpoint system seems to only work when Woodle Tree falls off a ledge; when you get hit by an enemy, you instantly have to start AT THE BEGINNING OF THE LEVEL. Granted, you have infinite lives and still have track of the water drops collected, but why can't I always start off at a portion of the level regardless of how I died? The control is also not the most intuitive it could have been. For some reason, you can't run and jump when moving up or down, nor can you do diagonal jumps. The control issues definitely need fixing up. To a lesser extent, there's the camera. I'm not as bothered by its clunkiness as everyone else was, but it can still be glaring for a game like this. 

Lastly, the game is over quickly and abruptly. I beat it in almost an hour's worth of game time, and while I'm the kind of guy that doesn't mind a short game (especially when the price is as low as it is), I was expecting at least an hour or two more than there was. And it wasn't like there was a boss battle or anything to close the game with; it just...threw an ending screen and that was it.

So yeah, this is definitely a flawed game. I wouldn't even really call it a great game, but I still at least recommend it if you can spare a few bucks for a small dose of indie 3D platforming.............Just as long as you can deal with the control and checkpoint issues.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970286203', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 138, 'playtime_forever': 135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 135, 'last_played': 1467564813}
review:
A vacuous 3D platformer with a crummy camera, uninspired level design, bad writing and dialogue that cannot be skipped, and music that sounds like someone noodling on a keyboard for a minute using the bare-bones Windows General MIDI soundfont (translation for those who aren't sound nerds: the music you'd hear on a Geocities webpage in the 1990s).

It did go on sale for five cents at one point in time, so for that particular price it's hard to get too disgusted. However, at the time of this review it's $1.19, and at that price I can manage a thumbs-down without much guilt.

If it's a nickel, pick it up for the trading cards, but be prepared to find about a nickel's worth of entertainment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198139720619', 'num_games_owned': 2236, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 210, 'last_played': 1517520470}
review:
You control a tree that defense himself with a leaf, you have to collect water to keep your world safe. A game to play with the family with a single difficulty mode, before buying the game you can play the demo, where you can play one of the levels to make an idea. The game originally include six levels.

The game has collectibles that when you get a required amount, you can upgrade your leaf so it can have more range.

[b]Controls.[/b]

Its easy to move around the game with the WASD controls.
Also there is a manual of all the controls before you click to play the game.

[b] Graphics.[/b]

You can choose between 9 types of screen resolution and 6 types of graphics qualities.

[b] PROS[/b]

Not a bad music for playing
Different levels
Differents qualities, so every computer can run the game and play it at the lowest or max resolution
You can play it fullscreen and windowed

[b] NEGS[/b]

Sometimes the camera get bugged
No audio voices


6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198044190411', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 73, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1571526357}
review:
iF IT GETs cheap, get this fucking game you will not regret it. Any gamer can truly apreciate the beauty of this woodle tree.


Woodle Tree was born in Beirut, Lebanon, the son of Branchy Tree (n√©e Bush), a costume designer/performer, and Widdle Tree. His mother is English, from Essex, England. His father, an American from Tree America has Oak, Pine, Maple, and Birch ancestry. Woodle Tree has said: "My grandmother is Oak and Pine, so I was around Pine art, furniture and cuisine when I was growing up".] He has also spoken of his English ancestry via his mother, mentioning his happy watching of The Two Ronnies comedy show, among others, when younger, and how his mother imparted English manners that he maintained into adulthood,"

author: {'steamid': '76561198026043470', 'num_games_owned': 1529, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 190, 'last_played': 1528134579}
review:
Woodle Tree is a game about a sociopathic log on his quest to give hayfever to innocent creatures, whilst simultaneously collecting fairy tears to return water to a land that already seems to have plenty of it.
While the game may have a lot of charm, wonky controls and mechanics that simply don't work detract from that. Most of the time the wind tunnel things don't do anything, except for causing you to fall to your death. Respawning 'might' place you at a checkpoint, or the start of the level, or just throw you off another edge.
The character and level design are bright, colourful and cute, and I think visually this game is great for a young audience. The music is mostly rather dull, at times bordering on mildly pleasant.
Overall it's not a bad game, considering it was pretty much made by one person. Kids would probably enjoy the colourful aesthetic, but the controls and bad mechanics would make it difficult for them to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998105505', 'num_games_owned': 5215, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 35, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1405023345}
review:
Woodle Tree is not a game that was without potential. The developers seem to have tried to create something good, but there are sadly some major issues holding it back

[b]Graphics & sound[/b]
Woodle Tree Adventure is not entirely unpleasing to look at. While the models are simple, and the colouring is relatively flat, everything is stylized in a way that gives it some consistency.
Sadly the often flat colours makes it needlessly hard to judge your exact position in relation to other objects, which makes platforming annoying. This could have been fixed by giving the ground textures some more definition, which would have made it easier to judge distances.
The sound design is lackluster. Your weapon, a leaf, makes an unimpressive sound. While it's understandable that a leaf does not make a "clang" noise, giving your attacks a stronger sound effect would have helped give the game some more life. Right now the game just feels empty due to its lackluster sound.

[b]Gameplay[/b]
Woodle Tree Adventure tries to be a simple 3D platformer, and the controls themselves work well enough. You jump, you attack and you move around, and it feels natural. Sadly the camera angels work against you. Moving up, down, left or right in relation to the camera is easy enough, but sadly the camera angles are often so that narrow platforms are at a very slight (and hard to see) angle, which means that if you just hold up, down, left or right you'll fall off. So you constantly need to nudge yourself in the right direction, which is just tedious, and due to the flat colouring, it's hard to actually tell if a platform is at an angle, and how big it is, when the angle is slight. This is really the biggest problem with the game, and it kills it.

[b]Closing thoughts[/b]
Woodle tree would be an inoffensive little 3D platformer, had the sound effects & camera angles been better. It would not have been a masterpiece, but as it stands, it's a bad game. And that's a shame, because it feels like the developer really wanted to create something good.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028098288', 'num_games_owned': 505, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 228, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1469529434}
review:
Juego entretenido. No es un AAA ovbiamente, pero pasas el rato agradablemente.
En mi experiencia si juegas cada vez un poco no te aburrir√°s, pero si superas la hora de juego puede hacerse pesado.
Lo que m√°s me atrae del juego es su sencillez y modo de jugar. A mi gusto bastante c√≥modo tanto con mando como con teclado. 
La m√∫sica acompa√±a bastante bien al juego y no se hace pesada en lo absoluto, siempre y cuando no pases demasiado rato seguido jugando.

El punto malo a mi parecer del juego, ser√≠a los √°ngulos de la c√°mara, pero a√∫n as√≠ no da demasiados problemas. Otro es que los textos (Los pocos textos que he visto) pasan algo r√°pido a mi parecer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048865581', 'num_games_owned': 2546, 'num_reviews': 242, 'playtime_forever': 100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1467136671}
review:
Woodle Tree Adventures... the bain of all mystery key buyers and free game lookers.
So, let's talk about it. 
It's a 3D Unity platformer with an annoying camera and shoddy controls. 
It's short and it feels unfinished to all hell... but for some reason I still enjoy it. I like how short the game is, I like that it's easy to get all the achievements (except maybe the 3,000 berries achievement). There is something there that entertained me for the 70 minute long story. 
The soundtrack is mediocre, with one of the songs being a fun tune and the rest being average background noise. 
There were some bugs. I encountered about 3-4 noticable bugs.
Also, there's a huge oversight in the game... Pressing escape will close the game... REALLY?!?!?
Overall, don't buy this, but if you get the game for free, I'd suggest booting it up and having a look at it.
EDIT: It takes 100 minutes to 100% the game.

Overall
4/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198267779591', 'num_games_owned': 81, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 40, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1482909874}
review:
This Game is aimed at kids obviously, has a mario or one of those old ps1 games styles to it, i wouldn't recommend it but it's an okay game!

Pros 
Soundtrack is pretty cool 
Get to collect the tears of fairies and berries
Get to smash the crap out of people trying to hurt you or innnocent caterpillars

Cons 
Terrible handling of  controls 
Graphics are worse than Half Life
Storyline is none exsistant and is just plain crap
The animals 1 hit you then you restart, no checkpoints for each level which is absolute annoying and bs 

Overall 
The game is just dumb and should not even be on steam. 

Oh Even though a friend gave this to me for free i would not play it again

author: {'steamid': '76561198051865219', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1515207823}
review:
The game is pretty amateur, but that's part of it's charm.

Most gamers these days are spoiled by AAA games that have perfected formulas and are made with millions of dollars and hundreds of talented people. I started gaming with the Atari 2600 and I can tell you what a real bad game is. 

Woodle Tree Adventures is not a bad game, it merely is an ambitious game made by one person and it hits more highs than lows... at least for the prize. It's cheap.

First the bad: The camera is the worst part of this game. The levels are floating in the sky and you can easily fall and have to start all over again (you keep everything you've collected which is nice though). The animations are slow and the enemies are more annoying than challenging.

The good: Good graphics. Game ran at 60 frames per second for me. Nice enough music. The levels were challenging but never felt unfair despite the bad camera. There are a lot of cute touches like ladybugs and other creatures.

This game is great just to see what a single person can do. Making games is hard, but making a 3D platformer is very very difficult. You might not care, but I do and playing a flawed albeit perfectly enjoyable game made by just one person makes it so much more interesting. Also it's cheap.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049224362', 'num_games_owned': 264, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 414, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 384, 'last_played': 1466082983}
review:
A decent game that could've been even better with more polishing.
The visuals are very kiddy-like which is obvious since it's targeted at a young audience, it doesn't mean you can't enjoy it as an adult but a kid will probably enjoy it more due to the cutesy artstyle and platformer gameplay. The game is mainly made for a controler setup so, keyboard is slippery and stiff.

- The camera is awful, must be fixed asap because the tunnel vision makes it frustating.
- The music isn't that bad, but after some hours of playing it gets extremely tiring due to the loop being so short.
- Better controls when playing with keyboard and mouse.

It is pretty entertaining once you get the hang of it and the new leafs you get make it enjoyable, so it just really needs tweaks here and there to make it truly shine. Also a proper pause menu with options would be very, very nice.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045671367', 'num_games_owned': 3048, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 306, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1510598502}
review:
[b]For the price Woodle Tree Adventures is available it's ok. If it's on sale and you don't mind redoing/rewalking parts of some levels then you'll have some fun with it and it's gonna be worth it.[/b] 


It is cute and it'll make you puke!

Overall it's a nice little 3D platformer in which you play a little tree stump that is armed with a leaf. It has the quest of collecting water drops called 'fairy drops'. Why? No idea, especially since there are watefalls everywhere. But that's not your only goal, there are berries all around and you have to collect them to upgrade your leaf and to unlock more levels. 
You can [strike]run[/strike] walk, jump and attack. 

It could have been a good funny little game, but there is one big.. huge issue. The camera. Sadly the angles are all fixated and the developer didn't choose them all to be very useful and comfortable. Sometimes the camera is set in a really bad spot, you can not really see a part of the level fully or the camera swings or zooms in/out at places that make you feel sick or jump into the abyss... 


It's a rather short game, i'll update when i am finished with it.

Edit: Finished. 

It has some really nice themed levels, the music is good too. But it's just really not that interesting to play and the camera is an obstacle sometimes. 

Get it on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198262513882', 'num_games_owned': 2395, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 711, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 711, 'last_played': 1475751116}
review: "Woodle Tree Adventures" is a charming platformer with a nostalgic art style reminiscent of classic 90s games. Embark on a journey across 6 enchanting worlds, restoring peace with magical water drops. The serene atmosphere makes it perfect for relaxation, accompanied by a soothing soundtrack. Even if you're not a platformer fan, the game's beauty is worth experiencing. It's a delightful blend of artistry and platforming, suitable for players of all ages, aiming to bring joy to every player's heart.

review:
So my friend gave me this game for free right? And I was like sweet, free sh*t. The download speed was like 15 seconds. I open it, then realize the game f*cking sucks. I'll break it down. 

[b] Pros [/b]
[list]
[*] Soundtrack is pretty cool 
[*] Get to collect the tears of fairies 
[*] Get to beat up innocent animals with a leaf
[/list]

[b] Cons [/b]
[list] 
[*] Sh*tty controls 
[*] Graphics are worse than Minecraft 
[*] Storyline is none exsistant 
[*] Crashed my $1k laptop once I completed the first level
[*] The animals 1 hit you then you restart, no checkpoints for each level 
[/list]

[b] Overall [/b]
The game isn't worth anything over a dollar. You'd have to pay me to play this garbage.

author: {'steamid': '76561198251008320', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 592, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 128, 'last_played': 1465574082}
review:
Woodle Tree Adventures is a game about a walking log that must collect fairy tears in several different themed worlds and one optional level that gets unlocked when you collect 600 berries, which are the equivalent of coins. It's a 3D platformer that really reminded me of Super Mario 3D Land. I wanted to like this game, but unfortunately after playing it I can't honestly say it's any good.

[h1]Pros[/h1]
+[b]Bright and colorful[/b]
+[b]Cute[/b]
+[b]Kid-friendly[/b]

[h1]Cons[/h1]
-[b]Terrible camera[/b]- Sometimes it was too zoomed out, sometimes it was right up in the character's face. I often fell down holes I couldn't see or got lost because the camera angle kept changing. It doesn't help that your berry sack just gets bigger and bigger, obscuring your view as you struggle to get onto the platforms.
-[b]Movement[/b]- Your regular walking speed is very, very slow and your running speed is way too fast. It only gets worse when you're in the water and you slow to a snail's pace, even when running. When you jump, you always go forward whether you want to or not. The whole thing felt like an ice level; I was sliding around all the time and accidentally fell out of the world many times because of it.
-[b]Confusing hitboxes & clipping[/b]- Noticed lots of clipping issues, from my character being half inside his own berry bag to enemies walking through each other. It's hard to tell when you're going to hit an enemy, especially with the default green leaf, because the hitboxes are messed up. Even when standing right next to an enemy and hitting it with the leaf, it didn't die. 
-[b]Soundtrack[/b]- In some levels, it's okay, but in others it's absolutely grating. In one world, it's just a bunch of piano keys being played seemingly at random on loop. In others, it's simply not there at all and you can hardly hear it. 
-[b]Unforgiving[/b]- In some parts, it's very easy to die not necessarily because the level is hard but because of unfair controls and the camera angle. When you do, you're ether sent all the way back to the start or sent to a checkpoint far from where you died. The checkpoints seem really inconsistent, too, because sometimes when I died I was sent to one and then I died later on and went back to the start. It's hard for the wrong reasons. Enemy AI is extremely basic (either standing still or moving along a very basic path) and the levels themselves aren't too difficult. It's just that the controls coupled with the camera make everything far harder to do that need be.

This doesn't feel like a finished game at all and would need lots of work to be worth the money. I got it free from a giveaway, but I definitely would not consider buying it if I hadn't. Don't get this unless you want free achievements and trading cards.

author: {'steamid': '76561198236686082', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1471685476}
review: So...  I really encourage You for making this game, and as I would guess Your first one too. Yes, the artstyle is unique and the game is intresting but there are some major flaws, that I hope You would fix in upcoming updates. First - Camera angles.  I mean GOOD LORD. Playing this game on mac is extremely difficult of how fullscreen mode works, and same, even tho smaller problem accurs on windows. I suggest giving the player full controll of the camera. Second - Checkpoints. I mean, what. You die by an enemy - you respawn at the start, but all the other progress is still there. Add some sort of checkpoint system or save function, something like that. Or you can try a life system. Third - interface. You should add a berry counter or something, which would show, how much berries you\'ve already collected. Forth - level/story/enemy design. You really need to work on the story a bit more. I am placed in a brand new world, where I have to kill friendly looking enemies and get some sort of fairy tear drops, while collecting berries at the same time. What. Add a bit more explanation, get some friends to try out the game, and tell you all the logic flaws. Fifth - don\'t give up. This is a fine game, even though all the flaws that I listen. As I said, I really support Your work, and would like to help. You have a fine future. Anyways, enough for my book-writing reviews. Have a nice day, pal!

author: {'steamid': '76561198048871855', 'num_games_owned': 704, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 110, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 110, 'last_played': 1464666669}
review:
‚ô• I have severe anxiety and find this game so relaxing to play!

I like it how you can play it for five minutes or an hour without feeling pressure to finish the level or defeat a boss. Those kinds of games are great but if you want to play something for a few minutes, this game is perfect!  

‚ô• The graphics are absolutely adorable.

I appreciate that the colors and scenery are easy on the eyes. There's no harsh neons, flashing lights, etc. 

‚ô• The levels are easy to understand.

I'm a huge fan of puzzle games like Nancy Drew but find that sometimes my brain needs a break! I like how the berries aren't hard to find, they aren't ever hidden too well. Just a fun game to pass the time with. 

‚úò As other reviewers have mentioned, the camera can be a bit wonky.

I have horrendous motion sickness and the camera constantly switching angles doesn't help with that. However I don't find the camera situation a deal breaker, especially since I tend to play the game for short amounts of time. 

‚úò I despise the monsters that rush at you.

You can bop them with your leaf but if you're too slow, you have to restart from the beginning or a certain check point. It drives me batty! 

‚úò Sometimes jumping can be hard to do.

It may just be me however there are some times when I find it hard to measure the jumps - I'll miss the next block and fall inbetween, slip from the edge when pressing the jump key, etc. However overall I really do enjoy this game - it never fails to put me in a cheerful mood. : D

author: {'steamid': '76561198175839927', 'num_games_owned': 118, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 171, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1590177822}
review: Best Game 10/420 IGN "Dem graphics"

author: {'steamid': '76561198145997351', 'num_games_owned': 49, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1464355795}
review:
I got this game as a gift and decided to give it a try, as I really like platformers. What it turned out to be, really disappointed me. First of all, if you make a 3D game, you cannot just hard-bind the camera to the character, you need to implement a way to move it with an analog stick or a mouse. Otherwise, it becomes a nightmare. Also, the movement and contros are really clunky, graphics seem nice at first, but after 5 minutes they start to give you a headache.

Overall, good concept, poorly executed. The game feels very unfinished, definitely not worth even 3 euros.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002996908', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 315, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 315, 'last_played': 1464347263}
review:
I received this game as a gift and thought, "what the heck is this? A log simulator?" Well, not quite! You play as a cute log who is on an adventure to collect water and fruit. Throughout your travels, you will come across mobs that you will have to stick it to.

Honestly, the greatest enemy in the game, apart from falling out of a reality that even Bear Grylls would struggle to clamber back into, is the camera. The positioning is horrendous at times - it will get stuck a lot. Furthermore it points at random things, which definitely makes jumping almost impossible.

Despite all of its flaws, I somehow ended up enjoying Woodle Tree Adventures and got hooked into playing it for a few hours. Sure, the game may be basic but it has a fresh pine smell to it.

 The camera angle and positioning is definitely a negative - you will randomly be glitched behind blocks, what is quite frustrating at times.

Overall, I would give this game a 4/5.

A message to the developers: I cannot wait for Woodle Tree Adventures tree-quel!


Thanks for reading my review, and have a tree-mendous day.

author: {'steamid': '76561198179292281', 'num_games_owned': 251, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 400, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 400, 'last_played': 1463858728}
review:
First of all, no matter what is written down below, don't buy this game and wait until 2nd installment is released!
It's not worth it in my opinion, and honestly after a short play I decided to complete this game merely for the easy to get achievements.
What I liked:
- level design
- challenging one or two times

What I disliked:
- terrible camera that is out of control, so it's hard to see the level sometimes
- brain damage causing soundtrack (it's really that bad)
- it's short
- no replayable

So, to sum up. Hold off until WT2 is released, but if you still want to buy it, don't do it for the full price.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982229305', 'num_games_owned': 500, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 172, 'last_played': 1463755574}
review:
I was gifted this randomly by a friend, so I wasn't exactly expecting much, but I found myself fairly pleased with the results.

It takes about an hour to beat.

pros:
cute graphics
good for kids
relatively fun gameplay

cons:
camera control is really bad, only allows zoom in/out and can get stuck on things occasionally
platforming segments are hard to accurately judge (because of camera)
the dash button is incredibly slippery and will cause you to fall off platforms a lot
very little information is presented to the player - i'd like to know if I found all the berries in a level or something
Not very many levels, and their entrances are crammed inside a tiny house.

Despite its cons, you're not gonna be getting stuck in geometry or facing off against faceless horrors(*cough*ubisoft*cough) and it's fun enough that i'd still recommend it.

TL;DR - game is fun but short, camera sucks, Worth it anyway.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075782070', 'num_games_owned': 197, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 175, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1463537424}
review:
This could be a really cool little game, if it had CAMERA CONTROL.
Not allowing the player to control the camera is not always that bad, if the camera movement is well designed. This is not the case. The camera is 90% of the time just focusing on the map from the front side, what kills the perspective of 1 dimension. You practically have to guess if a platform is alligned with the character, so you can jump to it. These wrong jumps  will kill you so many times in such frustrating way that this frustration does not compesate the fun you get.
There are a few other bugs and random crashes, but the lack of camera control is by far the biggest problem with this game. It is a shame, it has potential.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972142968', 'num_games_owned': 1922, 'num_reviews': 140, 'playtime_forever': 241, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 241, 'last_played': 1469281458}
review:
This game is way too simple.... Well it would be except for the fact that the camera angle is so terrible it makes this game incredibly difficult. You're going to want to shoot yourself in the face after the 2nd stage. It reminds me of the early days of 3d platformers. Except the old PS, N64, etc games were at least bearable. What the hell were the devs thinking? Why is something this stupid an issue in this day & age? Spare yourselves the annoyance. Spend your money elsewhere.

Do you enjoy knowing where you exist in space & time? Woodle Tree does not think the gamer should have this luxury.

If the camera isn't bad enough on it's own. The more you die or even make use of the camera, it bugs out & comes off of it's tracks. Sometimes locking into a zoomed in overhead view. Other times the camera completely flips around & you see everything from the back of the stage. Most times the camera will level out with the character & you will be staring at it's back.

review:

1/10 would uninstall again.

10/10, would get ass kicked again...

Just kidding, it blows.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020482980', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 200, 'playtime_forever': 231, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 231, 'last_played': 1462360770}
review:
Got me a free copy of this game to try out. My thoughts on the game now that I've completed it:

Story seems....well, I don't think think I should even call it a story....haha because there's no story; you rock up from the ground from some mother tree, that tree tells you to go look for waterdroplets and you traverse a few worlds collecting three droplets from each world and then you're done, the mother tree congrats you and then the end!

Partial support for Nvidia Optimus, this game runs on my Intel HD4600 automatically, but can be force via the right-click contet menu. Would be nice for full support for as at least it'd be using my GTX980M, giving me smooth 60 fps, rather than 20 fps on Fantastic settings @ 1080p...

Gameplay wise, well I pretty much described that in the story sentence above, but to add you get leaves, Green, Yellow, Orange and White - and you use these to flog off enemies.... I suppose you can play with another person that's around you for local coop, the other person would be controling a dog like character.... 

Oooh the camera angles! Why they not let us change camera angles via mouse or keys?? Some of the time, the camera angle would shoot from a flat shot so you're right looking at the character but don't know if you will be able to make the jump or not because you can't adjust the angles so you can see better! So you'll need to do a bit of guess work and hope you land on the other side! All the mouse does is zoom in and out, so you can't use your mouse to look around...

Graphics: Looks cheaply made....even with graphics settings on Fantastic level; actually I don't think I've noticed any change from Fantastic vs. Fastest, besides a huge fps drop!

Music/sound: I suppose they fit well with the game.

My bottomline? Well besides unable to change camera angles, it's an ok casual game. 

So they've updated the review system, but still no neutral thumbs? Coz right now I don't feel like it deserves a thumbs up nor a thumbs down....it's like flat in the middle between them; however, considering it was bug/glitch(besides that one exploit...) free, was able to entertain me casually so that I could kill off time I had whilst waiting for something else and that I got it for free, vs. the no full Optimus support and unadjustable camera angles - I will vote thumbs up as it's slightly over to the positive side.

Oh yeah and this game would probably suit a child more than a teen or adult unless you got nothing else/better to do/play.

===================================
Played on Raikou (Gigabyte P35x V3): i74710HQ, 16GB RAM, GTX 980M, 128GB SSD mSATA, 2TB HDD, Win 7 Pro x64, BD-R ODD, FHD display; resolution 1920x1080

author: {'steamid': '76561197961539340', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 70, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1461608208}
review:
The developers of this game appear to have seen that other games have used platforms, but didn't quite understand why. In a good 3D platformer (like, as mentioned in the game description, Mario 64 and Banjo Kazooie), there is challenge in navigating the environments. You see where you are trying to go, and the trick is figuring out how to get there, usually with tricky leaps, hidden paths, timed puzzles etc.

This game doesn't do any of that.

The only reason there's any challenge at all, in fact, is because every level is suspended over a bottomless pit. As such, every jump is either entirely safe, adding nothing to the experience, or is instant death, dumping you back at the start of the level. (Well, technically it will *sometimes* put you to a checkpoint part way, but there seems to be no particular reason why. It's never very close to where you were anyway, and subsequent falls with inevitable forget the checkpoint was there.) There are two types of pickups; berrys, which are everywhere and just unlock weapon upgrades (and one extra stage), and droplets. The berrys are sometimes hidden, but as they all respawn when you restart a level, it doesn't actually matter if you miss any... this game has no concept of 100% completion. The droplets are always out in the open, and easily accessible, if perhaps off the main route.

Have I mentioned the camera? It's *awful*. You have one control; zoom. This doesn't help when the camera decides it wants to be at a flat, low angle to the player, making it impossible to tell where any of the platforms are in relation to your character. It's no even like, given time, it will rectify itself. Nope, if you can't see, tough look; better try anyway, maybe the camera will be nicer after you respawn. Oh, also; you can zoom out forever, and in doing so things on every level that were clearly not meant to be seen, like random platforms from other level, berries floating out in the middle of nowhere, and (for some reason) *something* submerged near the player's spawn point, on every level.

Combat is entirely redundant. Enemies take one hit to kill, invariably. The ones that move have just one action; run towards you. (OK, technically two; there are bees that slowly drift up and down in place, but come on.) With the first leaf, attacks are melee. Everything is easy to kill, with most deaths I suffered happened when I turned away from the enemy I'd just killed, my sack had touched their dying animation, and that was that. Once you get the first upgrade, you can kill anything from a safe distance while they just stand still, often by accident. The two next upgrades... increase your attack range? Maybe? I don't know. Nothing actually useful. No idea what the bandana is for.

After an hour I completed the game, and had a good few seconds to run around in the big wide opening area that I had work so *very* hard to bring water too before the credits ran. This is mild in comparison to the rest, but let me talk game design here, for the rare beast who's read this far and is considering making their own game. If your game concept is based around the player bringing water back to their home land, you should probably do the following: first, make the land look dry and barren at the beginning, lot filled with lush greenry. Second, allow the player to pop back to that land whenever they like, and see how their work has made a change. (If you want to get all creative-like, have the changing environment allow them to access powerups, easter eggs, additional levels, or something to give them a solid feeling of having an effect. Third, when the player has finally completed their task, let them enjoy the paradise they have created. For a game that never felt like a climax was coming, this was still anti-climactic.

On the plus side, the main character looks kinda cute. 10/10 GOTY 2014.

review:
Woodle Tree Adventures is a small almost platformer type game, where you objective is to collect water droplets and berries to save the day. Although there is not much story behind this game, it's fairly cute and can be seen a a game for small children.

Pros:
-Cute as hell
-Easy enough to play and finish
-Has controller support (Xbox 360)

Cons:
-Keyboard controls are extremely clunky, game performs much better when an Xbox controller is used
-Sudden FPS drop for no reason whatsoever while playing it
-Repetitive and can become grindy if you want to finish the achievements
-No pause menu, which makes it frustrating

Overall, this game is not to bad, considering the target market, just needs a bit of work though. Still worth a try on sale.
6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198072172772', 'num_games_owned': 131, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1477265342}

author: {'steamid': '76561197998470271', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1458343170}
review:
In Woodle Tree Adventures, you can finally live out your wildest dream; being a solid piece of wood. As Woodle, you can finally realise the true potential of wood, and the magnificent life wood can lead. With a perfect voice actor portraying the wood beautifully, and a perfect in-game model representing the wood, never before has a game been so enjoyable, no other games come close to the perfection of the wood. The wood as been perfected to a fine art, and you can really feel it while playing the game. 

Overall, a beautiful game with beautiful art and design.




10/10 wood play again.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988827286', 'num_games_owned': 2858, 'num_reviews': 548, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1493304000}
review:
"Hey, let's make a precision platforming game."
"Good idea!"
"And let's give all the platforms rounded edges so it looks adorable."
"Uh.... won't that make it hard to judge where the platforms end?"
"And let's use a shader that maks everything bright and colourful by not giving objects shadows on different sides!"
"Preeeetty sure that'll make it impossible to judge where the platforms end."
"And let's put the camera at really dynamic shots so that every area is shot from a different angle - including where you run towards the camera!"
"Man, I really hate when the boss tries to come up with game ideas when he's been drinking."


Oh yeah, and I accidentally pressed Escape during the one-time-only introduction, so now I don't know what the story is.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009334801', 'num_games_owned': 996, 'num_reviews': 249, 'playtime_forever': 121, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1460019128}
review:
Che dire.
√à una specie di demo fatta da un ragazzo italiano, in cui siamo un tronchetto che va a raccogliere bacche armato della sua foglia e deve trovare 3 gocce d'acqua in ogni livello.
Ci sono giusto 7-8 livelli che durano un manciata di minuti, e la fine del gioco si raggiunge in s√¨ e no un'ora. 
La telecamera non si pu√≤ ruotare a piacimento e questo crea spesso molti problemi spaziali e rende confusionari i salti, mentre i controlli sono un po' imprecisi e scivolosi, ma se non altro rimane giocabile.

La grafica √® carina e le musiche rilassanti, ma mi sfugge perch√© un titolo del genere sia su Steam visto che sembra (e probabilmente lo √®) un semplice primo esperimento di uno sviluppatore in erba che prova a fare qualcosa in 3D. Poi per√≤ penso che su Steam c'√® roba molto peggiore di questa venduta a molto di pi√π, e allora va bene cos√¨.

Visto che viene dato via gratis almeno 10 volte all'anno, suppongo ce l'abbia chiunque in libreria, e se cos√¨ ottenuto una partitella si pu√≤ anche fare, ed √® l'unico motivo per cui lo consiglio.
Ma non ci spenderei soldi, ecco.

Peca um pouco na jogabilidade, mais para um jogo terminado em 63 minutos, ta de bom tamanho.

review: As a veteran matser of this game i can definately reccommed it to another person. You play as the silent protagonist, who's goals and motives are your own. Place through the game and go on a brutal raid on the local forest; stealing the year's supply of berries from the natives, and collecting the tears of the fallen. Enjoy as your jam roll looking protagionist goes on  amurderous rampage, killing all in sight.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996627259', 'num_games_owned': 1878, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1459694615}
review:
This game is a travesty.

Cons:
- The controls are super loose and don't feel precise at all
- The level design is random and doesn't have a good structure to it.
- The camera control is almost nonexistant (only letting the player zoom in and out), and the camera is also very janky, frequently becoming locked in a certain direction if you die and respawn, or if you don't hit the camera change trigger in the level.
- The enemy AI is simple and boring, not offering much of a challenge at all. Honestly, the camera is more of a challenge than the enemies.
- The unlockable weapons amount to very little. Essentially, they allow you to fire wind gusts more rapidly and further away from yourself, but they don't actually feel all that different, and seem almost unecessary.
- It can be beaten in about an hour.

Pros:
- It can be beaten in about an hour.
- The art is decent looking.

???:
- What the heck does the red headband do?

author: {'steamid': '76561198105075768', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 34, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1459260003}
review:
This game is friggin adorable. At first I was just going to let it run for cards but I actually like it.
Is it a children's game? I think so.
Is it a hard game? The controls alone make it nintendo hard. Plus if you touch the wrong creature you're back to the start. If you're precise enough it's not really hard though.
Also you can have a peaceful run and not kill anything if you're into that. You won't get a game reward for it but isn't the moral gratification of not hurting fictional creatures the ultimare reward?

The story is kinda weird because there's obviously a lot of water around so there's probably a sinister reason why you have to collect tears. Those fairies probably poisoned the water to kill the trees and there will be an epic war at the end where you use the tears to summon a dark wizard that gives Woodle superpowers and everything turns way darker and you fight evil fairies. I mean you play as a stump so there's probably a sinister reason why that's all that's left from the protagonist. I'm still at the first level but idk that game looks suspiciously happy. And Woodle only has a dad. Bet the evil fairies killed his mother. Maybe the tears will resurrect her? So many questions. The plot is so deep and mysterious that I'll probably play it a bunch of times to unravel all the secrets. Will update the review if I find evil fairies.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057766327', 'num_games_owned': 349, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 253, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1461719903}
review:
Woodle tree es un plataformero de la vieja escuela, al puro estilo de mario 64 o banjo kazooie tirando a la estetica de super mario 3d world. La banda sonora es lenta y relajante por lo cual el juego no tiene pensado frustarte o hacer tu vida un infierno, si no que te tomes tu tiempo para jugarlo y vayas avanzando con calma. (aunque me lo pase en 1 hora tomandome mi tiempo y todo)

Lastimosamente el juego es corto y me hubiese gustado que tuviese mas niveles, pero bueno, eso no quita que sea un mal juego.

Recomendado para los amantes de los plataformeros simples.

author: {'steamid': '76561198274296955', 'num_games_owned': 315, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 67, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1459171447}
review:
In reality, I have somewhat mixed feelings about the game. Lets start with the crud before we go into the cool.

The crud: The first cruddy thing you will find is the controls, the Xbox controls still limit you to 8 directions, like a Nintendo 64 game, second, the camera is completely butt. The camera does whatever the heck it wants, this makes it not good to make certain platforms. Third, the game is very short, not even an hour long, but I guess I didn't complete the game 100%, but my point still stands. Also, to complete the level, you HAVE to get all the tears, this is stupid, imagine playing New Super Mario Bros, but you have to get all star coins to continue. And finally(I think), The checkpoints are terrible, as in you can get pretty far in one of the short levels, but then you die due to the camera (remember that) and now you have to restart! Ok, I was very negative, but now lets get to the good.

The not crud: The game looks nice and has lots of atmosphere. The music is relaxing. (even though you have to buy it for no good reason) and finally, the variety in finding a bunch of berrys gets you new leaves, a bandanna, and even a new level.

So in conclusion, do what I did and buy this game during a sale only if you REALLY REALLY want it or are very interested.

author: {'steamid': '76561198213630589', 'num_games_owned': 952, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 208, 'last_played': 1449762526}
review:
This game is so soothing, it makes you wonder about what life really means...because you just wasted most of it in this game.
1) The camera is shit.
2)Your objective is to collect water for the thirsty world but there is a f*cking waterfall in the opening cutscene!
But for the rest... it's not that bad, just buy it on sale because spending $3 for this is a mistake

author: {'steamid': '76561198085250352', 'num_games_owned': 1387, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 148, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 148, 'last_played': 1432503746}
review:
Woodle Tree Adventures es un juego de plataformas en 3D desarrollado y publicado por Fabio Ferrara. En este videojuego, el agua del mundo desaparece y ser√° hasta que el jugador recoja las tres gotas de agua en cada una de las seis etapas para restaurarla.

Es un videojuego sencillo, en cinco horas tal vez se lo puede terminar (dando un promedio de cincuenta minutos por etapa).

El personaje tiene la capacidad de saltar y atacar con una hoja. La hoja puede ser mejorada. El jugador solo puede recibir da√±o una vez, en caso de que suceda simplemente se lo coloca en un punto de guardado anterior.

Hablando del apartado gr√°fico, deja un poco que desear, pero no quita lo divertido que puede llegar a ser. En cuanto a la banda sonora es relajante, los efectos de sonidos son gen√©ricos.
