author: {'steamid': '76561198057470595', 'num_games_owned': 144, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 183, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 129, 'last_played': 1479831486}
review:
What is this game about?:
Dont let it trick you, THIS IS NOT A KIDS GAME. this is a cruel game about a revenge story. Woodle, a log born from the dying ashes of his mother, is set on a revenge to kill every demon in this hellish world. The demons are disguised as happy creatures, but dont let that fool you. You have to collect the tears of your fallen brothers, who sacrificed their life to save yours. (im only at lvl 4, but Im pretty sure ill have to fight demonlord aranaktu at the end)
How is the gameplay?:
This game is hard. Like dark souls hard. Remember those icy levels in mario? well, that + the camera angles of donkey kong 64, and woodle tree adventures is born. In this twisted world gravity doesnt work all the time,and if you die, back to start bitch (although sometimes if you are lucky you will be able to spawn somewere in the middle of the map). Oh yeah, and those demons, all of them kill you with one hit. Not only demons will make you have cancer, also frikkin tentacle swinging ghouls. Nai shokushu! Oh and those "silly jumping puzzles" make deadcore look like childplay. 
Well then should i buy this game?
Yeah man, if you go to the free steam key reddit page, you can get your copy of this game, but I recommend buying it. It is recommended to have some experience in hard games first. I suggest finishing super hexagon, dark souls, deadcore and doom on nightmare mode, before even considering playing this game

review: Got it on a sale $0.59. Its ruff but I see a lot of potential and I think I read they are working on a second. So I'm interested to see where that goes. Its like Mario 64 but simple and cute. Its controls are uncomfortable and your weapon is a leaf that you waft at enemies. That all being said, its good because its bad. Like a Sanic Ball or Bad Dudes. Its a good time for less than a candy bar.

author: {'steamid': '76561198132780522', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 340, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 340, 'last_played': 1458237345}
review:
The game is cute, I can attest to that among other reviewers, but the game has a bunch of problems on the side too. First of all Woodle moves like a block of wood and not in a good way, the controls are too sluggish and slow for the stage environments. I understand there may be kids playing this, but it wouldn‚Äôt hurt if the protagonist can move slightly faster than a snail.

The camera angle leaves a lot to be desired as well, often times I would be struggling to see where I‚Äôm jumping and forced to estimate my landing spot, this is artificial difficulty and pure annoyance.

Beyond the above issues, the game did run fine enough on its own and I‚Äôm happy with the amount of content available. Thus for the current asking price, I would recommend this as an afternoon distraction, and it might not be a bad idea to get it for a younger kid either.

author: {'steamid': '76561198143469084', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 88, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 88, 'last_played': 1458233237}

The concept is great, but the execution needs a little more work.

author: {'steamid': '76561198099704746', 'num_games_owned': 770, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 8, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1458100458}
review:
Completely mediocre in practically every way, Woodle Tree Adventures looks good in screenshot, but is substantially less impressive in motion.

The game opens up to a quiet scene of a tree with a mustache talking to a new anthropomorphic stump. The dialogue is bland, not voiced, and sticks around for far, far too long and is, as far as I could tell from my random button pushes, unskippable. It sticks around for a few minutes at the most, but isn't actually a deal breaker.

What follows is. Being a 3D platformer, the way the character feels is imperitive to a good experience. This stump guy does not feel good. He walks far too slow, and runs far too slow, which not only clashes with the cartoony vibe the game seems to be going for, but seems to undercut itself as a platformer. The leaf this character uses as a weapon feels about as effective as an actual leaf, and the hitbox for the attack is just about as large as the leaf, ensuring you have to thoroughly snuggle up to the enemies that damage you on touch in order for you to hurt them. I also had a problem with a camera angle or two not giving me a very good idea of where the enemies were in relation to myself.

The stump also has a pretty floaty jump and the sound of him running around doesn't match up to when his feet actually touch the ground.

I also had a bit of input lag, but i'm not sure I can blame this on the game or not. My computer isn't anything special, but it's been enough to play Tomb Raider 2013 and Bioshock Infinite along with the vast majority of the rest of my library. I see no reason it shouldn't be able to run this game appropriately.

All in all, the cute graphics and models can't make up for a game that fundamentally feels bad and has such poor initial presentation. I only played five minutes into the first level before I was thoroughly sick of it. Dying also sends you back to the beginning of the stage (unless I died before a checkpoint), and I wasn't very keen to repeat the half I've done. 

Maybe this game gets really good later on, but that doesn't change a first impression.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028216179', 'num_games_owned': 2423, 'num_reviews': 159, 'playtime_forever': 311, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 300, 'last_played': 1458454745}
review:
[i]Woodle Tree Adventures[/i] is an adorable 3D platformer that allows players to step into the shoes of a tiny tree hero. The game itself is very simple and straightforward. Your goal as Woodle is collect Fairy Tears which in the game look like giant tear drops. Apparently your land needs water and these Fairy Tears can help with that. That‚Äôs it -[b]there isn‚Äôt much of a story[/b]. You also collect berries which will unlock things when you collect enough. The game is also very short, it only has six main levels and one bonus level and has little replay value.

The game is fun and would be great for younger players, however, I found a glaring problem with the game play. This game is 3D as I mentioned, however, the camera doesn‚Äôt act like it. You can‚Äôt control the camera outside of zooming in and zooming out. You can‚Äôt rotate the camera to see where you might be jumping and it causes depth perception issues as well lots of falls. It turned a fun and cute game into a frustrating experience. [b]I can‚Äôt even count how many times I fell to my death[/b] because I couldn‚Äôt see where I was jumping properly, and then where you respawn is random. Sometimes it‚Äôs near the beginning or maybe you‚Äôll get lucky and land close to where you before. There also no checkpoints which would help with that, but if the camera worked properly you wouldn‚Äôt need checkpoints because the levels aren‚Äôt that difficult. While I think a child would love this game I don‚Äôt think it would be fair to give them something this frustrating. On the plus side you have unlimited lives so you can keep dying forever.

[b]The things I liked most about this game was its art and music[/b]. I kept pushing through the game despite the countless deaths because I found it so cute. The art is bright and amazingly comforting, even the enemies are adorable. All the worlds are well-designed and have fitting music to accompany them. Aside from the simple controls, you can jump, run and hit things, the aesthetic aspects of the game were the only good parts unfortunately. I really wanted to like something so cute.

If you can handle the wonky camera you may like this game, I did but it was too frustrating. This would be a perfect game for children or people looking for a casual experience. My only other issue with the game is lack of explanation on what the upgrades do, I really saw no difference between the yellow, orange and white leaf weapons. [b]The game is very cheap and also comes with trading cards and easy achievements[/b] so if you can put up with the camera I say get it but I can‚Äôt fully recommend this sadly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198181182459', 'num_games_owned': 338, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 256, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 256, 'last_played': 1454390651}
review:
Es un buen juego para las personas que le gusta los juegos de plataforma , este juego trata de un arbolito o mejor dicho el tronco que tiene que pasar por diversos mundos ,nose lo demas no lo termine de jugar , el juego en si es algo lento , el problema mayor es la camara que sigue al personaje, aveces es un poco molesto que la camara este muy lejos y muy cerca sin poder mover hacia los lados ,terminando con el analisis recomiendo el juego si te gustan los juegos de plataforma y los juegos lentos ,es un juego mas para ni√±os peque√±os ,a mi parecer seria mucho mejor si se juega con un mando ya que con el teclado es estresante, si quieres distraerte un rato y salir de los juegos FPS o Moba este juego es perfecto solo que no lo compres si no esta en descuento ya que no valdria la pena .
7.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198097895236', 'num_games_owned': 1138, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 269, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 269, 'last_played': 1560557591}
review:
[h1]Not recommended too boring[/h1]
Pros:
Woodle is adorable <3

Cons:
Music is pretty boring
Bad camera control
Not much of a story 
Not very good animations
You die in one hit, and the attack animation is too bad
No healthbar, lives or any sort of punishment for dying

author: {'steamid': '76561198062040803', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 8, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1445981600}
review:
Words cannot express my express the events in this game, but I will try to paint a mental picture for you anyway.

My character was born into the world from a brown pile of slop. They arose from the muck with god-like grace, elevating through the different layers with precision, and class.
 I gave my character a name, that name being 'Swiss Shyte Roll', as it resembled a pile of dark foeces mixed with the baked treat, the 'Swiss Roll'. When he rose, he was facing an indian punk-rock formation, with orange skin, a macho-man moustache, fat eyebrows, and eyes so black they consumed the soul of everything for miles around.
It appears he'd mutated into some sort of solitary structure resembling a tree; his arms once flailing in agony as he'd been stuck in the brown slop, had grown 'leaf' cubes, and had branched off when his fingers bent and moved as his body siezed into its position. His legs, frozen in the ground, broke into fragments, digging into the slop also, locked in time as it were.

My character stood deadly still, very slightly swaying in fear at the monstrosity that lay before it.
Then, the Indian Punk-Rock Tree Man spoke.

"How are you, my little son" My character became alerted that I was the demon-spawn of this creature, and tensed up even more-so than before. Their face, my face, was locked with fear, but my character could not express their pain, as their mouth had not been created by this.. this demon of a tree..

The Punk-Tree told me my task in this world; to collect the tears of Etheopian children, and put them in a sack resembling a fat american's backside, contained in a pair of stictched up jean leggings, or 'Jeggings'.

This Punk-rock Indian Tree malformation then showed me how to do my task. He moved me towards one of the tears, me wailing and protesting behind the comfort of my monitor. I was in agony watching my character move to sieze one of the poor children's tears. 

Once he had forced me to collect these tears, he used his voodoo indian magic to teleport me further into his demon realms, and showed me a gothic hut he'd created for me. Inside, he showed me the Jegging bag in which I was to collect the Etheopian children's tears, and then he presented me with a contraption only a mind as evil as this Punk-Demon Tree could think of; A leaf for hitting things with.

My character could not express their emotion upon seeing this leaf, as the creator had not given me a mouth to utter pleas. Pleas for my character to not have to endure this task of heresy.

   10/10, would meme agen.
  My character was then forced to hit a voodoo-magic orb, upon which he was sent into the wide world to smack things with his leaf, and collect the frosty cold tears of the Etheopian Children.

author: {'steamid': '76561198130364748', 'num_games_owned': 687, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 48, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1593141583}
review:
[list] 
[*]Looks like someone made a game on Roblox and decided to make it $3
[*]Constant lag     
[*]Music constantly on loop     
[*]Stupid looking text font   
[*]Intro looks ugly     
[*]Unskippable text that lasts forever  
[*]Main character moves slower than a tank because of garbage controls [EDIT: There is a run button apperently but they never explain it and it only shows up if you pause the game.]   
[*]When you die you magically teleport to the beginning of the level with no penanalty, except that you have to walk ALL the way back to where you were before (note: there may be checkpoints later in the game but as far as I got there were none) [EDIT: There are apperently invisible checkpoint things in the game, but they still don't come for a while, at least in the first level]   
[*]Almost impossible to hit enemies with lame leaf attack 
[/list]

Verdict: 3/10 Better than Bubsy 3D (whatever that is worth)

review:

I especially like the log man creature and the voice.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068382391', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 49, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1457448899}
review: I don't usually write reviews( i have only one for the badge),  but this game is so bad i have to give it a NO.You can't change the camera angles.They will kill you.The respawn system is fucked up.There are checkpoints in the game, you don't have to start again from the beginning, but if you respawn on checkpoint 3, and you immediately die, you respawn on checkpoint 2.You die again, you are on checkpoint 1.There is a map where you start in a pool, and you have to climb upwards,If you miss a jump because of the retarded camera angles( which sometimes randomly changes to more retarded angle where you can't see anything), you are back at the start.I have no idea how this game have 65% positive reviews (maybe because people got it free and they voted yes?), but it is much worse than 65%.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081548244', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 8, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1457304582}
review: I literally only played 8 minutes of this game to write this review. This is a platforming game for 3 year olds. I don't know why I even bothered to install it, The screenshots tell it all. The story is painfully simple, so simple it's boring. The enemies don't even look like enemies some of them even look like ice cream cones! What the hell did I waste 8 minutes of my life for? Don't make the mistakes I did. never get this game. STAY AWAY.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087484181', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1458333009}
review:
And so it was that I traveled across the floating cube like mountains, Avoiding enimies as they slowly moved towards me, Jumping across great distances. All the while I looked down upon a young tree, As if waching myself, yet it was I who controlled this topiary figure as it waddled aimlesley, as we all do in life. However, my melancholy slow strut was about to meet an abrupt end. In an instant my view was thrust away from the young sappling and into an abyss of beryl, I was alone. No tree like figures, No water based life, Nothing. I was a single mind wallowing in my solice. Yet although sight had lead me away, my other scences prevailed. I felt the wind blow across my bark, I felt my stumps root into the grass below me. But yet my vision was set on an endless expanse of aqua. I began to loose measure of time swiftly, Yet I felt myself grow into the ground beneath me. My consciousness drifted as 100's if not thousands of years past. Until, I heard it. A screech that pierced my ears, yet somehow remained mono-tone, Then I felt it the tearing through my bark, shredding my insides. I tasted blood in my mouth, My own blood, and I smelt my own bark burning. In my final moments, I felt the force of my mass, crash to the ground, then I my corpse was dragged away, as I felt myself drift out of consciousness. The last thing I saw was the Blue Sky, Fade to Red.

Great game love being a fucking tree

author: {'steamid': '76561198181542795', 'num_games_owned': 202, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 31, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1613349995}
review:
Woodle tree adventure has (at this point) surpassed more then just my excpectations, right now it is safe to say "woodle tree adventure" is the best game I've ever played. This review will cover everything that you need to know about this amazing platformer puzzle action adventure rpg extraviganza of a game.

Gameplay
the gameplay is spectacular having a very well paced game, woodle runs like sonic yet jumps like rosalina's up-b in smash, this may seem like an odd combo but it works perfectly and I love it. The game controls fluently to the point where I thought I was the character in the game (its just that good) and the combat is just as great, with fast-paced action packed battles where you must use your leaf of the heavens to shatter your opponents while avoiding their attacks, all while watcing out for citizens, this is a mechanic I love as, the more citizens you hit the more woodle becomes devistated it truly makes you feel for the little tree

soundtrack
the soundtrack, which was created by David Wise and Nobuo Uematsu is a delight to the ears, the songs mostly consist of amazing piano works with some sax on the side. The music is heart warming, it can be light and then switch to a heazy blast in a matter of seconds, its truly spectacular. Plus the amazing guest artists such as earth wind and fire, ween and drake really brought some amazing pieces to the already amazing soundtrack.

difficulty
the game is very challenging however it is always making sure that it was your fault that you died never the games. Lag? theres none of that. Bad controls? nope. The game can be compared to the likes of darksouls however much harder. You are always rewarded for figureing those tuff parts of levels out and it makes you feel awesome. For example when you fight the first boss in the game, the minotaur, seems impossible until you realize you must climb the ladder of faith to reach his horns then perform a takedown. The games challenge is great.

Camera
for some odd reason this is complained about by many, and honestly I dont know why. The camera shows dinamic angles that make you feel good about yourself while not screwing with gameplay. Ill keep this paragraph short by saying the camera is great and y do ppl complain m8 XDDDDDDD!!!!!!111!!!11111!!!1

the other stuff
its all good, bro

final verdict
woodle tree adventure is spectacular and shows a great side to gaming. Where games like street fighter V and CS GO failed to perform this game excelled. Woodle tree adventure is something you should all pick up, try to get it at full price so the devlopers can get supported to make a second entry in the franchise. Woodle tree adventure proves that their is a light side to video games, that they are the future. Woodle tree adventure is more then a game

Its a legend

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198025292777', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 66, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1457203618}
review:
Woodle Tree Adventures feels like a prototype at best, and I've spent just as much time clearing the game 100% as I did doing the same for various Flash games on the internet.

First of all, the camera is mainly directed by the game itself, and the game is not a very good cameraman. You can only bring the camera closer and farther from your person in terms of manual control.

Second of all, the music sounds like something that plays in the background of an educational video from the early 90's. Solid material for some vaporwave remixes, if that's your thing.

Lastly, the game is disgustingly brief. To beat all the levels and collect all the upgrades took me roughly an hour, and that was me taking my time. Lord knows I can't make this thing go up to two hours of total playtime, so at least it is easy to refund if you want your spare change back.

Woodle Tree Adventures is cute, and a simple 3D Platformer on Steam, and that's about all it has going for it. Also the checkpoint system doesn't make any sense.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993206359', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 52, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1457176094}
review: Picked this up to play with my 3 year old son because it looked cute and simple enough for him to play by himself.  After about an hour of fighting with the camera, which moves to different angles at predefined positions that are easy to miss (causing you to end up looking at a scene the wrong way), and enemies that kill you in one hit as they appear suddenly from off-screen, we were both frusterated.  It's a shame, because the potential for this to be a cute kid's game is clearly there, but making a game for kids is no excuse for making grabage.  Indeed, I want video games to be something my son and I can enjoy together, and buggy, unpolished games like this are what could poison him to the idea.

author: {'steamid': '76561198204271975', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 210, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1507445086}
review:
I'm re-writing my review on this game because I realized I didn't really put out my full view on it.

THIS GAME NEEDS MOUSELOOK. It absolutely needs it, there's no reason why it needs a fixed camera.
Also, making the esc button ask you whether or not you'd like to quit would be nice, especially since I'm used to pressing esc to pause games. Really feels great to lose half a level's progress.

I'm not entirely crapping on the game - it's a good game. The character and the art style are absolutely adorable. But I don't think that it's worth the price (given it's not on sale). I happened to purchase this game when it was on sale for 59 cents, so I suggest you do the same.

There is room for improvement. I hope the dev(s) come back and touch this game up, maybe add a few more levels to it. If that's done, then maybe it'll get better reviews.

So all in all.. do I recommend it? Yeah, definitely. But be aware of what you're spending on it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198092362916', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 164, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 153, 'last_played': 1514142346}
review:
Here is my full out review of Woodle Tree Adventures:

First off, what do you do in the game? You play as a little cute tree stump that walks around and picks up cherries and water drops. Not very hard to do, so the game keeps a casual style.

As for the actual visual appearance of the game, it is very fascinating. The graphics are cartoony, but still maintain a very beautiful and eye catching style! You can't find worlds that look like this in other games. The worlds themselves are very detailed, and unique from each other. They may be short, but you still have a lot to do.

In terms of unlockables, you can upgrade your leaf to have more range and power, as well as unlock a cool little headband that doesn't do anything but just generally looks cool on your head. Pretty fun extra feature!

The music is probably one of the best parts of the game. Its very beautiful, and suits the environments very well. It sticks in your head for a while and also has the tendency to really relax you and make you feel very good while you play the game.

And about the camera, it isn't really that big of a deal. The game is still very playable, and the camera is not a huge annoyance factor. I have no idea why people are complaining so much about it, I mean it could have been better but the game is still playable.

So overall, do I recommend the game? Definitely. Its such a good price for such a great game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198118850003', 'num_games_owned': 150, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 19, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1456965208}
review:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nwEFKJd9-5c

This game attempts to capture the Nintendo 64 platforming style. To its credit, it does so... perhaps a bit too well.

The graphics are cute, the soundtrack is hit and miss for me. The controls are simple, and the gameplay feels like an old-school 3D platformer.

The most damning feature is one that it lacks: camera controls. You can zoom in and out, but without rotating camera controls, this game will feel like it's fucking you with a cactus while using ghost pepper sauce as lube.

Another miss with this game is the lack of a life system. It felt like I was playing [i]I Wanna Be The Babby[/i] more than a platforming game. On that same front, the respawn points were without precedent. You die from an enemy: back to the beginning of the stage. You fall off the map, you go back near where you fell. It was all over the place.

Despite all that, I still found [i]Woodle Tree Adventures[/i] a little fun. For $0.59 on sale, it's worth a cheap thrill. At full price, I wouldn't touch it with the Deku Tree's stick.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077342779', 'num_games_owned': 866, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 183, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 183, 'last_played': 1456952905}
review:
Un juego muy adorable.

Estamos ante un juego muy lindo y sencillo, ideal para los m√°s chicos; de ese tipo de juegos que le muestras a tus hijos, sobrinos, nietos, etc. 

Nuestro h√©roe es un peque√±o tronquito de √°rbol cuyo objetivo principal es recolectar una serie de "gotas de agua" esparcidas por diversos mapas, para posteriormente llegar con ellas hasta una meta (unos vasos); pero ten cuidado, que no es tan f√°cil como parece, los caminos son enredados y peligrosos, adem√°s habr√° enemigos esperando por ti, a los cuales enfrentar√°s tu poderosa arma: una hoja de √°rbol.

Por el camino tambi√©n encontrar√°s una serie de frutas que sirven como "puntos" o "monedas" para desbloquear escenarios extras y "armas"; que te servir√°n para ayudarte en el camino.

Pros:
- Graficos muy lindos.
- Jugabilidad sencilla.
- Muy intuitivo.
- Banda sonora y efectos muy agradables.
- Buena optimizaci√≥n.
- Multijugador (2 Jugadores).

Contras:
- La c√°mara es un poco molesta, y cuesta mucho adaptarse a usarla bien.
- Los checkpoint son un poco "escasos" y "aleatorios" (No siempre te dejan en el mismo punto)
- Un poco mon√≥tono, aunque esto casi siempre pasa con los plataformeros.
- Muy corto... en lo personal me hubiese gustado ver unas 3 o 4 etapas m√°s.

Conclusi√≥n:
Recomiendo el juego, ya que es divertido, en especial para jugar con tus hijos peque√±os (o sobrinos, primos, etc) de a 2 jugadores.

Nota:
7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198048422402', 'num_games_owned': 549, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 164, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 164, 'last_played': 1454384411}
review:
Uhhhh sure, why not?
+ It's cute and good enough to keep the kids out of your hair for a minute if you have them (and hair).
+ Reminded me I should work on how careless I am in games with slippery ice levels.
-/+ No replayability as an adult but who cares 'cause I bought it on sale for like 19 cents or something, so I could still afford coffee downtown afterward.
- Camera angles can be a little weird.

Took me 2.7 hours to 100% the 8 achievements, so it is good for folks looking for quick and easy "Perfect Games".
Although I think you might need a second controller to get co-op achievement.
Don't quote me on that though... Or do, if you know that to actually be the case.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020845913', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 460, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 459, 'last_played': 1533449762}
review:
I got this game for free, and I gotta say I'm not /totally/ disappointed.
The games not good. Really, who'dve guessed, but it's not really why you'd think.
You look at the game and it looks like some animation studen't fist product
It's got cutsey, simple graphics, it's a grab the key to open the door type platformer but that's not why it's not good.
It's not good because it doesn't feel rewarding
I see no reason to grab these enormous berries(?) other than to fill my sack.
The level design was alright but the enemies felt apathetic, like they wanted to attack but couldn't
Also the lack of UI for the berries(?) to show your progress on a level by level basis should have been added.

So yeah, no. Money could be better spent elsewhere.

review:
this breathtaking experience is really opening my eyes to the cruelty, yet gentleness of human nature. It shows you how large the world is but how small you are in comparison. but thats alright. it also teaches you that being just a minor being is alright, that you do your part to evolve the universe to the next step, despite how minor it may be. it teaches that every life has purpose and that while life can be challenging sometimes, youre helping everybody by staying alive. 

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198178892379', 'num_games_owned': 306, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 358, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 358, 'last_played': 1455729965}
review:
It is short but IT IS CUTE!

The controls for mouse and keyboard are a little clunky but for a cheap game (Got it at -90% Off) I did not expect much. The view auto rotates into weird positions but you can zoom in or out by moving the mouse forward and backward. (Discovered this a little late)


Breakdown of my 6hrs of play.
1.5hrs - Finishing the game
1.5hrs - Grinding the 3000 berries steam achievement.
3.0hrs - Idling to get the 3 Steam Trading Cards.

The game could have improved if users/players can create different levels and challenges if it has the steam workshop. Imagine all the possibilities.

author: {'steamid': '76561198138112327', 'num_games_owned': 617, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1476376515}
review:
[h1]Perfect for what it's supposed to be[/h1]
Woodle Tree Adventures isn't trying to be the next Super Meat Boy, or Thomas Is Alone, all it is is a simple story about a little tree stump-like creature, who is created by a world tree-type being to effectively water the world with magical fairy tears. It's a fairly aesthetically pleasing game, with nice graphics and simplistic world design, but the large worlds that facilitate a fair bit of exploration are enjoyable to play through. The gameplay primarily consists of exploring and jumping puzzles, with enemies not really doing much, but making the world seem more lively. It is extremely hard to be "killed" unless you run off the world. Coming from someone who plays the likes of Skyrim and Assassin's Creed, Woodle Tree Adventures isn't something I'd play constantly and invest hours into, but it's good for a few hours of time killing or relaxation, and it would be perfect for young children as a simple but engaging game. It is worth what you pay for it (2.99 at time of writing) if you want something simple to relax with or for a younger child to play with, but don't expect a massive game. [b]DISCLAIMER: I received a copy of this game as part of a free promotion.[/b]

review:
Dieses Game ist echt schlecht.
Es ist seinen vollen Preis √ºberhaupt nicht Wert und auch nicht mehr als 1 Euro, wer sich das Spiel trotzdem kauft sollte einen Controller besitzen da ich mir eine Steuerung per Tastatur echt schwer vorstellen k√∂nnte, da schin allein mit Controller echt schwer zu steueren ist.
Man kann seine Blickwinkel nicht √§ndern sondern nur herauszoomen und reinzoomen.
Mit dem Game ist man in weniger als einer Stunde durch, da es leider nur sehr wenige aber auch oft an den unn√∂tigsten Stellen Checkpoints gibt.
Das Hauptziel ist einfach nur alle 3 Wassertropfen pro Level zu sammeln, d.h hei√üt auch dass wenn man stirbt von anfang an starten muss doch immernoch seine Tropfen und seine Beeren oder was des sind hat.
Es lohnt sich wirklich nur sich dieses Spiel nur wegen den Steamkarten zukaufen.
[b]2/10[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198088775500', 'num_games_owned': 3186, 'num_reviews': 281, 'playtime_forever': 158, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 158, 'last_played': 1527232102}
review:
‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚úØ‚òÜ
I quite enjoyed this game , it was a fun little experience while it lasted and I would recommend it to you my fellow review reader :P
 3.5/5! 

Pro's
-Every level has a different design style
-It has unlockables 
-It is the only 3rd person collectaphon game I've seen on steam 
-It's cheap
-It has cards

Con's
-It's a bit to short, I'm left wanting more
-The camera is a bit annoying, it never really follows you how you'd expect it to
-The hit detection on picking up items is a bit to precise for a collectaphon

Overall it was a nice game though, if you have the money use it to support this developer :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198062008737', 'num_games_owned': 160, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 184, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 152, 'last_played': 1648962325}
review:
So i have finally finnished this game and i feel like it has potential unfortunatly it would seem that the dev team may have abandoned it and even announced a sequel, i really feel that my original post was a little bit harsh after playing the full game so i have given it a quick edit here and there and updated it and posted it below:

After first playing this game i felt like there graphics were quite nice but frankly if games were mental issues, this would be complete reality disassosciation paranoid skitzophrenic psychosis, honestly this game might be fun if you has serious brain injury or something that restricted you from thinking properly. but after playing it through i can honestly say thats more or less just the first level from what i can tell this game is about collecting "fairy tears" but you never see any trace of the fairys or why they are crying. your bag that you use to carry items (berries) grows as you pick up items (you also make a munching sound as you put them in your bag?) and can be quite annoying by the end of the level because more often than not the bag will be bigger than you and obstruct your view, the tears just hover behind you so you know how many you have (3 per level) and your main weapon is a leaf... seriously a friggen leaf... i mean you are a log for crying out loud wouldnt you at least use a stick or something. the game encourages you to collect more fruit to unlock better leaves to kill the enemies(?) with, which pretty much just increase the range with each new leaf. The game doesnt actually let you know whats an enemy or not you can only tell by hitting it with a leaf (thankfully this was only an issue in the first level) and watching to see if it dies as for the creatures they actually look quite messed up like whoever designed them did so after a cactus eating wander through the desert, thankfully however the game calms down after the very first level. If like me you managed to push past the first level this game can be rather fun, however it feels like a very early 3D game in the sense that the enemies dont actually attack you just die if they touch you, the puzzles are figuring out how to navigate the map and the maps are rather small. After playing the game to the very end i was left with 2 achievements to still unlock (Collect 1000/3000 Berries) and started grinding the hidden level at the end of the game to achieve these and quickly grew bored at 2000 berries.(though i will eventually complete the last one). This game CAN and WILL be fun if you approach it with a juvenile mind and without Bias from the ammount of hate people sling at it, just remember that enemies are more often than not going to stand still and watch you pass them and are more of an obstacle than anything else.

I guess it would be alright for a young child to play and the price is rather cheap ($3) but the gameplay is weak, the camera angles are dreadful and there is only 6 levels and 1 bonus level. As for unlocks there are 3 leaves that increase range as you unlock them and 1 Red Bandanna, however the bandanna does nothing (as confirmed by the dev) and just adds to the look of your Woodle.

All in all i can say the 2 hours i spent playing this game were not infact wasted as i thought they might be after playing the first level, its more of a nothing else to do game or something to play when you have very little time on your hands, i doubt i will keep playing it after i finnish the 3000 berry achievement. I give this game a very Generous 5/10 as it has the right idea's but the wrong execution, i would love to see this game expanded with boss levels and bigger maps however it looks like this will never happen. I for one wont say not to buy this game if you want to give it a whirl but there are 1000's of keys floating around just waiting to be collected and loved by someone.

(P.S. from the Author, i have reviewed this game ignoring the level of hate that it seems to gain and without a Bias, i feel that this game is infact worth completeing and not just writing off after the first level as the first level is by far the worst and the challenges become more challenging, for example there is a snow level where you slide around while climbing up obstacles and a beach level which you are climbing up a tower.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198250297878', 'num_games_owned': 521, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 302, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1608066233}
review:
This is the most metal game ever. 

And let me tell you why. You play as Woodle, a small log, created as the last hope for a society of trees that are running out of water.

As Woodle, you must collect the tears of angels from around the world, and bring them back to the trees to insure their survival.

review:
[h1]Question your life for only $2.99![/h1] 

..But with all seriousness, improvments that can be made:

[list]
[*][h1]Please free the camera,[/h1] game does NOT have a playable camera angle at multiple occasions, so just let the users decide camera angles.
[*]Specific tutorial on what the hell is going on might help out the players.
[*]Clear visual saving points.
[/list]

I can guarantee that with these three points fixed, it'll convince lot more of players to play this game for more than 10 minutes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057152317', 'num_games_owned': 322, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 290, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 157, 'last_played': 1590539946}
review:
This is a really nice looking game and really fun to play. The game has 7 nice, challenching, good looking stages where you have to go through. The goal is simple get the objectives and go to the end, the objectives (waterdrops) are nicely hidden. The game has some unlockables too, to unlock them you need to get peaches. The enemies in the game are nicely created and look really nice.

Positives:
- graphics
- gameplay
- story
- enemies
- playable for all ages
- nice unlockables

Negatives:
- bad camera positioning
- low amount of levels
- not a good pause screen (no options)
- once you played a level it gets less fun, but still fun

If i have to give the game a digit, i give this game an 7,5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198063968950', 'num_games_owned': 276, 'num_reviews': 116, 'playtime_forever': 92, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1453828368}
review:

btw in woodles house if you repeatedly hit jump while on the stairs you will start jumping upside down on your head and I still can't tell if this was intentional. http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=630776387


Seriosly if you have a friend get this, if you are forever alone however do not buy this game unless it is for your children. (Also make sure to tell your friend to wait under the elevator trust me it works.. http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=630779729

author: {'steamid': '76561198105556637', 'num_games_owned': 263, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 21, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1486671687}

author: {'steamid': '76561198037520114', 'num_games_owned': 605, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 153, 'last_played': 1527471839}
review:
First, is it worth it? Yes.

This is more of a new developer showcasing his abilities. For a quick fun platformer, this really isn't too bad.

Problems:
-Camera angles... This is probably the worst part of the game. The game allows full 360 movement with controller, it should support full 360 camera movement as well. If you let the game sit without playing, the camera will zoom out and sometimes bug out really badly.
-WASD movement won't cut it for the most part.

This game has issues for sure, but I have played through it easily enough. It is a good game for what it is.

author: {'steamid': '76561198198577669', 'num_games_owned': 630, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 89, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1453353323}
review:
This game is impressive in that it appears to have been made by a team of 1 or 2 people. Its a 3D platformer with a very simple premise; find the three water droplets and get to the end of the level. It is cute and has potential but I can't recommend the game as it has too much detracting form it.

Pros
+ Cute
+ Simple game play
+ Impressive for a small team
+ Levels have variation between them in feel and aesthetics

Cons
- ****** Camera is problematic ******* (lack of control, automatic angles change quickly without notice, don't let you see where you are trying to go, don't reset on death)
- Differentiation between friend and foe is only if it kills you / it dies.
- Can't tell which level is which (especially order) from over world.
- Hit boxes aren't great for default melee attack.
- Spawn points don't make sense.
- Very difficult on a keyboard, really needs a controller. (Is mentioned on title screen)
- Exit game should not be mapped to a single controller button press.

If the maker of this game actually reads this review please don't be disheartened. I really wanted to like this game and it has potential (maybe in your sequel).

author: {'steamid': '76561198066625492', 'num_games_owned': 586, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 520, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 371, 'last_played': 1704305368}
review:
I write this review after 100% the game and all its achivements.

Woodle Tree Adventures is a funny, cute game where you run around as a tree collecting items. It comes we a few different maps, created with a colorful palette, giving it a cute style which I think alot of young minds would appreciate.
I found this game entertaining and challenging at times.

To all parent out there: 
This game is a perfect starter game for your child, if they want to get an introduction into PC-gaming.
They come with easy controls (WASD, space to jump), not too difficult maps, no scary foes.

So i'd recommend this game to kids mostly.
8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198100889167', 'num_games_owned': 512, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 146, 'last_played': 1452621630}
review:
Hier ist mein Review zu dem, doch recht s√º√ü-aussehendem Spiel "Woodle Tree Adventures"

Die Steuerung
Durch die Kamera schrecklich! Um das kurz zu erkl√§ren: Um reinzuzoomen schiebst du die Maus nach vorne und um rauszuzoomen ziehst du die Maus nach hinten. WARUM?

Die Performance
L√§uft Fl√ºssig auf den h√∂chsten Grafikeinstellungen mit 60FPS (Geforce GTX 760)

Die Story
Du bist ein Baumstupf der von einem alten Baum den Auftrag bekommt Wasser zu sammeln. Das wars.

Das Gameplay
Wieder versaut durch die Kamera. Man greift √ºbrigenz mit Bl√§ttern, und sp√§ter einer Feder an (Das funktioniert aber nicht wirklich gut, da du die Gegner so gut wie nicht triffst). Dazu kommt noch: Das brauchst du auch gar nicht, weil die Gener das kleinste Problem sind. Man f√§llt st√§ndig runter. WEGEN DER KAMERA.
Die Checkpoints sind der Grauen. Du Spawnst, l√§ufst 10 Meter, Checkpoint. Dann l√§ufst du gef√ºhlte 10km und ERST DANN kommt wieder einer und wenn du dann ein paarmal stirbst bist du wieder beim vorherigen Checkpoint. WARUM?

Die Musik
Ganz nett gemacht, und sie variiert. Passt auch zu dem jeweilligen Level. Die Musik ist die gr√∂√üte St√§rke im Spiel

Die Grafik
Das Spiel ist am 6. Juni 2014 rausgekommen und wurde mit Unity erstellt. Eigentlich bin ich kein Freund von Unity, allerdings sieht man das dem Spiel gar nicht an. Die Grafik ist gut und passt zum Spiel.

Anmerkungen
- eZ 100%
- zu wenig level
- zu wenig abwechslung
- sch√∂ne Profilhintergr√ºnde (guckt in mein Inventar)

Fazit
Die Kamera und das Gameplay ziehen das Spiel ziemlich runter, was sie eigentlich nicht sollten. Das Spiel an sich erfindet das Rad auch nicht neu, es hat aber seinen eigenen Style. Mich Pers√∂nlich √§rgert aber auch das es nur ca. 8 Level gibt.

Bewertung
Genrebewertung: 5/10
Gesamtbewertung: 4/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198116598937', 'num_games_owned': 348, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 308, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 308, 'last_played': 1452857663}
review:
N√£o foi f√°cil, eu admito. Momentos de √≥dio e paran√≥ia (como pensar que existia um gato escondido de baixo da plataforma que n√£o fora nunca antes apresentado no jogo e ma√ß√£s flutuantes al√©m do limite permitido de navega√ß√£o) foram constantes em meio a minha jornada, tudo isso para que eu desistisse de chegar ao topo; mas meu cora√ß√£o sabia a verdade. No fundo do meu ser, algo me dizia que eu estava fazendo o certo em seguir em frente. 

Do meu ponto de vista, ao contr√°rio do que muitos dizem, WTA n√£o √© um jogo focado na realidade cruel do mundo em que se ensina da pior maneira o caminho da vida do crime. WTA √© uma fonte de aprendizagem emocional, onde voc√™ consegue se encontrar com sua paz interior e se tornar uma pessoa melhor consigo mesma (at√© mesmo escrevendo essa review eu estou passando por um momento de harmonia). WTA me ensinou o que √© ter perseveran√ßa diante a tantos motivos para se desistir, me ensinou o que √© ter compaix√£o com inimigos que n√£o querem nada mais al√©m do que sorrir para voc√™, ME ENSINOU a canalizar todos os meus sentimentos de √≥dio e fracasso em uma folha, e de que a f√≠sica √© o menor problema que voc√™ pode ter. O jogo ainda lhe permite customizar o seu personagem com uma linda bandana vermelha que aumenta seu status de velocidade. Ela pode ser adquirida na loja do jogo, que por tamanha praticidade oferecida, √© o seu pr√≥rio quintal. 

Muitos n√£o chegam a receber tamanha ben√ß√£o, isso pelo simples fato do jogo oferecer ao seu consumidor a chance de contribuir com o capitalismo financeiro corrente de nossa provedora. Mas eu espero que assim como eu, muitos poderam e poder√£o aproveitar o jogo com uma vis√£o positiva!

author: {'steamid': '76561197996919908', 'num_games_owned': 1532, 'num_reviews': 875, 'playtime_forever': 135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 135, 'last_played': 1452381320}
review:
[h1] Ein Spiel mit verschenkten Potential [/h1]

Ich habe das Spiel durch ein Giveaway bekommen, also kann ich mich eig. net beschweren. Aber ich tus trotzdem mal.

Das Spiel bietet an sich eine total s√º√üe Atmossph√§re und ein liebevolles Design.
Aber das gro√üe Problem ist die Kamera. Zum Einen ist die Kamera teilweise manuel. Das hei√üt, man muss st√§ndig rein- und rauszommen, da man sonst die L√ºcken nicht erkennt. Dann wiederum gibt es dann doch pl√∂tzlich einen neuen Blickwinkel, der dann teilweise auch richtig schlimm wird. Dabei hatte ich auch mehrmals einen Bug, dass ich quasi durch die Textur geblickt habe und garnicht erkennen konnte, wo ich gerade stehe. Das letzte gro√üe Manko der Kamera ist, dass man die Kamera nicht nach links oder rechts drehen kann. Ich meine: Warum zum Teufel rein und rauszoomen aber nicht zur Seite? 

Ein anderer negativer Aspekt ist das fehlende Tutorial. Es gibt so ne Art Fahrst√ºhle( die einen nach oben tragen), aber irgendwie haben die bei mir nur manchmal funktioniert und ich bin oft einfach runtergefallen. Ich wei√ü nicht, ob es sich hier um nen Bug handelt oder einfach die Erkl√§rung dazu fehlt. Das hat mich dann auf jeden Fall endg√ºltig zum Aufh√∂ren bewegt.


[b]Fazit[/b]
Woodle Tree Adventures h√§tte ein echt s√º√ües und gutes Spiel werden k√∂nnen, aber die Kameraf√ºhrung, die fehlende Einleitung und die Bugs zerst√∂ren diese Illusion. Man muss nat√ºrlich auch sagen, dass das Spiel von einem Mann programmiert wurde, der ja auch noch ein anderes GUTES Spiel programmiert hat. Und f√ºr 3 ‚Ç¨ kann man auch nicht die Welt erwarten. Ich kann das Spiel aber nicht empfehlen. Wenn ihr es ausprobieren wollt, k√∂nnt ihr euch ja gerne die kostenlose Demo runterladen :-)



Hat dir das Review weitergeholfen? Dann folge mir doch in [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/Drakeschool] meiner Steamgruppe[/url], wo ich meine Reviews als Kurator verfasse.

author: {'steamid': '76561198142939843', 'num_games_owned': 46, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1489434861}
review: It's an evil, cruel world out there, and "Woodle Tree Adventures" opened my eyes to the reality of it all. You are born into a life of crime. From the day you are born, you are running around collecting debts owed to the family, being fruit, of course. If they can't pay up, then their tears will suffice. Sometimes you have to use force, because sometimes they fight back. Your only weapon is a leaf, but I swear I have yet to see a leaf capable of so much pain and destruction in all my years as this one, and I've seen a lot of leaves, my house has windows. All it takes is one fell swoop and any retaliator or rebel is vanquished. Sometimes innocent lives are lost as well, caught in the crossfire, however some live to complain and tell the tale and must be taken care of later. Their deaths are most tragic and graphic; they fall backwards as a sign of submission, then right after they give a little "squee" they burst into white flakes, completely vanishing from existance. Families will forever be torn apart, populations drastically affected by the murders, but you remain unphased. This is what you were meant to do, and you do it with a smile. I value the time I've spent playing "Woodle Tree Adventures", as it has shown me a side of this world that I would have never seen outside of my bubble. It not only immerses us in the hard life of crime, but has an underlying message of love for one's family and how far people or small tree creatures will go to do what is best for the family.

review:
Das Spiel ist bunt und einfach gehalten. 
Der kleine Held l√§uft und springt durch die level und sammelt dabei Erdbeeren und Feentr√§nen auf. 
Auch mit Tastatur ging das spielen recht gut, es wird allerdings ein Controller empfohlen. Dank der bl√∂den Kamera ist das springen oft ungenau und man landet im Abgrund und muss wieder anfangen. Bei den gr√∂√üeren Karten zum Gl√ºck nicht ganz am Anfang.^^ Ansonsten gibt es keine negativen Auswirkungen, wenn der Woodle mal wieder im Abgrund landet.
Mit den Pfeiltasten kann man auch die Richtung steuern. Mit Mausbewegung rauf und runter kann man rein und raus zoomen. Das zoomen hilft auch etwas, wenn die Kamera mal wieder ung√ºnstig steht.

Jedenfalls hat mir das Spiel Laune gemacht und mit einem Kind an der Seite, welches das Herunterfallen mit einer Ger√§uschkulisse untermalt, ist dieses Spiel doppelt gut. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198086005237', 'num_games_owned': 383, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1452174338}
review:
Woodle Tree adventures is pretty unique.
You play as a tree stump with your weapons being leaves. Your enemies are ice creams and other zany ideas.
The level design is quite good, fitting the "peacefull" motive the entire game is based on. The soundtrack is also peacefull, as if I was listening to one of those compilations on Youtube. The game itself is not even that difficult, yet still fun, making it good if you have a child or younger relative that plays video games.

Anyway I would reccomend it if you would want to have such a game, especially if it's on sale.

review: This game is literally $2.99 when it's off sale. In other games, you don't have a purpose in life, but in this one, you do. You collect berries for your father tree so you can make him happy again. This is game is easily a masterpeace and took 2 seconds to download. 10/10 would recommend to all of my family and friends. It is better than almost any of the games in my library, and that is saying something. I hope this comment persuades you to buy this game because it is one of the best.

The mixture pour a trickle of milk, stir and cook, stirring constantly. Divide the dough into the desired number of pieces that will later Korzh. Roll out each piece on a board sprinkled with flour. Bake in the oven for about 10 minutes until golden color on a dry baking temperature of 200 degrees. Fluff the cooled cream cakes. If desired, each layer sprinkled with chopped nuts. author: {'steamid': '76561198107654171', 'num_games_owned': 766, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 233, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 134, 'last_played': 1488999781}
review:
WIP

[h1]This copy was a review copy given my the developer[/h1]
[b]This does not affect my judgement[/b]


I spent some time with the game and after about 2 hours of play I have worked down to a list of good things and bad things. I was not able to even complete the first level due to some bugs.

[h1] The Good. [/h1]

Cute fun character design.

[h1] The Bad [/h1]

Gamebreaking Bugs - That include:
No keys responding
The camera not changing back to default after you die.


Those two issues alone make the game almost unplayable, if you die with a bad camera you cant really continue that run because you have to restart the game so you have a camera angle that allows you to see where you want to go.
No keys responding is also an issue because there are a few jumping puzzles that are time limited in such a way, that if the game just decides not to respond, it still counts towards any other programs, but the game just decides not to allow you to not move.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077728810', 'num_games_owned': 1990, 'num_reviews': 175, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1451873258}
review:
Good looking game, I only played it for 12 minutes. Why?

The controls are unintuitive, and the camera! WTH. So, you can switch perspective fluidly in a 2D plane  - in/out and it changes your perspective in gaem as it does so. This is a game where you can move in 3D space, A 3D camera is imperative.

Also,  The camera perspective keeps switching, without you asking, as you attempt to play.

Maybe, maybe this is a good game, and it seems to be a game about the journey.... and I'm spoiled for games with great controls. I can't be bothered with a game that isn't intuitive to play.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198040845636', 'num_games_owned': 816, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 322, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 322, 'last_played': 1452119048}
review:
A short and enjoyable game. Its main problem was that it felt unfinished.
Sometimes enemies ran through obstacles and sometimes I went through elevator walls.

And as always with  these kind of games, the platforming is your worst enemy. It's sometimes really hard to see where you should jump to grab a berry and after a while your backpack is bigger than you making it harder to land jumps properly since you can't see yourself. 

And I have no idea how the checkpoints work. There were times when I respawned very close to where I fell and from time to time I'd just go back to the beginning even after that earlier "checkpoint".

But if you do get your hands on this, i'd recommend giving it a try. I'd also love to see a longer and a more polished version on something like a 3DS.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976116287', 'num_games_owned': 3117, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 285, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 102, 'last_played': 1465092451}
review:
Woodle Tree Adventures is a fun little platformer with cute graphics and easy-to-learn gameplay mechanics. It is very simple to pick up and learn, and even a child can do it. You can even upgrade your weapon by "farming" the pickups, so you can farm the easiest ones to get to if you are having trouble and want to get an upgrade.

It's a big plus that you are given unlimited "lives" and even if you die or fall off, you don't lose any progress in the level (except going back a bit geographically). All enemies vanquished stay gone, you keep any pickups and fairy tears you got on that level, and you are not penalized other than a bit of forward progress. That's a great thing that ensures the game can challenge you without becoming frustrating or problematic.

So far, I've only played (and beaten) the first level, and it's been very fun. I'd compare it to a simpler Super Mario 64 with smoother graphics. The camera can be a bit awkward and you cannot rotate it (the game handles that automatically) but you can zoom in and out as you desire. If you like 3D platformers with simple controls and easy-to-understand mechanics, you'll probably like this game.

It even comes with Steam trading cards, so if you pick it up cheap on sale you can recoup part or most of your investment and basically play it for free.

Overall, this is a very fun game and even at full price is a very fair deal.

10/10 would pimpslap a walking block with a yellow leaf again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017843065', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 142, 'playtime_forever': 209, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 209, 'last_played': 1451804669}
review:
Buggy, short, platformer.

The negative reviews are not being ungenerous. The camera angle on this game is hideous. There is also a mean bug that on certain deaths can flip the view, making it unplayable and forcing restart.

The game is mercifully short for those, like myself, determined to complete every game in their library. Six worlds/levels plus a 'bonus' one. I got my copy free and it is given away often. I still would not wish it on a friend, even for giggles.
The graphics could be described as cute. The levels themselves are not terribly designed. But the forced angle, with only a zoom option, limits and frustrates.

Would not recommend. Shame really, as it would have been ideal for crayon eaters.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982449347', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 205, 'last_played': 1453235329}

You have to jump around and sometimes its not obvious exactly where you have to go, but if you look around a little bit you'll find it. I enjoy it, I almost have it beat in a few hours, something fun.

review:
As I collected tears in my pursuit of what I assumed would be a happy ending, I discovered that you could change the camera distance.

While I was doing so, the camera started slowly panning away from the player without my input. It continued doing so, dispite my greatest efforts to regain focus on the player. After a while, the player was no longer visible and the level geometry faded away as well.

I guess you don't always get a hollywood ending.

10/10 cinematic masterpiece I would easily spend 0.59‚Ç¨ on again

review:
Posso iniziare dicendo che se √® in sconto, questo gioco si pu√≤ comprare, se no, NO. Iniziamo dalla grafica, che forse √® l'unica cosa che si salva, √® la solita grafica cartunesca che non annoia quasi mai, e ci d√† quel divertimento, che dura poco, smorzato dalla musica che all'inizio dai √® carina, poi inizia ad essere ripetitiva e abbastanza noiosa. Infine possiamo parlare del gameplay: il gioco dura un 50 minuti se non un ora, se si vuole finire e basta, se si vuole fare altri obbiettivi bisogna starci un altro p√≤. L'idea di fondo del gioco √® abbastanza carina, che diventa subito noisa, dall'assenza di una storia di fondo, che √® prorpio inesistente, ma ci viene presentato il gioco cos√¨, senza un accenno senza nulla.. forse con una storia di fondo sarebbe stato anche un p√≤ pi√π divertente..bha.
In conclusione: se il gioco √® in sconto prendetelo, vi fa passare quell'oretta cos√¨.

I just can't


this keeps claiming to be relaxing but get hit once boom back to start of the level that wouldn't be so bad if the game didn't move AT A SNAILS PACE im not sure if it was just me but this game was so slow i couldn't even think not to mention unskippable scenes of your birth and endless suffering as you collect the tears of previous players, on that point, THIS WORLD HAS PLENTY OF WATER why am i collecting tears, most of your time you will be wandering aimlessly trying to collect tears will picking up giant peaches that do nothing (if i'm not mistaken) well the lack of meaning and purpose of this character is astounding, because the first lines of the game explain our reason... BUT WHY i feel no draw to collect the tears because i just don't caaare the world is 1 dimensional and i can't even try to immerse myself in it i know "sire you only have 0.2 hours i this game you are in no position to judge!" you might be thinking... you're probably right BUT if you hate yourself and want to die a slow painful death lock yourself in a room no food or water turn off the lights but on Beats by Dr.Dre FULL VOLUME tie yourself down and play this game, if you're into that kinda stuff at least ( Õ°¬∞ Õú ñ Õ°¬∞) and lastly i think its pretty weird tha the enemies i've seen so far consist of smiling caterpillars and weird cat monster giraffe things that look liek they have no intention of harming you, not gonna lie though the graphics are pretty nice but other than that the music just drones onnn and onnnn and onnnn its not enjoyable at all unless you are a BadRats lover (not sarcastically) so yeah 

TL:DR

Trashy trash trash with good graphics boring music boring characters boring world boring existance boring everything teally and the game moves AMAZINGLY slow (not sure if thats just me or not but it was for me)

P.S I am aware there is no punctuation i just don't care enough about this game to even try

author: {'steamid': '76561198152525954', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 92, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1451293642}
review:
This is a very short and simple game that is good for passing the time. Although the story of the game itself is lackluster and the game has many flaws, it has potential. But as aforementioned, it only took me an hour and a half to "beat the game" as stated by the simple achievment, so don't expect too much replay value. The game has a more childish luster to it, so if you prefer blood and gore this definitely is not the game for you. The music of the game is soothing, so that's a plus. All in all, with its low price I would be willing to sell some Steam trading cards to pay for it if I had nothing else to play, but that's about all that I'm willing to muster for it. If the game had more added to it though, I wouldn't mind returning to it.

Pros:

Good music.
The levels are pleasing to the eye.
Simple, yet interesting.
Kid friendly.

Cons:

Low replay value.
Respawn system is annoying (for the majority of the levels if you 'die' you start at the very beginning).
Hitboxes for some enemies do not feel appropriate. The same goes for Woodle.
The game starts and ends abruptly: I.E. the story needs some work.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996351187', 'num_games_owned': 1474, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 686, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 126, 'last_played': 1590179212}
review:
Woodle Tree Adventures follows a young tree stump and it's unlikely friend the Beaver in a quest for all the juicy berries they can get their mits on!

The game takes place within separate worlds which are accessed by world spheres, inside Woodles house within the world hub (which is Woodles house and garden, which floats because reasons!)

The levels are varied and interesting, and there are plenty of different enemies to fight, although you have to be careful as you might hit a friendly little dude whilst you are at it. (I am still not sure if you are supposed to kill the caterpillars?)

All in all there is a lot of fun to be had and at such a low price I urge you check it out!

I will note the issues I do have that can hopefully be looked at by the Dev team
- camera angle is fixed and only zooms in or out, it would be nice if it zoomed out less and could be rotated
- the Beaver has to stick to Woodle like glue or doesn't stay on screen, either a split screen mode or an automatic camera zoom would mean you can both move around more freely
- The Beaver can't pick up or activate certain things Woodle can, such as the little blue and red mushrooms, if both players could do this it would be ideal.
-Some enemies just dance on the spot, don't attack you and only do damage if you walk into them, if they did something the game would be more exciting
Characters could have hearts and on depletion the level ends or you respawn at the start.

author: {'steamid': '76561198218094865', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 147, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 147, 'last_played': 1445964384}
review:
This might be an OK game for children.  It does have a very cute presentation, and the whole game is very family friendly.  Many of the enemies don't even really seem interested in attacking you.  Think of it as a cuter, cheaper Mario 64 Lite.

That being said, if you are an adult I would not waste your time on this one.  The camera is awful and cannot be adjusted.  The control scheme is awful and cannot be adjusted in the options.  The actual control of your character is awful, you have no weight... you feel slippery and floaty which is terrible in an platforming action game.

In short, the presentation is great for children.  The gameplay, however, is terrible.

3/10

There are certain mechanics that can be improved though, like how all monsters die at 1 hit, this area should be analyzed deeper, as well as possibilities for weapons to be used in certain levels as well as making their powers different from one another.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048365070', 'num_games_owned': 119, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1593324615}
review:
Es un buen juego para las personas que le gusta los juegos de plataforma , este juego trata de un arbolito o mejor dicho el tronco que tiene que pasar por diversos mundos ,nose lo demas no lo termine de jugar , el juego en si es algo lento , el problema mayor es la camara que sigue al personaje, aveces es un poco molesto que la camara este muy lejos y muy cerca sin poder mover hacia los lados ,terminando con el analisis recomiendo el juego si te gustan los juegos de plataforma y los juegos lentos ,es un juego mas para ni√±os peque√±os ,a mi parecer seria mucho mejor si se juega con un mando ya que con el teclado es estresante, si quieres distraerte un rato y salir de los juegos FPS o Moba este juego es perfecto solo que no lo compres si no esta en descuento ya que no valdria la pena .
7.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198094232237', 'num_games_owned': 1955, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 274, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 274, 'last_played': 1450206176}
review:
The camera angles are terrible. The small amount of cut scenes take forever and play very slowly. Sometimes when you die, you have to go back to the very beginning. Other times, you don't and in some levels this seemed by random chance. Trust me, you will die a lot in this game because of camera angles or leaps of faith. There is no fall damage so if you fall from a very high up point that took some time to get to, well congratulations and good luck getting back to where you were. I for the most part enjoy platformers but platforming does not need fixed camera angles.
Note that I completed the game and got all of the achievements. I played using a keyboard and mouse and maybe the experience is different on a controller

review:

Overall a 7/10 game, but for the price a solid 10/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022533794', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 92, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1450626540}
review:
Pros:
- Design (worlds, character, enemies)
- Can suit children pretty well (easy to get what the story is about, only few controls)
- Unlockable features (power-ups, cosmetics)

Cons:
- Soundtrack (some songs are really repetitive and unappealing)
- AI (enemies are almost harmless)
- Controls (sometimes unresponsive and quite awkward)
- Camera (unresponsive and badly calibrated)

Woodle Tree Adventures is a platforming game that would have needed some more work for it to be really enjoyable. The negative aspects are equivalent to more than 3/4 of the game and are too important to be ignored. The game could have been a great experience for children wanting to get into the world of gaming if it were a bit less frustrating.

review: This game is, in a word, horrible. First of all, the storyline is just weird. Collecting water is not a very interesting quest. Also,  when a character is talking, you can't even skip the talking. It took forever just to get past the opening scene. The controls are also very weird, and the camera seems to be stubbornly insisting on staying in one spot. All in all, a boring game that is almost unplayable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063824607', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 189, 'last_played': 1468513488}
review:
Woodle Tree Adventures est un petit jeu ind√©pendant sans pr√©tention, tr√®s mignon et √ßa se sent, √† tous les niveaux.
Le h√©ros l√©gendaire de ce jeu est un esp√®ce de petit tronc, engendr√© par un arbre moustachu qui a besoin de notre aide de toute urgence. Notre but et de parcourir les 7 niveaux du jeu (6 + 1 √† d√©bloquer) pour r√©cup√©rer des larmes, et ce afin de rendre au pays des arbres de l'eau, parce qu'il est compl√®tement dess√©ch√©. Quid de la princesse √† sauver ? Eh oui, notre mission est purement √©cologique ! Pour partir √† l'aventure, nous sommes arm√©s d'une petite feuille (4 types possibles √† d√©bloquer au fur et √† mesure de l'aventure) pour tapoter les ennemis trognons que l'on pourra rencontrer. En parall√®le de la recherche des larmes, les niveaux sont truff√©s de petites baies volantes qu'il faudra ramasser en les croquant afin remplir sa besace et d√©bloquer des feuilles suppl√©mentaires, et m√™me un bandana si on d√©bloque plus de 800 baies. 

Le petit tronc avec le bandana est quand m√™me super classe !

Quand on joue, plusieurs points, n√©gatifs et positifs, ressortent. 
D'abord, positivement parlant, le jeu est plut√¥t agr√©able graphiquement. Les textures sont fines, √ßa n'aliase pas, la profondeur de champ est bien respect√©e, si bien que les niveaux ont l'air tr√®s vastes au premier abord, l'√©clairage des zones et la luminosit√© sont au top : en bref, du point de vue visuel, tout va bien. D√©plorons tout de m√™me des couleurs un peu ternes par moment, mais c'est du d√©tail.

Mais les graphismes sont l√† un des seuls points positifs car, m√™me s'il y en d'autres, une √©norme t√¢che vient vite noircir le tableau : la cam√©ra. Cette derni√®re reste bien souvent fixe, ce qui pose certains soucis, sachant que ce jeu est compos√© uniquement de plateformes. Ainsi, lorsque la camera se fige au niveau du sol, de c√¥t√© au personnage, et qu'il faut effectuer un saut, la manipulation peut se r√©v√©ler compliqu√©e, entra√Ænant inexorablement chute sur chute. De plus, les respawn n'√©tant pas particuli√®rement bien g√©r√©s, il n'est pas rare de recommencer une zone au tout d√©but alors qu'on √©tait bien avanc√© dans notre progression. 

Ceci dit, les niveaux en eux-m√™me restent simples, plut√¥t vastes pour les t√¢ches demand√©es, qui consiste √† r√©cup√©rer trois larmes par niveau et les d√©poser sur un piedestal. Ce sont souvent de "quasi" lignes droites, sans pi√®ges. La vitesse du petit personnage peut-√™tre augment√©e par une tr√®s pratique touche de sprint, rendant la progression un peu plus rapide. Si seulement le petit tronc n'avait pas la facheuse manie d'avoir les dessous de pieds en savon... 

Quant √† l'ambiance, il est difficile d'en juger. Au fond, le sc√©nario reste tr√®s simple et l'univers enfantin. Les ennemis ne sont pas bien coriaces et restent tr√®s mignons : petits crabes aux dents pointus, chatons, et autres lutins sont au rendez-vous. L'ambiance musicale pourrait plonger d'autant plus le joueur, si bien-s√ªr les titres n'√©taient pas si aga√ßants √† la longue et qu'ils n'avaient pas l'habitude de tourner en boucle. En effet, quand on passe plusieurs minutes dans un niveau afin de r√©cup√©rer toutes les baies et larmes, la musique √† tendance √† se relancer au bout de cinq minutes.

Finalement, Woodle Tree Adventures est un jeu que je recommande, mais pas √† tous. Personnellement, je me suis ennuy√© assez rapidement, mais c'est bien parce que j'ai 20 ans et que ce jeu est tr√®s clairement destin√© √† un public plus jeune. Je pense qu'un enfant pourrait prendre beaucoup de plaisir √† parcourir sans probl√®me, gr√¢ce √† une m√©canique de jeu tr√®s simple, cet univers mignon tout plein et f√©√©rique, le temps d'une balade d'un peu plus d'une heure. A toutefois √©viter si vous cherchez de l'action, du sang et de la difficult√©. Ou si vous avez plus de 12 ans.

-------------------------

[b]Points positifs[/b] :

- Un h√©ros mignon
- L'histoire simple
- La prise en main tr√®s rapide
- Des niveaux complets
- Les cartes √† √©changer sur Steam

[b]Points n√©gatifs[/b] : 

- La brievet√© du jeu
- La cam√©ra qui se bloque
- Le h√©ros et ses pieds qui glissent
- Le sprint qui ne se ressent pas des masses

author: {'steamid': '76561198073600298', 'num_games_owned': 103, 'num_reviews': 162, 'playtime_forever': 358, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 358, 'last_played': 1449460961}
review:
This is the cheap version of Captain Toad Treasure Tracker.

You are a tree gods child wood thing that eats berries to survive and to grow better leaf weapons or something to find fairy water to save your people or idk. Cute story for kids and people who like talking trees and magic (THE DEKU TREE)

The character is floaty and hard to move most of the time and what makes it even more difficult is the awful camera angles that are nearly impossible to alter or change. The art is cute and child friendly and gives a nice warm feeling, but that soon died down when the gameplay started to show flaws. 

When you die from touching enemies or falling off the map you are teleported back to the starting spawn location and in some maps, that can be annoying and tedious when the camerapans down or in odd areas along with sluggish character movement. Clunky combat aswell, once you get 200 berries and upgrade to the yellow leaf, you have ranged capabilities which should be a starting trait, as mobs will touch you out of hitbox and sometimes kill you even when not in contact.

Easy gameplay makes it simple to pick up or grasp for young children or inexperienced gamers. Thats a plus.

For its base price of 3$ I would say save your money for something else of similar value or something in the 5$ range. I got it on sale for 0.50$ so I can't complain.

Personal Rating: 2/5

review: Parece un juego muy simple pero contiene una trama muy compleja en la que un peque√±o tronco que representa a la humanidad tiene la responsabilidad de salvar el planeta que ha sido exprimido por las miner√≠as y que se ven reflejadas en cada enemigo, esto hace alusi√≥n a la corrupci√≥n de los lideres del mundo que han dividido al pueblo y han provocado una revoluci√≥n fallida que ha dejado como resultado a una sociedad envuelta en el caos y la incertidumbre que pide a gritos una soluci√≥n ambiental definitiva, tienen que jugarlo para comprender todos los dilemas existenciales que este nos deja.

review:
Born from father to help the world grow by collecting water from the ancient times! This game takes you on a fine adventure to places no one has ever been. Your mission to bring the world the water of life, and the many dangers on your way is a challange for all of us! 

Woodle Tree Adventures is a joy for speedrunners and is a most fun game to enjoy.
It's also good for fast achievements.

Gameplay - 8/10 
Difficulty - 4/10                   
Fun - 10/10     
Total = 7/10

review:
Woodle Tree Adventures est un petit platformer, certe court, mais qui vaut le d√©tour.
On y contr√¥le Woodle Tree, qui doit, afin de sauver la for√™t, aller chercher des gouttes d'eau magiques afin de faire revivre cette derni√®re.

Il ne s'agit certe pas d'une grosse production. Il y a des soucis de cam√©ra, comme beaucoup de jeu. N√©anmoins, cela reste un petit jeu mignon, sans prise de t√™te, ne demandant pas √©norm√©ment de skill pour le r√©ussir, et qui se joue sans r√©fl√©chir.

Bref, un bon petit jeu pour jouer avec ses enfants, ou se d√©tendre apr√®s une dure journ√©e de travail.
