author: {'steamid': '76561198020796334', 'num_games_owned': 850, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 135, 'last_played': 1448562550}
review:
I only gave this game a "Yes" just because kids might like it.

Woodle Tree Adventures is a very relaxing platforming game made in the style of some of the older games like Super Mario 64 or Crash Bandicoot and features a friendly design for all ages. The game seems to be targeted towards younger people, maybe for 2-4 year olds.

The game isn't perfect though. There are a couple of complants revovling aruond the gameplay itself and one thing that might just my own opinion. The camera was just absolutely horrendous and glitched pretty much in every level and the movements were a little clunky and slippery. The other problem I had with the game was that if it really was targeted towards pre-schoolers and such, I myself wouldn't really let my kid play games before he was actually intelligent enough to understand the concept of video games and rela life.

Overall, somwhat enjoyable game for a low price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025468901', 'num_games_owned': 2460, 'num_reviews': 532, 'playtime_forever': 38, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1448503499}
review:
This game needs to take it's olfactory center out of it's anus.
Mind bogglingly poor camera choices.
Jarring movement between scenes. Within a single scene, very smooth.
And I must admit, beautiful graphics, despite being an older style.

Button choices are poorly done. Movement on a world - you get stuck on tiny little things. Oh no, a 2 inch bump in my path? I cannot cross it without jumping 4 feet into the air.

Main issue in this game is that the entire thing - camera movement, world design, everything - is designed to extoll the artwork.

Beautiful artwork, shite game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198128711964', 'num_games_owned': 398, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 85, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 85, 'last_played': 1448483769}
review:
Getting this random 5p game,  my expectations were that this would be a buggy mess and a complete waste of time, and I was wrong!

What was good:
-The game looks fantastic, its a beautiful cartoony style that really pops out, plus the lighting is simply great, bouncing off the vibrant colours brilliantly.
-A lot of the musical tracks are really relaxing and chill
-The gameplay overall is very fun, gives me a Mario galaxy x Classic Megaman feel.
-Smooth framefate throughout my playthrough (Best Settings) exept when loading the later worlds

What cound be improoved
-Rubbish gameplay elements, things like not being able to effect where you land after you fall, made me die multiple times.
-Terrible enemies, little variety, the main ones are those cone blokes who just stand there
-Awful camera, only zooming in and out is incredibly annoying, it would be great if we could turn the camera 360.

Overall this is a fun relaxing game that for the cheap price its at now is a steal of a bargin, pick it up if you haven't.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063244917', 'num_games_owned': 116, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 151, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 144, 'last_played': 1451515055}
review:
This game is exactly what you would expect it to be: adventures of a log. If you always wanted to know, how it is to be a tree, here is your chance! Fight your enemy with Leaf of Vengance, collect Drops of Wetness, and that other stuff that allows you to upgrade your weapon. Otherwise, i would reccomend it to kids 5-8, 9 yr old would be bored as it is not too hard.

Pros:
clear, simplisctic graphics
light music background
limited violence, you just smack 'em with leaf and they disappear
autosave feature
if you cant get past certain points in game, call your dad, he will figure it out
good price/quality raito
Still better than DayZ

Cons:
problematic camera, afaik you can manipulate height with mouse, but not angle. Kids wont notice ;)
no menu, you just exit with esc key

If you want to have your kid off your back for some time. buy it. If you get it for free, loot the cards, and dont bother playing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063421546', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 290, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 290, 'last_played': 1448252569}
review:
Woodle Tree Adventures ist ein sehr nett gestaltenes Jump&Run mit einem Fehlgelaufenem hauch von Action.

Man wandelt im auftrag eines Baumes in verschiedenen Leveln rum (im moment leider nur 8 insgesammt) um Wasser zu sammeln.
Das wasser ist in form von "Engelstr√§nen" und es gibt 3 in jedem Level.
Als kleine Hilfe bekommt ihr f√ºr euren kleinen Baumstumpf ein Blatt zum Zuhauen (Aua O.o) und uhm ja, irgendwas "Taschen√§hnliches" um Beeren zu sammeln.
Nach einigen Beeren werden neue Blattfarben freigeschaltet die von Angriff kein unterschied machen ausser das die Distanz bei jeder Blattfarbe ansteigt.
Das Leveldesign ist recht Farbenfroh und das Gameplay erinnert stark an Mario 64 auch wenn einiges fehlt.
Wobei wir bei dem Negativen w√§ren, bis auf die Bl√§tter und ein Stirnband (das anscheinend nur Kosmetischen zwecken dient) l√§sst sich nichts weiter freischalten. Es wurde an dem Movement & Kampfsystem gesparrt, mehr als im Kreis rennen, springen und mit einem Blatt wedeln geht nicht. F√ºr ein spiel aus dem Jahre 2014 sollte da schon mehr drinnen sein.

Aber im gro√üen und ganzen ist es im Sale lohnenswert, besonders wenn man Kinder hat die auch mal ne Stunde an den PC d√ºrfen.

Kurz und Knapp:

Grafik: 7 / 10
Sound: 7 / 10
Gameplay: 4 / 10
Steuerung: 8 / 10
Story: 3 / 10

Over all: 5,8 / 10

(Andere Reviews meckern √ºber ne schlechte Kameraf√ºhrung und dadurch unspielbare Passagen, ich kann dem nicht nachempfinden. Denke mal die Fehler wurden mittlerweile behoben, dennoch w√ºrde eine freie Kamera besser sein.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198044953811', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 145, 'last_played': 1448305339}
review:
[h1]Ein Baumstamm auf reisen.[/h1]

Woodle Tree Adventures ist definitiv kein Spiel bei dem ich vom Stuhl springe und sage, das muss jeder Gamer mal gespielt haben.
Es ist... nunja, nicht das beste aber auch nicht das schlimmste Spiel das ich bisher gespielt habe.
Hatte eigentlich sogar recht viel spa√ü daran (es sei denn ich bin 20x am selben Punkt runter gefallen Aufgrund der Kameraplatzierung...) und brauch auch noch eine Errungenschaft dann hab ich sogar ein perfektes Spiel.

[h1]Was ist also "gut" an Woodle Tree Adventures[/h1]
[list]
[*]Im Sale f√ºr gerade mal 0,05ct zu erhalten.
[*]Sammelkarten. Wer gerne Sammelkarten f√ºr Abzeichen braucht hat hier ein leichtes Spiel. Wer aber sein "verlorenes" Geld wieder haben m√∂chte, kann die Sammelkarten verkaufen und hat sogar gewinn gemacht.
[*]Errungenschaften sehr schnell und einfach zu erhalten, f√ºr Errungenschafts-J√§ger ein Top-Spiel.
[/list]

Das wars auch leider schon, aber es w√§re gelogen wenn ich sage, es h√§tte noch mehr Punkte die sich lohnen, dieses Spiel zu kaufen.

[h1]Daher auch hier noch die negativen Aspekte[/h1]
[list]
[*]Kameraplatzierung ist (wie auch schon oft in anderen Reviews erw√§hnt) sehr umst√§ndlich. Da kann man sich auch kaum daran gew√∂hnen da sie manchmal hin und her wechselt wie sie gerade m√∂chte.
[*]Kurze Spielzeit.
[*]Kein Wiederspielwert.
[*]Vollpreis von 2,99‚Ç¨ ist zu hoch angesetzt.
[/list]

[b]So gesehen ist es eigentlich kein Spiel das man aufgrund der tollen Story oder der unglaublichen Grafik empfiehlt.
Da es mir aber dennoch ein wenig spa√ü gemacht hat, ich einige Sammelkarten bekommen habe, mir pers√∂nlich der ein oder andere Background sogar noch gef√§llt und die Errungenschaften einfach zu bekommen sind, empfehle ich das Spiel dennoch.
Ich betone noch einmal, keine tolle Story, nicht die tollsten Soundtracks, keine super Grafik, daf√ºr allerdings ein wenig mehr Geld als vorher und in grob 1-2h ein perfektes Spiel.
Nur daher die Empfehlung. ;)[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198008224860', 'num_games_owned': 295, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 112, 'last_played': 1448130034}
review:
I found this game fun and addictive. The graphics are bright and colourful making the worlds in this game great for kids. The main character is a log... yes that's right a log, you play as a sentient log on a mission from his sentient tree father too bring water back to the world. The story is very simple to follow and seems very reminiscent of old school 90's platformer games (Like Super Mario 64) in which the main character (and the player for that matter) is given a simple plot device (e.g. save the princess) and the story is set up and the rest is up to the levels and gameplay.

The levels are very intresting each with there own unique style, there are six worlds in total to explore as you collect berries, fairy tears in order to heal the world and you chase down the complete set of 8 steam achivements. You can even team up with a friend to complete levels with the local two player co-op mode.

The soundtrack is quite charming and only adds to the overall enjoyment of the game, at times I even felt transported back to being a child and playing classic Nintendo platform games (Super Mario, Banjo Kazooie and Donkey Kong 64, to name but a few, came to mind.)

It's far from perfect, as the issues with the camera will show. As you are playing this game sometimes the camera will go a bit crazy and move to a point which will make it very hard to see your character, this happened to me on several occasions and made the levels harder to complete (not impossible just a bit harder.) As you can see from my total play time, (at the point of writing this it was 1.9 hrs) I has been quite a short game and even though the camera had its issues, I have still completed this game 100% with all the steam achivements unlocked.

In summary this game has some good moments that will spark nostalgic feelings in older gamers and spark new moments for younger gamers. The game is short so don't expect an epic story arc with hundreds of levels, but do expect fun gameplay, cheery music with bright colors and vibrance throughout. It may have its issues but this fun little game could keep you busy even if it is for a short while.

Review Score - 7/10

Why 7/10?
1. Would like to see more levels.
2. Camera Issues and Minor Bugs.
3. Fun, addictive gameplay.
4. Great Music.
5. Colorful, bright graphics.
6. Main character is very unique.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067460853', 'num_games_owned': 545, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 30, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1448056624}
review:
This is pretty much a classic style 3D platformer. 

This, of course, means that it has the good and bad sides of both.
It's got a beutiful world that is relaxing to look at, however some places, particulary jumps can be unforgiving.

As of anything critical of the game itself, restart points are too infrequent for the style of game.   This is something Nintendo improved after noticing this problem in Super Mario 64.

I like that they don't have lives.  This saves a lot of frustrations.

However, don't like the system that you get killed when you get hit by an enemy once.  A health gauge would have made the game better.

Generally it is a decent game, but not a good game.   Some people will like it, but I can't recommend it for everyone.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996319480', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 121, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1447792362}
review:
Lo cierto es que consegu√≠ este juego a trav√©s de un Giveaway masivo. Al principio pens√© que ser√≠a el tipico al que solo jugarias para conseguir los cromos y desistalar. Pero nada m√°s alejado de la realidad. He jugado solo el primer nivel y ya he visto que es un juego que merece su precio. Es bonito visualmente, la banda sonora es relajante y te ayuda a pasar con diversion los desafios que tiene. Estando a precio completo incluso vale la pena comprarlo. Es un plataformas en 3D con un peque√±o √°rbol con ojos como personaje el cual tiene que recolectar l√°grimas en los diferentes niveles. 

Jugarlo con teclado es increiblemente complicado dado que la c√°mara es algo mala. Este es el unico inconveniente que le he encontrado. 

¬øRecomendado?
Si, desde luego lo recomiendo. Hay juegos por el precio completo de este mucho peores y este aporta un entorno en el que puedes pasar unas horas divertidas y relajadas que recuerdan al cl√°sico Mario.

author: {'steamid': '76561198103883281', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1496956107}
review:
[i]Jogo bacana, muitos usu√°rios disseram que jogo lembra de Mario e Crash, e realmente lembra.
Isso tamb√©m deu uma nostalgia, mas eu recomendo esse jogo, justamente pra quem tem filho, um irm√£o ou uma irm√£, por que ele √© um joguinho muito bem feito mas que certamente n√£o ir√° agradar aos gamers que gostam de um jogo cheio de gr√°ficos e p√°.

review:
ITA

Si vede che √® la prima o una delle prime esperienze dello sviluppatore, ma Woodle Tree Adventures ha un pizzico di magia dentro di se. √® un titolo con molti difetti, dai comandi imprecisi, all'eccessiva facilit√† di alcune fasi, alla poca longevit√† e variet√† del gameplay e si vede abbastanza bene... ma riesce a catturare e di questo gli se ne deve dare merito. Buon titolo, spero di vedere altri lavori simili... magari un po' pi√π rifiniti :P

ING

You see that it is the first or one of the first experiences of the developer, but Woodle Tree Adventures has a bit of magic inside him. is a title with many flaws, commands inaccurate, excessive ease some stages, the little longevity and variety of gameplay and you can see well enough ... but manages to capture and for that he has to give credit. Good title, I hope to see more work like this ... maybe a little 'more refined: P

author: {'steamid': '76561198063489127', 'num_games_owned': 2158, 'num_reviews': 380, 'playtime_forever': 235, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 235, 'last_played': 1447517654}
review:
Ein unfassbar schlecht gemachtes Spiel. Die Story, falls man es denn so nennen kann, ist einfach nur langweilig und auch ohne sprechende Stimmen. Es wird zu Beginn einfach nur Text eingeblendet (, den man auch nicht √ºberspringen kann), w√§hrend sich das eigene Vieh und ein Baum anschauen.
Eine Einf√ºhrung ist auch nicht vorhanden.
Am nervigsten ist allerdings, dass sich die Kameraperspektive manchmal nach dem eigenen Tod √§ndert und man dann beispielsweise alles von hinten oder von der Seite sieht und man das auch nicht √§ndern kann. Man kann dann auch nicht mehr wirklich sehen, wo es weiter geht, weil man statt dass man Eing√§nge von vorne sieht, nur W√§nde von hinten sieht.
Schlecht gemacht finde ich au√üerdem die undefinierbaren Lebewesen, denen man begegnet. Manche sind friedlich und manche nicht, nur kann man das nicht erkennen. Dann schie√üt pl√∂tzlich eines der Viecher und man ist tot und muss einen gro√üen Weg nochmal zur√ºcklegen.
Das "Kampfsystem" ist auch sehr billig. Mit einem Schlag t√∂tet man einen Gegner sofort und mit einem Schuss/Schlag t√∂tet ein Gegner einen sofort. Es gibt auch Viecher, die einfach nichts machen und die man killen kann... bringt aber rein gar nichts.
Weiterhin gibt es auch zu wenig Spawnpunkte im Level verteilt.

[b] Fazit: Ein reines Desaster! [/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198024318503', 'num_games_owned': 5676, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1447502646}
review:
Ich habe das Spiel f√ºr ein paar Cent im Sale gekauft, und daf√ºr ist es meiner Meinung nach gar nicht mal sooo schlecht.

Sicher, die Kamerasteuerung k√∂nnte besser sein und die Steuerung etwas pr√§ziser, aber f√ºr einen kleinen Zeitvertreib zwischendurch durchaus zu empfehlen.

Die Grafik, wie auch die Soundkulisse sind sehr gut geraten und es macht sehr viel Spa√ü, dem kleinen Baumstamm zu helfen, die Wassertropfen einzusammeln.

Das Spiel nutzt eine Autosave-Funktion und falls man mal einen Abgrund herunterf√§llt, ist es auch nicht sehr tragisch, da alles bis dahin Erreichte gespeichert wurde - man wird lediglich an den Anfang des Levels gesetzt.

Kurz und knapp: Von mir eine Kaufempfehlung, gerade, wenn es im Sale ist.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055634739', 'num_games_owned': 925, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 76, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1447030893}
review:
It could have been a good kid's game. Key words are "could have been". With a simple and really colorful look to appeal a younger generation of gamers, Woodle Tree Adventures could really have been something that you could see your little 4 year old cousin play and have some fun when he visited you, but no.

Woodle Tree Adventures is a game that suffers terribly of god awful camera angles, which are adjustable to a certain degree but still terrible. Not only that, I disliked the way the character moves, it's too whacky. Checkpoints hardly work, if there's any. The game lasts about an hour, but given the problems it has, I found that to be a positive thing instead of a negative one.

If this is the first game of this team it's not bad, it just needs to be worked on. The camera positions really ruin the fun when you start to have some. Enemies lack personality, for me just seemed like they were dead inside, waiting to be whipped with a leaf. Also the character should kill them when you jump on top of them, pretty much like the Mario games. I think it'd make sense, because if you take a leap of faith (which happens a lot given the angles), if you land on top of an enemy by accident, too bad: Go back to the beggining of the level! Hahahaha how fun, right? NO.

I'd say not to buy this game, but since it goes down to like 5 cents on sales, go ahead.

Final Rating: 4/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198009035811', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 95, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1446997269}
review:
This game is awful. Here's why:
[list]
[*] None of the core game mechanics of the game are properly explained.
[*] The level design is atrocious, there is absolutely no indication where to go or how to get there.
[*] All the platforms are infuriatingly hard to navigate.
[*] You can't adjust the camera angle, which it adjusts itself automatically. Sometimes when you die, the camera doesn't change to a proper angle, making you absolutely unable to see what you are doing at all.
[*] Checkpoints are placed erratically; sometimes there's two within one platform of eachother, but often times the checkpoint is several minutes of walking back. Also, the checkpoints don't really matter, because most times you get sent back to the beginning of the stage no matter how many checkpoints you've passed.
[*] It is completely unclear and seemingly random what animals kill you and which don't.
[*] Dying has no consequences and you have infinite lives.
[*] The soundtrack sounds like someone mashed random notes on his piano to pads in VST synths that came packaged with his pirated version of Fruity Loops Studio
[*] Some level elements, especially the pipes that beam you upwards, lead to absolutely nothing. Why even have them at all?
[*] Large portions of most levels can be ignored, or omitted by making a large jump or jumping to your death twoards a check point.
[*] Some platforms have clipping issues.
[/list]

In conclusion, this looks like someone's unfinished school project for his bachelor of game design at F*** You University. 0/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198117030366', 'num_games_owned': 186, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1470691491}
review:
At first this game makes you think that it could posibly be fun for a younger audince, but after playing about 10 minutes of it you relize this is the closest you will ever get to hell. The point of the game is to beat levels collecting berries and you guessed it, fairy tears. each level consists of different emies such as: the candy corn yoga guy, the depressed looking emo thing, a tree looking object with freakishly long legs, and much much more ;). Each level introduces a new form of rage, at one point i tried to grab the woodle tree person out of the screen and mail to the creators to show them just what they have created. As you collect more berries you unlock differnt leaves, yeah that is your melee. it goes from green, yellow, orange, then white. Want to see what the white leaf looks like? dont google it no one has the patience to get that far. Even if you can make it to the white leaf you are insane by the time you unlock it and dont think to take a screenshot. So before playing this game please consider the following: Do I REALLY want to drop out of school, work at dell taco untill i am old enough to go to a mental hospital and grow old alone.

thank you
-Fluffy Freeman-

author: {'steamid': '76561198055706844', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 85, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1470526317}
review:
You are born in a life of lies, when your father tells you to "retrieve" the "stolen" berries to save the world. You venture out to complete the mission you have been given by this "nice-in-disguise" tree with the mustache, being your father. You start out in a peaceful world where everybody is smiling and enjoying their lives. With you, of course thinking that they are evil, starts slaying these creatures. The tears of the innocent drop to the ground as you slice them apart with your deadly leaf, which gets bloodier from every upgrade. You start to wonder which side you're on, good or evil. Like the tax-collector you are, foolishly working for this evil mastermind. The screams from the poor people and the white boxes from their bodies suddenly aweakens your mind from what evil deed you have done. At the end of the game you feel the regret, the innocents souls destroying your mind from inside. How could you be fooled by this monster....

tstue

author: {'steamid': '76561198126500833', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 89, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1446839888}
review: Okay Guys, here is a fast Review about the Game "Woodle Three Adventures".... I really dont know how to describe that beauty Lil' Diamond, but for the price of 0,09 Euro it's preeeeeeetty Nice :D I always make some..  (uhm, okay, i call it Lets plays :D ) on Skype with my friends and i bought the game and start it without an XBOX360 Gamepad (Because thats why :D ).About the Game: After we learn from our Father (?) that we shall collect some Waterdrops to save the .... Green World (?), we start with our lil' Green Leave into an Adventure to different Worlds. We go to Beaches, Ice Worlds and visit our beloved Bees and Worms. Oh yeah, and Collct Berrys of Course ! Because when Life gives you Berrys you must put them in your Backpack until you cannot see your Character anymore :D But okay, you MUST PLAY IT :D And its even better when some friends join you and see you fail, raging around like a lil' Kid because you dont wanna use your Gamepad and play with your Keyboard (#Yolo). Okay Guys, i wrote enough for you to try this little piece of Cake for yourself ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198044151242', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 73, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1446790040}
review:
My Grandfather smoked his whole life. I was about 10 years old when my mother said to him, 'If you ever want to see your grandchildren graduate, you have to stop immediately.'. Tears welled up in his eyes when he realized what exactly was at stake. He gave it up immediately. Three years later he died of lung cancer. It was really sad and destroyed me. My mother said to me- 'Don't ever smoke. Please don't put your family through what your Grandfather put us through." I agreed. At 22, I have never touched a cigarette. I must say, I feel a very slight sense of regret for never having done it, because your game gave me cancer anyway.

10/10

review:
This game feels super unfinished. I thought it was a cute game, but I can't give it a good recommendation after I literally fell through the map for no reason.
The "check-point" system works like, twice and then it sends you straight to the beginning. Thank god you can seemingly keep the fairy tears no matter how many times you die.
The controls have serious lag too. I'm glad I got this for only five cents when I bought it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034352021', 'num_games_owned': 751, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1694410615}
review:
This game contains high amounts of adorable beaver. You can't play with your beaver alone though. You need at least one friend to play with a beaver. The most realistic beaver simulator I have ever seen. Is best played in the public gaming lounge at your school while your friend shouts his rendition of super mario 64 music at you, then later sends you a facebook message with a link to the super mario 64 theme mashed up with terry cruz (the old spice commercial guy).
Don't believe me? Here are what real random people in a college gaming lounge have to say about woodle tree adventures:
-That is the cutest beaver ever.
-Does that candy corn have a smiling face? That will haunt me forever. Scarier than Slender man, hands down.
-This game really has me stumped.
-Oh No! I lost my beaver! Where is it?
-I don't know what is going on right now...
-*proceeds to shout mario 64 music for 15 minutes straight*
-I can't find anymore fruit. -Dude, there are several gay guys here. Are you blind?

So grab your copy of Woodle tree adventures today, but only if you have friends, because...
BEAVER!

author: {'steamid': '76561198033111862', 'num_games_owned': 145, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1502148159}
review:
[h1][b]This isn't a review of the game, but I can recommend it to childs.
Here you have a delicious Apple Pie Recept! :)[/b][/h1]

If the crust looks like it's getting too browned, take a large piece of aluminum foil and place on top of the pie in the oven. No need to wrap it around the pie, just place it on top. That will keep the top from browning further.
Pies always seem to take longer to cook than one expects. (Perhaps it's because we're always opening the oven to check on how the pie is doing?) The filling should be visibly bubbling, which you should be able to see through the steam vents. I recommend putting a rimmed baking sheet on a rack beneath the rack of the pie to catch the filling as some of it invariably bubbles up and out over the pie. Makes oven clean-up a lot easier.


Ingredients
Crust Ingredients for a flakey pie crust
2 1/2 cups (285 g) all-purpose flour, plus extra for rolling
10-ounces (1 1/4 cups, 285 g) unsalted butter (room temperature), cut into 1/2 inch cubes
1 teaspoon salt
2 teaspoons sugar
1/2 cup (115 ml) sour cream (use full-fat sour cream for best results)
Filling Ingredients
3 pounds of good cooking apples such as Fuji, Golden Delicious, Granny Smith, Gravenstein, or Pippin (about 6 to 8 apples, depending on the size of your apples and the size of your pie dish)
1 Tbsp of lemon juice or apple cider vinegar (to toss with the sliced apples so they don't brown as you slice them)
1/2 cup to 2/3 cup sugar, depending on how sweet you like your pie
3 tablespoons all-purpose flour for thickening
1/4 teaspoon ground allspice
1/4 teaspoon ground nutmeg
1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon
1 Tbsp brandy (Optional. By the way, if you have Calvados apple brandy, use it!)
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
Egg Wash
1 large egg yolk
1 Tbsp cream


Method

1 In a large bowl whisk together 2 1/2 cups of flour, 1 teaspoon of salt, and 2 teaspoons of sugar. Add the cubed butter and use your clean dry hands to toss to coat with the flour. Using your hands work the butter into the flour, pressing the cubes of butter between your thumb and fingers. Continue to work the flour until the mixture is shaggy and the largest pieces of butter are no larger than a kernel of corn. Make a well in the center and add the sour cream to it. Use a fork to work the buttered flour and the sour cream into each other until the dough begins to clump. Separate the dough mixture into 2 equal sized piles and work each one first into a ball, and then into a disk. Sprinkle with flour and wrap with plastic wrap. Refrigerate for 1 hour before rolling out. (See more detailed instructions with photos on our Sour Cream Pie Crust Recipe.)
slice peeled cored apples 1/4-inch to 1/2-inch thick

2 While the dough is chilling, peel, core and slice the apples into 1/4-inch to 1/2-inch slices. As you cut your apple slices, add them to a large bowl and sprinkle them with a little lemon juice or apple cider vinegar to help keep them from turning brown.
whisk together flour, sugar, and spices coat apple slices with flour sugar spice mixture

3 Combine sugar, flour and spices in a bowl. Add the flour mixture to the apple slices and use your hands to distribute the flour through the apples so they are well coated. Then sprinkle with brandy and vanilla extract and stir to coat all the apples.

4 Place one oven rack in the lowest position and put a large rimmed baking sheet on it (to catch any drippings from the pie.) Position a second rack the next rung up (still in the lower third of the oven) and preheat to 375¬∞F.
roll out dough to 12-inch wide, 1/8 inch thick center dough on pie plate

5 Remove one crust disk from the refrigerator. Let sit at room temperature for 5-10 minutes. Place disk on a lightly floured, clean, flat surface. Using a rolling pin, roll out the pie dough to a 12-inch circle, about 1/8 of an inch thick. As you roll out the dough, check to make sure it isn't sticking. If and when it starts to stick, gently lift it up and sprinkle a little more flour on the table surface or on the pie dough to keep the dough from sticking. Gently place the rolled out dough onto a 9-inch pie plate. Press down to line the pie dish with the dough.
spoon apple slices in pie plate mound the apple slices

6 Arrange the apple slices in the dough-lined pie plate. Mound the apples in the center.
place second rolled out dough circle on top of apples trim and crimp edges

7 Roll out the second disk of dough, again to 12-inches. Gently place the second round of pie dough over the apples. Trim excess dough with kitchen shears, leaving a 3/4 inch overhang from the edges of the pie pan. Fold the dough under itself so that the edge of the fold comes right to the edge of the pan. Press the top and bottom dough rounds together as you flute edges using thumb and forefinger or press with a fork.
paint egg wash on dough cut slits into surface of apple pie

8 Place egg yolk and cream in a small bowl and use a fork to stir until well combined. Use a pastry brush to brush the egg wash over the top and fluted edges of the pie. Use a sharp knife to cut slits in the top of the pie crust for steam vents.

9 Place pie on oven rack centered over the baking sheet on the rack below it to catch any drippings. Bake the pie at 375¬∞F until crust begins to lightly brown, about 20 minutes, then reduce heat to 350¬∞F. Bake until crust is golden and juices are bubbling, anywhere from an additional 45 minutes to an hour, depending on the type of apples you are using. (About halfway through baking check to make sure the pie isn't browning too much. When it's nicely browned, tent the pie with a large piece of aluminum foil to keep the pie from browning further.)

10 Transfer the apple pie to a rack to cool for at least 1 hour. Serve slightly warm or at room temperature. Great with a side of vanilla ice cream.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969177510', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1447690455}
review:
Ever wanted to be a cute little tree stump? In "Woodle Tree Adventures" your time has come. You will try to rescue the land of trees which is suffering a big drought. It's very easy to notive because daddy trees tells you so and obviously any water is consumed by the big waterfall which you can see in the intro and in several levels.. :D ... Anyway.. Just try to find 3 fairy tears to fill the water buckets at the end of each level and land of trees will be saved.
If you are lucky, it also has some elements of "Where is Waldo?" because of some weird camera glitches.

Nevertheless it is a very nice game to show the way of (tree) life. Plus, it's very appropriate for children by the use of its simple controls and the lack of being able to fail a level.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085975743', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 48, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1446612452}
review:
Woodle Tree Adventures is about a tree boy. He was born to snatch and run, stuffing as many berries as he can in is pack. Why must he take all of the worlds food supply? The poor travelers feel tree boy's wrath, hit in the face by a small leaf. Cat man, ice cream dude, and many others suffer the boy's beatings. The tree boy's goal is to collect fairy tears to heal the old man tree. The inncoent tree boy has been manipulated into doing the bad old man tree's work. Why must tree boy make the sweet fairies cry? What has this world come to? 
I r8 this 8/8

author: {'steamid': '76561198010187721', 'num_games_owned': 532, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 98, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1465777013}
review:
This game has made me reevaluate my life. I have become a better person. I have become the [b]√úbermensch[/b].

After throwing a bunch of doritos and empty mountain dew bottles at my mother as she was cooking me my hourly macaroni, she relented and gave me her credit card for to purchase games on Steam. Being the kind gentleman I am, I only put $1000 on it. But I didn't need $1000. All I needed was $.05.

This game has revealed the universe in a way only call of duty had before. I am but a stub, a branch of the bigger thing, the papa tree. It shows how futuile and yet ephemeral our simplistic lives are. Our tireless pursuit towards a meaningless end, but we must pursue. This game punishes you for losing, but you can not lose. You are stuck in a seemingly endless purgatory that not even Gaben could free you from. The only escape, as it is in life, is to push forward and reach the end, the enlightenment.

Thank you, for teaching me so much. Instead of throwing things at other to get them to do what I want, I smack them with a leaf mercilessly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062268020', 'num_games_owned': 152, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1575366434}
review: So lets see here, where should I begin this. I was checking the cheap games on steam and I saw this funny looking game so I instantly bought it beacuse you know why not. I also saw that this game was local Co-op so I bought it to some friends too when I was at a lan. But I started up the game and the first I saw was a poor looking resolution tab, I appiled the settings and pressed okey. I came in to the game and the first thing I saw was a big tree that apparently is my dad and it was giving me a intro to the game I don't even know if you can call it a intro. I didn't really read what he said beacuse who has the time to do that? And after he talked to me he started crying or something and I picked up the tear and the game started. Me the poor looking stock with a purple bag or something with a leaf as a weapon has to go around and pick up tears. Like how am I supposed to survive those dangerous one hit kill monsters when I only have my leaf. Like really how big is that leaf or how small am I? I played through the first level and believe it or not I actually enjoyed it and I had a few laughs with my friend. Overall I think this game is pretty good 7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198077902897', 'num_games_owned': 1338, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 112, 'last_played': 1448188028}
review:
It was a dark and stormy night when I decided to buy this game. After downloading this game I launched it immediatetly, little did I know what I was in for. After opening the game I was greeted by a great magical tree would said that I woud the deadliest pudding of them all. Armed with my leaf of complete agaonising pain,yes, my leaf, of agaonising pain, I was driven to vanquish those who stood in my way. I was destined to collect those big, damn pieces of fruit and those soulsucking fairy tears. With each piece of fruit my sack grew bigger and bigger I thought it was gonna pop and my juices burst all over my fellow marshmellow companions that only say one line 'Why are you hitting me. :('. These marshmellows knew crap all about my destiny, I am a pudding, I have a deadly leaf, and I will collect that fruit till the day my giant blue sack of unimagineable depths bursts. So, that was my story and I hope none of you are there for when my sack blows, cause its gonna blow like putting a knife in a toaster. (Which hurts by the way). I thank you all for reading this and always be on the lookout for my big, blue, sack of fruit.
#HopeIWinThisContest

author: {'steamid': '76561198085990919', 'num_games_owned': 101, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 79, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1457759438}
review:
Woodle Tree Adventures is a magical and beautiful game where you play as a piece of tree that spawns from a pile of turd. So then, in conclusion, your character is considered and now proclaimed to be a turd baby. You then autistically teleport into a house area where worms that look like those little chocolate ball candies that were vertically alined roam free and happily. There are many endearing factors in this game that are to be considered, like how when you repeatedly jump, your character, or turd baby, starts to slowly spiral until you are jumping on your head. MAGNIFICENT!<3 The most godly thing in this game is a leaf you find in your little dumbo house, which kills ANYTHING in one blow. aND DON'T GET ME STARTED ON THE UPGRADES TO YOUR GOD WEAPON where you can literally make small tornadoes and launch it at the poor ice cream looking, square shaped, eye cancer beings. The enemies are very respectable as well, due to the fact that they let out this ear destroying screech when they die, but the thing is that, no matter what enemy it is, they release the same screech! 

Overall this game is freaking hilarious, i love this and cant wait for the sequel! Heh...hopefully i win this contest

i rate this game 12 out of 10, yes, its that good

author: {'steamid': '76561198176485561', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 364, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 362, 'last_played': 1460843167}
review: Woodle Tree Adventures is a game that makes you rethink everything Bill Nye has taught you.  Is life even real, am I even real?  You don't play Woodle Tree Adventures, Woodle Tree Adventures plays you.  As soon as you watch the first cutscene you know, that the government is wrong.  Woodle Tree Adventures takes a risk with themes that no other games have brought up. Woodle Tree goes against what all recent game developers have been trying to shove down our throats.  We aren't computers, we're people, and Woodle Tree Adventures gets that.  At first I was puzzled, why haven't any other game developers realized, that we're people, then I realized.  There is no real life. The thing we call life is just a giant game of Woodle Tree Adventures.   It all makes sense now; all the religions got it wrong.  We must travel from planet to planet, draining them of all their fairy water and berries, maybe even get a bandana along the way.  However, as seen in Woodle Tree Adventures, the world isn't a peaceful place. Woodle Tree Adventures has prepared me for the next era of the human race, it has taught me the truth, showed me who my real enemy is. I only have a matter of time before Woodle tree Adventures is discovered by government officials, in the mean time I'll be grinding trying to find out everything I can before it's too late. I extremely advise that you do as well, for it is our future, our destiny.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072187205', 'num_games_owned': 458, 'num_reviews': 190, 'playtime_forever': 277, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 221, 'last_played': 1449874632}
review:
It's an interesting game with great aesthetics that feels like one of the new mario games.

There are some problems with it, such as:
- The camera follows only the 1st player, which makes it really hard to play as the 2nd player.
- The characters are a little bit slippery, which gets even worse on the snowy stage.
- Attack animations are weird and slow.
- It is extremelly short.

But it manages to provide some fun, and may be worth buying as a time waster.

author: {'steamid': '76561198142589037', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1450737144}
review:
You've got yourself here some game that your friend bought you, and he said to check it out.

You weren't really sure if it was a virus or not, but curiosity got the best of you, so you played it

Little did you know...

You would be thrust into a world where a single tree stump with legs, who wields a dinky leaf can outlast swarms of pretty music tracks, and other slightly-related tree enemies.

This game will take you beyond what you know of gaming, the furious attempts to make a collection of tomato, apple, square-circle fruit will haunt you as you live throughout the rest of your life.

Now is the time, now is when you truly meet your destiny, when you get your hands on a game that costs you your pocket change, you can change:

The world

author: {'steamid': '76561198053849257', 'num_games_owned': 382, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 205, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 197, 'last_played': 1457228918}
review: My father smoked pot his whole life. I was about 21 years old when my mother said to him, 'If you ever want to see your child get married, you have to stop immediately.'. Tears welled up in his eyes when he realized what exactly was at stake. He gave it up immediately. Three years later he died of some random cancer. It was really sad and destroyed me. My mother said to me- 'Don't ever smoke pot. Please don't put your family through what your father put us through." I agreed. At 28, I have never touched a bonng or smoked pot. But i must say i regret that choice, This Game is Cancer for trees, but Not bad with a Duo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198165747695', 'num_games_owned': 204, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 83, 'last_played': 1521301548}
review:
have you ever played a game where it looks like the people making it tried really hard, but it still sucks?


welcome to woodle tree adventures. 

i was drawn to it with the concept that it was a super cute gta. i have to say, narry a single prostitute was there to be beaten by my one weapon: a leaf. when something asked why i was hitting it, it was because it made everthing else do something or other.
it recomends using the xbox controller. i used something like that. problem is, i had this other control stick just mocking me as i tried to turn the camera and wiggle it around. there wasn't really any idea as to what i was supposed to be doing. the nine minutes i put into it will probably be added to by the children. but hey, as long as it's a nickel, go for it. maybe a dollar, but certainly not full price.. well, three dollars. whatever, you get what you pay for. good think little kids love cheap stuff.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080487927', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1446427733}
review: Woodle tree adventures is a top down rpg extravaganza, emphasizing top tier leaf wacking combat, and enemy ai on the level of a top tier rail shooter. I have played many amazing games, such as Bioshock, Skyrim, and Dishonored, but I have never seen a stealth system so perfectly managed. If you aren't within 3 feet of them, enemies can't even see you. That is next gen, and honestly I think that the sequel will the highlight at the next E3. I look forward to the excellent level design and camera.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081954333', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1446427739}
review:
Have you ever noticed how, in a typical RPG (and, now that I think about it, most games in general) battles don‚Äôt really mean anything? How many times have you defeated a miniboss, only to have it stand back up and laugh at you, saying ‚ÄúI have underestimated you! You are a worthy opponent! This is not the end! We shall meet again!‚Äù and make a getaway? Think about it. How many times do you beat up Balrog in Cave Story only to have him fly away without a scratch? How is Black Knight able to keep running away after Shovel Knight stabs the hell out of him? How come you black out if you lose a Pok√©mon battle, but none of the other trainers do? And how does the big bad villain always seem to get away, even if their HP hits zero, so they can reappear in the sequel?

Woodle Tree Adventures asks the question, ‚ÄúWhat if defeating an enemy in battle always means that they die?‚Äù

This might seem quite inconsequential in random encounters, but Woodle Tree Adventures will also pit you against several main characters. If you defeat a main character in battle, they‚Äôre dead for good, and the whole story changes to reflect it. Heavy stuff.

But thankfully, as the game advertises, you don‚Äôt actually have to kill anyone! The game offers a second option to get out of battles: talking the enemy out of fighting. This involves solving a simple puzzle, almost always involving the ‚ÄúAct‚Äù menu in battle. The puzzle changes depending on what kind of enemy you‚Äôre fighting; sometimes you‚Äôll just need to give them a compliment, other times you‚Äôll need to survive several of their attacks, and so on. Once they‚Äôre not emotionally invested in the battle anymore, you can ‚Äúspare‚Äù them, and the battle ends. You won‚Äôt get any EXP for it, but you‚Äôll still get gold. It‚Äôs a very unique fighting mechanic!

I admit, after my first playthrough of the game, I was disappointed in the story‚Äôs presentation. I thought that both the very beginning and the final area of the game were fantastic, dripping with shocking emotional dilemmas, but the middle 80% of the game‚Äôs content seemed like it relied too much on oddball humor and not much else. The game hilariously plays with expectations and has no shortage of genuinely witty satire of its genre, and I found myself amused by nearly all of it, but after the first two hours as I was walking across long linear worlds and listening to dozens of characters try to tell me jokes, I started to wonder where the emotional gravity had gone. ‚ÄúWhy is this game making me laugh, when I thought it was supposed to make me cry?‚Äù I asked myself. ‚ÄúWhere are the feelings? After such an excellent and powerful prologue, why is the game taking so long to show me more?‚Äù

Later that night, as I was lying awake in bed, the answer hit me: the game was quirky and lighthearted because I was sparing everyone‚Äôs life. I wasn‚Äôt playing as a murderer. If you want this game to have drama, you have to cause it. And I think that‚Äôs where all the hype is coming from, all the talk about player choice. This is a game about being a tree-hugging pacifist, or a murderous psychopath who kills anyone who gets in the way, or anything in between. You only need to live with whomever you decide to be, because the game won‚Äôt let you ignore what you have done.

Though it isn‚Äôt the most visually impressive game, and the stage design isn‚Äôt always the best, Woodle Tree Adventures has left me feeling that I have just witnessed a work of art. It tried some new and ambitious things and isn‚Äôt ashamed of what it wanted to be. It's about 6 hours long; I‚Äôd recommend anyone to play it at least twice, just to be able to say that they've made their own choices and seen what the game has to offer. It‚Äôs hard to imagine that anyone would regret the experience.

review:
HELLO I WANT TO TALK ABOUT THIS ASTONISHING GAME
THE STORY IS SIMPLE : DANY TREEJO YOUR FATHER WANTS YOU TO COLLECT TEARS (MINE WAS TEARS OF JOY FROM PLAYING THIS GAME)
THERE ARE MANY LEVELS AND YOU CAN PICK UP BLACKBERRIES? 
YOU CAN ALSO HAVE A $NINJA$ BANDANNA I DON'T KNOW ITS PURPOSE BUT IT IS VERY CLASSY I LOVED IT
BUT THE BEST PART OF THIS GAME IS THAT YOU CAN PLAY WITH A FRIEND : YOUR FRIEND IS A DOGSQUIRRELPIG-THING WHICH GROWLS VERY NICELY. EXCELLENT DOG !
THE GAME IS QUITE SHORTY BUT YOU CAN PLAY IT AGAIN WHICH IS A NICE FEATURE?

BUT THIS GAME HAS SOME DEFAULTS :
-TOO VIOLENT, YOU CAN EVEN HEAR SOME NPC SCREAMING ABOUT THE VIOLENCE
-YOU CAN'T PLAY IT WITH 3 FRIENDS.
-YOU CAN'T PLAY IT WITH 4 FRIENDS.
-THE CAMERA IS QUITE ANNOYING, BUT THE MAIN CHARACTER IS CUTE SO IT'S OKAY.

I HAVE TO SAY IT IS A WELL MADE GAME FOR EVERYONE. THANKS CHUBBY PIXEL, THANK YOU DEVELOPPERS, AND THANKS DANY TREEJO FOR YOUR HUMBLE PARTICIPATION

BYE

author: {'steamid': '76561198041385264', 'num_games_owned': 692, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 116, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 108, 'last_played': 1452008317}
review:
This game is actually amazing. I absolutely love the visuals (very charming, and especially cute), and the soundtrack is so soothing. This game is certainly relaxing. I honestly think this game get's a bad rep. Sure, the controls can be a little fudgy (much better with the controller might I add) but I don't think it takes away from the game overall. There are multiple upgrades, and fun worlds, and the gameplay is simple yet fun. I find myself really relaxed during all of it. There aren't any real downsides to dieing, so even dieing I don't feel frusterated whatsoever. It's just overall an amazing game. It's cute, which I have mentioned before, and that might be the main selling point for me since I love anything adorable (and I'm not afraid to admit it) but I can't help but love this game. The enemies themselves are so adorable too. I guess I should talk about the length. So far I am on the 6th "world" and if these are the worlds and not the levels, if you do well, the game is about an hour and a bit? If these are just levels and not worlds, than there might be even more. Still, there is definate replayability for me, and hey, as I am speaking, the game is 6 cents. Woah, a lot of commas (ignore them). 

tl;dr this game is worth it. 

10/10 (and I mean that) This is NOT a joke review.


Edit: There are only 6 levels.  (still worth it and my review stays the same) 

My total game time was 1 hour and 23 minutes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198139466009', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 151, 'playtime_forever': 141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 131, 'last_played': 1481875652}
review: Woodle Tree Adventures c'est un petit jeu pour initier les plus jeunes joueurs aux bases du jeu de plateforme en 3d. Son univers aux d√©cors vari√©s et color√©s plaira √† coup s√ªr √† vos enfants. Ici pas d'histoire sans un peu d'imagination, ce qui au final est assez bien adapt√© pour nos petites t√™tes blondes. Le personnage jouable est attachant, le chara-design des monstres est original. Le level-design et les m√©caniques du jeu simplistes rendent le tout tr√®s accessible. Une manette est indispensable pour appr√©cier le titre √† sa juste valeur. Le syst√®me de cam√©ra est toutefois assez particulier, mais rien d'insurmontable. L'ambiance musicale est indiscutablement rat√©e. Le niveau avec l'ambiance neigeuse en est un exemple flagrant ! Seuls ceux qui ont cette capacit√© extraordinaire pour appr√©cier les musiques d'ascenseurs y trouveront leur compte. C'est bien dommage, car le jeu dans son ensemble n'est pas mauvais et a du potentiel. Un titre au gameplay reposant, non-violent et kawaii qui conviendra aux plus petits.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022512373', 'num_games_owned': 565, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 61, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1446401392}
review:
[b] Woodle Tree Adventures is just as real as my life [/b]


No, Woodle Tree Adventures isn't just a game -- Woodle Tree Adventure is pure art.
The real "gameplay" isn't in the platforming, nor in the collecting, but in the philosphical questions you are forced to ask yourself as you continue in your quest.
Questions such as:

[i]Who is Woodle Tree and [b]why can't he smile?[/b]
What is the fruit for?
Why do I need that headband so badly?
Why am I looking for water if its ****ing everywhere?
Should I kill the friend who gifted me this game?
Should I kill....[b]myself?[/b]
Why do the wavy men wave? Is it really so bad just to let them wave on?
How did that giant mouse get in the box under level 3?
If Woodle Tree's dad is a tree, and Woodle Tree has legs, who is his mom? What happened to her?
What does it MEAN to Woodle?[/i]

Between the amazing art, the memorable characters (such as Woodle Tree, Woodle pops, the wavy men, and long cat), and the overall solitary feel of a true hero's journey portrayed through this game, I'm sure experts will be studying Woodle Tree Adventures for many years to come.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116490436', 'num_games_owned': 593, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 89, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1460379911}
review:
Woodle Tree Adventures...Ein "Spiel", dass wie Super Mario sein m√∂chte. Leider ist einiges schief gelaufen. Das Prinzip ist ganz einfach: Man ist ein braunes Ding(?) und muss Tr√§nen aufsammeln um ins n√§chste Level zu kommen. Damit man dort auch Tr√§nen aufsammeln kann. Woher die Tr√§nen stammen? Wahrscheinlich von den Beta-Testern... falls es welche gab.


[h1] My first Unity-Game [/h1]

Das Spiel f√ºhlt sich wie ein Testspiel von einem unerfahrenen Programmierer an. Es wurde leider kaum Arbeit reingesteckt. Man kann nur "springen" (wenn man das so bezeichen darf, aber dazu kommen wir sp√§ter), "laufen" und mit seinem Blatt andere Kreaturen ber√ºhren, so dass diese meistens verschwinden. Dazu hat das Spiel eine Menge Bugs. Man kann durch W√§nde laufen, spawnt im Nichts und Checkpoints werden oft nicht geladen, um ein paar Bugs zu nennen.  W√§re das Spiel wie der Goat Simulator, k√∂nnte man √ºber die Fehler lachen... leider sind diese in diesem Spiel eher zum weinen.

[h1] "Springen" und "Laufen" [/h1]

Woodle Tree Adventues ist ein Platformer. Wie wir alle (hoffentlich) wissen, ist in solchen Spielen die Steuerung sehr wichtig. Wie will man einen Platformer spielen, in dem man nicht richtig laufen und springen kann? Tja, das habe ich mich bei Woodle Tree Adventures auch gefragt!

[h1] Musik und Grafik [/h1]

Die Grafik sieht auf den ersten Blick ganz nett aus, vor allem die Shader. Leider sind die Shader deshalb so sch√∂n, weil das Spiel mit Unity gemacht wurde. Also kein Meisterwerk vom Fabio. Der Sound ist mehr schlecht als Recht. Langweiliges Rumgedudel, mehr ist es leider nicht. Ohrenkrebs kriegt man davon zum Gl√ºck nicht.

[h1] [u] Fazit [/u] [/h1]

Oh Mann... Woodle Tree Adventures ist einfach nur schlecht. Ich habe mich wirklich bem√ºht, das Spiel zu m√∂gen, leider ohne Erfolg. Die nervige Musik, die Bugs und die Steurung sind einfach nicht gut genug. Schade!

[h1] [u] Wertung [/u] [/h1]

Spielspa√ü: 5/50 -Das Spiel macht keinen Spa√ü/ -Dauerfrust

Grafik: 8/20 -Ganz nette Grafiken/ -Manches nicht selbst gemacht

Sound: 2/10 -Nervige Musik/ -Kaum Unmgebungsger√§usche 

Support: 5/10 -Keine Updates/ -Ab und zu Gewinnspiele vom Entwickler

Technik: 4/10 -Nichts besonderes/ -Gute Performance

[h1] 24/100 [/h1]


[i] Folge doch dem Kuratorprogramm der [url=steamcommunity.com/groups/-German_Gamer_Community-#curation] German_Gamer_Community [/url] f√ºr mehr Reviews! [/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198101737799', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1463412029}
review: Balanced and fair combat system, it's very engaging for the player. The deep story keeps the player on edge. With a story the likes of TellTale, The Last of Us and Life is Strange combined. It's difficulty only adds to the fun because you can explore the same level multiple times and it's very fun. The function of this games camera is to limit your view which is a deep metaphor for reality. The fact that the levels are so long and you work forever just to lose everything to something you couldnt avoid really symbolizes life and its many cruelties. 100/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198083454446', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 246, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 107, 'last_played': 1474831581}
review:
In a world where all of the citizens are dying of starvation and water deprovation, you're wise father tells you to save the kingdom by murdering all of the peasents that stole from your father in the past. The Fairy tears are spread across the land and are proven to be a powerful addiction for some of the enemies, corrupting them and tearing their lives apart. You, as the brave woodle assassin must save your father's fallen kingdom by murdering Snowy enemies and collecting berries to build up your resources.

 During your adventure you will find many evil beings who have been corrupted by the fairy tears for example, a group of satan worshipping white dots that wear candy corn hats and a green apple man who (due to childhood abuse and drug problems) chases after you until he falls over and starts crying. There is an octopus that mistakes you for your father and yells at you because your father murdered his family years ago. Later in the game you encounter a small group of sugar cubes wearing yellow diapers that walk in circles. If you walk up to them you will notice that they are just enjoying their day. The game leaves you with a choice of either to attack them or leave them be. If you choose to murder them, they will fall to the ground crying "Why are you hitting me?!" Your character picks up his metal leaf and shoves it down his throat. This was possibly the most graphic scene in the game in my opinion. You continue through the game stealing food and murdering your fathers enemies.


The end of the game is a final battle with the mob boss named "Woodlbeevur" who murders your father with an axe and continues to try to attack you. (Spoilers) To beat this boss you must gather all of the Fairy tears and throw them and Woodlbeevur until he drops to the ground crying. Then you must rip his head off of his body and place it above your fireplace back at your woodle house. The final scene in the game shows you (The woodle assassin) crying over your father's grave and screaming "WHY?!" as the game slowly fades to black. The credits roll in to a fantastic soundtrack overture, showing all of the hard work put into this masterpiece until the credits end on "Follow me on twitter!" with no escape other that force quitting the game leaving you (The player) to decide what happens next. Does it represent the unescapable forces of life its self? Or does it represent the depression in murder and the consequences of disobeying the law. Truly something to think about for an eternity. 

This is not a game,  this is an experience. The open world is as large as GTA V or Fallout 3 and the story is as rich as The Last of Us. Thank you for this game, and thank you for this experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025491516', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1406235225}
review:
Armed with nary but a leaf in his arsenal, Woodle stands before a foreboding world filled with obstacles to try and hinder his path on the way to claiming the world's berries for his own.

The world continues in its hindrance by requiring said berries to unlock levels with more berries. 

This game is a metaphor for life in that we are in a constant search for means to our own ends which in itself is but a means to a different end.

Fabio Ferrara did a wonderful job in portraying this and I wish him well in his future projects.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024427966', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1462050831}
review:
This game is one of the best out there. In my humble opinion, it is not only a game of the year title, it's also a game of the millenium. It's simply a whiff of fresh air into the PC gaming industry. This game, ''Woodle Tree Adventures'' can easily compete with AAA titles like The Witcher 3, which I simply adore. The only thing this game lacks is a sequel. A bigger, better sequel worth 10 cent instead of 5. Something that will just sweep the opposition from the face of our very earth.

If you have any doubts - don't. This game is all that you are looking for, combined into a gem, a game of the year 2015. The graphics, the gameplay, the sound works... Just... Beautiful.

Rating this game 10 out of 10 is simply an understatement. This game is far beyond any rating scale known to a mere mortal like me.

I love it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068014745', 'num_games_owned': 306, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 429, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 428, 'last_played': 1453271775}
review:
Great story and immersive gameplay. I was simply blown away, and I knew that I was hooked. Blown away by the amazing art style, the immersive music and sounds, and of course, the incredible story. 

This game has so many memorable moments, from shocking discoveries, to simple, enjoyable moments of relaxation. A lot of the beauty in this game comes from the amount of vivid and serene scenes that one will see as they progress through the story. These moments are nicely sprinked throughout the experience. So many of these things add up to make this my favorite and most enjoyed game of all time. 

+Beautiful, vivid art style 
+Amazing soundtrack
+Characters that feel very much alive in their own ways
+Good amount of replayability
+Gripping and extensine storytelling; you won't want to stop playing
+A variety of smaller things that tie the whole experience together

-Other various bugs that I'm sure will be worked out in time

TLDR - If you like immersive worlds and grand storytelling, buy this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198047847157', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1467672355}
review:
I don't understand why the reviews are so negative...

Pros:
-The landscape is so pleasing I spent a long time looking at them in the beginning. Not at all was I thinking "Why can't I leave? Am I supposed to hit a key on the keyboard? If so it's not telling me so I guess I'll press keys randomly!"
-Creative enemies. Never would I have thought to have a piece of popcorn with a party hat and 4 orange tenticles be an enemy.
-Deku tree like in Zelda. Unlike in Legend of Zelda where you just trap fairies instead of freeing them, he wants you to gather their tears... (Why are games so mean to fairies?)
-The animations. The protagonist thing has a sick strut as he walks that you get to see throughout the game.

Cons:
-With a price so low, it's CRAAAAZY!

10/10 Would slap people with a leaf again.

review:
I'm not gonna waste any more time with this game, so here's a review in short.

Pros:
- Cute graphics.
- There's some kind of progression.

Cons:
- Awful, awful camera.
- I don't feel in control. The character feels slidey and it's hard to judge where you're gonna land after jumping.
- Checkpoints. They either don't exist or they only work sometimes.
- The jumping animation is broken. You tilt 90 degrees backwards when you jump, and if you chain it you literally start bouncing on your head.
- THE NOISE. GOOD CHRIST, THE NOISE. Every time you jump or use your weapon, the character makes a really annoying noise. Picture a child saying "heh" while giving a short, sharp, pathetic grunt. Every. Single. Time.
- You have to hold down the run button. Your finger will quickly tire.
- You have to be pretty much touching enemies to kill them. 90% of the time, you either die or kill it [i]and[/i] die.

There's probably more to it, in both pros and cons, but I couldn't bear more than 20 minutes of it. By 10 minutes it was already a slog, and by 20 minutes I literally just didn't have the motivation to carry on. On the plus side, at least I know how to refund a game on Steam now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024255356', 'num_games_owned': 450, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 81, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1446153144}
review:
I can definitely recommend it on a deal, especially right now for 5 cents. It's quite a short game, I've just beaten it in one sitting. But I didn't expect it to be very long. It's a cute game with bright colors and peaceful (albeit often unfitting) music. There are, however, a few problems with the game. The main problem, which you will notice right away, is how the camera works. It's very situational. It can give you a nice angle at times, but others it'll make it rather difficult to tell where you're going to land when you jump. The second problem, which is the one that annoyed me the most, is this: When you walk or run off the edge of a platform, no matter what, you will perpetually move in the direction you were facing until you either hit the ground or fall to your death. It's a very annoying bug that can easily ruin the fun.
But again, I can look past these problems since I've only paid 5 cents. The game gets much easier once you upgrade your leaf, since you obtain a projectile attack and don't have to get so close to enemies. Do check it out.

review:
You're not a 6 years old child? NO WORRIES! This game will help you becoming one!
Really, this game is made for kids, but if I were a kid and played this, I would be so happy!
I'm 17 years old right now, but this game, for like 20 mins, stole my last 11 years and I was happy asf. The music chilled me out and the game ain't that easy many say. Finding and collecting all items is a bit harder than finding the clothes I wanna wear among the many I have around the room. I let you understand you need a good eye, especially with that crazy camera that does whatever it wants. 
However, I see no real reason to not recommend Woodle Tree Adventures, as I see no real reason to not play this game and take it seriously.




Unless you're over 10.

review: Woodle changed my life. My family saw me play and finally let me have dinner for the first time in weeks! People started noticing me and it's all because of this game. Oh, and not only is it life changing, it also if co-op! I have people lining up at my door to play with me! All thanks to woodle. Thank you Fabio Ferrara and Chubby Pixel for helping me have a life again, your game is amazing!

author: {'steamid': '76561198097629737', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 196, 'last_played': 1520753026}
review:
Things Woodle Tree Adventures does right:
-Cute Style and interesting character design
-Bright worlds with a decent enough amount of variety
-Those block guys who cry when you hit them

Things Woodle Tree Adventures could improve:
-Music is nice but get's repetitive quickly (would be nice to get some bouncier more energetic tracks)
-Killing enemies serves little purpose and doesn't feel satisfying (Most of them don't even try and hurt you and they make no noise while alive or dying. Also they all only take one hit even the big ones. An achievement similar to the 1'000 berries one could also remedy this nicely)
-Collecting berries after a while feels pointless (Could use an in level counter in one of the corners to show how many you've accumulated. Also berries really aren't used for much except for unlocking a couple levels and items)
-Exploration should be rewarded (A lot of times I'd find a secret little area and everytime I'd think it would be great if there was something here even if it was just an extra berry)
-Weapon upgrades don't feel very noticeable (Yes your projectile goes farther but all the creatures only take one hit to kill)
-Controls feel a little slippery and the world feels weightless making it hard to gauge where exactly you'll land when jumping. (Aside from a few clumps Woodle really has no effect on the enviroment)
-Could use more levels
-Boss fights wouldn't hurt


If I had to describe Woodle Tree Adventures in a word it'd be: complex. WTA is a short 3-D collect-a-thon platformer (reminiscent of Mario 64 and Banjo Kazooie) as much as it is a coming of age story. I won't get into the meat of the story but Woodle is sent on a life threatening quest to gather the fabled Fairy Tears and a crap ton of berries all while  trying to prove himself to his Father the Deku Tree. In this quest he encounters terrifying enemies such as Caterpillars, Candy Corn People and a couple really tall guys. There are 6 different levels rich in colour and interesting in design, as well as a few unlockable weapons (Although the don't differ much, I actually still have no idea what the headband does.) You can also bring a buddy along as a beaver to help you collect your berries. On the surface WTA is a cute platforming adventure you can waste a couple hours in, but at it's core WTA is a deep philosophical journey and a look at today's society as a whole. You collect berries monotonously as an allegory for everyday life, there are also underlying themes of surpassing your elders and whether giving up on your dreams to take up their mantle is the right choice. 

In the end though there are a lot of things wrong with WTA and a lot of things right I have to give it a 6/10. I hope a Woodle Tree  Adventures 2 is in the works and if so the developer takes my criticisms to heart.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058075753', 'num_games_owned': 130, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 394, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 237, 'last_played': 1455637550}
review:
This might be the best game on Steam. IT'S SO WEIRD BUT IT'S AMAZING. I have no idea why I'm playing this game. It's not something that a 25 year old man should play. IT'S NOT. It's more like a child's game BUT I CAN'T RESIST IT. IT'S SO RELAXING AND CUTE. It just does not blend in with the rest of the games in my library. 

It's so simple, you can have a heart attack. Ahem

>> You are this little tree stump (small tree, infant tree, CHILD TREE, TREE CHILD WHATEVER)
>> Your father (being the HUGE tree with a moustache he is)
>> tells you to collect water for this world.

>> So that's what you do. Why? Because your father SAID SO. That's right. Off you go to collect water.
>> Your father also tells you to collect berries too. So you do just that. Yeah. Yes father.

>> On your journeys to collect water and berries, you have 3 functions. Jumping, attacking, and moving. Attacking is not mandatory (Everything is cute afterall.)
>> There are CUTE enemies all over the place. There is nothing ugly in this game. I had a hard time hitting the enemies.

THAT'S IT. THIS IS THE GAME. THAT'S WHAT THE GAME IS. YOU COLLECT BERRIES AND WATER, AND THEN YOU RETURN HOME. THAT IS IT. THERE IS NOTHING TO IT. YET YOU COME BACK TO PLAY MORE. IT'S JUST AMAZING I DON'T BELIEVE IT I MIGHT ACTUALLY GO SEE A SHRINK ABOUT THIS :3

Also, the game is 5 cents right now. So buy it and you will make a profit : 3

DO I RECOMMEND THIS GAME? FUCK YES

review: I'm really conflicted wether I should recommend this or not. It has really cute asthetics and a graphic style I wish they develop on and make more games. But it has a number of problems: clunky controls, bad camera angles and infuriating checkpoints often you will have to start from the beginning again. Length of the game is just what I wanted from this game but in the 80 minutes I spent beating this game I still quit 2 times because of these problems I've listed before. Look at the pretty pictures and watch someone else play instead if you want to see a cute game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066000760', 'num_games_owned': 365, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 97, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1454732582}
review: This game changed my life for the better. I used to cut before i saw the endless happiness that is woodle. Never before have i laughed at cried at and loved a game or character more than woodle. The story is immersive and the charcters and enemies are so amazingly detailed it made me feel like i was in the game in real life. My friend all asked me to pay 5 cents for them so they could experience this true happiness, but i had to keep sending them to myself. If youare thinking about committing suicide or licking a bunch of dogs buy this game!!!! It teaches you the value of friendship and not to beat your stick blueballs

author: {'steamid': '76561198062575998', 'num_games_owned': 135, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 35, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1445997638}
review:
As a platformer game is not that bad. The graphics are just fine and the sountrack makes a good match with them.
However the controls are wonky, I played with a controller though, but even with it the way you are moving is pretty much uncomfortable(I did not try using the keyboard).
Another problem is the camera. You cannot control it. You only can zoom in/out which is almost pointless.

Taking all this into account I can (with some regrets) recommend this game. I will also suggest to buy it with a discount.

Overallscore 6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198088164161', 'num_games_owned': 1114, 'num_reviews': 176, 'playtime_forever': 58, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1446057210}
review:
Please don't go through the torture I went through...

Woodle Tree Adventures is a cute platformer looking like a 3D platformer with berrys that you need to collect I saw someone say there was 16 hours of gameplay so I bought it...R.I.P me this game takes less then a hour to beat and the camera never works and will break and glitch everywhere you cant move at all when jumping most of the time causing me to fall and have to go back to the beggining of the leval agian and again. There isn't much to talk about other then the camera and controlls that just ruined everything also theres 7 worlds or 8 not 6 XD Oh yah the multiplayer crashes when ever I try to use it. Nothing else to talk about this is a great platformerer beat to the ground by camera issues glitches and 1 hour or less of gameplay

review:
Woodle Tree Adventures se basa en controlar a un tronco con ojos donde debes completar los diferentes niveles recolectando gotas de lluvia.

Sus mec√°nicas son simples, esto hace que su jugabilidad sea agradable.
La dificultad de los niveles va aumentando a medida que avanza el juego.

Obtuve el juego de manera gratuita y, por lo visto, est√° eliminado de la tienda oficial de Steam. Si por alguna de aquellas eres capaz de encontrarlo en alguna otra p√°gina externa... Lo recomiendo, te asegurar√°s unas horas de juego.

review: For the 5 cents I've paid to play this game, it was quite lovely. The graphics are nice and cute and the music is quite relaxing. The controls are a bit getting used to, but that isn't such a problem. The only thing which bothered me were the messed up angles and "checkpoints" somewhere along the game. Other than that, it's definitely worth 5 cents - especially because I'll be selling my trading cards on the market for a higher price than I've got the game itself.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048701767', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1445943017}
review:
This game is a well crafted platformer that shows the pinnacle achievement of all award winning platformers. It takes all great ideas such as fixed camera angles, no checkpoints (hardcore) and a easy to learn but hard to master combat system. The combat system may seem simple at first because there is only an attack button, but with hours of training and mastering you will be able to perform the sikkest combos such as jump attack. 
Every level is well designed and adds a great sense of immersion to it, they feel genuine and there are many hidden secrets such as apples being hidden in a house with no doors.


Finally this game conveys a deep message that is a problem at the core of society, it teaches us that robbing other peoples water and leaving to them is justified as you must save your father. These ethics and values teach us that love for our own family comes at a great price and is a necessary sacrifice, although you could share the water with all the other citizens, why do that when you can beat them up with your magical leaf and hog all the shit for yourself?

Under the many layers of content, like an onion, you will need to peel every piece of skin off and discover a whole new world, a whole new meaning of life. And like an onion, your eyes will swell up and tear drops will slowly roll down your cheeks.
-11/10 IGN a truly magical journey that should be made compulsory for all people to play

author: {'steamid': '76561198155818165', 'num_games_owned': 27, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1446937135}
review: For those of you that complain about this game, you would have never made it playing games in the '90's. When I first looked at the pictures of the games before I bought it, the first thought that went through my mind was how much it resembled the Nintendo 64 games of the '90's. Yes, the tree at the beginning is VERY recognizable, and the story so far pretty much is a throw back to the '90's gaming. It's basically, "Hi, I'm your Dad. Now, go do this for me because I'm dying." It is really frustrating, addictive, and VERY fun. The enemies are fairly easy to defeat, but so are you. Not all of the NPC's are enemies though. The friendly NPC's usually look t you and question why you hitting them. Can't wait to play this more.
