author: {'steamid': '76561198075983062', 'num_games_owned': 181, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 153, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 144, 'last_played': 1590414545}
review:
Disclaimer: I bought this game for 5 euro cents.
Review: This game is just bad. At first I saw some potential in it because the art style seemed interessting.But then I actually started playing the game. The first major issue is that you do not control your own camera angle. Often times I was stuck somewhere just because the camera chose the most inappropriate angle for the situation.
   Secondly, the controls are extremely clunky almost to the point where the game is completely unplayable. What's more the game displays the depth pretty inaccurately. At some points I couldn't make a jump because I thought i was at the same level as the platform (although this may be caused by the poor camera angles).
   The game just feels unfinished. I am really sad to say this, as I saw some potential in it. The only redeeming factor for this game is that you can make a profit from the trading cards(because it is 5 cents as of writing this review). Other than that there is no real purpose of buying it.

review:
I bought this game for five cents with the intention of unlocking the steam cards only. I ended up trying it and I beat it in 47 minutes and had fun (with the exception of the horrid camera and depth perception). I can recommend this game at a 5 cent price, but I cannot recommend this game at a retail price. In short this reminds me of a really bad nintendo game or concept game. 

 I really don't know if I should thumbs up or down... I will recommend it if you somehow fit into the category above, if you are looking for a real gaming experience tho this is not it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049832291', 'num_games_owned': 202, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 149, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1464988804}
review:
This game is meant for a younger audience it seems and should be reviewed accordingly. Having said that, I am a 28yo female and I still found it quite amusing ^.^ Its a nice change of pace from Darks Souls / Smite etc "serious" games. This game is serious as well. But it's comparatively easier. 

- The enemies don't respawn, they have a decent variety and types, some are passive, some are just objects and some are aggressive. They are easy to defeat if you get the timing right. There's sufficient time to correct a mistake but they're not so easy that you can keep whacking the attack and get away with it.

- There are check points which are far enough from where you died to still maintain the platforming challenge but not too far to make it annoying.

- The level design is nice. It has different features and the game overall is quite creatively made.

- The camera is scripted but you can move it and enjoy the game. This game requires patience, and I mean that in a good way. When you arrive on a platform, take your time to judge where things are before leaping. I think its a good lesson for kids (and even some adults)

- Graphics are nice and cute.

- Soundtrack is nice too, this game isn't meant to be played for hours on end consecutively, if you keep your playtime limited to a level, it won't annoy you.

- You can't skip through / speed up dialogues (probably intended as a reading excericse maybe?)

Overall - 8 / 10.

[h1]STILL A BETTER COMBAT SYSTEM THEN ALL OF ASSASIN'S CREED NOOB FRIENDLY GAMES.[\h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198083400292', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 110, 'playtime_forever': 42, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1446321555}
review: Parto dicendo che l'ho pagato solo 0,05, si lo so non avevo proprio un cazzo da fare!.Partiamo recensendo questo Woodle Tree Adventures!.Allora ragazzi vi dico subito che per ora ho giocato solo il primo livello ho gi√† le idee chiare su come √® strutturato questo gioco, per√≤ quando finir√≤ il gioco rifar√≤ un ulteriore recensione dove spiego meglio!.Come gioco sarebbe una sorta di PlatForm dove lo scopo sar√† quello di raccogliere tutte le mele ("CIT ZEB":MA LISCIAMI LE MELE SUDICIO!) e evitare tutti gli zombie e/o ammazzarli e arrivare alla fine del livello.Una volta fatto tutto ci√≤ si sbloccher√† sempre il livello seguente.La trama da quel poco che ho capito √® che tu sei un albero e dovrai raccogliere tutte le mele e portarle al grande albero cio√® tuo padre.Che dire, come gioco per perdere tempo √® grazioso, diciamo che √® pi√π un gioco per bambini oppure un gioco per uno che ha voglia di perdere tempo (come me), il gameplay √® molto facile da capire SALTA, CORRI, SCHIVA e UCCIDI! quindi diciamo che ha tante basi per passare, poi √® sempre un gioco da 0,05 non ci possiamo aspettare una miniera d'oro!.L'unica cosa che ci tenevo a dire √® che la visuale sul personaggio √® sballata, ogni minuto dovrete stare l√¨ a metterla a posto.Che dire...si salva, se avete intezione di perdere tempo, questo gioco f√† al caso vostro!.Buon Gameplay! 6.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198059363694', 'num_games_owned': 524, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 5, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1445892189}
review:
This game was 5 cents. I bought 10 copies. Was it worth it? Let's see what Robert Frost thinks.

A Considerable Speck
by Robert Frost

A speck that would have been beneath my sight
On any but a paper sheet so white
Set off across what I had written there.
And I had idly poised my pen in air
To stop it with a period of ink
When something strange about it made me think,
This was no dust speck by my breathing blown,
But unmistakably a living mite
With inclinations it could call its own.
It paused as with suspicion of my pen,
And then came racing wildly on again
To where my manuscript was not yet dry;
Then paused again and either drank or smelt--
With loathing, for again it turned to fly.
Plainly with an intelligence I dealt.
It seemed too tiny to have room for feet,
Yet must have had a set of them complete
To express how much it didn't want to die.
It ran with terror and with cunning crept.
It faltered: I could see it hesitate;
Then in the middle of the open sheet
Cower down in desperation to accept
Whatever I accorded it of fate.
I have none of the tenderer-than-thou
Collectivistic regimenting love
With which the modern world is being swept.
But this poor microscopic item now!
Since it was nothing I knew evil of
I let it lie there till I hope it slept.

I have a mind myself and recognize
Mind when I meet with it in any guise
No one can know how glad I am to find
On any sheet the least display of mind.

4/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198046731487', 'num_games_owned': 2298, 'num_reviews': 128, 'playtime_forever': 125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1447130921}
review:
Good thing dying has no consequences, cause this game lacks shadows and has terrible camera controls.
Get ready to walk off ledges and into enemies as you collect berries and fairy tears to save the world/forest/your home.

It's not a hard game, it's a frustrating game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000641438', 'num_games_owned': 150, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 177, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 177, 'last_played': 1433680071}
review:
It was a free game, so for a long time i have circled around it, whether to play or not. It was in my library anyway so one day i took the courage to start it and it was suprisingly fun. 
For the 100% i needed only maps and one glitch, but i was worth it. 
Dont expect much and it will turn out to be a pretty good platforming game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198107344519', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 39, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1501872433}
review: This game had a cool concept but it was very poorly done. The camera angles are horendous because it's so difficult to control. The graphics in the games are pretty mediocre even if you crank up the graphic settings to fantastic. Also, it's like this game has no checkpoint system what so ever because when you try to hit an enemy (which is frustrating because of the camera) with your leaf, they either die in 1 hit or they hit you and you get spawned at the beginning of the map. Don't spend your precious 3 dollars on this. Either get when it's free, or just don't get it at all.

author: {'steamid': '76561198239666730', 'num_games_owned': 508, 'num_reviews': 177, 'playtime_forever': 192, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 192, 'last_played': 1440811013}
review: Okay, I know you're  probably tired of hearing the same review for this game like "Omg can't handle the camera angles!" or "Can't see where I'm going!" Well I just need to put these myths to rest. Yes this game does have some pretty terrible camera angles perhaps the worst I've ever seen. But it is literally the only thing that makes this game any sort of challenge. With infinite attempts, no collectibles and no traps, you wonder through a few worlds in very simple graphics and you forget why you're playing the game. It's a 3-D platformer that resembles a low-budget mario game. This game kept me occupied and I didn't hate the time I spent on it. I'd say buy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049105851', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 191, 'playtime_forever': 102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 102, 'last_played': 1440724964}
review:
Oh my... Where does one even begin with Woodle Tree Adventures? I think someone left me a Christmas gift early, because I love tearing the crap out of these horrible games! I got this game purely because my mate told me that it was a horrible game, and I looked at the trailer and screenshots and thought, "Oh. It can't be that bad! It looks like a fun little casual game!" So when it went down to $.35, I decided to check it out, and oh... my god. My mate was so very right. This game is just awful. Don't be fooled by the cute and nice-looking graphics, this game is one of the worst games you can get on Steam! Not as bad as Ankh or Kane and Lynch, but I'd still avoid this game, crucifix clutched in my hand.

The biggest problems from Woodle Tree Adventures spawn mainly from the level design. It's really crappy. The first level is direct enough for you to know what paths of the level veer off a tad so you can grab the three magic tears (whatever the hell they are), and still make it to the end with all three and not have to back-track. All the other levels are the exact opposite. The design is so vague, that you end up just casually walking down one of the branching paths, thinking you'll find a tear, but end up finding the three tear basins and having to go all the way back to where you came from, which can be a real annoyance. 

The platforming in this game is also very rough. The camera locks in this strange position that tries to make it look like a Mario-style side-scroller, but it's very clear precisely where you need to land, and the way the camera is locked will often have you missing and falling to your death (or even worse... walking all the way back up to try again!) And if it isn't the camera that will be hindering you from making that jump, it'll be the actual ruddy jump itself! Woodle Tree (I think that's the protagonist's name. I'd preferably call him Wooden S.O.B.) handles about as clunky as a metal trashcan with pots and pans strapped to it and about as slippery as a slightly dried banana. His jump can very from just-the-right-height to completely-off depending on whether Woodle feels like it or not (Sprinting usually helps. Sometimes.) And he also slides just a little, so if you're planning on landing on that very small platform... you'll be doing that jump at least five more times till Woodle can keep his bloody feet actually on it.

The lack of HUD can make the game feel even more vague. Collecting berries often seemed like a fruitless task without showing a little number up on the screen. So I'd have to keep turning off the game then back on, to go back to Woodle's house and see the actual number. "But why would you need berries?" you may ask, potenial buyer. "F*** if I know!" I'd reply, "I just get them because there's nothing else to do!" You need berries because if you get so many... you get a new leaf! Specifically, if you get up to 800 berries, you get a yellow, orange, and white leaf. And what do they do? Exactly the same thing! They blast a thingy that kills an enemy from the distance. The only thing that actually changes is the shape of the projectile and it's color. Personally, I think the change is asinine, as the green leaf can kill literally ANY enemy in one swipe. That's what I call real challenge right there! If you get 850 berries (which is a very odd number, in retrospect) you get a bandana. "Why would you want a bandana?" you may ask again. "F*** if I know!" I'd repeat, "But it looks cool when you jump!"

And, again, if you think those graphics look so cute.... you'll be having seconds thoughts when you play the game- as it tends to make a lot of... mistakes. The animations are way off- particularly on Woodle. When he turns, he does it so exact. Like a computer program being told turn precisely ninety degrees left. It just seems unnatural and bothers me. Woodle's feet also glide off the ground when he walks, and when he jumps... he can oftentimes nearly stick his feet all the way up in the air- doing a 180 and back before landing on a platform three feet higher than them. Woodle, as you may assume, is very agile- of course. There's also this weird enemy who walks on these long legs like he has Monkey Butt, and when you kill him, it almost looks like he was blasted back by a rocket onto his tuchas. Another graphical problem is Woodle's berry bag. The more berries you pick up, the bigger it gets. But the bigger it gets- the more it turns into a balloon encompassing the space around it, whether it be a wall nearby or Woodle himself.

You'd think there'd be more intelligent thought put into this game. Like maybe, the more berries you get the better. But it'll weigh you down, as your bag gets more full. Or the water may push you back towards the edge a little as you walk through it (instead of pathetically slowing you down). Or maybe there would be platforms that fall out as you stand on them longer. Or maybe if you die, you go back the start (as WTA has trouble remembering where to respawn you whenever you die. Sometimes I'd end up at the start, sometimes I'd end up five feet from where I died), and lose some of your berries. But that's far too challenging for a game like this! So the developers just tones and dumbed everything down into a monotonous mess that feels far longer than the 100 minutes I spent beating the story and getting the 850 berries (because there's no way in hell I'm going for that 3000 berry achievement). And yeah, the story is simple and sparse. Get tears, a tree with a beard is happy. The end.

This game is bad in terms of graphics, sound, design, and story. The only slightly redeeming element would be the graphics since for the duration of the game they do look nice. But everything else in this game is just so poorly done, it drags down the whole experience until you're done the game and you realise how many precious minutes you've wasted by staring at a screen, bored. The screen looks nice, though

author: {'steamid': '76561198056592125', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 37, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1442074370}
review:
Now you might think ''he only has 13 minutes so he couldn't possible know anything about this game''

 But What the fuck did you just fucking say about me, you little bitch? I‚Äôll have you know I graduated top of my class in the Navy Seals, and I‚Äôve been involved in numerous secret raids on Al-Quaeda, and I have over 300 confirmed kills. I am trained in gorilla warfare and I‚Äôm the top sniper in the entire US armed forces. You are nothing to me but just another target. I will wipe you the fuck out with precision the likes of which has never been seen before on this Earth, mark my fucking words. You think you can get away with saying that shit to me over the Internet? Think again, fucker. As we speak I am contacting my secret network of spies across the USA and your IP is being traced right now so you better prepare for the storm, maggot. The storm that wipes out the pathetic little thing you call your life. You‚Äôre fucking dead, kid. I can be anywhere, anytime, and I can kill you in over seven hundred ways, and that‚Äôs just with my bare hands. Not only am I extensively trained in unarmed combat, but I have access to the entire arsenal of the United States Marine Corps and I will use it to its full extent to wipe your miserable ass off the face of the continent, you little shit. If only you could have known what unholy retribution your little ‚Äúclever‚Äù comment was about to bring down upon you, maybe you would have held your fucking tongue. But you couldn‚Äôt, you didn‚Äôt, and now you‚Äôre paying the price, you goddamn idiot. I will shit fury all over you and you will drown in it. You‚Äôre fucking dead, kiddo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071995112', 'num_games_owned': 820, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 63188, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12161, 'last_played': 1685270837}
review:
So enjoyable that I added the developer to ask about preordering the sequel, Woodle Tree Adventures 2.

A word for those people who don't want to figure out the controls;
Move your mouse forward on the mousepad to see directly infront of you, move it backwards to see woodle from a birds eye view (to see things infront of you)

The game is most enjoyable when you take it slow and enjoy the scenery, and take your time to move and get the jumps right.

To keep this review nice, I will continue to play the game at least once every week.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=659598460

Hope the screenshot helps with the validity of this review.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116517331', 'num_games_owned': 3240, 'num_reviews': 302, 'playtime_forever': 249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 249, 'last_played': 1440870790}
review:
This might make for a decent children's game were it not for the fact that the camera is so poor.  It's a good example of why indie studios generally make 2d platformers and not 3d platformers like WTA.

On the plus side, it's a colorful game and fairly easy, with easy steam achievements.  It's also cheap and often offered for free here and there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198110455465', 'num_games_owned': 387, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 776, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 126, 'last_played': 1709420865}
review:
I have not many negatives to say about this game. Its adorable and cute, basic and easy, I enjoyed my time playing this. Mostly, I want to make sure I give the game credit for its basic controls and cute nature, because its one of the few games I could teach my baby brother how to play. This game changed a six year old's idea of games. It went from "Lets go down stairs and play Wii!" into "Can I play Woodles with you on your computer?"

If you play massive and popular games like Pay Day or Call of Duty this isn't for you. This is cutesy and adorable. Camera can glitch but consider it part of the challenge to the game. Its not challenging and its relaxing to not get frustrated. The cute basic storyline, the cute characters and "bad guys" and the maps make the game fun

Though the campaign was short and there wasn't a whole lot to the game it worked in its favor. Its simplicity made it easy to get into and enjoyable.

I can figure that this game isn't everyones cup of tea, but this was well worth the $3.

I believe these developers have alot of good ideas, especially with their other game The Way of Life. Consider me a fan and keep up the good work dev's.

review:
Ehm... Nop.
I got it on Humble Bundle and decided to give it a try, I don't mind it being boring (I mean, boring is subjective) but the thing is, it's irritating. It takes like 15 minutes each level because the camera simply won't take it easy on you and then you die, and then you have to run thorugh all the level again and do all the blind jumps again, and probably die again. Unless you're some sort of extreme coordinated expert gamer. But I don't think these people would be looking at this game... And then, after those terrible 15 minutes, the next level is just exactly the same. Yay! And let's not even get started on the achievements... I mean, 3000 berries? What? Am I suppose to repeat every level 5 times or something? ????

It's appealing to younger people, for sure, but my 10 yo little cousin couldn't play it because it was too hard to control the character, so...

author: {'steamid': '76561198000805162', 'num_games_owned': 3516, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1438420401}
review:
If there was any QA in the development of this game it doesn't show.
[*]Graphical glitches.
[*]Easily repeatable bugs found within seconds of playing.
[*]Poor 3D controls.
[*]Very little direction.
[*]Enemies and NPCs undefined.
[*]Unforgivably bad camera.

The only thing this game has going for it is the art direction (which is pretty cute and stylish), however that failed to translate to the actual assets so everything looks like a blocky mess.

I can't in good conscience recommend this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020385919', 'num_games_owned': 1478, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 211, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 87, 'last_played': 1473368242}
review:
Woodle Tree Adventures √© um jogo  simples,divertido e com um mundo diferente e √∫nico que o jogo pode lhe oferecer.

Woodle Tree Adventures √© um jogo ao estilo Super Mario 64 e Banjoo-Kazzoie,que tenta trazer a era empolgante do Nintendo 64,o jogo usa muito o recurso de explora√ß√£o,o jogador ira achar berrys que servem para abrir novos upgrades para nosso personagem e as lagrimas de fadas no qual √© o objetivo principal para se passar de fase.

A historia do jogo √© bem simples,por algum motivo esta havendo uma enorme seca no mundo e uma velha arvore lhe entrega a miss√£o de recuperar as lagrimas de fada para que a terra volte a ter √°gua e a ter vida novamente,nisso nosso her√≥is √© enviado a 6 tipos de mundos diferentes para recuperar as lagrimas,cada mundo contem 3 lagrimas no qual √© obrigat√≥rio pega-las para passar dos n√≠veis.

O interresante desse jogo √© sua trilha simples e suas fases coloridas e diferentes,o que da o toque perfeito para o tipo de jogo que Woodle oferece,tamb√©m existe o modo multiplayer que fica mais engra√ßado e divertido jogando junto com um amigo.

Mas Woodle √© um jogo um pouco problem√°tico,sua c√¢mera √© totalmente mal otimizada para o jogo,se tornando dif√≠cil de enxergar e controlar seus passos,o jogo n√£o tem dificuldade nenhuma sendo totalmente f√°cil de mais,existem peda√ßos do mapa jogados em lugares aleat√≥rios da fase,parecendo ter sido esquecido ou mal apagado do sistema,algumas fases s√£o bem mal feitas como a do gelo fazendo o jogador entrar dentro da neve a cada passo que o personagem faz.
Sinceramente a ideia do jogo √© muito boa e n√£o √© de t√£o mal assim,a continua√ß√£o do jogo esta sendo feito e ser√° lan√ßado em meados de 2016 e sinceramente estou empolgado para jogar ele,talvez agora com mais aprendizado,quem sabe Woodle tree Adventures 2 saia como realmente queremos que seja,como um super Mario 64 ou algo mais Nintendizado para os usu√°rios da Steam.

6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197981638563', 'num_games_owned': 4007, 'num_reviews': 517, 'playtime_forever': 151, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 151, 'last_played': 1436160969}
review:
It's hard to decide if I should recommend this one, or not. It isn't a bad game, that's for sure. Actually, I'd say that it's a pretty nice game for preschoolers. If you have a kid and want to introduce him / her to the world of video games, you may actually want to check this one up. It's a really simple and easy game that looks like it was made exactly for that reason - to introduce kids to gaming. It's even more simple than games like [b]The Munchables[/b] for [b]Nintendo Wii[/b]. It would be really hard to find something more simple and easy. And since it is also a very cute looking game, it's almost perfect for preschool children, who may find [b]Mario[/b] and [b]Donkey Kong[/b] games a bit tricky.

The idea is simple. [b]Woodle Tree Adventures[/b] is a typical [b]3D platform game[/b], in which you'll need to search for so-called [b]Fairy Tears[/b] to complete the levels. No boss fights, no complicated enemies (they look different, but actually all of them are the same exact thing that can be killed in one hit, no special strategy, no challenge, nothing), just some basic jumps and exploration. Which is nice for small children, but bad for adults. Unlike [b]Mario[/b] games, this one can't be called the game for the whole family. It's kids-only game. Nothing to see here for adults. But it isn't a bad thing. There's nothing wrong with kids-oriented games and platform game is nice for a change. After all, most of the games for preschoolers are so-called "educational games".

Unfortunately, there are two things that make me give this one a negative score. First, the terrible camera. Welcome back to [b]Nintendo 64[/b] times, ladies and gentlemen! That's exactly how it was back then. You can control camera to take a good look on levels and spot the key items (Remember [b]Nintendo Power[/b] times, when we were used to buy the magazines to get the level maps? Here you can just use zoom to see the whole level), but when you'll start moving, it'll be a royal pain in the neck. Sometimes camera will even make it impossible for you to see a thing. Which ruins most of the kids-oriented experience. Second, it's short. Really, [i]really[/i] short. You'll finish the whole game long before [b]Steam[/b] will start giving you [b]Trading Cards[/b], while quick run through the game will take about seven minutes. That's it, seven minutes to finish [i]the whole game[/i]. Plus like ten minutes to get all achievements (achievements hunters may find it interesting to get another game to their list of perfection in just the few minutes, but personally I can't see the point, since there's no challenge here).

So, all in all, this one is extremely simple and cute game for preschoolers, but poor camera and short length just kill it. If you have a kid, pick it up if you'll see it for the few cents on sale. If you don't, then skip it, since there's hardly anything for adult gamers here. It's way too simple. Go for [b]Mario[/b] instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561198137065965', 'num_games_owned': 601, 'num_reviews': 139, 'playtime_forever': 210, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 112, 'last_played': 1436213258}
review:
Review: Neutral

PROS:
took me about 2 hours to get 100% achievements (great for you farmers out there)
controls handle well on controller and WASD
great game for small children with patience, they would get a lot more than 2 hours gameplay from it

CONS:
absolutely no replay value past 100% achievements. there is nothing to do after you beat the game
beating the game takes less than 2 hours
typical sore face after all the face-palming a platformer causes

author: {'steamid': '76561198037076850', 'num_games_owned': 2264, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 96, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1435994142}
review:
If I were a kid I would enjoy it cuz I'm that kind of guy enjoy everything new to me...But I've played all Super Mario series so that I'm not fond of this unpolished game anymore.

It's an adventure-like platformer with horrible graphics(game released in 2014, not 2004) and bad level design. It has a catchy name makes me thinking about adventure but I'm frustrated with its camera view and enemies in the game. Also with that weird jump animation I'd like to say that it's good for oldschool punks.

Then here comes a paradox: If it's a game for kids, will they feel bored when they face the overpowering mobs? If it's a game for elder audience, will they play it ever?

So that's why they gave out this game as free.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045362376', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 42, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1435637457}
review:
2/5

Pros: Cute graphics, somewhat original designs for main character and foes (tree at the beginning is painfully unoriginal)

Cons: Control issues when using ANY non-xbox controller. Cannot set controls while in game, meaning you have to guess what "PadA", Fire1 and StartPadX all mean while in a menu outside of the game it's self. Also there is no menu in game at all, so unless you know exactly what each item in the controls scheme is, you can't even exit the game to re-arange your controls without using your Task Manager in Windows.

Also, camera control is non-existent. I adjusted controls multiple times and couldn't find a single way to move the camera manually, and the auto-camera doesn't follow well enough to warrent not being manually controlled (Literally had it at a 45 degree angle between the ground any the protagonist, obscuring my character entirely). The game also maintains a bad camera angle if at any point, you are defeated by a standard enemy.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999674590', 'num_games_owned': 2708, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 87, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 87, 'last_played': 1435413133}
review: The sad thing about this game is that I can see a lot of potential in it.  The art design is beautiful and the level design flashes potential.  It has a cute and simple concept that had the potential for a very fun, Nintendo 64 styled platformer that you don't see much of nowadays.  If I was an indie publisher, and someone presented this to me as an Alpha, I might have been tempted to fund further development, however that's all this game really is.  It plays like an unfinished Alpha of a game that has a lot of potential.  The level design is pretty, but the game is barely playable.  The game would be more tolerable if there was a working camera.  The camera gives automatic angles, and is absolutely horrid at it.  It makes the game way more difficult then it is supposed to be.  The only control the player has on the camera is to zoom in and out, and sometimes that doesn't even work.  This game plays like an abandoned early access game.  Avoid.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059060944', 'num_games_owned': 169, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1418650172}

author: {'steamid': '76561198031119731', 'num_games_owned': 1691, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 40, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1435366282}
review:
I tried to get into this since I love 3D platformers. Unfortunately, the camera makes the game unplayable. It gets stuck on things, doesn't reset when it needs to, and you have no control over the camera's rotation. A great deal of the time playing was fighting with the camera since at times I couldn't see where I was going. At some points it was so bad that 100% of the screen was blocked. Sometimes the camera clipped through objects in the world and obscured my vision by seeing the backs of objects you wouldn't normally see.

If the camera was fixed I could enjoy this and recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997692817', 'num_games_owned': 188, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 28, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1435234695}
review:
Quite unplayable!

+ Very nice graphics

- Awful gameplay
- Crazy and script-controlled camera. Damn, in 2015 the player MUST be able to control the camera with the mouse! Come on... And, overall, this stupid design choice gives the player no perspective on the scene, making, for example, a simple jump the hardest thing to do in the universe!
- Repetitive and not inspired soundtrack
- Who said enemies? If those are enemies, well, this is the end of videoplaying...
- Not inspired animations.
- The level design is really bad. 
- No storyline
- The objective is always the same. Who needs water? No, I just need three tears...
- Solids compenetration
- No menu. I just need to press the ESC button to close the game. Is this a joke?

Definitely, this is a clear example of how Steam MUST test the games before sell them, in order to give the users only seriously completed and valuable games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198184623491', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1434971358}
review:
"Na das sieht doch nett aus, ein bi√üchen wie Mario64..." wer so oder so √§hnlich denkt, nach Ansicht der Screenshots, dem kann ich nur sagen:"Lasst euch nicht t√§uschen!"

Man merkt dem Spiel an, das viel Herzblut drinnen steckt aber man merkt auch relativ schnell das der Programmierer nicht viel Plan von den Mechaniken hat, die ein gutes Jump'n Run ausmachen.

[b]Das f√§ngt an bei der richtig schlechten Kamera f√ºhrung...[/b]
Man kann die Kamera nicht frei justieren, lediglich heran-und herauszoomen ist m√∂glich aber in einem sehr unvorteilhaften Winkel.
Dadurch verkommen die meisten Spr√ºnge zu einer reinen Gl√ºckssache und werden zu echten Gedultsproben.

[b]... geht √ºber die schlechte Kollisionsabfrage...[/b]
Die Hitbox der Gegner und des eigenen Charakters ist nicht abgestimmt, wahrscheinlich nur ein gro√üz√ºgiges Quadrat drumherum.

[b]... und gl√ºcks abh√§ngige Sprungdynamik...[/b]
Wobei man eigentlich sehr genau springen K√ñNNTE... leider machen hier aber die ung√ºnstigen Kamera perspektiven sowie die schlechte Kollisionsabfrage fast jeden Sprung zu einer frustrierenden Nervenzerei√üprobe.

[b]... bis hin zum verkorksten Multiplayer Modus.[/b]
"Na ja, vieleicht bockt das Spiel ja zu zweit mehr." und auch hier wieder, falsch gedacht.
Der Multiplayer Modus ist mal richtig schlecht und √ºberfl√ºssig und hier mal kurz zusammengefasst die Gr√ºnde...

[list]
[*]Die Kamera folgt und ist IMMER auf Spieler 1 fixiert, was f√ºr Spieler 2 einfach mal jeden aufkommenden Spielspa√ü killt, da dieser zu 90% die meiste Zeit AU√üERHALB des sichtbaren Bildes, als kleines Nav. Icon, verbringt.

[*]Die Figur von Spieler 2, so knuffig sie auch ausschaut (nag, nag) ist zu gro√ü um auf die meisten Plattformen und durch die meisten Durchg√§nge zu passen.
Das einzig gute ist, das man Spieler 2 als "Plattform" mi√übrauchen kann um auf h√∂her gelegene Ebenen zu kommen.

[*]Spieler 2 spawnt immer in einer festen entfernung von Spieler 1... Schei√üegal ob dort fester Boden ist oder nicht.
Aber hey... wer hat nicht Spa√ü daran nach dem Respawn gleich in einen Abgrund zu fallen um anschlie√üend wieder zu Respawnen?! Und wieder, und wieder, und wieder...

[*]BEIDE Pads m√ºssen VOR Spielstart angemeldet werden.
Pad 2 im laufenden Spiel anzumelden und zu nutzen funktioniert, zumindest mit dem Wireless Empf√§nger von Microsoft, nicht.
[/list]

Aber das gr√∂√üte Manko, abgesehen von der Spielgeschwindigkeit die selbst eine Valium fressende Schnecke unterfordern w√ºrde, ist wohl das ich einfach, altersbedingt, die falsche Zielgruppe bin.

[h1][b]Mein Fazit, Jonguh![/b][/h1]
Wenn jemand seinem 6 - 10 J√§hrigen Kind eine Freude machen will, dann kann er bei diesem Spiel ohne bedenken zugreifen, wobei das Kind schon eine √ºberdurchschnittliche Tiefenwahrnehmung besitzen sollte... sonst k√∂nnten einige Stellen schnell frustrierend werden.
Ansonsten ist das Spiel Kindgerecht, zu 90% Gewaltfrei und auch f√ºr Epileptiker geeignet.

Wer ein anspruchsvolles, schnelles und gut programmiertes 3D Jump'n Run sucht, der macht lieber einen GRO√üEN Bogen um dieses Spiel... ausser ihr habt Hart gesoffen oder seid auf Medikamenten... dann k√∂nnt ihr einen Blick riskieren, denn daf√ºr reichen eure Reflexe auf jeden Fall noch aus.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056924398', 'num_games_owned': 680, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 168, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 85, 'last_played': 1540188020}
review:
Woodle Tree Adventures
This game looks stunning, and is one of the nicest looking Indie games I've played in a while, but that doesn't account for the bad camera, bad controls, bad fighting mechanism, bad checkpoint handling, and overall glitchiness this game has.
Do not purchase this game unless you enjoy frustration, or just want a neat looking piece of indie art.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071856398', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 169, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 169, 'last_played': 1434645209}
review: I got this game basically because it was cheap for the sale and kinda got it jokingly, but now i really love this game, although there are a few cons such as camera angles, (which you'll see what I mean if you get the game) and also the fact you die in one hit, but it is cool that the enemies do too. But it has way more pros than cons. This is an all around great game which is very original, I've never seen one like this, killing with leafs the enemies are pretty interesting and the worlds are creative and some of them you have to focus or you could fall all the way back to the starting location. this is a game that is good to play anytime and never gets old when you have a goal to get to in it (such as collecting a number of berries). I highly recommend this game for it's orininality, unique game play, all around fun and just the fact theres probably nothing else like it on the market!

author: {'steamid': '76561198075349043', 'num_games_owned': 754, 'num_reviews': 126, 'playtime_forever': 178, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 87, 'last_played': 1435607884}
review:
Ein Spiel das mir √ºberaschender Weise Spa√ü gemacht hat. Bei den nahezu nicht vorhandenen Checkpoints, ist man beim Scheitern, nervlich ziemlich schnell auf den Holzweg. Nun ja alles in einem war der weg sehr holzig aber dennoch sehr passabel, vom Schwierigkeitsgrad kann ich es jedem Jump n' Run Anf√§nger - Veteran ans Holz legen. 

Das Spiel bietet au√üerdem noch einen Grafikstil der den h√∂lzernen Topf der Kawaii-ness zum √úberlaufen bringt. Die Story ist ziemlich stumpf (nahezu so stumpf wie ein Baumstamm), ich w√ºrde schon beinahe sagen nicht vorhanden, aber sie ist vorhanden, aber es f√ºhlt sich einfach nicht story-lig an, braucht das Spiel aber auch nicht.

Zusammengefasst wird einem beim Grafikstil ziemlich warm ums Holz,
man kann runen und jumpen und was am wichtigsten ist:
das Spiel macht Spa√ü!
[wobei die Kamara hin und wieder nicht 100% mitspielt, aber das ist durchaus verkraftbar.Vergleichsweise soviel Kraft wie bei einem Baum aber nicht so viel "ver" und auch nciht so viel "bar" (was macht ein Baum den auch in einer Bar, pff)] 

Ich gebe 11 von 10 B√§umen, was ihr damit macht ist eure Sache.

Nachtrag aus 2021:
2015-Ich war super cringe

author: {'steamid': '76561198042173428', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 91, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1454003732}
review: It's an evil, cruel world out there, and "Woodle Tree Adventures" opened my eyes to the reality of it all. You are born into a life of crime. From the day you are born, you are running around collecting debts owed to the family, being fruit, of course. If they can't pay up, then their tears will suffice. Sometimes you have to use force, because sometimes they fight back. Your only weapon is a leaf, but I swear I have yet to see a leaf capable of so much pain and destruction in all my years as this one, and I've seen a lot of leaves, my house has windows. All it takes is one fell swoop and any retaliator or rebel is vanquished. Sometimes innocent lives are lost as well, caught in the crossfire, however some live to complain and tell the tale and must be taken care of later. Their deaths are most tragic and graphic; they fall backwards as a sign of submission, then right after they give a little "squee" they burst into white flakes, completely vanishing from existance. Families will forever be torn apart, populations drastically affected by the murders, but you remain unphased. This is what you were meant to do, and you do it with a smile. I value the time I've spent playing "Woodle Tree Adventures", as it has shown me a side of this world that I would have never seen outside of my bubble. It not only immerses us in the hard life of crime, but has an underlying message of love for one's family and how far people or small tree creatures will go to do what is best for the family.

author: {'steamid': '76561198129751905', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1435842712}
review:
The reason I don;t recomment this game is because the position of the camera is so frustrating, sometimes it turns in an other position where you can't see properly if you fall from the platform and if you do you can start all over again. Also when an enemy blew you away. There isn't an option to save any progress, so you are forced to complete a level.

The pro's are that the game looks cute and the sound is also nice and I( bought it for 24 cents....

author: {'steamid': '76561198170193291', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1476580707}
review: I haven't played a whole lot of Woodle Tree Adventures. But my experience with it has been very mixed. Is it good? Is it bad? The thing is, Woodle Tree Adventures knows what it's going for; a 3D platformer. But the games fatal flaw is how the camera "sometimes" goes where you want it to be. It's almost random. Other than the camera, I found one flaw having to do with respawning after dying to an enemy or a pit. Sometimes (there's that word again) you respawn around where you died. Sometimes you respawn near what I would guess is a checkpoint. But sometimes, you get sent all the way back to the beginning of the stage. Normally, I wouldn't have a problem with that. But the lack of knowing where you will end up is just...jarring in a sense! The level design for the game is...okay. I like it (Especially the technical 3rd and 4th stages). For music...there isn't a whole lot from what I've seen. Nothing too catchy. The music is just...okay also. Lastly, where this game shines the most: graphics. The game is very colorful and very pretty to look at. Some shapes and models seem a bit bland, but it just seems to "work". It all pieces together this Mario 3D Land-esque experience. Except involving trees. All in all, I recommend this game if you feel like checking it out. Just be prepared for an imperfect experience. The game's not bad. But it's not amazing by any means, it could use a bit more work in my opinion, but just a teensy-tiny bit. Other than that, it's a fun game. It is enjoyable, colorful, and there are trees in it! But I can't end this review without mentioning one possible glitch/intentional mechanic: When you are jumping on stairs or hitting your head against a block, you will occasionally flip backwards and jump on your head. This doesn't change the gameplay at all, it's just that your model will be upside-down for as long as you are continuously jumping. But anyway, that wraps up my first review ever. I thought I just had to explain my thoughts about this game to the Steam Community. Due to it's obscurity and imperfections. In any case, I give this game a 3 out of 5. It looks good. It plays okay. The sound design is meh. But the reason it's just over the halfway mark from 1 to 5; is because it is fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044655462', 'num_games_owned': 1674, 'num_reviews': 180, 'playtime_forever': 153, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1503578501}
review:
long story about this game (thee experience)

the game starts with the log clipping through the floor to the surface and a tree with  mustache starts big of by telling  the log to collect fairy tears cuz reasons then get dropped near the logs "house" and gotta take the leaf from up stairs and start
the first level.

through the game you see weird animations and no love in detail (like the cute mario galaxy graphic touch but its too plain no love in detail)
first level throws the character in the middle of nowhere with lots of copy paste blocks and enemie characters with generic symmetric bodyshapes....
running to the waving the leave and they shall die but get too close and you shall be resetet to the beginning of the level.
it is too hard to attack the enemieand no effort needed cause it is easier to just walk past them.
not even half of the level done i find too many reasons to quit and the need to start a new steam library category with a titel like "games i never touch again" or "crap collection".

- short version

+ cute graphic style

- cute at the beginning borring after 2 min of gameplay
- generic symmetry copy paste of world build by blocks and enemie build by blocks and sometimes triangles....
- weird animation mostly the jumping
- sounds missing for walking in the "water" if you can call it that donno
- bug made my camera troll me after first reset and quit the game after 2 times running through the level falling down with it

= i thought of this game too much and fell for it. it sucks and shall catch dust in my library and never seek my attation again!!!!

       10/10 would leaf blow this game to hell.......

author: {'steamid': '76561198142823300', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 211, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1462075552}
review:
If there was an in between button for recommending or not recommending a game, I would use it here.

Little more can be said about this game other than it is a decent platformer with a cute art design and somewhat awkward camera positioning. Basically, this is a budget Mario 64, that lacks depth and story. Aside from that, the controls are cohesive and the game is simplistic and decently playable. The biggest problem is the camera, since it often locks in a position that is difficult to see where you are going and sometimes even reverses the point of view, often causing you to die as a result.

As a $3 game, I would say look for a better use of your money. But, when this does go on sale for less than $1, then it might be fun to just toy around with. Drops cards and is an easy 100%.

review: I like this game, but it's obviously not that good. The camera angles can be a huge problem and the movement doesn't feel all that good. The combat system feels funny but I can kind of get used to it. Other than that, the game is fine. The art design is cutesy and the enemies look pretty creative. The money system is fine and filling up the bag with one hundred of those orange acorn things looks neat. It deserves a six out of ten if anything.

review: I'm not too far in but I am enjoying it. It kinda feels like a really simple Mario Galaxy lol well done. I have had the camera bug out on me a bit and turn to an odd angle but once I hit the next area where the camera changes itself the issue is gone.  All in all it's worth the .26 I paid but I would have paid the full, low low price of $3.29 CAD for this, as it has a feature I wish more games were offering and that is the demo option, which I believe more games should offer. In my opinion it is worth a buy on sale or at full price.

review: Very simple. Reminiscent of Super Mario 64 but obviously targeting a younger audience. Local cooperative play makes this a worthy addition to my library even though it's not the type of game I would play by myself. The only issue I have with it so far is that the camera angles sometimes throw off my depth perception. This is likely to be one of my first picks if I find myself playing video-games with a young child.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042580200', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 181, 'playtime_forever': 324, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1693402391}
review: Sometimes you have to accept that the adorable children's platformer is just that: an adorable children's platformer. There's a tendency for colorful games like Woodle Tree Adventures to carry some kind of intense theme or bizarre mechanics, but this is probably the most basic 3d hop 'n bop released for sale. That being said, it's serene, pretty, and harmless. You could see this game with an Early Childhood rating if it were ever released in stores, but don't let that stop you from zoning out and looking at the nice scenery for the hour or so the game lasts.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996760968', 'num_games_owned': 1342, 'num_reviews': 199, 'playtime_forever': 67, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1416180349}
review:
Really simple, really dull.  Half the time I was laughing with the game because of its style and the fact you're a flippin' tree stump smacking really doofy enemies with a leaf, half the time I was laughing at it due to the repetitive environment that is pretty much a copy pasted.  Fun fact: you can literally zoom the (rather poor) camera out infinitely.  My friends and I were cracking up after realizing I can make the stage the size of a pixel after zooming out for about 5 minutes.

Trailer is accurate enough, if cherry-picked footage.  Run around, tickle enemies with a leaf, pick collectibles up.

Not truly awful, but not at all very fun, and I would pay nothing more than the 40 cents or so my friend bought me the game with to watch me play it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198111543400', 'num_games_owned': 333, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 78, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1433986107}
review: this game makes me want to rip my hair out. it wasnt too bad until the last level with the ice.you just slide everywhere and cant control what your character is doing. this game is cancer to my life. you can hardly control the camera angles and alot of the time you cant really see where you are going. there is no health mechanic you just run into stuff and die then you restart the whole level. the music is sort of relaxing but the game counteracts it and makes you want to break things.if you enjoy being mad at life play this game. if you like to be a happy normal tempered person stear clear. the main character is a little piece of wood hardly relatable to any audience. i give this game a 4/10 because it makes me so angry when i play it. again only play this game if you are going to end your life shortly after.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975599804', 'num_games_owned': 1465, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 446, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1593657557}
review: As you can see from the trailer and the screenshots, this game does have pretty graphics.  But that's about the only positive thing i can say about this game.  Otherwise, it's nearly impossible to play.  Due to the wonky camera angles, it's impossible to tell whether your character will fall off, make the jump, be able to hit an enemey, etc.  And when you die, which you will do frequently due to the aforementioned faults, you will start all the way from the beginning of the level.  I could further list ten different things wrong with this game, but I will spare your time and say don't play this game.

review:
The game is an easy to pick up 3rd person platformer. I didn't think it was too difficult either.
The worst part of the game I'd say is the camera angles. Sometimes it gets stuck at an angle that makes it hard to jump.
Dieing usually resets the camera angle.

TLDR: It was a cheap game that gave me more money from cards then i spent on it. 3 hours in and I have all but 2 trophies so its not a major time investment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058569494', 'num_games_owned': 708, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 61, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1429239308}
review:
I paid .38 cents for this. I mean for that price you can't really go wrong with a game.  It's a very simple concept, and it is also very short. But again, I only paid pocket change for it. I 100% it in just over an hour (61 minutes to be exact) just cuz it was cute. And it had cards and was an easy 100%. It runs well, controls and camera are a bit annoying at first but you get used to them rather fast. So I mean, it was cute and there aren't any MAJOR game breaking problems with it.

TL;DR - It runs, it's cute, it's an easy 100%, there's cards. Just the camera angles and controls are a little meh. Expect an hour or so of gameplay. For 38 cents you can't go wrong.

author: {'steamid': '76561198146973128', 'num_games_owned': 458, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 290, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 1409389030}
review: Woodle Tree Adventures is a fun, old school platformer with a unique art style. It has provided me with hours of entertainment in single player mode, and is bound to give me more fun with multiplayer. It is not only a great game, it even allows use of an xbox controller for players who find keyboard controls to difficult. This game has relaxing music and a fun storyline. The graphics are smooth, bright and very appealing, especially for young children. I would definitely recommend this game to anyone, especially those with young children.

Unico problema √® la telecamera:all'inizio √® un po' fastidiosa in certe (ma poche) situazioni, ma giocando anche 10 min. la si riesce a mettere a posto anche senza cambiare la posizione del TRONCO (un tronco?!?s√¨√¨√¨!!!!)

author: {'steamid': '76561198001342103', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 61, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1428994105}
review:
OVERALL: Not that good, gameplay feels annoying and sluggish, sounds are also annoying and repititous. 2/10

Controls too slowly, i cant make jumps in a fluid manner. Jumping forward is too powerful, you jump forward at a constant speed but its a speed faster than the walking speed so frequently I fall off platforms and I don't feel like it's my fault that I did. 

You control the movement of the character 100%, there's no momentum, no slow down if you jump in one direction and then decide to change directions mid air.

The camera controls badly, i can't look around the level easily to tell if i still have to collect items there - to waste time getting back up. You can zoom the camera in and out but you cant use it to look up over the character or back behind him easily, Like I want to zoom out so I can see the depth better of where I have to pick shit up but then it just zooms out - there's no limit on zoom btw it goes out forever if you want.

The attack range is so small hard to see, but you die in one hit. If you hit an enemy he doesnt go away for a moment so if you hit him and then run into him you die instantly anyway.

The item pickup hitbox seems too small because I've gone through objects without picking them up.

It's hard to tell depth in the game maybe partly because half of the object textures are flat colours. There's moments where you have to jump to the side of the screen in the unknown because the camera won't look there, and there turns out to be an enemy so you die instantly - this fills me with hate.

The axis of motion is weird, it seems like it limits you to degrees of 5 around in the circle of 360, and not full 360, so your character jitters around as it turns and it feels bad.

The character's backpack becomes more full the more you pickup objects, so full sometimes you can't see past it.

I wish there was at least jumbled talking for voices for characters, it felt like the music was getting very repeaty, the sound of the waterfall cuts off before it loops again every 4 seconds, it felt like the world was not alive even as simply stylised as it was.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025864040', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 49, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1428967340}
review:
This game looks way better than it tastes.

Cons:[list]
[*][b]Boring[/b]
[*][b]Annoying music[/b]
[*][b]Stupid checkpoints.[/b] You aren't notified when you've passed one. Sometimes when you die you have to start all the way at the beginning, and other times it'll put you in some random spot.
[*][b]Bad keyboard controls.[/b] Wasn't able to try 360 controller because I don't own one, which might have made it a little less frustrating but very unlikely to have made this into a good game.
[*][b]Frustrating level design.[/b] I might have had some fun just going through the levels carelessly, but you have to find 3 droplets of water to complete each level. Navigation was so frustrating that backtracking never seemed worth it.[/list]
Pros:[list]
[*][b]Looks cool.[/b] If this game had a solid game design to go with these great characters, it could have been really popular. [/list]

author: {'steamid': '76561198000656463', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 86, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1429988285}
review:
Quirky little platformer. Although it's not exactly worth its price due to some faults in this game. It's a fun little game.
This game lacks a proper camera control system. You only have slight control over the camera.
Also knowing how many collectables there are in a level would be nice but not too important. For the completionists out there and such.
Furthermore the collectables are quite easy to get but there is a lot of them. That's not an understatement.
The collectables unlock upgrades to your character.

I recommend this game simply because for the price of a cup of coffee you can get a small game which will let you bash the hell out of woodland creatures with your leaf.

review: Mo≈æn√° trochu roztomil√° hra kde hrajete za nƒõjakyho pa≈ôeza ze stromu :oD.M√° stra≈°nƒõ m√°lo map,kter√© se daj√≠ dohr√°t za 1h.Jinak c√≠lem ka≈æd√©ho levelu je pozb√≠rat na mapƒõ 3 kapky a um√≠stit je na urƒçit√Ω bod.Je tam spoustu chyb nap≈ô.m√° to hodnƒõ ƒçasto ≈°patnou kameru p≈ôes kterou se ned√° v≈Øbec nic vidƒõt :oD.Jinak je to klasick√° sk√°kaƒçka ve 3D kde zb√≠r√°te nƒõjaky ovoce sem tam nƒõco zabijete a konec hry :oD

author: {'steamid': '76561197979937358', 'num_games_owned': 4314, 'num_reviews': 161, 'playtime_forever': 213, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 213, 'last_played': 1426844996}
review:
I like (very) cheap games - often they are trash, but i like it when it's simple to play.
This is a tiny Jump'n'Run game (actually more for kids) with no violence, but sometimes tricky gaps - when you fail, you often have to start from the very beginning - thats pretty annoying from time to time.
I even LOVE it, when a game doesn't have 362 levels. Although it's short, you will loose motivation soon cause the only aim is, not to fall down of something. You don't have to beat enemies or stuff. 

Afterall i recommend this - man, it's ~1‚Ç¨/$ and got achievements + cards..

100% after ~ 2 hours - 20.03.15

author: {'steamid': '76561198002506911', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 415, 'playtime_forever': 368, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 368, 'last_played': 1426370609}
review: Cute game for kids with a decent graphic art design.  Nothing sophisticated in the sense of story, graphics, or gameplay.  You are a small tree trying to collect water drops to save the big tree.  You use a leaf to attack any enemy you may face, and if you are hit by an enemy or fall off the edge (which you'll do a lot) then you'll restart the level without having to recollect all of the water drops or the apple looking things laying around.  The game is definitely a casual, third person platforming game.  However, the reason why I don't recommend this game is due to the horrible camera.  There were times when I fell off the edge that the camera would shift a full 180 degrees compared to what it should be.  Without any manual control over the camera, this made it a very difficult task.  Too often, even if the camera worked, it became an issue for the simple platforming sections.  Overall your kids may like this game if they can past the frustrations.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045010569', 'num_games_owned': 23, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1426344963}

author: {'steamid': '76561198046343516', 'num_games_owned': 2899, 'num_reviews': 122, 'playtime_forever': 229, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 214, 'last_played': 1426335508}
review:
What to write about a little sympathic plattformer made by one person? It was entertaining and I felt the effort the developer put in it ... BUT: some things can't go well, and that's why I had to give my first negative review. Even if the game is not expensive, some features make playing it somewhat hard (and I played it through!): Firstly the camera view and angle is very unconveniant zooming into and creating different angles, so that you are stuck in looking into some blocks -> requires a new start! And secondly the spawning point are very confusing: mostly you have to start at the beginning of the level, but sometimes not and this not in the right series. Well for me these two things put away lots of the charme of the game. But if it's on sale (or even gratuit) then you can give it a try.

Has 6 cards and achievements - playing time around 2 hours, 3-4 hours, if you want all the achievements (without cheating).

author: {'steamid': '76561198013495990', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 128, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1423642906}
review:
The good:
- The colors look good.

The bad:
- The gameplay and quests are so simple that I lost interest very quickly.

Overall:
This game couldn't hold my attention for longer than a few minutes. It might be good for a kid to wander around, collect things, and smack at "bad guys" but for anyone older you'll enjoy spending your time on a different game.

Recommended for kids but anyone 10 or older I'd say pass.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076804276', 'num_games_owned': 169, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 225, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 155, 'last_played': 1458056810}
review:
This game has charm and is pretty nice visually but ultimately lacks any real depth. The gameplay is incredibly boring and hardly engaging. The game plays slowly and camera issues make for an extremely frustrating game at times. 

Achievements don't work on Mac which is a big flaw of the game and frankly it is not that great even for your children. It is cute but the game is so simple most kids will be bored to death.

3/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198028570547', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2563, 'playtime_forever': 99, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 99, 'last_played': 1564852391}
review:
"Woodle Tree Adventures" ist ein kindgerechter Plattformer.

Der gro√üe Baum schickt uns kleinen Stumpf los, um den Wassermangel zu bek√§mpfen. Daf√ºr m√ºssen wir in jeder der sechs Welten jeweils drei Wassertropfen finden. Auf dem Weg begegnen uns auch einige Tierchen, die uns nicht wohlgesonnen sind. Diese k√∂nnen wir aber mit unserem Blatt umwedeln.

Um das Blatt noch besser zu machen, sollten wir die reichlich in den Levels vorhandenen Fr√ºchte einsammeln. Diese gelten praktisch als W√§hrung und k√∂nnen aus unserem Blatt auch eine Distanzwaffe machen.

Man sollte das Spiel mit einem Gamepad zocken, denn die 3D Umgebung, die aber meist eine fixierte Kamerarichtung hat, bedarf es immer wieder, da√ü wir rein und rauszoomen. Zudem ist die Kontrollierbarkeit unserer Spielfigur mit einem Gamepad deutlich differenzierter als mit der Tastatur. Und diese Differenziertheit ist auch notwendig, denn das Spiel zeichnet sich leider nicht gerade durch eine allzu pr√§zise Steuerung aus. Vielmehr wirkt alles recht schwammig und etwas ungenau. Allerdings kann man sich, auch durch das eher gem√§chliche Tempo, mit der Zeit daran gew√∂hnen.

Wirklich schwierig hingegen erweist sich hin und wieder die Kamera, die sich vor allem in engen Passagen gerne mal √ºberfordert zeigt und wild umherirrt. 

Wirklich sterben k√∂nnen wir nicht. Fallen wir irgendwo runter oder laufen wir gegen einen Gegner spawnen wir einfach beim letzten R√ºcksetzpunkt. Durch die unendlichen Lebel h√§lt sich die Frustration in Grenzen und auch unge√ºbte Spieler k√∂nnen die Level schaffen.

Die sechs Level sind an sich zwar nicht kurz, insgesamt ist der Content aber √ºberschaubar. Auch werden die Level nur bedingt komplexer. Lediglich ein Schneelevel bietet spielmechanisch ein wenig Abwechslung.

Wirklich s√º√ü ist das grunds√§tzliche Design. Durchaus liebevoll sind die Figuren gestaltet. Die blockartigen Umgebungen sind passend bunt und zeigen durchaus Liebe zum Detail.

Das Game ist sicher kein AAA-Titel und kann sich auch mit den gro√üen Jump-and-Runs der Spielegeschichte nicht messen. Es ist aber ein liebevolles, kleines Indie-Spielchen, das gerade jungen Spielern durchaus eine Weile Spa√ü machen kann. 

[h1]Wertung:[/h1]
7/10 Atmosph√§re
5/10 Story
7/10 Grafik
5/10 Sound
6/10 Spielmechanik
6/10 Balancing
6/10 Spielspass

[h1]Fazit:[/h1]
S√º√ü und kindgerecht.

[h1][b]6/10 Gesamtwertung

author: {'steamid': '76561197999807713', 'num_games_owned': 930, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 110, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 110, 'last_played': 1423565974}
review:
[h1] Woodle Tree Adventures - As aventuras do galho drogado [/h1]

Bem, comprei esse jogo pois achei semelhante ao Super Mario 64, entretanto N√ÉO e N√ÉO, FUJA DESSE GAME!!! Woddle Tree Adventures n√£o √© um jogo ruim, √© um jogo horr√≠vel de ruim! 

 [list][*][b]Hist√≥ria:[/b] N√£o tem hist√≥ria nenhuma, voc√™ s√≥ tem que catar umas gotas d'agua para salvar uma √°rvore gigante; Para que tal fa√ßanha seja concretizada, voc√™ controlar√° um galho maconheiro, que quando pula levanta as pernas pro ar (wtf?!) e carrega uma arma como folha.

[*][b]Jogabilidade:[/b] O galho maconheiro √© chato de controlar, nunca para no lugar que voc√™ pula, sem contar que os obst√°culos sempre est√£o mais longe de onde o seu pulo alcan√ßa, por√©m esse galho sempre consegue chegar, incr√≠vel.

[*][b]Gr√°fico:[/b] O gr√°fico √© extremamente ultrapassado, chegando quase ao n√≠vel do Nintendo 64, al√©m do gr√°fico ruim, o jogo trava em uma fase espec√≠fica por conta da falha na renderiza√ß√£o.

[*][b]Trilha Sonora:[/b] A trilha sonora deve ter umas 2 ou 3 m√∫sicas, todas totalmente esquec√≠veis e entediantes. [/list]

Apesar todos esses problemas, os dois maiores est√£o na c√¢mera maldita e na droga do checkpoint. Voc√™ n√£o pode controlar a c√¢mera e ela simplesmente vira a hora que quer, te fazendo muitas vezes pular na sorte de cair em alguma plataforma. O checkpoint tamb√©m sofre desse mesmo problema de vontade pr√≥pria, as vezes ao morrer voc√™ nasce em um lugar mais perto, mas na maioria das vezes voltar√° ao in√≠cio, s√≥ para passar mais raiva.

N√£o tenho mais o que falar sobre essa trag√©dia, exceto que guardem seu dinheiro, ainda estou pensando se o jogo valeu os R$ 0,60 que paguei. A n√£o ser que voc√™ queira as conquistas que s√£o f√°ceis de fazer, passe longe desse jogo. [u][b]Nota: 1,0[/b][/u]

review:
Da ich das Spiel noch nicht zuende gespielt habe, und wahrscheinlich auch nicht werde, hier nur ein Zwischenfazit:

Pro:
+ sehr nette Graphik
+ einfaches, unblutiges und daher bestimmt auch f√ºr Kinder geeignetes Spiel

Kontra:
- keine Kamerasteuerung (abgesehen vom Zoom), die manchmal wirklich von Nutzen w√§re
- schlechte Savepointsetzung im Level
- kein Men√º?!
- schlechte Levelauswahl (bis auf runde, verzogene Kugeln in denen das Level angedeuted wird....was mir mit meinem Goldfischgehirn nicht geholfen hat :) )
- die Levelmusik wird irgendwann sehr eint√∂nig bis nervt√∂tend bis provozierend bis *AAAAARGH!*

Fazit: Wer sich das Spiel zum Sale gekauft hat: Gl√ºckwunsch! Es war die paar Cent allein f√ºr die Grafik wert. Wer keine kleinen Kinder hat, die umbedingt bespa√üt werden m√ºssen oder sein inneres Kind begl√ºcken will, dem w√ºrde ich es definitiv nicht empfehlen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198135835322', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1423418754}
review:
Je viens tout juste de finir le jeu et le moins que je puisse dire √† son avantage c'est : Il est trop cute ! *0*
Par contre, et ce, malgr√© tout le respect que j'ai pour LE d√©veloppeur (Car ils ne sont que deux), la maniabilit√© est quelque peu horrible. C'est dommage, mais le plus p√©nalisant, c'est plus la cam√©ra qui pose un vrai probl√®me et nous fait mourir √† plus d'une reprise. On peut la zoomer ou la d√©zoomer sans probl√®me avec la souris, mais la cam√©ra est buggu√©e, de ce fait, on peut se retrouver avec une vue qui rend impossible le jeu.

Je l'ai fait d'un seul trait, et comme vous l'avez remarqu√© il n'est pas long, cependant, il n'y a que 6 niveaux dont un mode 100% que je n'ai personnellement pas eu le courage de faire malgr√© sa relative simplicit√© (Avoir plus de point). En r√©alit√©, chaque niveau, si on enl√®ve tous les probl√®mes, peut-√™tre fait en 10-15min, h√©las, la maniabilit√© et la cam√©ra rallonge sa dur√©e de vie.

Niveau musique, rien de tr√®s √©norme mais ce n'est pas non plus horrible √† l'oreille.

J'ai not√© aussi quelques bugs avec la hitbox du personnage mais rien de trop n√©faste pendant le jeu (Au bout d'un moment, on est tellement blas√© par la cam√©ra qu'on oublie une ou deux morts de plus.)

Petit avertissement : Echap quitte le jeu... mais il sauvegarde automatiquement en fin de niveau.

L'histoire est quant √† elle purement anecdotique et n'a pas de r√©elle int√©r√™t.

Je ne peux √©videmment pas recommander ce jeu et c'est bien dommage, car si tous ces probl√®mes √©taient r√©gl√©s, sans √™tre incroyable il aurait eu droit √† une √©valuation du type : Sympa mais sans plus.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050478086', 'num_games_owned': 1672, 'num_reviews': 156, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1481758932}
review:
Woodle tree adventures is a game where you control a little hero tree using a leaf to defend yourself trying to find the magical water drop something in order to save the trees.
The game is just plain awful, the sound effects are less than amateur-ish, the visuals are decent but the camera angle will mess you up every single time and the story is uninteresting.
I guess what makes this worse is this game comparing itself to gems like super mario 64 or banjoo kazooie.
Even at 3$ this isn't worth your time, if you really want to torture yourself grab it during a sale for half a dollar.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017200784', 'num_games_owned': 857, 'num_reviews': 133, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1412662990}
review:
A game that is missing something.

When I loaded up the game, I was impressed by the graphics which reminede me of platformers like 'Super mario 64'. However as I played the game the faults became more apparent...

The gameplay is quite weak. You can walk, run and jump. Furthermore, you can attack with your leaf (which is tiny as hell by the way). Basically your aim is to collect the water droplets in each area (just like stars in mario). You face a variety of enemies which will kill you in one shot when they hit you. A bigger problem is when you die, you will respawn at the start of the area, which wastes time gettiing back to where you were. The camera is also difficult to control and can get stuck on object of the terrain, hence making platforming unnecessarily difficult.

The graphics are nice. Very reminicent of 3D platformers such as mario, banjo kazooie and donkey kong.

The music isn't that great. Aside from no voice acting (which isn't a problem), the games music is quite mundane and forgettable, unlike the nintendo platformers I was accustomed to.

The story is also forgettable.

Even though the graphics are nice, you should definitely stay away as this game has nothing that will  keep you playing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198106670935', 'num_games_owned': 757, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 200, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 200, 'last_played': 1422911519}
review:
Personally I don't like this game, so why do I recommend it?
Due to the target audience I see it being directed at. It is a game I see being played by very young children, with their parents helping and/or incentivizing them along the way.

I see this game as a child's first platform game.
Most of the bad reviews are mainly people playing a game it isn't meant for them. As this is a game for people who aren't even able to write yet.

Unfortunately it also looks as if it's the developer's first game as well (but if it is then it's a good first effort).
Here are some bad points, from an adult's point of view (but be sure to read the 2 last paragraphs of this review):
[list]
 [*]  Bad 3D modelling. Simplicity is fine but in this case it seems it is simple due to lack of 3D modelling skills. 
 [*]  Badly optimized. Even being a simple game it managed (somehow) to lag noticeable in later levels, reaching 15 frames per second on a good PC.
 [*]  Bad UX. Pressing Escape closes the game without prompting you if you want to. And when you reach the end your only option is to press Escape as you're 'stuck' in the credits screen.
 [*]  Bad camera positioning, often, at some points of the game. Sometimes making the player fall to their deaths or be killed by enemies.
 [*]  Most enemies are smiling and some moving animals are not enemies. Inconsistency in conveying what is an enemy and what isn't.
 [*]  Poor level design in some areas.
 [*]  Bad design choices, levelling up your weapon happens by 'chance' (you have to gather enough fruits for the different weapons BUT then you have to walk around the house, to an area you wouldn't think to go, and jump on the podium with the corresponding weapon to select it. Why?)
 [*]  Music can be annoying sometimes, and unfortunately I didn't know how to turn it down/off
[/list]

If you're either a teenager or an adult this game is not for you, but if you have kids or younger siblings they will ignore all of the flaws listed above and it will keep them entertained for hours and it will help build their game control skills.

An inexpensive way to introduce the child to the mechanics of platform video games in a cute and stress free way (because it doesn't penalise failure, just sends you to the start of the level).
It has it's flaws but it is very charming as well. Definitely a game young kids will enjoy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066310618', 'num_games_owned': 3195, 'num_reviews': 124, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1405143036}
review:
The camera angles are horrible and ruin the experience of an otherwise perfect and fun 3rd person 3d platforming game for anyone of any age.
Graphics: 8 - They are nice and smooth and really cute
Gameplay 3 - Fun gameplay but some parts of certain levels are almost impossible due to severely inconvenient camera angles that make it difficult to control
Sound/Music: 7 - Nice and relaxing and fit the game perfectly
Fun/Difficulty: 3 - this simple little game is extremely frustrating and is the most difficult platformer I have ever played.
Overall: 5.25. I don't recommend you buy it but  it you get it for free (like I did) then you might get about half an hour of moderate enjoyment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014249361', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 63, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1422584880}
review:
What can I say? I got this game for free... there are tradable cards.

If you want to pay money for this game, don't. It's not worth it going through the bug.

The game itself could be enjoyable if it was a little more polished, rewarding the player with better aesthetics and if it wasn't so buggy. The player does not control the camera but controls depend on where the camera is. So you may be running in one direction and suddenly the camera switches positions causing you to veer 90 degrees off a cliff.

The game could be fun if it was speed run friendly and there was a leaderboard for that aspect of the game and more levels to compete on. This would make Co-op make sense, having friends compete against one another on maps.

The program is cute but the mechanics that should make this things a game are just not there. Perhaps calling it a "game" is too generous.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025834191', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 228, 'playtime_forever': 355, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 355, 'last_played': 1422193668}
review: Woodle isn't hard by any means, nor anything to get hard over, its ultimately a cute platformer with terrible camera angles and AI. The game's environments are actually quite well done and the platforming is enjoyable although relatively easy, and the game's story although simplistic compliments the remainder of the game. The combat is also quite basic but it is serviceable, however the "enemy AI" is awful at best, with either stand still or terrible detection (some charge you or throw projectiles but seem to not see you 90% of the time). Its a cute platformer however to kill a bit of time on, worth picking up for casual play, but nothing more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198174415618', 'num_games_owned': 82, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 200, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 200, 'last_played': 1422321046}
review: This is a cute little game. I would recommend it to someone who is looking for something relatively easy. The game has 6 main levels, and a bonus level that's unlockable after you collect 600 berries. Gameplay is relatively short, but it was definitely worth what I paid for it. The game has cute graphics and calming music. It does lack a main menu, and sometimes after you die and respawn the camera angle changes making gameplay awkward for a bit. Overall, I would recommend this to someone who is looking for some easy, relaxing gameplay. Those who are looking for a challenge should look elsewhere.
