author: {'steamid': '76561198021009654', 'num_games_owned': 2452, 'num_reviews': 266, 'playtime_forever': 103, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 103, 'last_played': 1422117978}
review:
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Spiel: 

Ein Jump‚Äôn‚ÄôRun f√ºr Kinder, da es keinerlei Schwierigkeit gibt.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Einzelspieler:

Es gibt circa 7 Level die man durchlaufen muss und ein Paar Beeren oder soetwas einsammeln muss um das n√§chste Level freizuschalten. Leider gibt es keinerlei Schwierigkeit in diesem Spiel keine Energie, keine Leben , kein Zeitlimit und unendlich versuche. Die Spr√ºnge sind meistens so ausgelegt das man die Level eher durchschleichen soll als sie durchzurennen.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Grafik:

Grafisch sch√∂n gemacht, kann man echt nicht Meckern ausser vielleicht am Stil.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Musik:

Ruhige Musik die im Hintergrund dudelt.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Steuerung:

Geht meistens ganz gut mit XBOX360 Pad, dennoch h√§tte ich mir eine bewegliche Kamera gew√ºnscht.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Pro/Contra:

+ Design
+ f√ºr Kinder echt Top
- f√ºr Erwachsene eher Flop
- keine selbst Justierbare Kamera

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Fazit:

Dieses Kinder Jump‚Äôn‚ÄôRun bietet f√ºr 1h Spielzeit wirklich nur Kindern Spass erwachsene bzw. erfahrene Spieler rennen die Level nur so durch. Die Kamera Probleme sind meistens das schlimmste an der Sache und die wahllos gestellten Checkpoints verstehe ich irgendwie garnicht. Dennoch ein sehr gutes Spiel f√ºr Kinder.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Zusammengefasst: 

Einzelspieler: 6/10
Grafik: 7/10
Musik: 5/10
Steuerung: 8/10
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Spiel: 6/10

I want to recommend this game to ALL of the people who play games in the world as it is extremely fun and entertaining.

I would also like to recommend to steam that they Boost the price of this game up as i believe that the creators deserve more money for this masterpeice. 
Thankyou, and i hope you all enjoy this brilliant game, i have collected all the apples in this game and i have became the rank "Master Oak Tree" that is the highest rank in the game. 
Enjoy.
Dan Taylor A.K.A Oak Master!

author: {'steamid': '76561198110483386', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 151, 'playtime_forever': 155, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 155, 'last_played': 1421945836}
review:
Got the game for 0.29‚Ç¨ from Steam sale and it's worth at least that. Cute and fun little game with no violence. 

Timing jumps was very hard at times and there was a lot of falling off the map. Fortunately, the levels are fairly short and any water drops and berries you've collected will stay with you when that happens, so going back to the beginning of the level isn't that annoying. 

The camera angles can be really bad sometimes. For example, at one of the places where you're thrown into the air, the camera suddenly switched behind the structure and I couldn't see anything. Had to quit the game and restart the level. In another place, after falling and going back the level a bit, the camera was inside a building and I had no idea where Woodle was. Another restart. 

Still, despite the problems, it's a fun game and good for when you want to play something cute and harmless. My play time in record, 2 hours, is for one playthrough, picking some additional berries to unlock the bonus level, and playing that and replaying some other levels to get the 1000 berries achievement, so it's a short game (I'm not a fast player).

author: {'steamid': '76561198041949592', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 605, 'playtime_forever': 63, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1531179057}
review:
Hey everyone and this is my review about the game!

This is a Bad platform game.


[h1]Interface/Menu/Settings[/h1]

Game has a lot of resolution sizes.
You can play fullscreen or windowed mode.
You are able to play on a controller.

[h1]About the game.[/h1]

So you are playing as a little tree with a leaf. You are able to use the leaf to hit enemies but it's a good thing that you almost never have to use this as you are able to dodge enemies rather easy. The one thing that you will love the most is the terrible camera in this game. You are not able to rotate the camera and it's on the worst location too. You will have to pick up apples in each level but there is no such thing as an indicator on how much you have already collected. Each time that you have died you will respawn back to a checkpoint. However these respawns seems to be random as on one moment you will respawn back to your previous location while other moment you will respawn back at the beginning of the level.

Basic cheap graphics.
Music is not really fitting.
Controls not always accurate
TERRIBLE CAMERA ANGLES.
Kid Friendly.
Random respawn checkpoints.
Only contains a couple of levels.


[h1]Other things.[/h1]

Not worth it.
My wood is harder.
Don't believe in these fake positive reviews. The game IS BAD!

-------------------

I Give this game a 2/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198058585920', 'num_games_owned': 505, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 120, 'last_played': 1421850995}

author: {'steamid': '76561198060806210', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 60, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1448343040}
review:
This game shows good potential for a super mario 64/ super mario 3d land style sandbox platformer only issues so far i have are:

1 when you get hit you get brought back to the start of the level instead you should be able to get a leafy green shield power up  and maybe loosing the water drop things when your hit then when you loose them all, you loose a life and get kicked out into the main tree house building.

2 im not sure if i didnt map the camera but there wasnt much camera control as far as i could tell. 


3 maybe more power ups like projecticles or jump higher maybe.

4 you dont have any 1 up counters or counting how many items(fruit or berries) you collected think like most platformers

5 each level should unlock new areas by completeing various tasks or challenges i.e beat a boss or win a race,find an item, time trial race (be reasonable with time limits)

6 your attack needs more range half the time i get hit cause i cant tell if im close enough or too close touching an enemie, also due to the camera , need a camera controls to see what angle baddies from, maybe a power up gives you a stick or a bigger leaf or shoot wind attack with leaves, maybe wind tunnels could bring you to higher areas like a spring or elevator would

7 have multiple ways you can finish a level in no particular order, less linear more on exploration,replayable, unlock new goals in older stages or items

author: {'steamid': '76561198085674623', 'num_games_owned': 346, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 139, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 139, 'last_played': 1421806358}
review:
The camera angle. You will jump off a ledge (literally) because of the camera angle. This game does not include depth perception, and it's not DLC either. [i] Most [/i] of the time you can see where you are going. Apart from all that, it has a nice atmosphere and it looks nice. It was a nice little platformer, but mostly because I got it on special for 20 cents or something.
7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198015863346', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 162, 'last_played': 1421791453}
review: I really wanted to love this game, and frankly, there's nothing much wrong with it. The controls are a little bit clunky with the keyboard, the game is very short, and there's not a great deal of challenge to it. However, it delivered what I expected from it: a cute little platformer, reminder of the old times. It's suitable for children, and frankly, for 3 euros, it's worth it's price. Just don't expect much more from it than what you see on the screenshots.

review:

S√≥ que n√£o se enganem pelos v√≠deos e fotos, o jogo √© bonito mas a jogabilidade √© horr√≠vel, esse jogo √© muito mal otimizado e faz PCs medianos parecerem uma carro√ßa. A c√¢mera √© horr√≠vel e os checkpoints n√£o se decidem, uma hora voc√™ aparece no meio da tela e na outra voc√™ aparece no inicio.

Esse jogo n√£o tem sistema de energia e nem de vidas, ent√£o enquanto voc√™ tiver paci√™ncia para jogar essa atrocidade disfar√ßada de jogo fofo o jogo vai continuar. Mas como o jogo n√£o foi muito bem feito, um desafio surge e ele √© a c√¢mera e movimenta√ß√£o, muitas vezes voc√™ vai ficar com um angulo ruim e como seu personagem n√£o anda totalmente reto voc√™ vai ter que ficar ajudando esse tronco b√™bado a se endireitar ou vai cair. A coisa mais chata √© cair e ter que andar tudo denovo at√© o final. Mencionei que voc√™ precisa dar um clique no mouse para mudar a c√¢mera? Pior a anima√ß√£o de pulo, fiquem pulando sem parar e cada vez mais o tronco vai ficando de ponta cabe√ßa, √© super estranho e pelo jeito esqueceram de limitar o tanto que o toco vira.

Esse jogo tinha de tudo para ser um dos meus favoritos, mas a jogabilidade ruim, c√¢mera e falta de desafio com inimigos est√°ticos fizeram um conceito bom virar um jogo ruim, parece mais uma Demo j√° que depois que passar as fases o jogo acaba meio que do nada, com o primo da Deku Tree te agradecendo e fim, te prendendo nessa tela at√© voc√™ fechar o jogo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033451721', 'num_games_owned': 358, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 75, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1421697255}
review:
Woodle Tree Adventures erinnert mich zuerst an Super Mario 64. Es ist ein kleines Indie Jump'n'Run Game, in dem man pro Welt bzw Level 3 magische Tr√§nen einsammeln muss, um den Boden seiner Heimat zu bew√§ssern. Zudem kann man Radieschen sammeln, um neue Ausr√ºstung zu bekommen, mit der man die nicht sonderlich gef√§hrlichen Gegner besiegen kann. Wird man dennoch getroffen oder f√§llt aus der Welt, muss man meist wieder von vorne anfangen.
Die Welten sind dabei sehr abwechslungsreich und weisen verschiedene Themen auf, wie z.B. Schnee, Bienenstock und W√ºste.
Im Spiel kann man zwar laufen/rennen, springen und schlagen, allerdings reicht dieses simple Prinzip, damit es f√ºr die ca. 75 Minuten unterhaltsam bleibt.
Wer also Lust auf ein kleines, niedliches Jump'n'Run hat, dessen Umfang √ºberschaubar ist, bekommt mit Woodle Tree Adventures eben genau dies.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985969658', 'num_games_owned': 1012, 'num_reviews': 690, 'playtime_forever': 45, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1421356479}
review: Alright game. Cute main character and world. Camera is the worst in history, as you can't move it and it gets stuck at terrible angles and gets you killed. One time I restarted at a checkpoint and it was facing a different way than it was supposed to so I couldn't progress in the level because I couldn't see and had to restart the level. No way to rebind keys. No main menu or way to exit besides completely exiting game or alt f4'ing. Platforming doesn't feel as responsive as it could and just feels a bit off. Game takes about 45 min to complete, which is way too short. Also checkpoints make no sense as a lot of times if you miss a jump you have to start back at beginning of level but sometimes you start closer up but for no apparent reason. One time I respawned closer, died at the exact same part, and then respawned at the start of the level, which made no sense because I had just died in this same spot and spawned much closer. 6.5/10. Try it out with caution.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043333555', 'num_games_owned': 847, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 674, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 323, 'last_played': 1586133269}
review:
Well this game sure is something.

At first glance it appears to be a fun little game worth playing, but it isn't until you start playing it first hand that you realise this game was barely programmed. The camera functions are almost non-existant other than a zoom in and out, meaning you can't articulate the jumps. On top of the it likes to keep the camera right behind you and does not rotate in any way which causes many deaths.

The hazards in this game from in a form of static enemies that pose no threat. Some move back and forth independantly and some chase you at low speeds to attempt variety but all can be killed with a single hit on the leaf.

It makes me so angry because this game looks so good. It is so beautiful. The only reason I went to get all the achievements is because why not, I have nothing better to do than play "Woodle Tree Adventures." Do yourself a favour and make sure you are ready for a bad game before purchase.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014073463', 'num_games_owned': 474, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 189, 'last_played': 1417730962}
review: Este juego de plataformas en 3D, bastante colorido y alegre, cuenta por un lado con algunos aspectos que lo hacen llamativo, como el dise√±o de los niveles y la posibilidad de jugar en coop local. Pero no logran levantar los groseros errores que este juego tiene en su jugabilidad, desde la nula inteligencia artificil que los enemigos poseen, hasta la camara que termina siendo molestia. Finalmente podrias pensar que no recomendaria el juego, sin embargo cumplio cabalmente su objetivo, que es divertir. Debo admitir que fue muy divertido jugar las aventuras de tan adorable prota manico que asesina a todo el que se encuentre sin provocacion alguna, como es woodle.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994870015', 'num_games_owned': 691, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 117, 'last_played': 1420687812}
review:
The fact that I 100%'d this game is seriously causing me to consider seeking professional help. 

On the one hand, I support and love the fact that this game was basically made by one dev who is active on the steam forums for this game. Through that lens, this is in an incredible achievement and one to be applauded. 

Through the lens of just picking up this game and playing it though, there is almost nothing that Woodle Tree does right. Awful checkpoints, awful controls, awful camera, awful physics, awful hitboxes, and a general sense of "What am I doing with my life?"

If you were holding out hope that the story would be GOTY-calibur I've got some bad news for you on that front as well.

Basically every aspect of this game feels like BETA-quality. The worst offenders are surely the camera and checkpoint system. It's so easy to fall or get killed without clearly seeing what is happening only to be forced back to the beginning or halfway point of a level. I'd wager than half my time spent playing was traversing areas I'd already cleared because I kept falling at some bizarre jump point miles away from the checkpoint. 

Also, the "weapon upgrades" in this game are very strange. There's no way to switch between them without physically picking them up from the stage-select world. Also, by the time you unlock 2 of the 4 unlockables, the game is basically over. There's also no nuance in that there's no reason you'd ever want to use an ability other than the most recently unlocked.

Hard to believe I just complained about nuance in a game called Woodle Tree Adventures, but it is what it is. It's just poor design.

Speaking of, this makes me wonder: who is this game made for? The visual style (perhaps the best part of the game) seems to suggest children. And yet, there's no way small kids would be able to play through some of these stunningly awkward jumps with a cock-eyed camera angle. 

Or at least...they shouldn't be made to be. And niether should you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198117399271', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 1582, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1294, 'last_played': 1558132489}
review: I'm usually not a big fan of simplistic art styles, but this one really reminded by of old platformers from the PS1 and N64 era. I liked it a lot. The game however was quite bad. The are only 7 levels and you can finish all of them in less than an hour. You collect "berries" throughout each level which can unlock a bonus level as well as "leaves." The worst part of the game is the beyond bad camera. The angles are terrible, it's a chore to control, and will get you killed more often than not. The controls are also slightly wonky. I wish I could rate this higher, but in its current state it just isn't worth your time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032636062', 'num_games_owned': 2817, 'num_reviews': 104, 'playtime_forever': 354, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 354, 'last_played': 1416345589}
review:
Personal Rating: 3 of 10

3-D platformer game with rather simplistic mechanics. I think this game is meant for those of younger age or some who wish to re-live the good old days like Super Mario. 

You control a stump with a noble quest (which I have forgotten) assigned to you by a huge tree (this is what I personally perceive because I wasn't 100% attention). You need to progress through a 3-D world with vicious monster and your only weapon is a leaf which you used to smack them while collecting berries.

Given all that this game is full of potential and I would gladly invest more time in it and complete all the achievements. BUT god forbids, the camera work and control is so awkward its absolutely unforgiving. I do hope that developer is still active and would incorporate a third-person view in this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036284454', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 9, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1420104365}
review:
Amazing. Absolutely amazing. Woodle Tree Adventures evokes a playfulness not seen since "Whomp's Fortress Stage" in Super Mario 64. It's brilliance is in it's simplicity, three actions, jump, run and "clean up the woods" or "sweep" (or "attack", whatevs) create a seamless interface into this fairytale world. The aesthetics are superbly simple, as though this were some unearthed cartridge found in the Land of OOO and jacked into Beemo's butt.

Although having to restart at the beginning of the stage grew to be a bit tedious, I would highly recommend this to players of all ages.

Casual, un-time consuming, but complex and deep and WHIMSICAL!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198015299785', 'num_games_owned': 314, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 180, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 180, 'last_played': 1419960920}
review:
This game is alright. In my opinion it suffers only from two things, but unfortunately these things make this game really difficult to enjoy. First of all the camera is terrible..most of the time it's really difficult to see what's going on around you..something that is made worse by the very limited field of view. The second thing is that you can't change the controls..it doesn't sound too bad, but it can ruin your game when there's a button that instantly exists the game and you keep pushing it by mistake.. I would love to be able to unbind it or at least re-bind it to something else.

6.5/10. I would buy it if it's on sale. Also, the trading cards make this an easier purchase.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982924205', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1419773921}
review:
In the game's current state, I don't know if I would recommend Woodle Tree Adventures to anyone, as there are a few things that break the game for me.

The camera system is flawed. You have no control over the camera, and for a 3D platformer like this, it makes it almost impossible to play the game. Fixed cameras in games like this are fine if they are done right. Unfortunately for Woodle Tree Adventures, they aren't. In some instances, you have to run toward the camera, not knowing if you're about to walk off of an edge or into an enemy. Using the recommended 360 controller, the triggers and right thumb stick are not mapped to anything. Using those to control the camera would make the game much more playable and enjoyable.

I had an instance where I paused the game and accidently hit a button, and the game just disappeared leaving only the skybox. Music, objects, platforms... all gone. The only option I was left with was to close the game. 

The game is pretty straightforward, but it would be nice if it gave you more instruction, or told you what you were supposed to do other than collecting water. There are fruits or nuts that you collect, but from what I've seen, the game doesn‚Äôt tell you what they are used for. Another reviewer said they were used to upgrade your weapon, which is a giant leaf, but all of the enemies seem to die in one hit, so I don't really see a point.

All in all, Woodle Tree Adventures is not a bad game. I paid $0.74 for it, and if the Dev patches/updates the game, I will change my recommendation. But in its current state, I give Woodle Tree Adventures a 2/5.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979472687', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 261, 'last_played': 1419463007}
review:
Great jump n' run in classic platform style with sweet soundtrack!

At its current price (0.74‚Ç¨) i can fully recommend it to whomever likes Super Mario 64 and similar.
Also the storyline is pretty unique. You play a little tree (i named him [i]Stumpy[/i]) and have to collect 3 fairy tears in each level and afterwards reach the exit. Additionally you can unlock stronger leaves (your "weapon"), a stylish ninja headband and another [spoiler]underwater[/spoiler] level.


[h1]POSITIVE[/h1]
+ easy enough that even children can enjoy
+ precise controls
+ nice and calm soundtrack
+ cute graphics (a stump never looked better!)
+ local co-op modus
+ full xbox 360 controller support
+ achievements, leaf upgrades and a vanity item to unlock


[h1]NEGATIVE[/h1]
- the camera is a big drawback but you can adjust the zoom level
- some objects (like berries) have no shadow, thus its hard to determine their position
- only 6 levels and an additional one to unlock with 600 berries
- no real challenge if you can successfully complete any Mario level
- including all achievements i guess it takes a casual gamer about 2-3 hours to complete everything


The camera is somewhat awful but with a little bit zooming in/out you can fix it most of the times. I had only two times, where i outright was not able to see my character but the developer does not punish you for dying so its no real problem after all.


I had a lot of fun and would like to see an update with more levels and more items to unlock :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197993063886', 'num_games_owned': 319, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 69, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1419460514}
review:
Recomiendo el juego solo si estas muy pero que muy aburrido y quieres sacarte algunos logros.

Juego de plataformas en 3D, somos un tallo de un arbol y tenemos como objetivo recoger 3 gotas de agua por cada mundo que visitemos ya que nuestro arbol se esta muriendo de sed, nuestra arma es una hoja verde. A parte de las gotas de agua, recogeremos manzanas que nos serviran para desbloquear nuevas hojas con nuevos efectos.

Puntos a favor:
-Visualmente atractivo.

Puntos en contra:

-El posicionamiento de la camara, dificulta  mucho la experiencia de juego llegando a ser frustrante.

-Hay bugs en cuanto se refiere a la bolsa donde almacenamos las manzanas, la cual crece cuantas mas cojas, esto y unido a la camara haran que en determinadas situaciones hagas saltos de fe.

author: {'steamid': '76561198146081563', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 35, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1406099365}

author: {'steamid': '76561197992384313', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 79, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1461612218}
review: The jumping is much easier than people seem to be making out, its slow paced and very easy to control midair and easy to get the hang of, just working out exactly where to land can be hard at some of the zoomed out 2Dish parts and the lifty up air drafts are kinda finnicky but otherwise its a decent relaxing short platformer. I briefly thought there were some secret bonus levels but I was accidentally activiating the level balls from long distance with the long ranged leaves so nevermind.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018827188', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1419391330}
review:
There's honestly nothing to like about this game.  There's no story beyond the usual 'Collect the McGuffins!'  Graphics are minimalistic and childish.  Sound effects are even more minimal and boring.  You only get one attack (can be upgraded, but you'll still only have one attack), and it's one hit to kill both ways, which makes combat thoroughly unexciting.  Many 'enemies' won't even try to fight back.  There's little challenge in the platforming, beyond that which arises from the annoying inability to control the camera angle (zooming is all you can do).  And the only penalty for dying is being sent back to a checkpoint.

Maybe a little kid would have some appreciation for it, but still, there are better kid-friendly platformers out there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049477494', 'num_games_owned': 130, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 83, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 83, 'last_played': 1417260314}
review:
Yo obtuve este juego porque lo regalaban, pero si hubiera pagado por √©l me estar√≠a tirando de los pelos. Parece un videojuego hecho por un aficionado, no se si es de una empresa o alguien que lo hizo por afici√≥n, pero parece incompleto.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015041218', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1419996115}
review:
The game is cute and simple and exhibits nostalgia of 3D platformers in the past, but doesn't have much else going for it.  The controls are very simple (using keyboard), but jumping does feel a bit floaty

The fixed camera and the issues accompanied with it (e.g. perception between platforms, super close-ups) can cause a lot of frustration and strongly detract from the game.  Similarly, the more berries you pick up, the bigger your backpack grows, which could block the camera even further.

If you have spare change (I got this game for less than a dollar), you can give it a try, but don't be expecting too much.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029439506', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 244, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 243, 'last_played': 1424312565}
review: It''s a simple and short plataformer with cute graphics and ok gameplay. I recommend it for people who enjoy this type of game and want to have a nice and relaxing time. The game is very easy, most enemies don't even attack you, and the music is simple but relaxing. It's not to be taken seriously, it's just a short walk through cuteland. The fact that it's short is actually a good thing because it would become tedious if kept going longer, since altought the levels have different themes the gameplay is always the same and the unlockables all do the same thing (except the headband that does nothing). It's a nie little game for what it is and a fun experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048971010', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 104, 'last_played': 1419043454}
review:
Feels like a class project that you would try to play for the sake of your friend to give some support. I wouldn't expect to see it on Steam as anything less than an Early Access project. Got it as part of a Humble Bundle, which is a pretty reasonable - you don't expect everything that pops up in an indie bundle to be spectacular.

Cute idea, but needs a ton of work. As people have mentioned, camera angle and edge detection are extremely sketchy - there are some jumps that are a matter of luck whether you can make them or not, and I overshot the same platform, which should have been a very simple jump, six times before I decided I had had enough. Walking through water is excruiatingly slow. I kept playing more out of stubbornheadedness than any liking of the game - I suspect I'll 100% it for the same reason. Still wouldn't pay money for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009485246', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 37, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1418940208}
review:
Woodle Tree Adventures is such a cute and relaxing game!

+ You are a wee little tree stump. Your main objective is to find fairy tears to save the forest. 
You will also try to collect as many berries as possible. It's essentially a very basic 3D jump platformer. However, the soundtrack, artwork and color palette of this game makes it a total winner for me.

- Yes, you will find yourself falling off the world more than you want to and the angles can be rather difficult sometimes BUT this is a game that feels so soothing that I don't even care.

review:
So, a tree in the middle of the green grass... that is about 20 meters from a waterfall, asks it's offspring to go and find water for their dry land ?!?!
Ok, this is a game, and it's not serious game, but it sucks xD

Also, game is very slow, hit boxes are... weird, to say the least, and when you die(?) you are always returned to the beginning of the level...
Camera has a tendency to move on it's own to a position where it is almost impossible to play the game, controls are awkward and imprecise and game is visually cheap (although cute at some times)...

It is just bad... Nothing more to say...

author: {'steamid': '76561197993428182', 'num_games_owned': 754, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 28, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1418591325}
review:
I'm not even sure where I got this game. But anyway, here we go.

The game has a very simplistic style. The art style is cutesey, kind of mario-worldy. Everything has beady little eyes and your character makes cute noises. Combat is very simple -- Enemies either throw things at you or attempt to run into you. You defeat them by wooshing them with a leaf. Enemy AI is as basic as you can get. When you die you are put at a random place in the world, somtimes back at the very beginning.

Your goal is to collect berries (apples? What are they?) to unlock other worlds and to gather tears to finish the current world. The beginning has a few spelling errors and there's real no rhyme or reason to what you're doing. You seem to be a tree stump trying to give water to a bigger tree, so that's your ultimate goal.

The camera, at best, is atrocious. You have a few options: Super close to your character, or super far away. There is no rotation and sometimes being put behind things causes your camera to freak out and either go really far away, or drop to ground level. 

The music is nice, the style is nice.

If you are looking for a calming puzzle/platformer to play in your free time, find something else to play.

Overall score, 3/10. Definitely not worth the 3 dollars it's selling for.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978705200', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 250, 'playtime_forever': 53, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1418502433}
review:
With this game, there isn't much to talk about.

Note my play-time, I didn't quit the game early. That's about how long it's going to take to beat Woodle Tree Adventures. Getting all of the achievements might triple that play-time, but that's entirely because they're a fruit-collecting grind.

Why do I recommend it?
Well, it's very pleasant. WTA is a fine change of pace from sadistic games like Wings of Vi. You don't have to worry about dying horrifically every five seconds just to reach the next checkpoint (where you'll die even more). Your only mission in this game, is to hop around and be at peace. 

If you're looking for something with a bit more substance, then look elsewhere. I didn't mind my play-through of WTA. If nothing else it was a well-deserved break from the hell I usually put myself through.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065704401', 'num_games_owned': 322, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1416959464}
review:
Horrible platforming and a camera that will make you nauseous. This game is painfully easy. I know it's supposed to be a casual, relaxing game, but this is seriously something I would give to a 3 year old. Unfortunately, as easy as the gameplay is, the abhorrent, slippery jumping and the detestable camera angles make it practically unplayable.

The art style is alright, cute, but nothing to write home about. Only reason to play this game would be to get the trading cards, because it does have some pretty charming backgrounds and emoticons.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035655574', 'num_games_owned': 1323, 'num_reviews': 204, 'playtime_forever': 409, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 409, 'last_played': 1416502763}
review:
When it comes to how it‚Äôs made and how it runs, I would say this is a pretty bad game. It‚Äôs unpolished, the animations are god awful and it just generally feels amateur. With that said it's kind of cute and I still ended up playing and 100%ing it. I‚Äôd say it‚Äôs an easy 100% and that‚Äôs the only reason why I even started it.

"Classical elements from the 90's games and new interesting ideas."
Honestly I'm not really sure what new interesting ideas they were referring to, but if one thing reminded me of the classic 90's games it was the camera. The camera is quite frustrating and reminded me of the Mario 64 rage days. Finding yourself literally screaming at the screen as if it's actually going to help. What's worse here though is that the camera is locked.

It's not really at all challenging, the levels are pretty casual and are completed pretty easily. You collect berries as you go, which help to unlock levels, but there aren‚Äôt all that many levels to unlock so after they are unlocked the berries become somewhat pointless.

The story is pretty lame, but I guess with most 3D platformers the story is never really a focal point.

All in all it‚Äôs quite bad, although I still played through and completed the thing, I'm not going to recommend. It's not great. If you're looking for a quality Mario 64 type game look elsewhere.


TL;DR : Badly made, a little cute and easy to 100% but terrible.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983291252', 'num_games_owned': 4279, 'num_reviews': 194, 'playtime_forever': 209, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 209, 'last_played': 1415917720}
review:
Woodle Tree Adventures is a quick and casual 100%. The levels are simple and quaint. It's very linear but it's not something you play when you want a challenge. It's more of a pick me up game when you're in between other activities.

The camera needs a lot of work. Most of the time it gives you awkward angles and there's not a whole lot of options to re-adjust it.

Adorable game overall. I recommend it for an hour or two of half-bliss.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049396467', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 215, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 132, 'last_played': 1462944696}
review:
This game does not have any cool, fancy game mechanics or features. It's platforming at it's very basic, and I love it so much.

You play as a cute tree stump named Woodle who are being asked to bring back water to the forest. On each level there are three water drops hidden somewhere on the map, and you need to collect all three of them to complete the level. The only way to defend yourself against the enemies is hitting them with a leaf. You will make them dissapear in one hit, but in one hit they will send you far back in the level.

Woodle carries a bag in which he puts berries into that are scattered around the level, there are so many of them. With the berries you can unlock levels and upgrade your leaf so it becomes better. When you have enough berries you can unlock a cute bandana for Woodle so he looks even cuter.

It's one of my favourite games because of how simple it is to play, and how really cute everything looks. Sometimes you can't tell difference between a good person and an enemy. I like the level designs and the fitting soundtrack. I love the snow level especially. The only negative thing about Woodle Tree Adventures is the camera. It's a mess to control and it often gets stuck behind a block so you can't see where you're going.

It takes around an hour to complete, and it's really enjoyable for that short time. :3

author: {'steamid': '76561198024246936', 'num_games_owned': 5024, 'num_reviews': 194, 'playtime_forever': 264, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 199, 'last_played': 1440313737}
review: Woodle Tree Adventures is a very bright and mellow game, providing a short but pleasant reprieve from loud, monochrome murderfests. It is a safe, relaxing, no-frills 3D platformer with a gorgeous if slightly saccharine aesthetic. The game can be enjoyed by all ages, but balance the $3 price tag against the short length, limited replay value, and control issues. The jumping puzzles demand precise controls that the game just doesn't have, and the antagonistic, glitchy camera will frustrate young and old alike. Nonetheless, I was pleasantly surprised by this game. It really chilled me out, I fell in love with the visuals, and I had a lot of fun for the less than 2 hours it lasted.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991357133', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 243, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 227, 'last_played': 1679230491}
review:
[h1]Woodle Tree Adventures Review[/h1]
I bought this game for 1,04‚Ç¨ and finished it in 3 hours or so. The game feels very much like a student project, and it probably is.
[list]
[b]Pros:[/b]
[*]Great aesthetics
[*]Cute characters
[*]Easy gameplay
[/list]
[list]
[b]Cons:[/b]
[*]Dreadful camera that's sometimes nearly game-breaking. The player can only zoom in and out, and sometimes the game decides to rotate the camera on its own. In various levels this makes the perception of depth really difficult.
[*]No constant respawning. Sometimes you'd respawn at the beginning of the level, sometimes halfway, or sometimes somewhere completely different.
[*]Levels seemed unfinished at times, especially when zoomed out.
[*]The different leaves don't really seem to change much other than the initial ranged attack upgrade you get with the orange leaf.
[*]Unable to complete all achievements if you only have one Xbox 360 controller or never have friends over.
[*]Keyboard controls are awful. Arrows for movement, shift for run, spacebar for jumping and then [i]E for attack?[/i] No remapping either!
[/list]

[h1]Conclusion:[/h1]
For the 1 buck I bought it for it was a somewhat alright game, but very frustrating due to the various cons. I got all the achievements other than the "play with your friend" one, because I only have one x360 controller and I never have friends over. More bad than good, and honestly, I'm disappointed.

Final rating:
[u][b][h1]4/10[/h1][/b][/u]

author: {'steamid': '76561197980829383', 'num_games_owned': 959, 'num_reviews': 115, 'playtime_forever': 33, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1414818963}
review:
This game is terrible. It's a stripped down 3D platformer. You play as a stump who needs to collect berries and water "Because the world is thirsty" and that's the entire plot. 

The only penelty to dieing seems to be to start at the start of the level. But these are long paths and trucking back to where you were because an enemy taped you one time becomes tedious fast. 

I got this game for free and that may even be over priced.

author: {'steamid': '76561198133043492', 'num_games_owned': 676, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1410982196}
review:
I loved the trailer when I saw the game in a Humble Bundle. But when I played it, I was pretty disappointed. 
The graphics are very cute. I also love the concept of the character and the enemies.  But it can be a bit improved. It looks pretty unfinished. It just misses something what I cannot name.
I liked the levels, not too easy or difficult. And your character carries a big bag to collect berries. The more berries you collect, the bigger your bag becomes, which looks pretty cute.  But the camera mode is terrible. So that killed a lot of my experience in the game. Because the lack of a proper camera and so the view over the level, made it hard to see what I was doing or where I had to go.

I wish there was a neutral option instead of just positive or negative. It is a cute game, but there are a lot of minor annoyances. But it is not expensive, so it is not a big waste of money. It is still fun to play when you have nothing to do. It is just not a game that I would recommend to all my friends.

My rating for the game: 5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198033915602', 'num_games_owned': 325, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 249, 'last_played': 1626184399}
review:
The demographic for this game seems to be targetting a, 6 and under, age group.
The game works on Windows, Linux and Macintosh.
The average graphics is for a pc with a mid-low range pc specifications.
Mario-esque story element.

+Has a charming quirky style.
+The price relative to other games for a non-sale price is almost reasonable.
+The game supports multiplayer gamepad configurations.
+The user inputs can be remapped as desired.

-Not impressive technical side in implementation leads to some users feeling game is unpolished e.g. camera, finicky projectile mechanics, physics.
-The gameplay is not completely linear, but also doesn't have the most replay value.
- for remapping buttons.
-Ambiuously named remapping control options.
2.5/5 Unoverwhelmingly recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046116780', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 102, 'last_played': 1412820447}
review:
Note: Played this on Ubuntu 14.04, I find the game runs quite slow at 1920 x 1080 with graphics at max (or lower) (Edit: Runs fine on fastest even using intel graphics on laptop - no noticeable difference from max). This effects gets more noticeable on the bigger levels and I guess this is likely due to running it on Linux since its hardware requirements are low.

Controls:
Primarily played this with an xbox 360 controller and the controls are easy enough. You may also configure them from the settings window that launches prior to the game. Have not changed the controls so am unable to confirm if there are any problems there.

Gameplay:
The camera angles are easily the most annoying thing. Would prefer a more angled view (looking top-down) so that you can better maneuver. Zooming in and out helps but it is still awkward at times and the camera angle changing as you pass a certain part of the puzzle is not always welcome. Edit: Occasionally falling down resets the camera to a completely horizontal view which is terrible.

No idea how the beaver or badger works, it sort of popped in at places by itself during lvls 1 and 2 but has gone missing since. The enemies that move are easy enough to avoid and others are just static. I like that the bag/satchel thing your character carries grows larger as you collect berries, a nice detail.

By collecting berries you can eventually unlock other puzzles and upgrade your leaf although I have yet to figure out how the latter helps. Edit: Leaf can be used to defeat enemies.

Graphics & Sound:
Cartoon-y graphics and music that is repetitive but not yet irksome. At some points jumping upwards to climb structures can result in your character going horizontal but corrects itself once you settle. One sound for all enemy types killed.

Story:
There is a brief intro video that provides some context but other than that there is no story at all.

Bugs & Quirks:
After clearing the game there is no exit to menu option (or rather the starting island I guess), you either quit or stare indefinitely at the credits. Same for any level in-game, you can not return to your little house from which you originally select a level.

No steam achievements, likely a Linux only issue.

Rating:
Edit: 2/10, picked this up on a free I am grateful for the game and would recommend this as a way to pass time. I usually play solitaire or a similar game to clear my mind or pass time in between doing things and this has done reasonably well as a substitute. Cleared the game in about two hours tops. would be less if I did not muck about as much.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035500396', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 73, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1412513980}
review:
I wish I liked this game. Its tedious, unimaginative and rendered nearly unplayable by the just terrible camera angles.
Even though I received this title FREE, I still feel a bit cheated somehow, maybe its the time I'll never get back?

Its graphically cute, quaint and if you can forgive the constant clipping issues, pleasant to look at. I tried introducing my four-year old to a non-Minecraft platformer using Woodle, (as its not a worthwhile challenge for a seasoned platform-gamer) but the unforgiving, unchangable camera angles make even the simplest jump too much for him, and though there aren't lives to worry about, the respawn throws you seemingly at random back through the level.

I wish I liked it. I want to like it, but I don't...

review:
"C'est mignon tout plein ;-)"

PRIX : 6 / 10
Je vais rester neutre au niveau du prix qui est loin d'√™tre cher, pour 3‚Ç¨ le jeu propose des √©l√©ments visuels sympathique, mais au vu de la qualit√© finale, on pourrait s'attendre √† une meilleure finition (peut-√™tre dans de futures mises √† jour).
Ce n'est pas du vol, mais c'est loin d'√™tre une bonne affaire (c'est le genre de jeu qu'on retrouve dans des bundles pour quelques euros, mieux vaut l'obtenir de cette fa√ßon :-)).

PERFORMANCES : 3 / 10
La premi√®re chose que j'ai constat√©, c'est que l'optimisation du jeu est tout simplement horrible, il faut une b√™te de course pour pouvoir faire tourner le jeu avec les graphismes au maximum et m√™me avec une bonne configuration on n'est pas √† l'abri de ralentissements inexplicables.

GRAPHISMES : 8 / 10
Pour rester dans le domaine visuel, j'ai un petit coup de coeur pour la patte graphique du jeu, enfantin et tellement mignon  :3 (c'est √† peu pr√®s la seule chose aboutie dans le jeu, malgr√© tout de m√™me quelques probl√®mes dans les animations et les rendus de certaines textures).

JOUABILIT√â : 3 / 10
Clairement LE point faible du jeu, une maniabilit√© atroce. Entre la cam√©ra qui cadre mal et les mouvements du personnage parfois impr√©cis, vous risquez fort de mourir lorsque vous sauterez de plateforme en plateforme, c'est assez compliqu√© d'√©valuer les distances, mais heureusement on a des vies √† l'infini.
De plus la cam√©ra qui tourne √† 360¬∞ dans des b√¢timents de 4m¬≤ (on commence √† voir √ßa d√®s le d√©but dans la maison de notre h√©ros), √ßa peut vous retourner l'estomac en quelques minutes, je n'ose pas imaginer ce que √ßa donnerait avec l'Oculus Rift ...

MULTIJOUEUR : - /10
N'ayant pas de manette de XBOX 360 sous la main, je n'ai pas pu tester, mais bon je ne pense pas que cela rajoute beaucoup plus de fun au jeu.

DUR√âE DE VIE : 4 / 10
Il faut entre 1h (pour la fin normal du jeu) et 3-4h (pour obtenir tous les succ√®s) pour finir ce jeu, heureusement si c'√©tait plus long cela ressemblerait fort √† des s√©ances de tortures.

CONCLUSION : 4 / 10
Malgr√© le fait que j'ai obtenu ce jeu gratuitement je ne peux pas vraiment recommander ce jeu. N√©anmoins, je pense qu'il faut lui laisser sa chance et comme je suis d'une humeur sympathique, je l√®ve mon pouce :-). C'est clairement un jeu d√©di√© aux jeunes enfants, √ßa peut peut-√™tre les int√©resser, je me souviens qu'√©tant plus jeune certains jeux √©taient totalement difficiles, mal con√ßu et compl√®tement pourris et poutant on y jouait et on arrivait m√™me √† progresser en pers√©v√©rant (ici la difficult√© √©tant tr√®s faible, je ne pense pas que cela posera beaucoup de probl√®mes pour terminer le jeu).

author: {'steamid': '76561198052007123', 'num_games_owned': 6824, 'num_reviews': 1312, 'playtime_forever': 410, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 410, 'last_played': 1411683510}
review: I had high expectations for this game. On trailers it looked like a solid, fun and cute platformer. Sure, it is cute. It also looks fun, but I can't say that after I played Woodle Tree Adventures. This is the main problem with this title. On screenshots, it looks amazing, but when you play it, it's just terrible. The longer you play the more problems there are, mainly with camera. Physics also feel strange, and when you mix both of these things you are stopping to have fun, because even simply jumps makes you sometimes easily to fall and die, and you need to go with few parts of game over and over. It would be cool if the game was hard, but if it's problem of how's the game was made then it's not good. If you didn't managed to get this game for free then skip it, there are plenty of platformer games that are much better, that are actually worth money and time spending in.

review:
This game really surprised me, it was really fun to play the cute little tree. You can beat the game in less than 2 hours, I think maybe that's the attraction of this game. Its a lot of fun for 2 hours, but nothing more. It would be a really great free-2-play title, but I wouldn't recommend to pay money for it.

Game : 6.0/10
Graphic : 5.5/10

[b]100% Achievement :[/b] [strike]Easy[/strike] | Medium | Hard | Very Hard
[b]100% Achievement Guide :[/b]
1. Complete the first level - As mention as its title (Storyline)
2. Unlock the Yellow Leaf - Collect 200 berries
3. Unlock the Orange Leaf
4. Unlock the White Leaf
5. Beat the Game - As mention as its title (Storyline)
6. Collect 1000 berries * - As mention as its title, the easiest way shown below
7. Collect 3000 berries * - As mention as its title, the easiest way shown below
8. Play with a friend **  - Shown below.


* This requires rebinding the "BackPack360" command to a key. In the launcher, go to "input" tab and find "BackPack360". After that, launch the game. After finishing a level, play it again. However this time press the key that you've assigned. Each time you return the level selection screen you will get the same amount of berries as you collected during your first run.

** In the launcher, go to "input" tab and find "StartPad3602". Once found, assign it the key of your choice. After that, launch the game. Once in the level with your house, simply press the key that you've assigned. If the achievement doesn't pop, simply restart the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014988292', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 96, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1411355049}
review:
Woodle Tree Adventures is a simple 3D platformer. The story is simple and easy to understand, and the difficulty level curve dosn't jump very high. I would recomend this game for use in introducing young players to 3d platform games. 

As it stands it is not a bad game, it just seems to be lacking a few little things. But the music is nice and I didn't find any major bugs, it's small difficulty curve might make the ending a little anti climatic, but it's ok for what this game is trying to do.

My biggest problem with the game is the camera, when you walk into a new "camera angle zone" it changes the zoom and angle of the camera, but if you die in certain places and are trown back into a prevous area the camera will not revert. 

My other nit-pick to this quick but enjoyable game is the levels do not keep track of how many berries you get... so it's hard to say if I got every berry in each level... that might be something that would add replay value to the game. 

TL:DR its a very easy platforming game sutible for people of all ages, 3.5/*****

author: {'steamid': '76561198048863294', 'num_games_owned': 4748, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 174, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 174, 'last_played': 1411701017}
review:
Plataformero 3D en el que manejamos un simp√°tico brote que nace con el objetivo de conseguir agua y bayas para su comarca en sequ√≠a. En el transcurso deberemos pasar por diferentes mundos con diferentes ambientaciones, eliminando a los diferentes enemigos con los que nos topemos usando nuestra √∫nica arma, una hoja con la cual los azotaremos. A medida que obtenemos bayas se ir√°n desbloqueando nuevos tipos de hojas con poderes especiales (verde, amarilla, naranja y blanca) que nos permitir√°n eliminar a los enemigos m√°s f√°cilmente desde mayor distancia. De todas formas, la gran mayor√≠a de los enemigos son eliminados sin demasiados problemas con la hoja por defecto, as√≠ que los upgrades son un tanto in√∫tiles.

A decir verdad...tengo sentimientos encontrados con este juego :\. Visualmente es un juego muy agradable y colorido, que me recuerda de cierta forma al Mario 64 (sin √°nimos de comparar!), pero en cuanto a la jugabilidad deja mucho que desear. Por un lado, cuesta bastante adaptarse a los controles y las c√°maras; hay algunos cambios de perspectiva que marean bastante y hacen que debamos cambiar repentinamente la direcci√≥n de un sentido al opuesto, lo cual resulta muy inc√≥modo y nos har√° caer al vac√≠o m√°s de una vez. Adem√°s, a veces es complicado agarrar las bayas u otros elementos dado que es dif√≠cil darse cuenta d√≥nde es que est√° suspendido exactamente. De todas formas, luego de un par de horas de juego nos terminamos acostumbrando y m√°s o menos logramos manejar al personaje como queremos. Un tip con el que d√≠ sin querer luego de un rato jug√°ndolo y que no est√° en ning√∫n lado, ni siquiera en la pantalla de informaci√≥n sobre los controles, es que con el stick derecho del mando (al menos con el de XBox360) se puede alejar o acercar la c√°mara, lo cual da un poco m√°s de flexibilidad al momento de explorar los mundos.

Por otro lado, le falta bastante optimizaci√≥n a mi entender. Con resoluciones grandes (1366x768) corre ultra laggy en calidad alta y hasta en normal. En mi caso para jugarlo en la TV opt√© por bajar la calidad a baja porque dada la precisi√≥n que requieren algunos saltos es bastante molesto jugarlo con lag por m√°s m√≠nimo que sea (solo como aclaraci√≥n, mi PC est√° descartada ya que corre sin problema juegos con requerimientos bastante mayores que este en calidad high o mayor).

El sistema de checkpoints es muy inconsistente y hasta aleatorio me animar√≠a a decir. Algunas veces estamos reci√©n comenzando el nivel y al perder volvemos a un lugar cercano al que est√°bamos como es de esperar, mientras que otras veces tenemos el mundo ya bastante avanzado y al perder volvemos al inicio, lo cual nos har√° quedar o.O m√°s de una vez.

Adem√°s tiene unos cuantos bugs, algunos relacionados a lo visual como objetos que desaparecen y se pueden atravesar, y otros (mucho) m√°s graves relacionados a la jugabilidad, como por ejemplo que luego de jugar un rato la primera vez al entrar y salir de un mundo autom√°ticamente ganamos cerca de 100 berries. En mi caso, solo probando los diferentes niveles llegu√© a las 1000 berries en no m√°s de una hora de juego sin darme cuenta, desbloqueando, para mi lamento, todas las plumas disponibles as√≠ como tambi√©n los logros correspondientes a esos unlocks. Luego me enter√© que en el punto de encuentro existe hasta una gu√≠a para conseguir 3000 berries en pocos minutos debido a este bug. Como si esto fuera poco no cuenta con una manera de iniciar una partida desde cero sin tener que reinstalar o hurgar en el file system para borrar nuestro avance, ya que apenas entramos al juego nos lleva al estado en el que quedamos durante la √∫ltima partida por el mecanismo de autosaves que utiliza.

Si no fuera por estos problemas mi puntuaci√≥n ser√≠a un tanto distinta, pero aunque me da pena por lo simp√°tico y la variedad de mundos tem√°ticos a los que nos transporta, en este momento no le puedo dar m√°s de 5/10.  S√≠ puede ser bueno para ni√±os, ya que como dec√≠a, independientemente de los problemas, visualmente es bien agradable, tanto los mundos como los personajes. Para tom√°rselo enserio, olv√≠dalo por ahora, al menos mientras no solucionen los inconvenientes. Para pasar el rato, podr√≠a ser ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198058277876', 'num_games_owned': 2405, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 93, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 93, 'last_played': 1411053459}
review:
Es un buen juego para matar una o dos horas que tengas libres. Se hace demasiado corto y no incita demasiado a la rejugabilidad, a excepci√≥n de los trofeos, aunque estos se pueden conseguir a base de aprovechar errores del juego.  
La camara no es lo mejor que tiene este juego, muchas veces te deja tirado. Su dificultad, en cuanto a enemigos, es bastante pobre ya que se centra m√°s en ponertelo complicado con el tema de los saltos entre plataformas y esas cosas, pero aun as√≠ es facil.  
Lo que m√°s destaca es el apartado artistico que es bastante bonito. 

Yo lo consegu√≠ gratis pero hubiera pagado por √©l por un precio razonable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093514365', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1431905157}
review:
Woodle Tree Adventures is a 3d action platforming game in which you play as a small Tree stump wielding a leaf collecting fruits and water drops in your backpack to save the world.  It is a game with lively and colorful graphics, reminiscent of many of the favorite games I played as a child on the N64, however that's about where the games charm ends.

Pros:
-Beautifully designed and vibrantly colored worlds and characters which are cute, whimsical and well designed bring back fond nostalgic memories of old school platformers.  The areas seem fairly well designed and are really a treat to look at.  The character designs are really cute and unique.  These qualities present a lush and intriguing platforming environment that you actually want to try to explore.

-Great controller support which implements itself without need for setup.  The preset button configurations are simple and intuitive.

Cons:
-Horrible animation quality, the characters seem to half walk/half glide across the screen, animations are slow and choppy.

-Poor camera control creates problems within the game where you can't see where you are trying to go, or enemies and platforms are blocked from view.  Often times it's difficult to grasp where you stand in relation to the platforms and enemies around you, leaving you swinging your weapon and finding the enemy is to your side rather than behind you, or much farther away than you thought.  This is a real killer as much of the game requires reaching that next platform and when you can't see it, the result is quite frustrating.

-Poor performance causes this game to run extremely slowly and rifled with lag.  You'll feel more often than not that you are about as quick as a snail... and this alone makes you want to close the game.

-enemy death animations are slow and drawn out, however as they are dying they still manage to attack and kill you while you attempt to slink away.

-the sound quality is really mediocre, some sounds are drastically louder than others, most of the sound effects sound like they do not belong in the game and make no sence at all.  The music is ok, but it really doesn't feel like its in the right game.

Overall I can't recommend anyone plays this game.  Adventure/platformer games are all about the gameplay, and this game has a horrble implementation of anything resembling gameplay.  Its so gruellingly slow and buggy you want to ragequit after just a few minutes.

review:
I really like this game. That doesn't mean it's that good, though.

Their heart was in the right place, and everything looked great, but the gameplay felt unpolished and the game fell
short. Very short. Maybe sometime the developers'd make a level pack for us or something. I love the style and
how cute this game is though. I don't wanna leave a bad taste in your mouth with this negative rated review, but
the game isn't too good.

If you want something that looks visually amazing, give it a buy. It's cheap as hell.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991071129', 'num_games_owned': 877, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 89, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1518731947}
review:
Although the graphics are cute and charming, The lack of story or anything creative really hampers the game. 
There is a serious lack of explaining what any of the items do or any reason i am a stump with a swollen purple tumor on my back. It wants to be Mario so badly but falls flat on it's face. I really hate the fact that you get hit once and you start from the beginning of the stage. The music is relaxing but not remotly engaging at all. The game is very bare bones in terms of gameplay. I can honestly say there are better platformers on newgrounds or adult swim. If your looking for a good platform game try They bleed Pixels or blood of the werewolf. I can't recommend this at all.

author: {'steamid': '76561198137628277', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1410483330}
review: I expected something like Super Mario 3D World for the Wii U. I was so, so wrong. This game is just awful. I never not reccomend games, but this title has earned it. DO NOT BUY THIS GAME.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028425767', 'num_games_owned': 589, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 61, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1421528375}
review:
This is only good if you are either under 10 years old, love anything cute and bright or just want something simple to play. Now my review should show you I played on 59 minutes of the game, that's because that's how long it took to complete. I'm an adult male (20s-30s) and still had an okay time with it. This does have a fixed camera and some areas can make it hard to tell where you are, but if you've played enough 3D platform games than you should know from logic what to do next. 

The story line is pointless, but again this is a quick game and I'm guessing it is aimed for children so they might take longer than I did and still have a good time just seeing themselves move around in this bright environment. There are no icons around your screen to show you how much you've collect or how many lives you have left (You have unlimited lives in this game)

The enemies are lazily created, some of them look as if they are friends or just creatures as part of the world, but you cannot tell until you try and hurt them. There are only 2 different creatures which are harmless.

I wouldn't play this again, but I purchase this from Humble Bundle and so a bit of that went to charity and so I don't feel so bad.

If you want something more geared to gamers which is just as cute I say take a look at 'Lovely Planet'

author: {'steamid': '76561198046901941', 'num_games_owned': 656, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1714, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1497, 'last_played': 1447211388}
review:
I would not recomend this game for adults. But for small children like mine who range from ages 2 years to 8 years this is a fun game with great challenges and zero consequences for failure.

Beyond as a childrens game I will say again do not buy until these key features are addressed;

- When adding co-op to a game like this at least add some split screen. The camera is fixed to the first player and you will lose the second player very fast.

- make a menu. simplistic development. when my 8 year old daughter ask "why this game has no menu?" That means you F'ed up. I don't want my kids playing resolution before the game starts. Again make a menu.

- I do not know how the Mac and Windows versions are but the Linux version has broken achievements. (correction) I see in the forums that all platforms have broken achievements. congrats.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002678005', 'num_games_owned': 1614, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 626, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 271, 'last_played': 1577067909}
review:
I've had a lot of fun playing this game, I would recomend buying it [u][b]only if you have young children to play it with.[/b][/u]

I play this game with my four year old son. Every level is pretty freeform, I didn't even know if levels could be 'beat' until I took over the main character after my son stopped playing and found out how to finish them, however, for anyone that is no longer a child, you will find this game very easy, and very boring.

I've spent at least four hours so far following my son playing as the co-op beaver character, I can collect the items for my son, defeat enemies but not pan the camera or finish the level.

I got this game through humblebundle.com, if you have children you want to introduce to 3-dimensional platforming games, this is a great start, especially for only 2.99, I highly recommend it in those situations; you will enjoy reminiscing over the glory days of your first adventure games while they are having a blast [u][b]experiencing it for the first time.[/b][/u]

author: {'steamid': '76561197965846840', 'num_games_owned': 500, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 94, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1410407397}
review:
If Woodle Tree Adventures was given to me as an assignment for a game development class, I suppose I would give it a passing grade.  Functionally, the game works fine.  That said, as a comercial project, it just falls flat.  Woodle Tree Adventures begins with Not The Deku Tree telling... Woodle, I guess?  It's never clear on the player character's name.  Anyway, you have to gather-up water drops.  The story is told and then forgotten about, both by the player and by the game.  So clearly we're here for the gameplay, and that's just fine.  There are so many games that are determined to make you sit through hours-worth of cutscenes to tell their terrible stories, so I'm just fine with having a quick summary and then onto the game.  It's just that when you get there, you almost want to know more about the story.

The game advertises itself as harkening back to the days of Super Mario 64 or Banjo Kazooie, and to that respect it's fairly accurate.  Taking place on levels that seem to be inspired by Nintendo's recent 3D Mario titles, your objectives are two-fold.  Collect berries to unlock more powerful ranks for your leaf, and collect the three water drops to bring to the end of the level in order to complete it and unlock a new one.  Basically instead of coins and stars, you have berries and droplets.  Fair enough.  I can dig simple.  The problem with the levels isn't so-much in lack of things to look for, but more in how the levels are delivered, and in how Woodle (I'm just assuming that's his name) controls and fights.

First, the levels.  As design goes, they're competant-enough.  However, the developer rules over the camera with an iron fist.  The player is only allowed to control the zoom of the camera, which only sometimes allows the player to get a better look at the area they are navigating.  This creates a common problem in most levels where the player is expected to navigate, explore, and even platform along a 3D environment while the camera insists on parking as low as possible in order to give the player a strictly 2D view.  This is a particular problem on a level where the player has to navigate up a wall of honey combs, but there's a pit hidden from view behind what otherwise looks like could be flat terrain.  Then there's the ice level with the obligatory slippery terrain, and the player is expected to navigate and platform up a thin line of stairs.  Too far back, and they fall into the pit and back to the beginning of the level; too far forward and they fall onto the ledge below and have to start over; all while dealing with slippery controls because of the ice.  Then there's the problem of only [i]some[/i] levels having any check points.  Die on the wrong level, and it's all the way back to the beginning to re-navigate any annoying obstacles (and it seems it's always the levels with annoying platforming segments that have no checkpoints) in order to catch back up to where the player died in the first place.

Woodle himself seemed content to add to the frustrations.  The game's physics are kind of weird in that Woodle seems to maintain momentum, even after running into a flat surface.  This lead to a common problem where, after running into a wall or something, I would jump and find Woodle projecting himself forward despite no input on the analog stick.  This lead to more than one occasion where Woodle seemed to take control of himself in order to find the nearest pit, and back to the beginning of the level (or if I was lucky, to a checkpoint).  The combat in the game is equally uninspired.  There are enemies, and they will attack Woodle to try and send him back to the beginning of the level.  Thankfully, they're also painfully easy to defeat; especially once Woodle gets the leaf that sends-out a projectile.  Not only are they no threat, but killing them doesn't even feel rewarding.  They all make the exact same noise, fall over, then disappear.  By, aren't we getting stimulated.

Normally this is the part where I'd say that the game was clearly designed for children, so it's okay if it isn't exactly game of the year material.  There are two problems with that defense though.  Firstly, the advertising specifically appeals to nostalgia by referencing games from about 20 years ago, meaning that anyone who played them (especially during their prime) is going to be 25 or older.  Secondly, there are just better games that are child-appropriate.  Steam has thousands of games available to choose from, and there's also the option of acquiring (or dusting-off) an N64 in order to have their kids play the very games whose appeal this game uses for marketing.  Granted that children tend to have lower standards, but when games are available that are child-appropriate AND entertaining for older audiences, why settle?

Sadly, I cannot recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198117295623', 'num_games_owned': 654, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 37, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1410366877}
review:
As I am a bit of an achievement hunter, I love to 100% games. But this game... Boy oh, boy. This game is bad

I got it for free, so I guess I shouldn't complain but, I will. 
This game is very much like an old PS1 game, but the controls, in my opinon, are awful. The platforming is so unfair, making you make the impossible jumps just so you can collect that on last berry that you need to 100% the level. That's not even the worse part. The worst part is that when you even try to 100% a level, you still have to redo it, over and over to get the berries for those two f'ing achievements. This game is just something you should buy for a friend you hate, but don't want to let them down.

So, would I recommend this game? No. Unless you want to blow some cash on a game that feels like it could be a flash game.

I give this game a 4.7/10. Playable to the slightest point, but would not recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060039172', 'num_games_owned': 1294, 'num_reviews': 163, 'playtime_forever': 137, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 137, 'last_played': 1405734196}
review:
I'm sorry, no. Do not play this game.

I honestly came in with the expectation of playing a cute, fun collect-a-thon from the old N64 era, but instead came walking in a messy, unfinished game that would be perfectly excused by me if it was in early acess, except it's not.

The camera is trash, the game is buggy and it's just not fun.... I can only praise this game for it's unique and well done art style, but other than that, this game is something that has no excuse to be on the Steam store in the state of this.

If this game gets patched and has all of it's issues fixed, then I think this would be a fun and small game for all fans of this genre, but until that day comes, don't think about getting this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038944776', 'num_games_owned': 853, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 41, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1409567337}
review:
Well what can I say? I will be honest I did not expect a lot from this game. I mean It's ¬£1.99 to start with. But I was wrong to judge this book by its cover. This is a lot of fun. Yes its designed more for children but as a fully grown child I really enjoyed playing this game. It has great looking graphics. Smooth gameplay. Great platforming aspects & some pretty nasty monsters that will kill you. 

So overall I would recommend this game for people who enjoy platforming games and want something a little light hearted or if they have children and want something safe and fun for them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198109333284', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1408850713}
review: A prime example of how a single glaring flaw can turn an otherwise average game into something So Bad It's Horrible.  The camera is awful.  Sometimes it faces the wrong way for what you're doing.  Sometimes it abruptly turns and screws up your jump.  Sometimes the angle is too low to tell where you are on a platform.  But above all, you can't rotate it manually, so you're stuck with whatever crap the camera throws at you.  This is unforgivable in a 3-D platformer, and unless it's fixed, I cannot recommend Woodle Tree Adventures.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005296031', 'num_games_owned': 2529, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1408822080}
review:
This game is gorgeous. I'll admit I bought it because it looked like a nice, relaxing time. However, there's not much of a game here. There are six levels, in each one there are three items you need to get, then you go to the end. Scattered around are a bunch of nearly worthless to collect berries, and completely non-threatening (though interesting looking) "enemies." Any deaths you have will be a direct result of the ridiculous camera, which then sends you back to some totally whack checkpoints. Granted, none of the stages are long enough to where checkpoints matter too much.

Basically it boils down to a really gimped collectathon. A short one. My play time is how long it took me to beat the game and get every achievement. So if you're into about an hour of bland gameplay while looking at pretty graphics, this is for you.
