author: {'steamid': '76561198105144170', 'num_games_owned': 2435, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 243, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 243, 'last_played': 1408701360}
{'steamid': '76561198131776055', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 190, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 145, 'last_played': 1466797965}
review:
Woodle Tree Adventures is overall a very fun, unique, cute, addictive, and challenging game. It is similar to Super Mario Galaxy in the way that you must travel to different floating worlds and parkour your way through them.
But like any game, it has its flaws.
Firstly, the camera angles. Sometimes, the camera will be stuck at a very uncomfortable angle, making it nigh impossible to see where you are going, resulting in falling into the same pit 50 times.
Another thing it lacks is consistent checkpoints. Where you die effects where you will respawn, but you actually have to die to see where that place will be. Its different in each place, and doesn't make sense.  For example, on the beehive level, if you died about a third of the way through the level, you respawned just barely before there. But if you died near the end of the level, you had to start all the way over. It was also stuck on a very annoying camera angle the whole time, which made it rather difficult and infuriating.
Aside from that, I rather enjoy the cute graphics, music, unique story, and fun gameplay. I do recommend it to those who enjoy playing casual indie games from time to time to quench boredom.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098854675', 'num_games_owned': 855, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 56, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1408511635}
review:
[h1]~Woodle Tree Adventures~[/h1]

[b][i]Creo que este juego es un buen titulo y mas si poses algun familiar o conocido peque√±o que pueda disfrutar este mismo desde tu cuenta o ordenador, ya que su tematica no posee alguna especie de "malicia" o algo que pueda afectar en manera negativa a ellos[/i]

Un buen juego, donde deberas recolectar los "ApplePoints" (Como a m√≠ me gusta llamar), Conseguir unas "gotas de agua" necesarias para finalizar los niveles o mapas e ir obteniendo unas cuantas mejoras y ir desbloqueando nuevos y mayor mente complicados mapas; en si mismo el juego no tiene un gran atractivo pero sin duda puede ser algo adictivo en momentos de gran ocio, ademas de ser un juego que sin duda su publico debe de ser ni√±os peque√±os tambien uno como grande puede recordar esos viejos juegos que tuvimos de peque√±os, ademas puede ser emocionante como frustantes a la hora del juego.

Estos son algunos punto del juego que se deben considerar antes de siquiera quere comprarlo.

[olist]

    [*]Los considerables mapas que posee este juego son muy buenos, no son exageradamente estrabagantes pero aun asi son fantasticos, en estos debes de buscar e indagar para obtener todo lo que posen desde los "AP" hasta las peque√±as gotas que necesitas para acabar completamente el mapa...

    [*]Los enemigos son algo extra√±os (pero es comprensible considerando que eres un tronco que recolecta manzanas), sus animaciones no son gran cosa pero sin duda pueden hacerte regresar al principio del mapa si tan solo te distraes o actuas tarde antes de atacarlos.

    [*]El personaje como ya mencionado esta, un "tronco" hijo de un arbol "magico" (que puede hacerte recorar uno muy similar que sin duda pudo haber marcado tu infancia), la animacion de su ataque es chistosa y diciendolo de alguna manera muy tierna, igualmente sus movimientos lo son mas, correr con este mismo puede ser muy relajante y como ultimo sus saltos son algo raro mas por que si saltas mucho terminaras encontrando un muy interesante y posible bug que probablemente nadie contemplo.

    [*]Para obtener una mejor experiencia a la hora de jugar no es muy recomendable jugar con un KeyBoard ("teclado") ya que este termina siendo molesto y en cambio el juego parece estar optimizado para el joystick que sin duda ofrece un mejor desempe√±o.

    [*]Su musica no es mucha (creo que solo pose una o unas cuantas) pero es muy relajante, digna de este estilo de juegos.

    [*]Sus cromos no son nada grande pero algunas cosas son buenas y mas si uno decide fabricar las insignias.

    [*]Sus logros no son realmente nada dificiles pero el hacerlos puede ser entretenido y mas si juegas con algun conocido y disfrutan un tiempo de calidad

[/olist]

[u]Por ultimo les doy las gracias por tener el tiempo de observar mi An√°lisis que sin duda espero que afecte de manera positiva su decision, siempre hay que darle una peque√±a oportunidad a los titulos que encontremos; por que todos los juegos merecen una oportunidad para ser conocidos[/u]
[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198106999924', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 170, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 148, 'last_played': 1409987422}
review:
For some, this is the worst game they played. For me, it was okay.
I find the game's visuals and sound very relaxing. The simple but compelling theme is what makes the game unique.
It could use some work, there are times where the camera is bugged, and the controls are a bit unresponsive, nevertheless,
I enjoyed the game and I hope it gets more levels. (Also, i'm still waiting for the co-op)

Overall: 7/10
Would recommend to people who like simplistic and casual-looking games.

Addendum: This is harder than Dark Souls.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960522414', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 167, 'playtime_forever': 105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1408401097}
review:
An extremely cute platformer game that you can beat in probably under an hour. It's extremely simple... you need to navigate the levels and collect three tears (per level) and make it to the end trigger to unlock a new level. You can collect berries to unlock a few things (a water level, a headband, and three other leaf weapon types.) Collecting berries is also required if you want to unlock achievements.

The enemies are pretty simple.. some will follow a path, some will run at you... although you can't really tell which creatures are hostile and which ones are not. The ones with the happy faces seem to mostly be good.

The camera is absolutely terrible and you can only control the distance away from your character, but it resets in different sections of levels a lot of the time.

The music and sound effects are simple and nice.

It's a super simple game and quick to beat. The level design is quite nice and varied. Visually it looks pretty great. 
It's certainly not terrible but might not be all that interesting or engaging for most people. Young kids could get a good kick out of it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035808481', 'num_games_owned': 1652, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 327, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1469067946}
review:
So far I have played the games 25 minutes, meaning the first 2 levels, but it didnt make me want to play more. 
I dont reccomend it for several reasons. First of all the looks. Its a subtle reason and it may be different for others, but while the game looked cute in the screenshots, it looked kind of empty in the final game. It looks like someone had a level editor and shoved a couple of platforms together, added a flower and an enemy here and there and was done with it. It gets even worse through the fact that killed enemys stay dead when you die, meaning that you will jump through the even emptyer world over and over again. But what kills you if there is so few enemys you might ask. Well what killed me was the camera, the controls and the joke of a weapon you have. Now I read through the news a bit and apparently there is a way to control the camera, but I havent found it. that way I played the game with the camera the game set, and that was awful. I often ran down cliffs simply because I couldnt see where exactly I was jumping. Speaking of the jumps- to me the jump felt more like an awkward limp than anything else. I had a hard time reaching platforms that were supposed to be reached, simply because you cant really jump to any height. Now to the weapon: this may actually change, since your weapon is a leave and I saw that you could unlock other leaves later. The starting leave though requires you to almost touch an enemy before you can hit it, with touching an enemy being an instant death thats kind of a problem though. playing with wasd I had problems turning to the enemys in the right angle in the right moment to hit them, the camera didnt help either, with me running into things that seemed far away. All in all I did not have a very good experience at all with this game, its a challenging platformer without wanting to be a challenging platformer because the mentioned points make everything so much harder. Maybe this experience is different for others, but I can only make a review for myself and I would say 3/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960478145', 'num_games_owned': 2351, 'num_reviews': 616, 'playtime_forever': 51, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1408397476}
review:
It's not that I dislike kid-friendly games. Heck, I've beaten The Maw! Although "beaten" doesn't cut it with that difficulty, but heck it.
What kills this game for me is the fixed camera perspective so I can't help myself to see how far I am supposed to jump and how far I am actually jumping and the controls. Floaty controls in a platformer. Cardinal sin.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077896720', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 233, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 233, 'last_played': 1408216243}
review:
'Woodle Tree Adventures' es un juego entretenido... hasta cierto punto.
Este tipo de juegos siempre suelen llamar mi atenci√≥n; gr√°ficos coloridos, enemigos simples, niveles cortitos, y un personaje 'kawaii' que tendr√°s que ocupar durante todo el transcurso del juego.
-La primera vez me encant√≥, se me hizo muy simple y no esperaba la hora para jugarlo de nuevo.
-La segunda vez me compromet√≠ a completar el juego a su %100.
-La tercera me estres√©, el puto tronco al m√°s leve movimiento se ca√≠a y empezaba otra vez a la mierda.
-A la cuarta el cabr√≥n se segu√≠a cayendo. Aparte de parecerme mon√≥tono, el juego en cuesti√≥n se basa en seguir un mismo patr√≥n: Coger las malditas frutas y 3 gotas de agua a trav√©s de un mapa gigante con enemigos m√°s simplones que la tabla del uno.
En resumen, lo dej√©, me aburri√≥. No lo compren, no da para m√°s de 3 horas de juego, si no, pierdes la cabeza.
Para un ni√±o est√° bien, desde luego, es recomendable.Ellos tienen m√°s pacienca y les importa un rabano morir una y otra vez.
Gracias IndieGala por regalar este juego y no cagarla en comprarmelo :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198018217478', 'num_games_owned': 1902, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 206, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 206, 'last_played': 1407984313}
review:
I got this game thinking it would be good for kids.  Unfortunately, it's hard to tell where you're going to land on a jump and there are a lot of instant-death falls all over the place.  My kids kept handing the controller to me so I could play it for them.  The camera controls are mind-boggling.  It will let me zoom in and out (so far out I could see the entire level but have no idea where I was), but I couldn't move the camera left or right.  

If the camera was better and there were a LOT less difficult jumps it would be a good game for kids.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040806402', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 58, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1420152358}
review:
The game is pretty much shovelware. 
There was some potential for Woodle (i'm assuming his name is Woodle) in that it could have been an arty wimsical game, but the amount of effort here is minimal. The story revolves around you going on a quest to stop the evil... no, wait, it was something about... fairy tears?...for trees....and there's gnomes and cat tree things...ok nothing is explained, and there's no motivation other than to collect these large fruit things (oh yeah there's that too), which reward you with other leaves that have other abilities... and that's about it.
As for the mechanics, they suck. The camera is (sometimes) controlled by the mouse (but only foward and backwards) and usually screws up your depth perception, letting you misjudge the distance between you and a deadly happy gnome or jumping onto a pillar and god help you if the direction of your journey is foward over woodle's back. Also the controls feel clunky and you can't rebind anything, and the graphics look like those cheap computer animated movies you find in that little mexican market on the corner. 
I wont be surprised if this game had previously been for iphones or tablets, in which case i ask who in the hell greenlighted this? (Oh and the only reason i have this game is because it was free for a bit or something).

author: {'steamid': '76561198044669924', 'num_games_owned': 1668, 'num_reviews': 138, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1407729009}
review: I've played two of the however many levels of the game, and I have to say - I don't get what all the hate is about. It's a cute little platformer that doesn't try to reinvent the genre. The story is that you were brought to life specifically to collect Fairy Tears and bring water to a land - the Fairy Tears acting as your MacGuffin, like the crystals in a Crash game. You collect them throughout simple platforming levels that are surprisingly long, but never overstay their welcome. Along the way, you pick up Wumpa fr-, err, berries, which serve as sort of a score/unlockable counter - every so often, you unlock a new item for your little Deku Scrub. There also seem to be a level that requires 600 berries, but I'm not sure how grindy getting that is. The game overall is rather easy, however; enemies serve little to no threat, and the platforming is simple. The thing that's most likely to kill you is the camera screwing up because you backtracked. To fix a camera screw up, you just go past the point you were just at - but it's still irritating. So far, I give it a 6.5/10, another .5 if it gets a controllable camera. The June 29th update claims you have camera control, but it's not distance that's the problem, it's angle. The price is right, as it seems like a rather short game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198113033211', 'num_games_owned': 375, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 205, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1447534628}

author: {'steamid': '76561198045183946', 'num_games_owned': 2908, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 61, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1437787835}
review: For a game supposedly inspired by Mario and Zelda, Woodle Tree Adventures bears strikingly little resemblence to either. In fact, I found none of the "classical elements from the 90's games" and "new interesting ideas." described on the store page. What I did find while playing this was a poorly made platformer with horrible camera controls and nonexistent enemies (unless you count the ones which just stand there and wiggle their arms at you, which is actually pretty much all of them). The developer attempts to cover up the fact that this game is lacking some of the most essential points of a platformer by trying to sell you on the "catchy and unique" art style and "refreshingly peaceful" feeling of travelling the game world. Perhaps the graphics style might appeal to some (namely children) but the only reason the graphics are unique is because most other game developers choose to use things like textures as well as models more complicated than your basic cubes and cylinders with legs. It was a bold move (or more likely one made out of the inability to produce anything higher in quality) but for me it just didn't pay off.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066263905', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 53, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1407579092}
review: This game was like having a friend hand you a revolver with a grip that stabs into your hand with spikes who then says that you're going to play one-man russian roulette. The logical choice would clearly be to not play and find better friends, but if you held out till the end like I did for this game, you'd see that the revolver was full of blanks. I honestly thought there would be some sort of twist in the story, a "Bang" so to speak. something to break the boring atmosphere and something to give the clunky controls worth, but there was no solace. In fact, the story makes no sense as you are tying to "bring water to a thirsty land" yet every mission has waterfalls and rivers. The enemies are slow and easy to kill, but the only way you'll end up dying in this game is with the platforming. It's easy platforming, but the character will just rocket to any direction you set him towards. For instance, in most games, turning around while jumping might slow you down just enough to allow you to land. turning around here would be like using the portal gun to rocket you backwards through the power of momentum. I'm just lucky I didn't have to actually pay for this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041113007', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 81, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1407564603}
review:
Is Woodle Tree Adventures a great platformer? 

Probably not. Let me explain why:

The camera, god, the camera. The game features an automatic camera and it just doesn't work properly most of the time. Then, we have the not really accurate jumps. Is really annoying, having to fall countless time for cliffs just because the jumps aren't as precise as they should be. Because it's not supposed to be like that, it's not like the game says "You jump and you stay in motion till you hit the ground". Nope, you can freely move while you're jumping, but you're still gonna fall of a lot of cliffs. That, and the game has a few bugs.

Even so and counting all that, I really liked this game. It's... nice. The art design is really nice and makes you feel comfortable all the time. The music is calm and nice. The level design, the simplicity of the game, etc, etc. It just makes the game feel nice.

I don't think that's enough to 'save' the game, but it's certainly not bad. The game is short, I finished it in maybe two hours. But it was a nice play. So, do I recommend this game? If you're just looking for a good platformer, there are plenty out there that are better than this. Even so, this is a nice game at a low price. I hope the game gets better via updates, because I really  think it has potential.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074562113', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 19, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1407506655}

author: {'steamid': '76561198043159492', 'num_games_owned': 1840, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1407434626}
review:
The Good:
+Pretty visuals
+Woodle is cute
+Peaceful Music
+Local Co-Op

The Bad:
-Camera is a problem (post patch)
-Art style makes it difficult to distinguish ground from wall
-Not much to do
-Gameplay feels mindless
-Scarce checkpoints/pointless repetition
-Slow gameplay

It's a good game for kids, but I wouldn't recommend it to anyone outside of that age group. There's just no real substance to this game. You collect berries and three tears to get through levels. That's it.

On a more technical standpoint, the levels are pretty, but dull. Almost all of the enemies in the game world feel out of place within, with a few exceptions. The art style and camera make it difficult to judge distances, which is a killer in platforming games. If you misjudge the distance of the jump, then you are almost guaranteed to restart from the beginning, as checkpoints are scarce (note, this review was written AFTER the camera patch that is advertized on the front page).

author: {'steamid': '76561197999584737', 'num_games_owned': 4130, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1407430652}
review:
First, I want to say that I understand that this is a game developed by a single person, I think it has some promise, and I absolutely support developers learning the ropes and trying to make it. So despite the fact that I can't recommend the game, I applaud the developer for his effort.

The game is a Super Mario 64 / Super Mario 3D Land style 3D platformer where the world is made up of a bunch of connected geometric objects. You're a tree. You can run, jump, swing a leaf to attack... and that's about it. The objective of each level is to get three water drops and get to the end of the level; there are also berries scattered around (around 100 berries per level or so). You don't need to collect berries to finish the game, but if you collect 200, 400, or 800 you can "upgrade" your leaf, at 850 you get a headband for your character which seems mostly cosmetic, and there's an optional hidden level at 600 berries. There are 6 main game levels plus the optional level. Each level takes about 8-10 minutes. Personally I 100%ed the game--that is to say beat all levels and unlocked all optional content or unlocks in-game--at 71 minutes.

The issue is that much of the core gameplay loop doesn't work very well. Your default walk speed is far too slow, your default run speed is far too fast to be controlled for precise jumps. The game also never tells you you can run, so, PRO-TIP: You can. Underwater, everything is too slow and the physics don't adjust at all besides movement speed. Jumping is not controlled very well and I frequently missed pretty easy jumps. There are clipping issues. There are almost-but-not-quite making a jump and getting stuck in the lip of geometry and having to jump again to get unstuck issues. There are also issues where you feel like you've picked up a berry but you aren't inside its hitbox, so you sort of wander back and forth until you pick it up. You almost never get good feedback--the "feel" of the game is a real problem.
 
When you die (you will, frequently, enemies AI is basic, many enemies are stationary, the rest move in fixed patterns, but clipping is generally poor and it's difficult to tell if you're going to hit an enemy when you swing your weapon), you respawn instantly either at the beginning of the level or at a checkpoint, but you can't see where the checkpoints are and in my experience they're rarely where they make sense to be; but because enemies and items don't respawn when you die, you basically run through an empty level until you get back to where you died.

The camera is the biggest problem. The camera angle is frequently no good; for example, in a 3D platformer the camera should never be directly on your level facing straight, because it ruins depth perception entirely. The camera should never be so close that it obscures the action, and yet it is. Worse, as you collect berries, the bag your character holds gets bigger and bigger, so the obstruction is actually worse at the end of levels than at the beginning. You should never have to run towards the camera and take leap-of-faith jumps to get to platforms unless there's some visual indication that you ought to.    

It's an hour long game, so obviously if you want to play it, you'll deal with the frustration. But it's pretty rare that you're playing and something isn't going to be bugging you.

The music's composition is not bad (it is a little simple, and it's not really catchy), but the author chooses very very very chintzy, cheap sounding samples for almost every instrument. In particular there's some sort of harpsichord used as one of the main instruments and it sounds really terrible. Sound effects are rare, to the point that the game feels a little unfinished because there are times where you expect sounds and don't get them. 

You can't quit the game from inside the game without doing an Alt+F4 or Apple+Q or whatever. There's no main menu to go back to. When you beat the game, it sits at the end of the credits section. This is very frustrating to me. There's also no Steam Cloud support, and although the game is multi-platform, achievements don't work on the Mac or Linux versions.

It's a pity because the graphic side of things is very good. The enemies and your character are cute. The visual style is simple but colourful, and reminds me favourably of Mario 64 or Super Mario 3d Land. There are lots of little touches in the animation. If I had to guess, the guy is probably an animator or an artist who made a game, rather than a programmer.

I don't want to dissuade the guy from continuing to make games and there are occasional hints of promise, but it comes off more as the kind of thing that would have been free online in the late 90s / early 00s, or the kind of thing that would be released on Desura. I am confident that before Steam changed the approval process to be more open last year, this game would not have seen release. Moreover, the dev is still actively patching the game, but a lot of what he's adding in seems to be stuff that would be typical of a 1.0 release, which makes it seem even more like a hobby project.

It's definitely an earnest effort and I hope the dev keeps trying, but I don't think it's /there/ and besides supporting the dev, I don't really feel like there's much to recommend here.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066514689', 'num_games_owned': 1064, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 94, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1408800000}
review:
Woodle Tree Adventures √© um jogo de plataforma 3D interessante. A hist√≥ria do jogo √© t√£o simples quanto o mesmo: voc√™ controla um tronco de madeira, coletando frutinhas e gotas para salvar o mundo onde ele vive.

A jogabilidade √© simples, mas √© falha de vez em quando. Os pulos n√£o s√£o muito precisos devido √† movimenta√ß√£o do personagem, e isso pode acarretar mortes indevidas ao longo das fases. A c√¢mera do jogo n√£o √© muito boa tamb√©m, j√° que ela √© fixa e raramente ela se move para um √¢ngulo bom. O √∫nico ajuste que voc√™ pode fazer nela √© aumentar ou diminuir o zoom, o que ajuda em algumas ocasi√µes, mas poderia ter sido bem melhor. A parte de a√ß√£o tamb√©m √© bem simples, mas assim como os pulos, os ataques podem ser imprecisos de vez em quando.

O gr√°fico do jogo √© bem bonito, tem um apelo visual legal. Cada fase conta com diferentes tem√°ticas, como neve, fases aqu√°ticas e at√© mesmo uma "colm√©ia", mas assim como na jogabilidade, o level design do jogo n√£o √© muito bom em certas partes, combinando a frustra√ß√£o da jogabilidade imprecisa com um level design mais ou menos. Os inimigos tem pouca varia√ß√£o, e quando n√£o atacam voc√™, eles simplesmente ficam parados esperando que voc√™ os ataque, ou n√£o.

Apesar de ter citado alguns pontos negativos, vale a pena citar alguns pontos positivos tamb√©m: o jogo possui um coop local para 2 pessoas, praticamente igual aos jogos da LEGO. Para quem curte conquistas, √© um jogo bem f√°cil de se conseguir todas em pouco tempo, pois o jogo √© bem curto e d√° pra conseguir praticamente 75% das conquistas em 1 hora de jogo. N√£o √© um jogo que vai marcar sua vida, mas √© uma √≥tima distra√ß√£o para quem n√£o tem o que jogar no momento.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033663691', 'num_games_owned': 140, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 60, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1407150135}
review: After playing this for some time, I don't have any speck of doubt that this is the best game ever made, it has everything, a story that will take your breath away, excellent plot, in fact one of the best I've seen in video games, one of my favorites being Alan Wake's and I can say this is better than Alan Wake's. The soundtrack is relaxing but not in a way that it will make you want to head to your bed and take a nap, but giving this game a great intense but also under control feeling, you control a log, that takes creativity. Plus you use a leaf, making this game environmentally-friendly, a game for the mature and the young, simply a masterpiece of the new era of gaming.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019621629', 'num_games_owned': 3959, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 99, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 99, 'last_played': 1407102040}
review: A masterpiece and a truly remarkable achievement. Fabio Ferrara has created a beautiful game world and breathed life into it with puzzles, secrets, enemies, and loveable characters that will completely engross gamers around the globe. Stunning attention to detail is present throughout the game and is constantly evident in the visuals, audio, intelligent gameplay and brilliant A.I.. Anyone wanting to tackle the same themes will have to be compared to Fabio Ferrara's work in the future, and it won't be pretty.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019652453', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 39, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1434509449}
review:
This game is really one big disappointment, sadly.   The art style is very cute, but that's about the only positive thing I can say about it, as the game suffers from some major flaws that just kill the game:

The camera angle is horrendous.   In a 3-D platformer, having a fixed camera angle is both baffling and frustrating.   It makes jumping and moving an exercise in frustration.   I tried to give the game a fair chance to make an impression on me, but the camera angle alone was enough to cause me to cut my time in it short.   

The story, or lack thereof, is very thin and not engaging in any way, shape or form.  It doesn't provide any motivation whatsoever to keep playing.   After a few minutes roaming around, instead of it feeling like there's a greater purpose to my actions, it becomes a case of "Meh.  WHY am I doing this again?"

Movement in this game is a major downfall.   It felt like traversing any distance was done at half the speed of smell and it made the whole experience feel more like a chore than something done for fun.   

There really isn't much of a challenge to the game, other than contending with the camera angles and movement issues.  The enemies are incredibly passive and it was insanely simple to avoid them, considering that they did little to nothing that would make me want to attack them instead of just walking by them.   

All of these combined to make this game a rather tedious and completely forgettable experience.   Whether it was an isuse of inexperience on the part of the developers or simply a lack of effort, there are just so many issues with the game that even if the art style is somewhat endearing, it's not worth playing.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971838196', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 356, 'playtime_forever': 193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 104, 'last_played': 1415554427}
review:
Spielwertung: 8/10

Ein h√ºbsches, kleines Spiel, das mich an die guten, alten N64 Zeiten erinnert hat. 

Die Geschichte des Spiels ist schnell erz√§hlt:

Als Spr√∂√üling eines gro√üen Baums soll man Feentropfen (Wasser) sammeln, um dem trockenen Land zu helfen. 

In bester Mario-Manier hopst und l√§uft man durch die Lvl und versucht 2 verschiedene Ressourcen zu sammeln: 
Beeren und Wasser, jeweils 3 Tropfen pro Lvl. 

Alternativ kann man noch einige Monster verkloppen (die super s√º√ü sind^^) Das ist aber alternativ. Zwar greifen 
einige aggressiv an und bei einem Treffer landet ihr wieder am Anfang des Lvls, aber man kann in diesem Spiel weder sterben noch seine gesammelten Beeren und Tropfen verlieren. Man muss einfach nur alle 3 Tropfen zu den 3 Eimern am
Ende des Lvls bringen. Die meisten Monster kann man aber ohne weiteres ignorieren. 

Die gr√∂√üte Schwierigkeit ist die Landschaft, denn man kann zwar im Wasser nicht ertrinken, aber in luftiger H√∂he immer mal 
wieder in die Tiefe st√ºrzen. 

Manchmal erweist sich die Kamera hierbei als gr√∂√ütes Hindernis. Wenn man aber einmal den Dreh raus hat, sollte das keine Schwierigkeiten mehr machen. 

Das Spiel hat keinerlei Oberfl√§che, keine Punktezahlen und keine "Missionen". Man kann einfach die Lvl erkunden. 


Der Umfang des Spiels betr√§gt 6 oder 7 Lvl. Nach ca. 100 Minuten flimmerte bei mir das Ende des Spiels √ºber den Schirm. 
Bis dahin hatte ich auch 6 der 8 Erfolge im Vorbeigehen miteingesammelt. 3000 Beeren zu sammeln, kann man machen... muss man aber nicht. ;)

Fazit: Nichts Besonderes, aber f√ºr 100 Minuten eine sch√∂ne, leichte Kost, Daumen hoch! ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561197998754194', 'num_games_owned': 1111, 'num_reviews': 209, 'playtime_forever': 251, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1459469605}
review:
for 3 dollars this meets my expctations BUT there are issues I find unnecessary.

The camera suffers from locks and odd angles, and cannot be rotated or corrected if it should get locked in a weird position.  I encountered this in games back in the PSX and N64 era, I get it, but it is an issue with cameras I do not want to put up with in 2014.

The jumps are odd, and I can't tell if the wind blew me or what, but I cannot seem to get exact results each time I jump. Runnin makes this worse. The camera makes it even more of an issue.  Can't line it all up right, like the old Tomb Raiders, it feels like you are jumping blindly through these levels.

You cannot really die, and dying costs seemingly nothing.  Enemies are one hit "Kill or Be KIlled", the only real penalty being that you go back to a previous place in the level.  No respawning enemies or having to recollect things, just a placement further back and a long walk of nothing to do, usually because you fell off the edge due to my other issues.

Do I expect these opinions to be heard? No
Do I think the game will see updates affecting these issues? Not a chance LMAO
Would I buy this on sale? YUP

It is cute, easy, and has all the basics of a platformer.  The fact that you cannot really die is a boon to me, as I play this game with an Autistic kid, and she would be trippin balls if we had to restart all the time.

For a low key, does not fuckin matter platformer, it serves its purpose in my collection.

But I would never buy this just for myself to play.  I was honestly expecting a longer game (but whatever, it is 3 dollars)

If it were a 15$ game, I would expect these things to be more rounded, and more content overall.

As is, just STFU and enjoy it if you own it.

And tell me that it doesn't take you back to the first time you saw The Great Deku Tree, right?

author: {'steamid': '76561198063298811', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1406639830}
review:
Woodle Tree Adventures is a basic platformer which is meant for children 6 and under. The objective of the game is collect tears in levels and optionial berries which if you collect a lot of them, ur sack of berries just glitchs through ur character. The game to me is so boring and you just move so slow ormaybe its my laptop. In my opinion i think ur the enemy for u literally attack ice cream doing yoga with a leaf!? Theres really nothing else to say about this game
I give this game 7 out of 10 because the audience for this game is children, not adults or teens however the levels are design good and the berries and tears are hidden very good
This could be a much better game. The graphics are charming, the soundtrack is nicely chill and the lack of stuff like time limits is quite nice. It's got serious potential, but a few negative aspects really work against that potential.

The first and most damaging is the fact that you cannot control the camera. In a 3D platformer where it's very easy to mis-time your jumps, that's a quick road to frustration. Even worse, sometimes the game will change your camera angle for you, making it hard to see a jump that a moment before was perfectly visible. Add in the fact that if the character's pack is full it enlarges so much sometimes that you have trouble seeing past it and you can see that earlier potential just start to bleed away in a flurry of missed jumps.

The second flaw doesn't directly affect gameplay, but it affects immersion a lot. That is, the character animation. For the most part this is fine, and I really do like little touches like being able to jump until Woodle is upside-down. Charming. But when walking about the world, I noticed very quick that the walk animation doesn't interact at all with the ground. The speed at which you move seems independant of the motion of the legs, giving a feel of sliding about which may not seem like a lot but since you have to look at this for the entire game, it gets a bit bothersome. And to a degree, since you can't really tell speed from watching the character, sometimes it's hard to judge jumps and you're down into the abyss again.

The third is the general lack of explanation of anything. I've played up to where I was able to buy a second leaf mainly by accident. I had no idea why I was supposed to gather fruits until I pretty much randomly wandered outside the house for a bit. I'm not really sure what it does yet, since there's no explanation when you get it, so I guess trial and error? In any case, the game doesn't really give you anything to tell you that upgrading your leaf is significant, so it almost feels like the game doesn't care. Even a little fanfare would be nice.

Overall, I'd say maybe a 6.5/10. Barely recommend, mainly based on the remaining charm and the knowledge that updates seem to be planned. Hopefully they'll fix some of these issues.
Before begin, who is the genius who doesn¬¥t know there exist a thing called "paused", seriously is stupid you press "Esc" and the game closed...totally.

The thing can¬¥t be more simply, you need to collect 3 tears in every level to restore an old tree because is old and blah blah blah blah is dying or something.

Levels are short (it have 6 levels and one extra)

But is replayable to find more berries to unlok leafs and achievements...

Is very easy if you don¬¥t do a ragequit the first 5 minutes if you fall.

Relaxing music.+

The coop achievement....seriously? you need to have an xbox 360 controller? there is something called split-creen (i don¬¥t say online also because is indie)

Well a indie game only about cute little things and happiness, oriented to the children public...

So if you come here because you want something easier than Dark souls or another average puzzle game because your mind can¬¥t handle all that, this is your game...

author: {'steamid': '76561198051443870', 'num_games_owned': 395, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 158, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1470014677}
review:
I can describe this game in three simple words: Pure. Platforming. Fun. Wait, why would I not recommend this game if I enjoy this game, mixed messages galore! Well, if you are sticking around to read this, I wouldn't recommend this game to [b]an average steam user.[/b] Why? If you look at the most popular games sold, they are creations of commitment to spending hours and hours exploring, killing things, playing online with friends to continue the rampage. This game has absolutely none of that, the only people I would ever recommend this game to are those that don't play many games, those who don't really have time to play a game, anyone that that wants a very small game to enjoy or maybe a little sibling or relative who is just staring off playing games.

You are Woodle, you must collect berries and fairy drops...not much story beyond that. You travel through eight worlds to collect these things, in each world are three drops that you must collect. There are a few weapon unlockables, but other than that, this game finds its charm in jumping, exploring, and enjoying the very vibrant world created by Chubby Pixel. As I was playing this, I was reminded of games like Banjo-Kazooie or even Gex 64: Enter the Gecko, it was such a great trip into nostalgia, that I didn't mind that it took me a little over an hour to beat, but in my opinion, it was extremely worth it.

Now on to the bad stuff: the camera is jittery and sometimes in the wrong place, there isn't any sort of GUI and the enemies aren't really...smart. Again, this is why I would not really recommend this game to an average gamer who would rather play something like Skyrim or Dark Souls II. Another thing I want to point out is that this game is much easier played using the 360 controller instead of mouse and keyboard as controlling the character is sometimes difficult.

However, if you are like me and just enjoy small or even have time to commit to some 60+ hour adventure, I highly recommend you at least watch some gameplay footage of it. To the average gamer, though, who has that sort of patience and willingness to venture out to become a Dragonborn, crunching numbers, calculating statistics or wanting to see that KDR ratio on your leaderboard, this game is definitely not for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029170689', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 53, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1406740530}
review:
0/5

After this game I start to think that free giveaways are not enough, they should start paying us for this kind of crap.
I'm going out on a limb: is this a one-man project done for a university course that lasted from 3 to 6 months? I see no other option.
The gameplay is a sort of exploring-world-sandbox, where you collect items in order to get (useless) improvements and advance to the next level. Enemies are useless, shallow and beating them is trivial. The (fixed) camera management is godawful poorly designed, sometimes it gets stuck and you have to restart the game. The entire environment / map / movement is generally bugged.
This game is probably decent for kids from 1 to 5 years old, when it'll get some fixes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198123330547', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 37, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1406704828}
review: This game reminds me a lot of the older platform games where the object of the game, just like this, is to make it through a level collecting a particular amount of certain items to beat it. You have a leaf weapon to take out the baddies and a little sack that expands through the level as you collect items needed to unlock more levels. Not the best of games, but was rather enjoyable with an easy going classic sounding soundtrack and some tricky jumps to be made to complete the level.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036497917', 'num_games_owned': 768, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 154, 'last_played': 1406662245}
review:
Cons: 
1. Very bad story, actually no story
2. Camera, very very bad field of view. 
3. Checkpoints. When you die, you spawn near spawn place, if you die again it return you to start of a map 
4. For this simple game too much system requirements, low FPS for old graphic cards
5. You can't turn off sound if you run this on WinXP or older, so annoying
6. If you start again game while you were in middle of game, you spawn with green leaf
7. Enemies are so stupid and you don't represent any threat

Pros:
......

Don't buy this game, if you got this already grab 3 cards and go away

2/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198074633304', 'num_games_owned': 446, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 49, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1406330160}
review:
Controlling the character with a game-pad is okay, but the locked camera position makes gameplay awkward.  I found that I could zoom in and out with the mouse but that didn't help with the camera position, especially as there were times that the scenery completely blocked my view.

The level design is fairly boring and the enemies were dull and predictable.  Overall I am glad I didn't actually pay money for this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198133201296', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 28, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1406975436}
review:
pros :
- fun and addictive game
- simple and easy to play
- small size to download
cons:

author: {'steamid': '76561198070553060', 'num_games_owned': 305, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 96, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1590353589}
review:
Before begin, who is the genius who doesn¬¥t know there exist a thing called "paused", seriously is stupid you press "Esc" and the game closed...totally.

The thing can¬¥t be more simply, you need to collect 3 tears in every level to restore an old tree because is old and blah blah blah blah is dying or something.

Levels are short (it have 6 levels and one extra)

But is replayable to find more berries to unlok leafs and achievements...

Is very easy if you don¬¥t do a ragequit the first 5 minutes if you fall.

Relaxing music.+

The coop achievement....seriously? you need to have an xbox 360 controller? there is something called split-creen (i don¬¥t say online also because is indie)

Well a indie game only about cute little things and happiness, oriented to the children public...

So if you come here because you want something easier than Dark souls or another average puzzle game because your mind can¬¥t handle all that, this is your game...

author: {'steamid': '76561198003785049', 'num_games_owned': 4805, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 1140, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 836, 'last_played': 1546537894}
review:
Un juego bastante entretenido que hara a los mas jovenes de la casa pasar algunas horas de diversi√≥n visitando los 6 mundos en forma de plataforma, o en mi caso, revivir recuerdos de ciertos juegos que jugaba en mi playstation cuando era un crio. 

Juego completado al 100%

Lo bueno:
-Juego de plataformas muy entretenido
-Bastante colorido
-Cromos
-Trofeos
-Jugabilidad sencilla

Lo malo:
-Idioma ingles (para los mas jovenes necesitaran a los adultos para entender un poco la intro del juego)
-Bastante corto en duraci√≥n

Puntuaci√≥n: 8,7

author: {'steamid': '76561198042083399', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 34, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1406476907}
review:
Rip-off pf Super Mario 3D Land, and does an awful job at doing it.
The controls are this game's biggest problem. They are so slippery, and with such level design
that includes precise platforming, I find myself falling off edges the whole time, and the god awful camera
doesn't help either.
Sound is boring, unfitting and forgetable.
This game needs an update in every aspect.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034359551', 'num_games_owned': 845, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 40, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1406470852}
review: Ich bin schon mal von vornerein so ehrlich und hebe damit auch gleich den ersten Punkt f√ºr das Spiel hervor: Ich habe nichts bezahlt und daf√ºr ist auch okay. Und es ist dem Entwickler auch anzurechnen das er es zumindest versucht hat und es war sicherlich auch gut gemeint, aber am Ende nicht wirklich gut gemacht. Das gro√üe Problem ist die Kameraeinstellung die pr√§zise Spr√ºnge in einigen Situationen nahezu unm√∂glich macht. Leider ist das die einzige Herausforderung die das Spiel bieten kann - Gegner sind quasi nicht existent - und das ist mitunter ziemlich frustrierend. Es w√§re schon deutlich besser wenn man die Kamera selber positionieren kann aber die einzige Anpassungsm√∂glichkeit ist ein rein- bzw. rauszoomen und das auch nicht immer. F√ºr ein Kinderspiel ist die Steuerung ungeeignet, f√ºr Erwachsene ist das restliche Spiel viel zu simpel und monoton. Empfehlen kann ich Woodle Tree Adventures also f√ºr niemanden auch weil es f√ºr beide Gruppen viel bessere (Indie-)Platformer gibt.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093003722', 'num_games_owned': 991, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 52, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1406459479}
review:
This could have been an OK game for little kids if done in 2D. The spectacularly poorly executed attempt at 3D graphic did way more harm than good. 

Most of the time the camera is stuck at such a curious angle that makes it downright impossible to see what is in front of you. Other times, you CAN see where you're going, but you have no way to see what's to the left or to the right.
At the rare moments when the camera sets itself in a reasonable position, it still somehow manages to completely screw your depth perception.

And then you press [ESC] and the game quits to desktop, because the creators never heard of a menu screen.

review:
[h1] Simples [/h1]

[b] Hist√≥ria [/b]

A hist√≥ria do game √© extremente simples, o objetivo consiste em passar por 7 mundos para coletar as chamadas "L√°grimas de Fadas" para recuperar a √°gua de sua terra natal. A campanha com todas as conquistas (100%) pode durar mais ou menos 3 horas, tenho muito mais horas por ter perdido o save algumas vezes (problema que n√£o foi do jogo em si).

[b] Jogabilidade [/b]
Esse √© o ponto onde o game falha miser√°velmente, joguei o game no teclado e no gamepad do xbox 360, no teclado √© horr√≠vel e no gamepad da uma melhorada mas os principais problemas como a falta de resposta de alguns comandos permanece. A c√¢mera √© totalmente mal configurada, chega a ser frustrante em alguns momentos n√£o conseguir pular de uma plataforma √† outra pois a c√¢mera n√£o possibilita a visualiza√ß√£o da mesma.

[b] Vale o pre√ßo? [/b] 

Sim, vale apesar dos bugs presentes nos controles, √© uma boa experi√™ncia para se ter, se ainda acha caro, aguarde uma promo√ß√£o e compre-o.

author: {'steamid': '76561198130621851', 'num_games_owned': 229, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 122, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 79, 'last_played': 1565072198}
review:
Ok I dont understand why people were hoping for this game to be the new mario knock off. This game is about you collecting water to progress to the next game and these little berry things. 

Now people complain about the camera angels, and yes you can not control them I agree. But you know why they added em there? To make the game hard and to forget to get that one little thing on that god damn edge we didnt see! People complaining about the camera angels are only complaining how hard it is to get that berry and about "motion sickness".(Did not get motion sickness from the game so i think the guy has a problem with games and it not being because of this one game). That shit is fun and makes you achieved on how you did it.

Now about the game. Its cute fun and new. you wack shit with a leaf and you can upgrade that leaf into a white leaf and we all know that bitches love white leafs. There is also coop which is so fucking adorable but its not splited screens so you gotta work together. Now the game is an hour long and has 6 levels. And each have a new fun way how to get the berrys and shit. 8-10 got what i wanted and liked it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024704964', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 172, 'playtime_forever': 38, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1406346531}
review:
Worth it for the price of free if you like platformers.

The good stuff is that it's actually quite fun. Great graphics and stuff.
No timer or lives, keeps you calm.

The bad stuff is that you can't control the camera. This is a big problem.
Also, the controls are meh. The need to be better, but mainly it feels bad because the camera.
Also, the checkpoint system is kinda random. There are no like real checkpoints, but you just respawn randomly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049147250', 'num_games_owned': 759, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 97, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1406339775}
review:
I got Woodle Tree Adventures for free so I really can't complain. This game claims to be a homage to 3D platformers, and as a person who grew up when these kinds of games were in their prime I can say that this game fails to mimick them. While its cute and colorful, there are a lot of things missing that don't quite qualify it to be on the same level as, let's say, Banjo Kazooie or DK 64 - both games I consider to be the epitome of 3D platform adventures.

Bad news first, I'll start with the negatives.
- It's plain, a little too plain. The cute and simpleness is nice at first but you get bored with it fast. The last two levels are at a beach and a snowy mountain which seem like a nice change of scenery but they also seem to get boring quickly.
- The music is bland and repetitive.
- It has some unfixed glitches. One time I fell through the world because I got stuck under a moving elevator. Another thing is the spawn points seem completely random. If you die, sometimes you're spawned back at the beginning of the level and other times you're spawned near where you died. One time I spawned underneath the level with no way to get back up and had to restart the game and play the level over again.
- The camera perspective can be your biggest enemy. There is a way to control the camera but the only thing it seems to do is zoom in and out. This game seems to depend heavily on parkour skills in terms of difficulty. A lot of 3D platformers do this, but when you can't change your perspective, making precise jumps becomes more frustrating. You will most likely die a lot.
- There is no typical item counter, status screen, etc. It really isn't needed, especially in this game, but you're playing a platformer that has a huge focus on item collecting you want to know how many of that item you've collected in the level so far and how many are left. After you exit a level you can see how many berries you've collected overall but there's no way to tell if you've collected all of the berries in one level and how many you have collected in a particular level. There is also no health bar or lives because there are none. One hit kills you and you have unlmited lives, so there isn't much of a penalty for dying.
- There are no boss battles, every enemy, big and small, takes only one hit to kill. You only have one weapon in the game that can get upgraded depending on how many berries you've collected.
- Very short, it took me about an hour and a half to complete it, and that was with me dying... several times.

There's a lot of negatives but there are some good things about the game:
- Decent control. I didn't have a hard time controlling the character. Most of my deaths were really just because of the bad perspectives and not because the character was difficult to control.
- The game seems to be expanding more and more so there seems that there is possibly room for improvement.
- Despite the large amount of negatives I can't help but find it charming. I actually kind of liked it, but the negatives make me feel like I shouldn't reccomend this game.
- The price is fair. $2.99 is not that much for a game that is still expanding. But at the moment, even with that price I can't reccomend the game. I think it would be best to wait for major updates if someone is interested in buying this game.
- It seems like only a handful of people, maybe just 2 or 3 worked on this game which is an achievement all on its own. With the small size of the staff I think they've actually produced an enjoyable game despite all its flaws.

Overall, Woodle Tree Adventures feels more like an alpha demo of something that is in the works to becoming a full-fledged game. It definitely feels unfinished. It also feels like the age group is geared towards children rather than older, 90's 3D platformer fans. Its simple and virtually has no penalties for dying so it feels like a younger audience would be more interested in a game like this.

It seems like this game is still being updated and I'll probably continue to check out any major updates because as I said: oddly enough I like it, but at this point I would not feel right saying I reccomend it for it feels unfinished.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964437873', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 40, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1407494041}
review:
Super short, bugged and unoptimized 3D platformer based on Unity engine. Ran it on highest graphical presets with 18fps. And no, I did not play it on my toaster.

I was like: Wow, these guys earn money with THIS? F*** it, I'll do the same and see the $$ flowing in.

I had visions of being completely debt-free and that I won't have to worry about university funding anymore.
But then, when I remembered they gave this * out for free, it was like a critical punch back into reality.

And so, the sarch for easy earned legal money continues...

review:
Woodle Tree Adventures is a basic platformer which is meant for children 6 and under. The objective of the game is collect tears in levels and optionial berries which if you collect a lot of them, ur sack of berries just glitchs through ur character. The game to me is so boring and you just move so slow ormaybe its my laptop. In my opinion i think ur the enemy for u literally attack ice cream doing yoga with a leaf!? Theres really nothing else to say about this game
I give this game 7 out of 10 because the audience for this game is children, not adults or teens however the levels are design good and the berries and tears are hidden very good

author: {'steamid': '76561197973713843', 'num_games_owned': 626, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 94, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1421472446}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198053568113', 'num_games_owned': 4851, 'num_reviews': 351, 'playtime_forever': 73, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1406244053}
review:
Where to begin... I guess I could start with the best part, colourful graphics. Other than that... The game is pretty bad in my opinion. The soundtracks are just so simple and have a maximum of 1 to 3 instruments per song. The sound effects aren't good. The game has many glitches, such as: Monsters killing you after you killed them, respawning at the start of the level even after respawning at a certain checkpoint (no way to know when you activate a checkpoint)...

There's also the horrible, horrible camera angles that the game decides to give you. I had to control the game with my Gamepad + my keyboard + my mouse. Jumping in this game was very stressing, I could never tell how far I needed to jump because of the camera angles. The game has no main-menu and no UI at all. To quit a level, you either have to reach the end of it after collecting 3 tears or close the game, because there are no buttons to quit a level (as far as I can tell).

This game only took me 57 minutes to complete and the story was inexistant at all. That's including the glitches I ran into and the few times I pressed ESC to pause my game... Which actually closes the game. I really cannot recommend this game, it was more trouble than fun honestly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026807213', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 268, 'playtime_forever': 5, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1406182904}
review:
What can I say? This game is a masterpiece. I've spent my whole life playing video games every second of every day, and I can honestly say I've never played a game better than Woodle Tree Adventures. The graphics are at least 3 generations ahead of their time, the story put me in tears, made me angry, then put me in tears again. Woodle Tree Adventures deserves not only the title "Game of the year" but also "Best game ever made, or to be made." It took me for an adventure, and I promise you this is not a game for casuals. This game DOES NOT HOLD YOUR HAND. No, It's grusome gameplay that seems almost impossible at times will have you begging for more. This game is the game to play. I have faith that in less than a month every single person in the world will have played this game. It's what we have to show from years & years of technological research. It is without dispute the best game ever.
~
~
~
~
~
DO NOT Discredit my review by saying "Oh, he just played 5 minutes, the lowest amount of time to write a review" or "Look at his profile, everyone is calling him gay!" First off, I'm not gay. Second off this game is really good so don't look at my time and just play the fucking game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997336464', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 58, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1406148583}
review:
[h1]If I had a five year old[/h1]
[i]Woodle Tree Adventures Review[/i]

Woodle Tree Adventures is a somewhat-3D plattform 'adventure'. The young stub with no name is set out to find some whatever or someshit (i didnt really pay attention to this very complex story) to his thirsty rachet father. So he runs around in wobbly plattform-levels. 

While this is a cheap game, the value you get for your money is minimal. I can easily see how Woodle Tree Adventures could be a smash hit, but it lacks so much which could have been filled in within 4-5 working days in developing. Some characteristics to this young stub who only can exhale words like "heh" and "huh, which reminds more of a sobbing three-year-old than a tree trying to jump up a cliff. Soundeffects other than the pre-mentioned "heh" and "huh", feets walking on grass and a splash when hitting water, would be a nice addition. Also camera controls.

Woodle Tree Adventures is easily playable, and could almost be considered 'fun' when speedrunning, but the lack of camera controls makes it highly frustrating. you can zoom in and out (endlessly) but you cant move the camera around. Seeing that the levels often are highly detailed in a unique, cute and fun art-style and also very tight-cornered - some ability to move the camera to a better advantage point would really help. 

For 3 euros this is almost ok. You could start a watch and to speedruns and maybe squeeze out some fun that way, but other than that this is more suitable for the iOS market and children from 3 to 6.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982942764', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 142, 'playtime_forever': 78, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1422049991}
review:
Woodle Tree...
Is a game where you're going out for the elder tree collecting water for each and everyone...
but.. NEVER BEFORE have I held such broken and sticky controls (Was using F710 gamepad as it reccomends)
the sliding, and jumping makes it rough but the damn camera angle that randomly turns 180 degrees so you're forced to play the map backwards is just insane... I also took alot of printscreens of various maps, showing that theres a fruit that's impossible to get, content never reachable, and the reverse camera (If you have played*) The enemies are one shot each, but with a green leaf you can kill everything but orange leaf (upgrade) you can't kill the caterpillars :I BUT GET MORE CHECKPOINTS INGAME PLEASE

The game it self is aparently NOT early access and costs 2,99‚Ç¨ W/O % off.

Time to talk about the good things.
It's cute, and adorable, really colorful and vibrant and for once it's lovely to see this sort of game with a slight enemy variant, even though it did not change the game too much. The color and atmosphere is just warm and lovingly, and I found my self in the end actually asking for more levels- It's a really REALLY short game.

So overall... I wouldn't really reccomend this, and then again if you're in for a cheap (somewhat broken) platformer well... then this is what you're out for.. I am very splitted by it.. 


Not reccomended for people looking for a fully working game.
 (Honestly thought this was early access)
5/10 but reccomended for the people who are really bored.
-Lyh Flare

author: {'steamid': '76561198032096001', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 204, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 204, 'last_played': 1406109859}
review:
Pro:
- Doesn't Take too long to download due it being a small game.

Contra:
- Just a few graphics presets in the Launcher
- No ingame options
- Keyboard controle is mediocre at best 
- Camera positioning with Keyboard control can be described as suboptimal (e.g clipping through the level walls)
- Uninspired soundassets
- Non existing Story Line
- Worst of all: IT'S F***ING BORING

I've gotten this game from the PcGamer's and Bundlestars' "Build Your Own Bundle" promotion for free.
Basically it's 3D Platformer set around collecting "Fairie's Tears" as a small wood log. So you walk around a few Levels beating enemies with four different kinds of leaves which isn't too difficult since they're moving at a snail's pace. Apart of the "Fairies Tears" there a "Berries" to collect for buying the afore-mentioned leaves and in my opinion to artificially extend the game's playtime in an annoying way. That's the meat of the game.

The Only reason to get this game would be, it having a really high discount 75%-90% or being free and playing it to sell the Trading Cards

author: {'steamid': '76561198103819788', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 181, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1452888568}
review:
Ennesimo esempio di come "indie Game" sia nel 99% dei casi sinonimo di buone idee messe in un prodotto raffazzonato, carente e assolutamente insoddisfacente, incapace di giustificare qualsiasi forma di pagamento. Woodle Tree Adventures √® un platform che riesce a fallire a scapito di una piacevole idea di fondo, mancando in modo grossolano le regole basilari di un buon platform 3d.

Voto :3/10

Il genere dei platform 3d √® un genere vasto,un genere che da sempre ha riempito il panorama console ma che non ha mai offerto grandi titoli sul panorama pc, obbligando spesso a ricorrere a vari emulatori. Woodle Tree Adventures (da ora WTA) cerca di portare su i nostri schermi quegli ambienti colorati e divertenti strizzando l'occhio a capolavori come Mario 64 e Super Mario 3D. Un gioco che cerca di "emulare" questi capolavori, e per di pi√π fatto da italiani, mi ha ovviamnnte attirato, ben felice di finanziare i piccoli sviluppatori italiani , sopratutto se si parla di platform.
Purtroppo per√≤, la felicit√† e 'impatto positivo sono durati  circa 30 secondi, tempo necessario per muovere i primi passi nel mondo di WTA e accorgersi dei suoi enormi limiti.
Ci sono delle regole non scritte ma che tutti, giocatori e programmatori, conoscono nel mondo dei platform.
I platform devo tassativamente avere 4 cose:
-velocit√† e dinamismo
-musiche e ambienti coinvolgenti che mantengano alto il ritmo di gioco
-visuale sempre chiara e facilmente comprensibile, che non ci ponga mai nella situazione di morire dopo un salto sbagliato, certo che sia accaduto per la pessima visuale rispetto ad un nostro errore (un errore personale lo si  accetta, un errore causato da scelte insensate dei programmatori no).
-un protagonista simpatico e carismatico, che ci invogli a guidarlo nell'avventura di gioco

Ebbene, WTA riesce a fallire tutti questi punti. 
Il personaggio, un tronco, viene presentato con 4 righe di testo senza lasciar capire nulla, e scegliere un tronco non √® esattamente un buon inizio...un tronco non rispecchia certo ideali di velocit√†, agilit√† , dinamismo o divertimento...
Appena il gioco comincia ci accorgiamo subito di come la visuale sia fissa. Risulta infatti possibile zoommare indietro e avanti, perquanto in modo del tutto casuale la visuale si avviciner√† o allontaner√† da s√®, rendendo inutili le regolazioni. Non sar√† per√≤ possibile ruotare la visuale, che resta fissa e vincolata a quanto √® stato deciso dai programmatori (talvolta cambier√† angolo per alcuni punti, ma rester√† comunque sempre fissa). Tale scelta √® assolutamente insensata per un gioco che si muove in 3 dimensioni. Siamo nel 2014, e adottare una telecamera fissa era una pessima idea gi√† prima del 2000, evidentemente i programmatori sono 15 anni che non giocano un platform 3d. COn questa scelta capire le distanze, le proporzioni, misurarsi nei salti, nel raccogliere oggetti o semplicemente spostarsi risulta estremamente caotico, complesso e "tirato a fortuna". Morire perch√® non avevate visto un mostro, oppure vi sembrava distante, oppure per un salto mancato clamorosamente grzie ad una visuale che non vi aiuta...√® una cosa normalissima in WTA. E quando morirete, ripartirete dall'inizio del livello.
Ai problemi di visuale poi si aggiunge pure la lentezza del personaggio, che si muove lento come, appunto, un tronco. Una lentezza ingiustificata, che riesce solo a annoiare e a farvi giocare tenendo costantemente premuto il pulsante della corsa...ennesima scelta senza senso.
Come se non bastasse, tra visuali improponibili e lentezze varie, ci si mette pure una musica che dire deprimente √® poco. Passate 15 minuti nel primo stage, con quella musica di sottofondo, ed il vostro principale pensiero sar√† il suicidio...ma il suicidio masochista, quel suicidio che vi spinge a strapparvi il cervello dal naso con un cucchiaino.

Sul piano grafico c'√® poco da dire, la scelta richiama tanto lo stile Mario64, fermando li le somiglianze. Pu√≤ piacere o meno, ma concettualmente √® la sola scelta interessante del gioco.
Nel complesso √® un gioco semplice, dal concetto elementare, dalle dinamiche platform ormai consolidate da 30 e pi√π anni di videogiochi... eppure WTA fallisce proprio su quelle cose fondamentali ,quei "dogmi" che tutti conoscono e nessuno s√† spiegare come i programmatori abbiano volutamente ignorato.
Un bel tentativo, una discreta occasione mancata, sopratutto perch√® italiana. Un titolo che non vale assolutamente la spesa, forse come key gratuita in qualche promozione...ma anche li il guadagno √® misero.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044115669', 'num_games_owned': 744, 'num_reviews': 132, 'playtime_forever': 35, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1406018599}
review: I was expecting a fun platforming adventure, I really was. You know that age-old adage, "I'd like to see you do any better"? I honestly feel like I could. Maybe not aesthetically, which is one thing Woodle Tree Adventures has going for it. It's beautiful. But other than that, it's not a fun experience. Gameplay is so rigid and boring, and there's so little to do. A very, VERY lazy effort on the developers' part. I'm glad I didn't spend any money on it, because it honestly isn't worth any.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020131935', 'num_games_owned': 402, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1412278133}
review:
I think this game is a really good platformer concept, seems to be intended for little kids, it has BEAUTIFUL graphics, controls are really easy and to be honest, since is almost a two man job my kudos goes for them. Too bad there are not many levels and the new weapons are gave way too early in the game.
There are some things that needs to get fixed, like the new level takes way too long to load, also there is a level (number 4 or 5, I cannot recall and I'm not going to redo it) where the music is simply annoying and stressful. There is no camera control and sometimes the camera view gets stuck.
Like I stated before, this game is intended for little kids, still I enjoyed it and I will recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198102236617', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 9, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1405816292}
review:
The first time starting the game it crashed. Second time it worked...

Then i started to play....And that didn't go very smoothly either. The controls ( w,a,s,d,space,e,shift) were easy enough however as i tried to exit the game (esc) nothing happened.

The game's camera keeps switching to impossible angles so it's hard to see an enemy ( or where to jump for that matter) and also when you walk up a stairs (in you're home) you walk halfly into the wall.

The looks of the game are adorable though- reminds me a bit of Mario (don't ask me why) it's rather curveless and has nice bright cherful colors.

Now i didn't play this game any further because of the impossible camera switching.

Do i reccomend it? No, not untill these bugs are fixed- unless you want to be amused by the camera switchingness in the game?

author: {'steamid': '76561198080447125', 'num_games_owned': 485, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1635485399}
review: This is the best game ever made with the expection of E.T. the Extra-Terrestrial and super man 64 this game is a legendary game about a tree that moves while not the best controls ever they are very responsive if you die its beacuse of you not the game its that good the music is god tier the graphics are Crysis 3 Rival-Like the animations are so good that they look like real life the and my game looks so good it makes my computer lag its amazing the objective of the game is to find all the fairy tears its such a innovative concept the game also contains many platforms the jumping works so well i'd say its almost as good as Mario 64 this game has one of the most interesting storys in video game history the objective is the collect 3 fariy tears in each level now this is such a innovative feature you get a leaf now this leaf should be in games like God Of War or Dante Inferno this leaf is the best weapon in gaming history you might say "what is so good about a leaf" well Woodle can swing the leaf to make baddies go flying to outer space its so quick that you don't even see the animation there are many glitches however they a very good edition to the game i ran into about 9 game breaking glitches in the game but the levels whereso well that don't even care now you cannot control the camera however the auto camera is so good a can say this same camera should be a standard in all games overall woodle tree adventures is a adventure for ages a game that is so dang good this game redefines how realistic a video game can get Woodle Tree Adventures is easily one of the best if not the best game ever  i can recommend this game to anybody this is easily one of the best games ever made this is GOTY 2014 just amazing and a very good game 100/100 GOTY 2014 GOTY of all years best game ever made Woodle Tree Adventures is just a amazing game they don't make games like this anymore easily a legend of game

author: {'steamid': '76561197967418148', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 60, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1405733884}
review:
It's a shame this game isn't as good as it could be.

Woodle Tree Adventures is a pretty basic 3D platformer. You jump around and collect three "fairy tears" per level and then reach the exit. You can collect berries on the way to unlock better versions of the leaf you use to attack, and avoid or kill enemies that mostly don't seem to care about much more than just standing there. The controls feel a little loose and impercise, so some jumps are a bit harder than they look like they should be.

The whole game just kinda seems unfinished. Except for a few that go on patrols or the rare one that will actually walk towards you, most enemies are just sort of out of the way and not doing anything. There are no camera controls; everything shown with pre-determined camera angles, and some of them are in bad positions. Some of them also won't trigger properly, leaving you with even worse views sometimes. The checkpoints seem broken too; SOMETIMES you'll respawn at a checkpoint close to where you died, but most of the time it sends you back to the very start of the level. Once, [url=http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=288086509]the game sent me back to the start of the stage with the camera facing the wrong way[/url]. Since you can't fix that, I had to play the first part of the level basically backwards until I hit a point where the camera decided to change to something more reasonable.

The level select are just globes that show up in your house without any sort of labels and aren't presented in a linear order, so it could be easy to forget what level is the latest one you unlocked if you step away from the game and come back. On the other hand, since the game only lasts about 40 minutes, you'll probably beat it in one sitting anyway. I kinda considered going back to collect the rest of the berries to get the last weapon, but the game doesn't tell you how many berries you've collected in each level, so god knows where those are [edit: It turns out that doesn't matter, because you can go back to a level and just get as many berries as you want to get the next item. It's not counting your completion rate, so you don't HAVE to get everything].

This game could get better! It seems like the devs are patching it with new levels and features, like multiplayer and the ability to zoom the camera in and out (but really, full camera control is more important). I feel like they do care about the game, but it's just not all there yet. I will keep an eye on it as they continue to add to the game, and I hope those problems I addressed get fixed. Keep an eye on this game and its development, and hopefully I'll be able to change this review to a thumbs up someday.
