author: {'steamid': '76561197995849278', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 227, 'playtime_forever': 94, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1405650340}
review:
Bueno, no tengo muy claro el signficado de √©ste juego. De hecho dudo que qui√©n lo hiciese lo tuviese claro. En cualquier caso, Woodle es un peque√±o toc√≥n (tu personaje) que ira por mapas plataformeros en 3D (tipo SuperMario 64) matando enemigos tontos con una hoja de bosque. Y digo enemigos tontos, porque es que te ven y si te atacan es mucho. 

El nivel de dificultad es 0. Es decir, los enemigos te pueden matar de un toque, tu a ellos tambi√©n. Si te caes al vac√≠o no mueres, continuas en el √∫ltimo punto de control. No tienes sistema de vida, ni da√±o, ni nada por el estilo. El objetivo del juego no lo comprendo. Vas por unos munditos recogiendo unas especies de frutas y de esa forma lo completas y te largas a otro mundo.

 En mi opini√≥n parece un juego sacado para ni√±os de 3-4 a√±os. Aparte hay que recalcar algo que si que es fat√≠dico: el sistema de visi√≥n. El juego est√° hecho con "c√°maras" enfocando cada punto del escenario, pero ojo, no puedes girar la c√°mara y en muchos lugares, debido a lo mal posicionada que est√° la perspectiva, no podr√°s ver ni lo que tienes delante. Eso hace que el juego pierda mucho inter√©s y si a eso le a√±adimos que el reto del juego consiste en cojer frutos y ojas de lluvia que no se para que se utilizan pues tenemos francamente un juego tedioso y aburrido. Una aut√©ntica l√°stima debido a que tiene unos gr√°ficos muy bien cuidado y el sonido tampoco est√° nada mal.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040608375', 'num_games_owned': 391, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 103, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1519841186}
review:
A VERY simple and MINIMALISTIC game. There is no true objective, there are only three buttons you press to play the game, the character has the most annoying voice when jumping, there is no story (well some wierd old tree gives birth to a fat little stump (eww) and then you (the fat stump) has to collect your fathers tears to save the "land", or something). worthless "enemies" that pose no threat, Glitches with enemies and you clipping through things, no satisfaction in "beating" the game, and lastly the fault that it is hurting it the most it has too few levels. 

"WHAT?! after all you mentioned the worst part is that there isn't enough levels for you to play a poorly done plataformer?!" -confused reader 

Yet dispite all that I had an extremely great time. Get some friends to come over have some drinks and play this game. NEVER play this game alone, and im sorry to say but NEVER buy this game over $2.50 yet i can still recommend this game as it is one of the few games that can be extremely fun to watch while someone else is playing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198108959985', 'num_games_owned': 265, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 343, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 343, 'last_played': 1406331107}

author: {'steamid': '76561198003545953', 'num_games_owned': 3094, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 104, 'last_played': 1405460307}
review: This is not a mean "unrecommended".  The game simply doesn't feel finished.  It feels like an alpha version running round empty worlds collecting berries and engaging in kill or be killed tactics with the most oblivious creatures.  The style is cute, the glitchy physics are fun, the story is only technically there.  "We need water! No, ignore that water level, we need giant drops of fairy tears!  Okay, done.  You must ingest additional berries."  This game is technically fun, but not much.  It's honestly not much of anything.  I tried this game because it was a cute looking platformer.  Unfortunately the camera angles were too debilitating, and the enemies too confusing, to allow the platforming to be any kind of interesting.  It could become something interesting, but its been around for a while and doesn't look like it's going anywhere.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977654536', 'num_games_owned': 4287, 'num_reviews': 125, 'playtime_forever': 121, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1405414007}
review:
at the heart, it is a satisfying gaming experience for the most part that is worth a few hours of your time for the very easy 100 percent achievements, and trading cards being a nice bonus.

the devs(or whoever made the decision) to include STEAM trading cards and achievements made a good idea as people like me would have never looked at it otherwise, even as a free gift from indie gala (thank you indie gala)

the sound design in the game is the best part. nice satisfying noises, great music. 
the game recommends you use a gamepad, and I do too. it doesn't feel good on a keyboard at all. the very frustrating and inconsistant camera are easier managed on a gamepad for some reason. Keys are bindable though. You can do a 2 player deal as well if you have a small child that would like this kind of game. Don't make an adult sit down with you though. That'd be cruel. 

its a decent platformer as in its not bad. its just not original. nothing about the game is original. its hardly even an adventure, with just a few stages and no connection between things. barest of bones narrative. and to be frank, very lame art/world/character design. only controls are to move, jump, run, adjust the camera's closeness to you (its not a camera you can rotate) and weakly swing a leaf (your one and only move that isn't simply moving your character around the level) there really isn't a difficulty to speak of. a 5 year old could play this game to completion.

my only real gripe is the inconsistant and uncooperative camera. also the overall art design really seems like it was made by one teenager with ambitions to go into game development, which in combination with the lack of other game elements warrents very little of your time. however i do immensely recommend it if you are after easy achievements. I have them all with the playtime shown in my review.
At 2.99, I wouldn't recommend this game. At .50 cents or free , i can.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052591527', 'num_games_owned': 42, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 660, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1452645148}
review:
I think this game lacks a lot of things.

First and formost, it's a game where you basically collect berries and fairy tears.  The story isn't that interesting though and I died in boredom. 

I was hoping for a better intro. But I guess it's okay. But please do put a "press enter to start" so that people would know you have to. 

Correct me if i'm mistaken. You can't change the controls in the game. The controls are easy but not everyone has to be forced to use them as is. Plus I think there are controls which the game doesn't really show(?) Like for example the sprint (shift) or zoom (move your mouse) . There should be more tips or if not, a better tutorial.

The music is relaxing I guess. But it's boring having to listen to it when you're in an adventure. A more lively BGM would fix that.

The graphics is good, but it's kinda glitchy and unrefined at some points. The design is kind of original and it looks cute.

The gameplay was okay, i had a hard time in having my perspective fixed because of the camerawork and how the zoom wasn't introduced.

What I'm saying is that 2.99 usd is okay for a game like this. It's fairly cheap but for me, I'd rather get other games cause for me I thought the game wasn't worth playing. Sorry devs but basing from what you guys can pull off, you could've done a better job because the game only went to waste. You guys had so much potential.

review: A funny little platformer.  I got this game for free, so keep that in mind when reading this review.  The graphics style is very smooth, bright, and appealing, and its got a very cutesie atmosphere.  The mechanics are alright, but could use some refining.  The levels are simply formatted and straight forward, just collect berries and fairy tears (To summon the dark lord satan of course).  All in all, it's a nice casual platformer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041543513', 'num_games_owned': 761, 'num_reviews': 213, 'playtime_forever': 41, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1405320896}
review:
I got this game for free, and I sincerely think you should only get this game if you have the same opportunity.

If you really, really like platformers, you MAY like this game, however, there are countless other platformers for you to enjoy instead of this. I try really hard not to give a thumbs down review, but I just can't avoid it with this game.

The aesthetics are good - very simple, colorful environments. The music is nothing fancy, but appropriate for the simple gameplay. 

The controls are very simple and easy to learn, the learning curve is pretty minimal if non-existent. The only real difficulty comes from the camera being fixed, you can only zoom in and out at a weird angle, however, you do this by moving the mouse back and forth (even though, intuitively it would be more ergonomic to use the mouse wheel for this function). I tried experimenting with the keyboard and mouse to turn/pan the camera, but it is indeed fixed for the game. The worst part, is that there are areas in the game where the camera will orient a different way, and if you die it will remain fixed in the new orientation, potentially making it even more difficult to navigate through the map. There also does not seem to be a checkpoint system, so everytime you die by touching an enemy or falling off the stage you have to restart from the very beginning of the area.

You play as a little tree stump and have to collect fairy water drops(?) and these floating orbs that you store in your pouch. The purple pouch gets bigger as you collect more orbs, and I thought this was a nice touch.

The game plays super casually and is not very challenging - you hit enemies with a leaf to destory them.

As a platformer, the game is kind of boring, and the story is not very engaging - a master tree created you to give water to the land (and that's about it).

I usually don't mention the game price if I think the gameplay (and everything else about it) outshines its price tag. That being said, this game currently costs $2.99, and I don't think you should bother getting it even if it was free (except maybe for the cards).

Do not recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983628550', 'num_games_owned': 1897, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1405087517}
review:
Main problem: Hindering camera with no input options other than zoom in or out.  

It's too hard to control or see to control where you are and where your character is, usually floating past where you intended to land a jump and off the edge of the level... for to 40th time.  Falling means going back to a nearby checkpoint (as does touching most enemies), which isn't a terrible punishment, but there's nearly no learning curve since all jumps feel blinded by pre-determined camera perspective.

This game has some hints of cute platform fun (Mario 64 style), but primarily the camera needs more work before it's worth giving it a try.  Thankfully, this game has recently been updated and is likely to see more improvements.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999173289', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1405213262}
review:
When getting this game for free from the IndieGala giveaway, I expected a calming experience of being a treestump, running around exploring the world. Now, the idea itself sounded quite decent and the videos were also fun to watch, but after a short while the good idea behind it turned into a rather troublesome outcome.

Where to start... You get pressed out of the surface of earth to then suddenly be the child of a big tree sitting in the center of a place that never was explained. He tells you to go save the world by gathering tears that spend life and water to all creatures and plants. Having said such, you then live on a floating island with the stages sitting inside your house, taking away all you space you need to live... It's not like you'll ever make use of the furniture you have in there anyway.

Having selected a stage you are greeted by music which I found okay at the start, but it turned out to be quite irritating, especially in a stage where you spawn on some beach. The music there turned into a madness of keys being pushed without an end to it, the song ends, you sigh in relief, and there, the song starts all over again.

The graphics look fun and are childfriendly, the same goes to the gameplay. Dealing with the camera though forced me to actually get a bit upset playing this game, as I had a hard time of non-resetting, locked viewpoints after dying. There even was a moment, where I saw a huge stretched out texture all across the screen due to my character being reset without the camera. That incident made the game be unplayable and I had to reboot. You can zoom the camera out, which is a start, but not being able to rotate it and it not resetting to it's original position make it challenging to enjoy this game. To add up to it, checkpoints seem to be placed in a weird fashion, as dying sometimes resulted with me being all the way at the beginning of the stage, which can be a bit frustrating after a while. If there was a checkpoint and you messed up, it would throw you back by another one which could be waaaay back from where you came from. This made things a bit sad sometimes aswell.

The gameplay itself was just okay I'd say. The controls are kept simple, which is nice, but the movement can be a bit weird to deal with at times. Enemies don't feel challenging and you usually just spam the attack button to get rid of them. Some foes also seem to be randomly placed, and I saw no reason for them being there. There were spiked enemies in a big field and I never saw a way of accidently dying by them. They were just standing there, in the open space. Now, who would jump ontop of them without an obstacle making you jump in the first place? I just feel like they were placed there to fill a gap.

And then there you are, running around from one stage to another, gathering the berries and tears you find to save the world from... drying out? He never has gone into detail, and he also never re-appears as you progress in the game, so there basically is close to no story to this game. After 69 minutes, I saw him again, sitting in his old spot telling me two lines of text, then booting me into the credits where I was stuck, even after them finishing, until I closed the game, lovely.

There is a bit more content to it afterwards, a stage that unlocks when you have 600 berries, and items that unlock as you progress with gathering named berries during the stages. Now... I never got to experience what the unlocked stage is about, as it seemed only responded with a white screen, then freezing, waiting for me to kill the .exe.

All in all, I'd say that the game was okay for the fact that I didn't have to pay for it. Same goes to the frame, I like the idea of having a peaceful platformer without any punishment or time-limits in addition with cute and simple graphics. But I was punished by the lack of camera movement, the weird checkpoints that threw me back a lot all the time, and the fact of the camera just locking into weird places afterwards.

Too bad...

author: {'steamid': '76561198022004891', 'num_games_owned': 3044, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 88, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 88, 'last_played': 1405200163}
review:
Bad game.

+ Cute artstyle
- Bad graphics, it's not 1996 anymore. When enemies die they just 'disappear' , no visual effect whatsoever.
- Incredibly easy  - you can finish the game in less than an hour.
- Horrible controls, no camera control. Makes it impossible to see where you're going. It's too zoomed in, also.
- Bought it, then went "free" on IndieGala only shortly after being accepted on Steam.
- Rips off The Legend of Zelda: WindWaker (the leaf as a weapon) and The Legend of Zelda: Ocarina of Time (Deku Tree)
- Only 6 levels. 4 at the bottom of your house and 2 above. -_-
- No point in collecting the collectables, as the counter is only in the overworld and the upgrades are minimal. You're only making the game easier for yourself, not more difficult when you progress.
- The achievements are uncreative: collect 3000 berries. How about make the berries more useful and make it: Collect ALL 102 berries in World 1 for example.

review:
What should I say? Beating this game was a child's play. Somekind of berry counter was bugged so I got the 3k berries a in few minutes. In the beginning I had some issues on the camera control. Then I figured out, you just can use it by zooming in and out with mouse moves in hope to get a better view.

Otherwise I really enjoyed playing these lovely animated and dreamful sounded enviroment levels. This game has no violence at all. It's like a Mario64 clone which is one of the greatest entertaining games ever. I liked the Bee Level or the Underwater Level. Even the Snow Level was slippery during walking. It's quite challenging to collect all 3 drops in each level. A nicely done fun game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198076721797', 'num_games_owned': 915, 'num_reviews': 778, 'playtime_forever': 109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1405096927}
review:
I can't really in good conscience recommend this game. I actually enjoyed my (relatively small) time with it, which might be in part due to getting it free, but. That's beside the point.

THe make-or-break issue I have with this game really comes down to how unfathomly broken the checkpoint system is. I've 100%'ed the game and I am still not sure if checkpoints are intentional or a glitch, since they don't tend to work half the time and you can find yourself at the very start of the level after dying at the very end.
Fortunately the levels are short and the direct path to the end is always even shorter. The game has a focus on exploring the 3D environments with many small side-paths and alternate routes and all, and it does a decent job there, though there's a real lack of a motivator.
Unfortunately there's not much beyond terrain to traverse. There's water and these booster things that are also abhorrently broken, and there's enemies that are barely a threat most of the time. Other than that, just basic terrain. And wonky camera. 
Yeah... the issue here is that this game is, on a technical level, a mess. I can't deny that.
On the other hand, it's kind of charming in a way, and I can't call it "unfun". The art is nice, the (relatively few) stages are all decently diverse, the music is okay, the story doesn't get in the way of anything, the collecting is decently fun... it has the potential to be a good game, but failed in the execution.
Considering that you can still currently get the game for free, check it out, but otherwise, even at its low price it's probably not worth full price; get it during a sale if you're really curious.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970644409', 'num_games_owned': 6460, 'num_reviews': 130, 'playtime_forever': 61, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1405147274}
review:
[B]Woodle Tree Adventures[/b]
Rating: 3/10

This is the story of a little tree that goes water-drop hunting for his father. He has to jump and defeat enemies to get to the drops and deliver them at the end of the level where they are put in plastic cups.

The game looks kinda cute, and that's the only positive point really about it (oh, it is dead cheap and you can get it for free at the time of writing). It plays horrible with a fixed point camera that tries to give a nice view but often fails so you really can't see where you are going. You really need to play this with and xbox controller, and then often you are struggling not to fall off the level.

You also encounter different enemies which you can beat by hitting them with your leaf. Which plays and looks really goofy and doesn't add up to a better gaming experience.

I completed the first level and started the second so I didn't see really much of the game but I think it will not improve a lot. 

Nice try to create a Nintendo-like game but it really fails to do. Avoid playing this, just collect the cards...

author: {'steamid': '76561198103033403', 'num_games_owned': 1906, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 35, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1405009117}
review:
Disappointing game, it wanted to be cute and I wanted to like it, but the camera doing whatever it wanted (and not even being consistent in it) was a huge setback: I died, respawned at the start, and the camera got stuck following me sideways up close and personal and would not even zoom out or rearrange itself at all until I died again, so I basically couldn't see anything. Same with the berries backpack, I was collecting them even though I had no idea what they were for, and the pack got so big it got in the way of my jumps, too.
Add to that a lack of menu (seriously? I couldn't find any menu... ) and lack of proper settings control, and I just couldn't be bothered to play it past the first level.

author: {'steamid': '76561198102063164', 'num_games_owned': 556, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 39, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1405409520}
review:
When I first played this game back in 2014 - I was harsh on it. I thought the game controlled poorly, the story was non-sensical and the graphics were very plain and very bad. However, that was well over 5 years ago when I first experienced this game.

In 2020, my opinion on the game has changed after I got a perspective on how...truly difficult video game development is. And how truly heartbreaking it is to have a game be bashed & hated on by everyone when all you have is a cute idea you're passionate about and you put in the time & effort to realize it with a full game. That's Woodle Tree Adventures. It is the idea of a guy for a very relaxed, chilled out platformer with simple objectives and controls. While the controls of the game are admittedly very floaty and uncomfortable, the game is designed around the floaty control scheme in mind. The graphics of the game, which I heavily criticized in 2014 when I first played it, are stylized in this very childlike wonder fashion which has held up surprisingly well over the years.

The game often goes on sale for pennies basically, and do I recommend you give the game a shot next time it's on sale? Sure! At worst - you can always refund and get your 1 euro or so back.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983180973', 'num_games_owned': 3953, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 154, 'last_played': 1404955388}
review:
Graphismes : Une chose est s√ªr ce Woodle Tree Adventures est beau. Mais plus que √ßa, il se veut enchanteur. Se balader dans les niveaux de ce titre vous fera tr√®s certainement retomber en enfance ! :)

Jouabilit√© : C'est fluide et l'aspect plate-forme est bien respect√©, seul hic (√† mes yeux) les sauts ! Il suffira de faire une mauvaise manip' pour tomber rigidement dans le vide sans pouvoir ne serait-ce qu'un peu changer de trajectoire ! 
Pour ce qui est du combat, un seul coup de votre feuille f√©tiche mettra √† terre les monstres les plus impressionnants :'D ! 

Dur√©e de vie : A l'heure actuelle.. Une seule heure de jeu suffit pour finir chaque niveau du jeu. Rajoutez trente minutes pour d√©bloquer chaque succ√®s.

Bande son : Aie.. Alors que quelques niveaux restent √† la hauteur, d'autres comme celui de la plage sont de vraies catastrophes.

Sc√©nario : Vous √™tes une b√ªche (de bois, pas de no√´l..) et devrez partir √† la chasse aux pommes (Oui oui pomme, je pr√©f√®re √ßa aux baies *-*') ! Emportez le tout dans votre sac, ramassez les trois gouttes d'eau pour finir les niveaux et le tour est jou√© ! 


PS : Des bonus vous attendent sur la map du spawn, √† votre droite avant de choisir un niveau ! 
Il suffit simplement d'avoir le bon nombre de pommes ! ( Oui pomme *-* )




Note G√©n√©rale : 10 / 20 : Captivant mais surtout fascinant de par son style d'art unique, ce jeu de plateforme old school remplit bien son r√¥le pour le temps d'une petite heure ! A l'heure actuelle, ce Woodle Tree Adventures reste tr√®s pauvre en contenu mais est dot√© d'un formidable potentiel qui ne demande qu'√† √™tre exploit√© . 
Le prix n'est pas si choquant, surtout qu'en ce moment, des cl√©s sont distribu√©es gratuitement ! Alors Wait & See !

author: {'steamid': '76561197999892157', 'num_games_owned': 1842, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1402773223}
review:
Woodle Tree Adventures is the reason nobody should rely on Steam Greenlight for good games. Inticing people to upvote your game with the promise of a free game will surely get you what you want which is that Greenlight, but you will be frowned upon in the gaming world.

On top of this pet peeve of mine Woodle Tree Adventures screams mediocre around the board. The game feels unpolished and clunky, the camera system is annoying and very hard to analyze where you are on the maps. The combat is very bland most enemys are efortless and don't attack, the berry collection system is monitionous and annoying more than anything. Even at $2.99 I would not recommend this game unless you like bad titles.

Here is my video spotlight if you want to see my reasons for this review. 

http://youtu.be/DGOmD7xdP4M

author: {'steamid': '76561198015378070', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 116, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 116, 'last_played': 1404939389}
review:
An extremely cute game both conceptually and graphically. Gameplay so far seems unremarkable and mainly consists of climbing or riding things in order to grab berries and fairy tears. However, I've only finished level one. I did see the emergence of new exploration tools in level 2 such as wind tunnels that lift you up. 

Why did I feel compelled to leave a negative review so soon? My struggle with the terrible camera! You are only allowed you to zoom in and out. Not having 360 degree freedom greatly interfered with distance perception, so I fell off and died a lot. It's a good thing you don't lose what you've already collected. Using controller, the camera bugged out and stuck one a certain angle every other time I hit pause. It wouldn't realign itself for the rest of the level, and I didn't want to restart since I collected almost every berry on the map. Then the camera broke again at the start of level 2. I'd definitely say that the buggy camera is a huge deal breaker for a platformer that relies on exploring map space.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062756160', 'num_games_owned': 851, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 33, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1404925932}
review:
A pretty solid 3D platformer. It's short, but (with a gamepad) the controls are pretty tight and responsive. Collect berries, collect all the tears, and then move on to the next level. It's pretty simple and straightforward, and great for a casual experience.

The only real flaw in the game is the camera angle. It's pretty stationary, though you can zoom in and out. There's times when you really wish you could rotate the camera. It's bothersome the most when you're in an area where it's hard to gauge your exact position in the 3D space, and you aren't sure if the platform, enemy, etc, is right next to you, or a little forward or backward from your current position. You're going to jump too far and off a cliff, or walk behind or in front of objects fairly often. Again, it's a bit annoying and an inconvenience, but you don't have "lives," so you die, respawn nearby or at the beginning of the level (depending on if you hit a checkpoint), and continue on your way.

It's no AAA title, but it is a fun little platformer if you've got some time to waste.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053171381', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 33, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1404891521}
review:
A game I just couldn't recommend, WTA is where you play as a log who goes on adventures to eat berries and collect tears. Sounds simple enough but in truth isn't.
Pros -
Cute graphics that match up with Wind waker.
Characters are different and never bland.
Gameplay easy enough for adults and children to enjoy.
Even with my basic graphics card it still played well.

Cons -
Controls on keyboard are a nightmare, Yes I know that it says play with a 360 controller but that leaves people who don't have one out, Same problem with castle crashers and other games.
Camara is worse than I have seen in years, Hitting enemies is a pain and getting items is worse. 
Enemies don't show much of a threat, I know it's suppose to be a happy world but that takes away any challenge the game had at all.

So just to say
Story - 6/10 Not bad but simple.
Graphics 10/10 I love graphics like these, Feels like a interactive book from my childhood.
Controls 6/10 The control aren't awful but sometimes feel slow.
Camara 2/10 The camara is the worse problem in the game, It's so close that you can almost see the main character's pores.

It's not a bad game but I would recommend you get it on sale or look out for a giveaway. I got this game for free and I'm happy I didn't pay for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988663774', 'num_games_owned': 3547, 'num_reviews': 351, 'playtime_forever': 78, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1404797165}
review:
This was basically made by one person, so in a way it's kind of cool that you can make a bad knockoff of Super Mario 64 by yourself in 2014.

But it's a bad knockoff of Super Mario 64 where the only real difficulty comes from the absolutely miserable camera, as enemies are all essentially trivial to defeat, especially once you get the yellow leaf, and you have infinite lives. That's... less cool. Anyway, this game was given away for free by IndieGala so I can't say that much horrible about what I paid for it, but I would also not recommend it at any price because it's never really fun, just slightly amusing at best.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074408642', 'num_games_owned': 593, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1404747736}
review:
IndieGala was giving this away free, and I'm not one to turn down free stuff, so I figured I'd take a look. Let's just say I can see why they could only give those keys away, nobody in their right mind would pay money for this.

Woodle Tree Adventures is a very basic 3D platformer featuring the bare mininum of what you'd expect from the genre. You can jump, melee attack, and hold a button down to move slightly less slowly. Each level features 3 drops of water to collect and take to the exit. Along the way you'll find some platforms, enemies which mostly stand still and wait for you to hit them so they can flop over without any real animation, and some berries which can unlock a bonus level if you have the patience to grind 600 of them. There is nothing else of note to be found anywhere.

The only real obstacle in the entire game is the camera, which cannot be controlled and will instead swing around haphazardly with a mind of its own. In many places it seems to be actively trying to block your depth perception, creating the only source of "difficulty" as you repeatedly fall past a platform you misjudged.

I'm rather hard-pressed to think of anything positive at all to say about this game. The main character is kinda cute I guess. And thankfully it only took me 45 minutes to be done with it. But I do wish I could get those 45 minutes back.

review: Well, this game is pretty god damn good. The Platforming is very tight and good, the graphics are nice and cartoony, and the characters are very cute. (really they are freaking awesome) The only problem is the camera, which isn't very focused on the character

author: {'steamid': '76561197992070626', 'num_games_owned': 472, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 70, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1404742833}
review:
The Mojo tree has given you a quest, the quest to kill everyone with a leaf.
It's now your duty to become a ninja tree.

Before giving any judgement about this game, you should know that everything: the levels, music, models are made by one and only guy.

The game really looks like Super Mario 3D World, the environments and the details are pretty amazing. Collecting items and discovering everything from a level is what I like the most in games. And the controller support makes the game even more enjoyable.

However, the camera is sometimes shy and not in the proper place, plus you can't move it left and right, only up / down.
The maniability is also hard in small areas, the character keeps moving forward after landing.

In the end, I think that this game has a good potential and should be an Early Access, the game can be really much improved and have more features. For example, a level editor or puzzles in some levels.
For the moment, you can beat the game in 30 mins. The price given would be all for the genius creator of this game.
It's worth it.

6/10

review:

Este sin dudas, es un juego cuyos gr√°ficos y cuyo estilo me ha sorprendido bastante, ya que recuerda mucho a los t√≠tulos de la saga Super Mario, como los Galaxy o los 3D World, lleno de colores vivos y personajes en los que el autor ha puesto su gran creatividad para darles vida, que puedo decir, son muy kawaii :D. En cuanto a jugabilidad, me ha parecido un plataformero bastante simpl√≥n, y que deber√≠a pulirse en algunos aspectos, ya que los enemigos apenas tienen inteligencia artificial, por lo menos en el primer nivel, ya que se muestran algo pasivos y no responden demasiado a los movimientos del jugador, si te dan, te env√≠an al √∫ltimo punto de control. author: {'steamid': '76561198068993748', 'num_games_owned': 560, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 110, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 110, 'last_played': 1404822763}
review:
Woodle Tree Adventures √© um jogo de aventura simples, casual e tranquilo. Ele foi baseado ([i]como descrito na descri√ß√£o do pr√≥prio jogo[/i]) Em jogos de aventura dos anos 90' 

O gameplay √© simples, voc√™ √© um pequeno tronco e anda pelos cen√°rios em busca da [b]"√Ågua m√°gica"[/b], para poder restaurar o mundo e trazer a p√°z a ele. Durante os cen√°rios √© exatamente o que voc√™ faz, para passa-los voc√™ tem que achar e levar as tr√™s gotas de √°gua ao fim do cen√°rio. Assim que termina um cen√°rio, voc√™ abre o pr√≥ximo. Neles voc√™ coleta frutas, com elas voc√™ destrava uma nova folha, que √© sua forma de atacar os inimigos. S√£o tr√™s tipos, destravadas com um n√∫mero espec√≠fico de frutas. Ao se conseguir 600 Voc√™ desbloqueia tamb√©m um cen√°rio extra.

[b]Os gr√°ficos[/b] do jogo s√£o o ponto mais not√°vel do jogo. Apesar de serem simples, s√£o bonitos e tem uma arte bem particular.

[b]Seu som[/b] assim como suas musicas s√£o, as vezes, pouco percept√≠veis, mas, at√© que s√£o boas. Mas tamb√©m, nada que seja mem√≥r√°vel. 

[b]A jogabilidade[/b] parece estranha logo de in√≠cio, mas, √© assim mesmo. No come√ßo se estranha um pouco, mas, da para se acostumar r√°pido e ver que ela n√£o √© ruim. Os inimigos que voc√™ enfrenta s√£o bem simples, eles apenas ficam parados, se movem para um lado ou outro e apenas alguns tentam te atacar, √© bem f√°cil passar por eles, muitas vezes nem sendo preciso ataca-los. Os √∫nicos pesares mais s√©rios, tamb√©m s√£o com a jogabilidade. Primeiro e principal √© a c√¢mera. Ela n√£o √© ruim, mas, adora tomar alguns √¢ngulos estranhos, ou ent√£o [i]quando eu minimizei o jogo [/i] quando voltei a c√¢mera girou sozinha, ent√£o ficou imposs√≠vel jogar porque escondia todo o cen√°rio, tive que fechar o game. E os check-points, eles s√£o extremamente aleat√≥rios. Algumas vezes voc√™ cai e volta num, outra hora voc√™ tem de ir do inicio. Mas, n√£o √© nada grave, porque voc√™ n√£o sofre nenhum tipo de penaliza√ß√£o. Quando voc√™ encosta num inimigo ou cai, voc√™ apenas volta pro inicio. Mas, tendo tudo que voc√™ j√° pegou. Apenas vai ter que passar o caminho de novo.

Ent√£o Woodle Tree Adventures √© um jogo simples e bem tranquilo. Ele tamb√©m √© muito curto, cerca de uma hora √© o bastante pra se passar ele completamente. Ent√£o, os quesitos pra recomendar ele ou n√£o, s√£o exatamente os mesmos. Voc√™ apenas tem de decidir se ele vai te interessar. Eu acabei recebendo ele de gra√ßa. Ent√£o, n√£o tenho do que reclamar. Mas, se o game tiver um desconto bom ([i]mesmo ele sendo bem barato[/i]) vai compensar bem mais pelo que ele apresenta.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051601138', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 51, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1404670421}
review:
Maybe the worst game I've played this year. It looks cute and stuff, but playability is nowhere to be found.

The goal of the game is not clear, at the begining your father/fake Deku tree explains that you must pick up fairy tears, but nothig seems to happen when you do so, and there is no tear counter or something. On addition, there is no way to quit a level; you either close the game or stay in the level forever (or if there is a way, I have not been capable to figure it out). If that was not enough, the point of view spins randomly, making the game almost imposible to play at some points.

However, if you can get it for free or as part of a good bundle, it has only six cards so you can score an easy badge.

________

Tal vez el peor juego que he probado este a√±o. Es bonito y tal, pero la jugabilidad brilla por su ausencia.

El objetivo no est√° claro, al principio tu padre/falso √°rbol Deku explica que hay que conseguir l√°grimas de hada, pero parece que no pasa nada cuando lo haces y no hay contador de l√°grimas ni nada parecido. Adem√°s, no hay manera de salir del nivel que est√©s jugando; o te quedas en √©l para siempre o cierras el juego (o si la hay, yo no he sido capaz de descubrirla). Por si era poco, la c√°mara gira aleatoriamente, haciendo algunas partes pr√°cticamente imposibles de jugar. 

De todos modos, si lo consigues gratis o en un bundle interesante, s√≥lo tiene seis cromos as√≠ que es una insignia bastante f√°cil de conseguir.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066723752', 'num_games_owned': 392, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 39, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1434932028}
review:
Il gioco in se √® carino, il prezzo non √® esagerato, solo che sembra ancora in beta:

-La visuale √® pessima, si bugga spesso ed √® realmente gestita male.
-I suoni sono un ago nell'orecchio, uno solo di orecchio, dato che all'altro giunge solo la musica di sottofondo. Sentirete i suoni da una cuffia/cassa soltanto, prima una poi l'altra a seconda della visuale. Credo l'intenzione fosse quella di fare un effetto surround in modo tale che se un determinato evento accada a sinistra il gicoatore avrebbe sentito il suono a sinistra, ma non √® cos√¨, il suono √® in base alla videocamera. 
-Le animazioni di "lotta" sono carine, solo che non c'√® una vera e propria lotta: potrete instakillare quasi qualsiasi mob che si muova con la vostra foglia premendo il tasto E, se non sarete abbastanza veloci ed entrerete nel "hitten-box" del mob (che non corrisponde esattamente al mbo stesso) morirete. 
-A proposito di morire, i checkpoint non sono segnalati, cio√® se morite teoricamente rinascete al punto di partenza, ma a partire dal secondo livello/mappa ci saranno i checkpoint; peccato solo che li attiverete senza nemmeno accorgevene. 

E ci sono anche altri piccoli problemi che, messi assieme, fanno un grande problema: il gioco sembra ancora non finito.

√® anche vero che, come dicevo, il prezzo √® basso, quindi se avete visto un gameplay e vi attira compratelo, solo non aspettatevi molto e siate molto pazienti...

author: {'steamid': '76561198097738062', 'num_games_owned': 759, 'num_reviews': 128, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1404614404}
review: Feels like a high school programming project rather than a game. Movement didn't work with my Xbox-wrapped PS3 controller (which works with other games I play,) so I had to use the horrendous keyboard controls. Extreme lack of polish everywhere.  Uncomfortable silence at times, audio levels are generally unbalanced - when you swing your weapon, the character shouts almost inaudibly, but waterfalls are loud. Nothing generally has any weight, not the jumping, especially not hitting enemies. They just fall over slowly and pathetically. If you die, the level just kind of starts over halfway through your death animation with no prompt or screen animation or anything. The camera uses fixed angles, like old survival horror games, but they're not useful or appropriate for this. My friend says an elevator pushed him out of the level within the first ten minutes. Ahhhh.... I just can't do it.

Ce jeu me rappel les jeux de mon enfance ... Ou plut√¥t leurs plus gros d√©fauts! La cam√©ra est harnachique, le sc√©nario est basique et n'a aucun sens d√®s lors on le lie au gameplay du jeu. Ce dernier est limite injouable. La musique est globalement la m√™me: un truc calme, qui s'associe √† la perfection √† la molesse du gameplay. Techniquement c'est moche . Certes c'est d'un indie mais le fait qu'il le soit n'excuse pas tout. Les textures sont plates et se chevauchent avec d'autre textures. Les differents sprite 3D ne sont absolument pas stable, les √©lements du jeu se traverse entre eux! bref!! 
j'ai tr√®s vite soulign√© que la cam√©ra √©tait hanarchique mais il faut le voir pour le croire!! on dirait un mauvais jeu ps1 ou l'un des 1er jeu 3d de la nitendo 64! author: {'steamid': '76561198058193222', 'num_games_owned': 151, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 48, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1404546353}
review:
There isn't much about Woodle Tree Adventures that seems complete. The idea is simple, jump around some woodland and find some water or something.   The art design and concept are good, but everything else is riddled with problems. 

It‚Äôs not really clear what you‚Äôre supposed to be doing at given moment and the levels are haphazard at best. Every enemy is the same amount of useless.  When you die you start over at the beginning of the level, unless you start over at some other arbitrary point. After playing the first level for a while it seemed like I was supposed to gather up 3 tears or water drops of some sort to move on the next level. I only found two water drops, restarted the game and suddenly the next level became available? 

There is essentially no interface to be found in the game, no menu or settings once you start up the game. You can‚Äôt start a new game or do anything at all besides jump around and whack stuff with a leaf.

From the first splash screen you have some graphics settings and control configuration which are just as incomplete as everything else. If you set the resolution to low you probably won‚Äôt be able to read any of the text, which isn‚Äôt much of a problem because the dialogue and story are apparently contained entirely in three sentences when you first boot up the game. The control options are downright confusing.

I don‚Äôt want to disparage the developer too much because the game is very charming and I think there is some potential here, but Woodle Tree Adventures is far from complete. I couldn‚Äôt recommend anyone buy it if they‚Äôre expecting a finished product.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025471558', 'num_games_owned': 515, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1407634101}
review:
I've always wanted to play a game as a tree stump that sideways jumps and attacks wolves. Not to mention attacking running potatos with leaves. At the end of the day, it's good to know that you can stand on the marshmellow people. It's the small things in life that make everyday worth waking up for.

Seriously though, it seems like a small team did this game and it's not a AAA game. But honestly, it is a fun game to play. I like the levels so far. I wish you could pan the camera instead of just zooming in and out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054922547', 'num_games_owned': 162, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 36, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1404521071}
review:
Woodle Tree adventure √© um jogo de plataforma com cen√°rios tridimensionais, e uma c√¢mera bugada que varia entre 2D, primeira pessoa e uma de frente (semelhante a um self) essa de frente sem duvidas √© a pior de todas devido ao estilo tridimensional dos cen√°rios. No jogo voc√™ controla um peda√ßo de arvore em um cen√°rio com gr√°ficos cartunizados. Quanto ao cen√°rio n√£o tenho nada contra gr√°ficos em forma de cartoon, tanto que, acho os gr√°ficos de Team Fortress 2, Crash Bandicoot e Rayman Origins incr√≠veis, entretanto o de woodle tree adventures deixa muito a desejar, em minha opini√£o os desenvolvedores n√£o souberam tirar proveito do estilo cartoon para apresentar um cen√°rio criativo que cativa-se o jogador, mas pelo contrario apresentaram um repetitivo que cansa o jogador. O jogo tamb√©m conta com quedas de FPS o deixando mais lento, pela forma tridimensional ele pode ate lembrar um jogo de Nintendo 64 ou Playstation 1, mas s√≥ a primeira vista porque n√£o passa a divers√£o que a maioria daqueles jogos passavam. Devido a seus cen√°rios repetitivos, jogabilidade chata e enjoativa e uma trilha sonora horr√≠vel, que irrita s√≥ de ouvir, eu n√£o recomendo o jogo. Tinha esquecido de falar dos controles, bem eles s√£o bem simples e compat√≠veis com outros joysticks, √© a √∫nica coisa desse jogo que eu diria que funciona direito.
NOTA: 1.5/10
DATA DE QUANDO JOGUEI: JUNHO DE 2014

author: {'steamid': '76561197970788250', 'num_games_owned': 2663, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 70, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1404518663}
review:
Woodle Tree Adventures is a simple, colorful, and cute platforming game that will appeal primarily to younger players. More experienced gamers won't get as much out of this short adventure, but the game isn't bad.

Woodle Tree Adventures consists of six stages (plus one unlockable level), and the player - or players in two player local co-op - has to guide their cork-like avatar around the maps in search of three giant tears and then haul them to the level exit. Levels also contain collectible berries, which are used to unlock new leaf weapons for your character as well as the bonus level. Enemies dot the maps too, and they can be easily dispatched with the leaf weapon or avoided altogether.

Each level will take about 10 or 12 minutes to complete, and they can be replayed at any time. Since there are Steam achievements for collecting 800, one thousand, and three thousand berries, expect to play through Woodle Tree Adventures several times if you want to get all of the game's eight achievements.

For the most part, Woodle Tree Adventures is a pretty easy game, although the lack of a rotatable camera makes lining up some of trickier jumps a bit frustrating. Fortunately there are unlimited lives and the small map sizes ensure that players won't have to retread the same ground too much. Even so, expect to plummet to your doom more than once because you couldn't line up a jump properly.

Woodle Tree Adventures is bright, family-friendly, and a bit bland. You've definitely played better 3D platformers than this. But if you need something to keep your kid quiet for an hour and there's no booze on hand, Woodle Tree Adventures will do the job.

review:
What to say about this game ?

Good points : This game is funny, nice platform game.
the game has different kind of levels.
The music is relaxing.
cuteness level : over 9000.

Bad points: The camera is seriously horrible, sometimes, it's not playable.
The storyline is almost nonexistent ( like Mario I would say )
the animations are slow, sleepy game.
You'll finish the game fastly.

But this game is enought good to be bought ! ( It's only 3$ )
Grade : 5/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074876041', 'num_games_owned': 288, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 85, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 85, 'last_played': 1404445971}
review: I'm going to make this sort of review very short and simple. The music was very nice, and it was extreemly easy to get 100% achievements (85 minutes). The camera however is god awful. There are monsters randomly placed around that are really easy to take out (all one hit), but your perception of depth is the only thing you are actually fighting. If you're looking for a casual couch game with co-op then you might enjoy this, but for me the camera took too much of the experience away.

author: {'steamid': '76561198143319047', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 5, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1404489029}
review:
El desarrollo del juego es algo lento, la jugabilidad es desastrosa, bien podria servir como juego infantil, ya que los graficos y los controles resultan basicos...

En definitiva, un juego simplemente mediocre si pasamos por alto algunos detalles.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054907844', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 9, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1404489706}
review: This game brings the most intense fights you could ever imagine. Fighting with yourself over whether or not suicide is a better alternative to this game sheds light to things you never knew you were. Like someone with at least half-decent taste in a game. I've played some games I hate just for the cards they bring, but if you think I'm going to spend an hour and thirty minutes running around as slow as molasses on acid, with enemies that either stand completely yet still kill you, collecting berries because some tree who creates magical text to convey what he wants to say because he is incapable of speech, you'd be as crazy as whoever thought making this game is a good idea and whoever thought buying 10,000 steam keys to this game to give away for free combined.

author: {'steamid': '76561198143001804', 'num_games_owned': 182, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 285, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 157, 'last_played': 1562501817}

author: {'steamid': '76561198025489879', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 52, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1405624211}
review:
This game was a piece of art.  I was hoping that there was going to be a cool final level, but there wasn't.  This is definetly worth the play through because it only takes less than an hour to finish.

I have a few suggestions though:
- Make the area where you can get the different leaves infront of the house, I never found that until end game.
- Allow the user to take control of the camera.
- Achievements were not unlocking for me (I am on Ubuntu)

author: {'steamid': '76561197988951570', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 189, 'last_played': 1404482264}
review:
This game is awful.

The camera is horrible, buggy and does whatever it wants. You can't rotate it in any way, the only "camera control" there is, a rudimentary zoom, doesn't even let you adjust height.

The game itself is quite bland, a simple (VERY SIMPLE) platformer aimed at children. Too bad even children will have problems with the lame controls, camera problems, sad attack/damage mechanics with enemies, seemingly random checkpoint system and overall bad level design.

I got this game for free, but I'm thinking about asking for a refund... of my dignity as a gamer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043850482', 'num_games_owned': 464, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 102, 'last_played': 1404450068}
review:
Woodle Tree Adventures acerta e erra (feio) em v√°rios aspectos.

Ele √© um jogo agrad√°vel em visual e conceito. N√£o se pode negar que ele tem seu charme.
O Jogo tem um enredo simples no estilo "Precisamos de voc√™. Colete isso em cada level." Pronto. O jogo j√° foi apresentado. Isso √© um fator importante, j√° que o jogo obviamente foi feito para agradar todas as idades, √© justo que tenha um linguajar simples para o entendimento de todos.

Mas apesar de todo o charme e carisma, esse jogo falha no que tenta ser. Um jogo de plataforma. E n√£o √© qualquer jogo de plataforma, mas sim um Mario 3D Land/Mario 3D World, jogo que pra muitos, mostrou pro mundo de uma vez por todas, como um jogo de plataforma "3D" deve ser.
Este jogo faz um esfor√ßo muito grande pra ser o que Mario 3D Land √© que chega a doer. Mas n√£o vou considerar isso como um ponto negativo. Afinal, n√£o tem nada de errado nisso (inclusive, jogos digitais tamb√©m tem o direito de ter suas inspira√ß√µes. Certo?).
O que Woodle Tree Adventures mais pecou, foi o fato de fazer um jogo que plataforma em que o real desafio acabou n√£o sendo o level design, ou os inimigos, ou at√© mesmo coisas que supostamente deveria servir como obst√°culo para seu progresso. Mas sim, sua mec√¢nica.
O jogo N√ÉO funciona da maneira que era pra supostamente ser. E o jogo esfrega isso em sua cara logo no primeiro level.

Passei um bom tempo tentando entender qual √© a l√≥gica por tr√°s da c√¢mera do jogo. N√£o faz sentido algum. Ela n√£o segue padr√£o nenhum, ela n√£o respeita seus comandos, ela muda de perspectiva a hora que quer... √â insano. O desafio maior do jogo √© lidar com ela. N√£o existe um "Ah n√£o, um inimigo dif√≠cil de passar nessa parte!", mas existe um "Ah n√£o. A c√¢mera est√° come√ßando a mudar de novo". E o controle m√≠nimo que voc√™ tem dela, n√£o resolve.

Morrer nesse jogo n√£o √© t√£o grave. Voc√™ n√£o depende de vidas e n√£o tem Game Over. Inimigos que voc√™ j√° eliminou, n√£o v√£o reaparecer, o que voc√™ coletou, j√° est√° coletado. Ent√£o, sem problemas. Tirando um √∫nico detalhe:  O jogo n√£o sabe o que √© check-points. Hora eu morro no fim da fase e volto no meio dela, hora eu morro novamente no fim da fase e volto no come√ßo dela... N√£o faz sentido. Soa que √© aleat√≥rio.

Com rela√ß√£o aos controles, n√£o tenho muito a reclamar. √â bem s√≥lido quando depende do pular e andar. Pular correndo e a queda pode se tornar um problema. Maior o problema se torna se voc√™ depender de algum elemento do cen√°rio para te ajudar a impulsionar os pulos e etc... √â estranho. Nesse aspecto o jogo ao mesmo tempo que √© extremamente consistente, √© inconsistente. Por exemplo, voc√™ n√£o utilizar√° muito isso em jogo, mas pular em uma √°rvore √© extremamente f√°cil! S√©rio. √â perfeito! E por incr√≠vel que pare√ßa, √© t√£o bem feito e √∫nico, que nunca vi um jogo de plataforma aplicar algo dessa maneira. Mas s√≥ funciona em √°rvores! O resto do jogo √© super inconsistente! Me pergunto porque os desenvolvedores se dedicaram tanto num aspecto que voc√™ quase nunca (e provavelmente vai ser um "nunca") ir√° utilizar para seu progresso em jogo.

Enfim. Espero que os desenvolvedores se dediquem muito para fazer umas melhoras nesse jogo em talvez novos updates. Porque mesmo com esses defeitos, eu vejo muita personalidade e dedica√ß√£o nesse material. Sinto que faltou uma revis√£o ou algu√©m acabou "ficando com pressa".

N√£o sou a favor desse "voc√™ recomenda esse jogo?" porque creio que todo jogo tem que ser jogado. Seja bom ou ruim. √â parte de um estudo e uma experi√™ncia. Tentar coisas ruins tamb√©m pode se tornar algo saud√°vel, e muitas vezes √© apenas uma quest√£o de gosto. Mas... Como as pol√≠ticas da Steam com rela√ß√£o a isso n√£o s√£o bem assim, vou acabar dando um "n√£o" para esse jogo. 

Como disse antes, espero de cora√ß√£o a aten√ß√£o dos desenvolvedores para melhorar esse jogo que flui potencial.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054668617', 'num_games_owned': 120, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1404418365}
review:
My Overall Opinion

I got this game for free through a promotion and look at the time and an hour passed by! I lost track of time so i guess that is a good thing but i only lost track because the game was so bad i found my self laughing at it. 

Some Issues That Need to Be Addressed

1.) You can go back to levels that you have already played to boost your strawberry count.
2.) The fighting mechanic. It is clunky and just plain stupid with a simple point and click that does not go diagonally.
3.) No checkpoints. If you die towards the end of the level you have to walk all the way back to where you were or sometimes the game will put you somewhat close to where you died.
4.) The ESC button closes out the game. Fix it so that it shows options like video, audio, controls, quit etc.
5.) There is no point in the start up pop screen. Never really liked them on any game.
6.) The game sometimes automatically changes your camera angle in a way that you cant even see where you are going to. It won't even let you change it by zooming in or out. 
I would recommend this to someone as a last resort.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063013389', 'num_games_owned': 1076, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 132, 'last_played': 1404433199}
review:
Based on my first impressions, I recommend it.
BUT, on one condition; 
Pure and simply, it's the game solely for small children (or FIRST first timer gamers). Anyone older/more experienced will find the game boring and simple. I didn't play much of it, but I managed nicely to recognize many elements that told me what kind of game this is. The graphics is simple, technically-wise (cubed geometry, not a lot of polygons, levels aren't big...), as well as conceptually (straightforward levels, easy obstacles, etc.). Story also; There's one intro screen like from a children's book which tells you everything in two sentences, and then you're off on your adventure(s) collecting droplets (elven tears in the game (Ewww!)) to bring life back to your home.
Everything is saturated and colorfull, I actually couldn't manage friend-or-foe identification, cause everything looks similarly colorful. And, curiously, you can kill every kind of creature - the ones that are threat, but the ones that aren't as well. I think the little ones would like it and as their first dive into gaming and platforming, this could be a decent enough effort.
But for anyone else, there's a myriad of problems: camera is in old-old-school fashion sticking to its rail and can't be moved, graphical options are non existent, I had problems rebinding the keys, since there are listings for the same key function (but probably for different devices) which you must guess yourself. You don't know if you're changing direction keys for keyboard, or gamepad, or something else.. move speed is too slow. I mean, come on, even N64 era had quicker movements in simple 3d! 
The main character is a cutesy creature which, again, could appeal to the little ones, but everyone old enough to count to 20 by himself will quickly find it boring and uninspired.
So yeah, if you have little kids (school kids not - they'd be insulted), you could go for it in a bundle, or discount, other than that, don't bother.

review:
100% on this game already?!   Well.....REVIEW TIME, then.....


Got this for free from a giveaway.  Feels like an incomplete school project.

It's like Mario 64 and Banjo Kazooie, but vastly inferior.


You could take it or leave it.... Me?   I'm going to LEAF it....and I don't mean that as a good thing.

2/10



One of the only good things that game of it are a beginner 3D experience and a single emote...  (Tip:  Get the :trunk: emote and put two of them next to each other.~)

review:
Cute looking game, but the controls and especially the lack of of camera options suck and kind of killed the game for me. As of writing camera controls (distance, but not angles) are supposedly implemented, but I could not find how to use these (or any evidence of actual implimentation) on the Linux version.

It's a shame though, because I do really like the look of this game. 
It's obviously kid friendly, so if your kid isn't as picky about controls as I am, maybe buy it for them.

review:

In ogni caso lo consiglio se volete comprare un gioco adatto a dei bambini.
La grafica √® piacevole, cos√¨ come anche il design degli ambienti e dei personaggi.
L'unica cosa che mi ha dato un po' fastidio √® la musica: decisamente triste, per essere un titolo palesemente destinato a dei bambini.
Il gioco, inoltre, √® perfettamente giocabile anche con il pad dell'Xbox360, oltre che con la tastiera.

review:
Muy entretenido, el t√≠pico juego pa los chiquillos porque les entra por el ojo al ser bonito y sencillo, pero no es un plataformas para cr√≠os.

El control es un poco malo pero podr√≠a ser peor la verdad. La c√°mara es fija aunque puedes acercarla y alejarla sin rotar (mejor eso que una c√°mara p√©sima) y por lo general los enemigos no son muy molestos, aunque te tocan con p√≠xeles que no existen. Una cosa un poco molesta es que los check points est√°n cuando les da la gana, y puedes morir y volver un check atr√°s porque s√≠ (es normal, tampoco es para quejarse demasaido).

Est√° pa echarle un par de horillas y completarlo, o la mitad si s√≥lo quieres acabar la historia. Recomendado para echar un ratillo "muy mono".

author: {'steamid': '76561197966022897', 'num_games_owned': 3304, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 92, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1403138595}
review: You get what you pay for.  It's no Mario 64, but for a much younger crowd looking for a basic vanilla 3D Platformer, they might love this one and it might get them into the genre overall.  The visuals are bright and cheery, but troublesome cameras at times really made some tricky jumps a bigger headache than they needed to be, but with no "Game Over" screen ever, that softens the blow a bit for camera-related deaths.  If you don't like 3D Platformers are are on the fence with them you might want to pass up this game, but if you love them and have $3 to blow then you might like the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961888950', 'num_games_owned': 1345, 'num_reviews': 191, 'playtime_forever': 160, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 160, 'last_played': 1404418718}
review:
En l'√©tat actuel des choses clairement je ne recommande pas ce jeux.
Le seul point positif pour l'instant reste le graphisme "mignon".

R√©sumons les points n√©gatif:
-Gestion de la cam√©ra d√©gueulasse
-Son proche du n√©ant
-Bug graphisme (le balluchon se remplit et grossit ok sauf que le balluchon en question traverse les d√©cors)
-Pas de compteur de ramassage de fruits
-Pas de compteur de vie (normal vie infinie, une aberation dans un jeux de plateforme...)
-Pas de tableau de score
-Pas de difficult√© (la seule difficult√© c'est votre patience pour finir un jeux aussi merdique)
-Maniabilit√© qui reste malgr√®s la manette des plus al√©atoire (certainement dus √† la magnifique gestion de la cam√©ra...)
-Dernier niveau accessible avec 600 fruits mal optimis√© (entre ralentissement de porc et plantage du jeux)
-Pour finir le jeux se torche en 1h00 waouh dinguerie ce jeux...

Bref je ne recommande pas ce jeux, l'ayant eu gratuitement je consid√®re que c'est son prix le plus juste (gratuit) en l'√©tat actuel des choses, ne payez pas pour un jeux mal fini et aussi court...

author: {'steamid': '76561197991369092', 'num_games_owned': 2901, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 127, 'last_played': 1404380607}
review: The most basic of basic 3D platformers/collectathons, but with none of the enjoyment that many of us remember so fondly.  Thinking about classics like DK 64 or Banjo-Kazooie, I've come to the belief that, it wasn't so much the "collecting", but the exploring and discovery that provided the enjoyment.  The classics had inventive worlds with fun characters and neat puzzles; this game has text boxes, no atmosphere, and a monotonous art style.  I understand the idea that the dev(s) had going in, but they have ultimately failed.  To be honest, wouldn't recommend spending even the $3 purchase price on this, I got it completely free and was still disappointed by it.  Hopefully a Hat in Time will prove that the genre as a whole isn't completely dead.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022222836', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 47, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1404374394}
review:
Incentive jogos bons, por favor, [b]n√£o compre[/b].

[b]Cr√≠tica:[/b]
O jogo parece que est√° em fase de testes, a hist√≥ria n√£o existe, √© apenas uma desculpa pra voc√™ ter um objetivo, isso seria at√© ok, se o jogo tivesse a jogabilida.de boa.

As anima√ß√µes, explica√ß√µes e inteligencia artificial s√£o completamente b√°sicas, ataque o que anda e pronto. As colis√µes s√£o mal feitas, as vezes voc√™ atravessa paredes ou mata inimigos e morre em seguida pois o jogo n√£o entende que o inimigo sumiu do mapa. 

A m√∫sica certamente foi feita por algu√©m que n√£o conhece de teoria musical e apenas pegou um programa de auto-music.
Os efeitos sonoros SEMPRE se repetem quando acontece a mesma a√ß√£o, assim como a anima√ß√£o.

==================
[b]Pontos positivos:[/b]

- Gr√°ficos arredondadinhos, √© gostoso de olhar.
- Controle do personagem √© meio ruim, mas √© fluido.
- Tem ideias quase interessantes(mundo, plataformas diferentes, design de personagens)
- Partes de level design legal aqui e al√≠.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010763537', 'num_games_owned': 405, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1404368570}
review:
I see potential in Woodle Tree Adventures. 

I see a lot of potential, but in it's current state it's pretty hard for me to recommend it:

Camera: The camera is fixed (to be fair, i read that you can zoom in or out but couldn't find a button in the Xbox 360 controller assigned to that function), a mayor letdown because precision platforming is all about that, precision. The game was not comfortable at all to play for me because of this. 

Music. The music NEEDS A LOT of work. And i hope the developer hears me on this: Mario games are good not only because of their gameplay, they are also, because their music is awesome and adds to the experience. 
The music in the game makes me want to sleep, it is not engaging, it doesn't motivate me to keep playing.

Gameplay:  It's interesting and a new take on a classic genre, a platformer in the same vein as Mario, Crash Bandicoot and Sonic the Hedgehog, which is not a bad thing at all! Found it very similar to Super Mario 3D World.

The control is responsive but this is counteracted by the camera which creates a constant struggle for the player, who is calculating distances without different perspectives, all the time.

The hit detection needs work, i found myself a lot of times attacking, killing the enemy and magically dying myself too.

Characters: They are cute and simple, but more charisma would be good, specially for the main character. I understand that the plot is simple, but a lot of the success of the old platforming games comes from the "mascot", a charismatic character that we (the players) want to see victorious because we feel identified with it.

Graphics: The graphics are pretty colorful and add to the experience, simple shapes made me remember the N64 and Playstation era.

All in all, WTA is not a bad game, and i really wanted to enjoy it because i have played platforming games all my life, but the game needs work, a lot of work. I'll be looking forward to updates of this game and change this review if i see progress.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066991229', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 48, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1404401315}
review:
Faccio fatica a credere di aver giocato a una cosa simile. Ci ho giocato per qualcosa tipo un'oretta (anche se il mio profilo mi segna 20 minuti perch√© dopo 20 minuti √® crashato Steam).
Questo gioco ha tutti i difetti del mondo. Se fosse una pre-alpha, si tratterebbe della peggior pre-alpha di sempre. Il primo bug l'ho riscontrato dopo 3 minuti. Checkpoint che a volte funzionano, a volte no. 1000 nemici diversi ma ugualmente inutili: si fanno fuori con un colpo. Level design ripetitivo, ambientazioni che pi√π anonime non si pu√≤, si fa fatica anche a capire lo scopo di questo gioco. Sapere che √® stato sviluppato da un Italiano mi fa vergognare del mio Paese, mi sentirei una persona orribile a far pagare per questa roba. Non so veramente come si faccia a consigliare un "gioco" del genere.
Non voglio nemmeno averlo nella mia collezione, farebbe brutta figura anche di fianco a Big Rigs.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990947284', 'num_games_owned': 5370, 'num_reviews': 1355, 'playtime_forever': 60, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1513118576}
review:
I will update my review once the devs of this game will have it improved.

If I were you, I would not buy this game at this point. The setting and the game as a whole might be nice, but this game has MASSIVE, game-breaking camera issues which are a major let-down. The idea behind the game is actually great and normally, I'd enjoy it pretty well. But at this point in developement, I can't suggest you to buy it. Check the forums now and then and make sure that the camera issues have been fixed. If they are, I can definitely suggest you to buy this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198043409387', 'num_games_owned': 1084, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 59, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1404335507}
review: The Artstyle looks very nice, but the game has many problems.  The biggest for me is the camera, which you have almost no control over except for zooming in and out, which seldom helps with some parts, like the "side-scrolling" parts.  The enemies in the game are also very dumb.  Some do not even move while the more aggressive only come after you if you're three feet away, so they're not much of a threat (unless, of course, you spawn right next to them with this game's shotty checkpoint system and die).  Oh, and the enemies can all be one shotted as well.  Overall, I would only reccomend this game at a dollar or lower because it still provided some fun even though it's a very short game with hardly any replayability.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012421313', 'num_games_owned': 699, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 43, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1404504498}

author: {'steamid': '76561198000701639', 'num_games_owned': 257, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1404333789}
review:
Short but fun cartoony platformer.

First time when I hopped into the game, the game looked cheap in many ways. Simple graphics, simple loading screen and, excuse me, an ugly starting screen. My expects were kinda... crushed.

Well, after getting into the game, I saw that I could use my controller to play this game. And surprisingly, this is one of the rare games where my controller works (Speedlink XEOX gamepad, Xbox 360 edition). And I gotta say, the controls were pretty basic, yet enjoyable.

The goal in this game is pretty easy. In each levels, you have 3 tears, you need to collect to finish the level. Also, you can collect these "apples" that are scattered around the world, to upgrade your leaf (weapon). Levels in this game are pretty amazing. Simple, yet difficult. I was enjoying my time platforming through the levels, finding all of those apples.

the Soundtrack was just brilliant. I loved it. It was bright, happy and theme-fitting soundtrack for every level. I would even say that the soundtrack on this game is one of my favourite ones.

One bad thing about this game right now, is that it is simply too short. I finished the game in 1 hour, and it has currently only 6 levels. I heard that the developer is planning new levels and bosses, but as right now, it's just too short and easy. Also most of the enemies are simply too easy to dodge. These rushing types of enemies are most likely the best enemy right now in this game, since the ranged ones just stand there, waiting for 20 seconds before throwing something at you. I only accidentally found this feature in the snow level.

In short, excellent platformer with great soundtrack, but tends to be too short and easy. But for that small price, it is definitely worth a try.

review:
I really want to recommend this game but there just doesn't seem to be much here. Also some very poor controls make platforming that should be easy enough incredibly hard. And the checkpoint system is completely broken. I don't want to sound like a jerk, but somebody seriously messed up with that checkpoint system. Anyway, whoever made this has some promise, but for now, they have Woodle Tree Adventures, which is, at its best, subpar.

4/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198060947404', 'num_games_owned': 1046, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1455355471}
review:
Introduction & Pros:

 Woodle Tree Adventure is a cute 3D platformer that really entertains both children and adults. Its art style and design are simple and well done. The music is great and really adds to the games cheery mood. It has several different worlds that offer interesting platforming and visual effects. The enemies are cool as well.

Cons & Conclusion:

As much as I love this game, it had some minor issues... My issues were small technical glitches like broken camera angles & clipping. But neither really affected gameplay. I should also mention that this game is very shot, like one hour short. But I still had fun with the little time I played it. I recommend this game for platformer enthusiasts and children!

How much wood would a woodchuck chuck if a woodchuck could chuck wood?

author: {'steamid': '76561198140489457', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 46, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1451620405}
review: I believe this game has its heart in the right place. 3D Platformers are an obscurity nowadays, and a game that tries to replicate those early era, polygon intensive games deserves a little respect. However, this game goes a little TOO far in some aspects as a copycat. There is absolutely no camera control, meaning those picture-perfect jumps are going to be a stretch. I will give it this, though- the graphics are adorable and seem to have been crafted with an early generation PSX or N64 game in mind. But beyond that...this game needs work. And lots of it. I wouldn't reccomend it...not even at its low asking price. I would wait until patches come out to fix the lag, add camera control and perhaps tighten the character controls a little.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041704880', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1403486424}
review:
Woodle Tree Adventures is about an adorable low quality tree stump with arms, who beats unsuspecting enemies (who can't or won't fight back) with his adorable low quality leaf, while collecting pointless, strange low quality berries. 
He travels to six similarly low quality, but yet polished and brightly colored, worlds to collect his berries and beat up the poor enemies. 

There is no penalty for death, you just have to start the level over, but you don't lose any progress (ie: nobody will beat you up and steal your drugberries). Edited to add: Yes, Drugberries. He's gotta be doing SOMETHING with them!
The berries appear to have no point, except to be hoarded at your little Woodle house so nobody else can have any. Also, be careful going up the stairs. When I was at that 'hub' between worlds, I managed to trip (read: drag woodle face first) up the stairs. It's those adorable, low-quality legs. 

I didn't want to judge a book by it's cover, and when I saw it on Greenlight, I thought I'd give it a chance.
Is it worth it? Probably not. Did I get some amusement out of it? Sure. I'm always up for bright and shiny collectathons. As long as they are marginally functional, which Woodle is, I'm in. (Don't get too inspired to jump while in the left-right moving platform on level 1.. you'll go through the floor! And the camera angles? OH LAWD!)

My recommendation? Pick it up uber-cheap and farm it for cards, or if you've got a kid in the house, stick them on the controller for a bit. After all, it's always better to beat on unsuspecting ladybugs, sheep, turtles and other adorable creatures in a videogame than in real life, right?

Edited to add after completion of game: The inability to move the camera is my main pet peeve. And holy crap the game is so EASY. Don't like where you're at? Walk off the edge, there's no penalty. Just collected a faerie tear and don't want to jump back through the puzzle you did to get there? let something hit you, you'll start over with the tear and no penalty. At least it's relaxing. It has a much better soundtrack than you'd expect from something like this.
